text: Quality of the sushi and food is good.  Didn't care much for the rice - it was a little hard.  The server was nice, but the place got really busy, and I felt like we waited around an awful lot.  Then later on the place smelled like something was burning. Not sure if I'd come back again for lunch, because if you have plans after - you won't make your schedule. Maybe ok for dinner?

This is a Top 3 Contender in my book for one of the best sushi places in town! Highly recommend this place great AYCE menu. Spicy Tuna, Tiger, Nigiri Rolls, Cajun Albacore, Deep Fried Cali, and some Gyoza are the best!

we use to come here quite often with our friends. but recently their service is getting down pretty bad. there are still some of senior server knows what they are doing. but all the new servers that we don't know( started past few month) they don't even have any knowledge of fish or sushi. they looks pretty and cute. but all the looks doesn't give us any good quality of service. last visit was last thursday... it was just bad experience by their service. we got there around 7pm... it was all servers that we don't know. and  it was pretty poor customer service over all. we did all you can eat.. but rolls got kept missing and we have to constantly remind them get drink refill.....     we love there  foods and few of servers has been workin there since we started going there from las year. it might be owner's styles or favor that has pretty lookin servers. but better training more instead putting extra make up or tiny shorts.. we like to enjoy their food. but long waiting time, wrong order, and bad customer service makes us to think twice before going there now. very sad.

I have become a Sushi Koma regular. It is my boyfriend and I's favorite AYCE Sushi restaurant. The fish is always very fresh, and they have a wide variety of rolls to choose from. 

The restaurant itself is pretty small, so if you go during dinner time, you can expect to wait awhile. But it is well worth the wait! The staff is also very friendly and helpful! I definitely recommend this place!
Checked out this place for the first time today. Loved the beef teriyaki special!
Food is great; service is not-so-great.  The food came out quickly; however, the wait staff was not the nicest.
This is one of my favorite sushi joint!! It's a rather small restaurant bit service is always great both table and sushi bar. Everything is delicioso! N
Room and seating is a little small, but food was great. My boy Vincent enjoyed some super dank sushi. We're stayed there popping bottles till close!

We finally made it to Sushi Freak! (although, I may need to change the name on this review since I heard that they are going to be now called 'Sushi Koma' or 'Sushi Buzzz'). 
We were greeted right away, we sat at the sushi bar, and we ordered AYCE (and a Sapporo, duh!).
Edamame to start, it was okay, a little bowl that seemed to be microwaved... 
Then we got two orders of white tuna and their tuna carpaccio. The white tuna was buttery and fresh and the carpaccio was more like a garlic tuna - both were good.
I was disappointed that they don't have tuna poke, they offered a tuna tostada... we passed. I don't want 'kind of a poke,' I want poke!
I love that you can get 1/2 rolls with AYCE.
We had the Ponzio, Fish Paradise, Stephanie and Dragon Rolls (1/2 orders)
I liked them all, the sauce was slightly heavy-handed, but really good!
We had to have one more order of white tuna (mmm mmm good!). I also ordered mackerel (thats my judge on a good sushi spot, if its fresh, its a keeper).
Needless to say, Sushi Freak (Koma / Buzzz) is a KEEPER! With a huge portion of tempura ice cream for dessert, we were stuffed, happily so!
The server was friendly, attentive and gave great suggestions. 
We will be back for sure!

All you can eat sushi, this place is a good atmosphere, great staff, fish is fresh and prompt! Nothing was overloaded with rice which a lot of all you can eat sushi places do, so far this is my favorite sushi place in the LV

AYCE was pretty good. The fish was fresh and the service was good. The only negatives I have is that the place is really small and they don't offer a lot of appetizers for AYCE. Good but not GREAT. May or may not go again...

The sushi here is good, but the service is horrible, they forgot things in the order like salad and our server changed like 3 times, they brought us the wrong sushi rolls, they don't take empty plates or refill drinks, they bring us things we didn't order,
and they never bring the check. 3rd time this has happened, hopefully they do something about it, because it's not worth the headache.

Do not order the Kids meal.  It consists of 2 very tiny plate of, in our case, 2x skinny shrimp tempura, 3 Cut in Half pieces, pieces! Not 3 Pieces of sushi, 3 pieces of cut up egg and 1 scoop of ice cream, and was charged $10. Horrible! They also informed us of various fish they were out of AFTER we had started ordering.  WE would not have stayed if we were given this info as we were seated. Been to this place once a year ago and we think the place has go down a lot in quality and service, but considering its AYCE then i guess they are just AYCE quality

My husband and I visit LV every 1-2 years and always have at least one meal with sushi. Growing up and having lived in Hawaii for most of our lives, we know what good sushi is and are often disappointed...but not this time!

We were in LV the first week of July and my husband searched for sushi restaurants on Yelp. This restaurant is nowhere near the strip, but it isn't a very long drive, either. We got there at about 10:00 PM after we went to a show. It's located in a small shopping center with a large parking lot. 

Although the space is small, it is just right. We were warmly greeted and seated as soon as we walked in. The seating is very close, but somehow it all works. For those who prefer, there is seating at the sushi bar. 

They have a large and varied menu, and we went for the all you can eat. We didn't eat as much as we normally do since it was a little late, but what we had was excellent! Very fresh fish and the proportion of fish to rice is perfect. No skimpy pieces of fish here. 

Something that weighs heavily on our decision to return to a restaurant is the service and Sushi Koma has top notch service. The wait staff continuously checked on us, cleared dishes and asked if we'd like to order more. We didn't even know who our "waitress" was because they all worked as a team and waited on all the tables. I give kudos to the staff and management for this. And they were all relatively "younger" and extremely pleasant and friendly. They seemed to genuinely enjoy being there. 

Needless to say, we will be eating here on our subsequent visits to LV and will recommend it to others. I highly recommend Sushi Koma!

Just moved to this area and this place is literally right across from my place. I always go to sushi mon for AYCE but this place has a higher rating on yelp and it's a lot closer to my place. Came here with my girlfriend at around 10pm last Friday. Its not timed either unlike sushi mon.  AYCE dinner is $25.95 with an order of amaebi and uni. The amaebi is so fresh! Love it! Also tried their Kobe beef sushi, sashimi roll and seared tuna. Yum yum. All the staff are very attentive. They came check us every 5-10 min to see if we need anything and they always refill our cup! They also recommended us many good items on the menu...the best thing is they didn't omit any orders. All of our orders came quickly. Also, half rolls are available too:)

Came back three days later with my bf around 11pm! He liked this place as well. Staffs are hospitable, even the sushi chef are friendly! This place opens till 3am!!! Didn't get AYCE this time because we are too full for it. Just crave for some sushi rolls after bowling! We ordered two rolls to share, one Philly roll and one volcano rolls :) they are about 11-12$. They also have a separate a la carte menu like sashimi dinner set etc. 

AYCE is highly recommended!!:) love this place! Probably wont go back to sushi mon when there's a closer, better AYCE sushi place with no lines :)

Lunch time.  Only one waitress doing her best but all tables full so service slow. Sushi chef service so unbelievably slow. Table of 4 took an hour to have 6 rolls made!  Teriyaki chicken too salty and chicken did not taste right.  Sushi rolls low quality. Ordered AYCE for 3 at the table and as stated rolls took forever to receive. Perhaps a ploy to keep the AYCE orders to a minimum because you are tired of waiting. Japanese lasagne was awful as was so gooped up with mayo. Will not return.
Sushi koma is awesome!!! Great service, sushi is amazing,  servers very knowledgable, and great ambiance! !! I would recommend the sashimi roll and kimmy roll! I will be back!

Disappointed in their seating system.  We arrived at 545pm and was told the wait would be 20-25 minutes and noted only 2 other groups waiting in the lobby ahead of us.   We decided it would be ok for 25 min.   After waiting and hour and seeing multiple people come in after us being seated before us, we found out people were calling in from home and getting on a "wait list" - not a reservation system, as they don't accept reservations.  Had we known about this call- ahead waitlist system, we would have called too.  It was unrealistic to be told 20-25 min when there were so many people on this wait list ahead of us.  Suffice to say we didnt stay to eat.  Too bad.

This place is really good.  I thought the staff was extremely friendly and attentive.  Even when the restuarant got busy they were always checking on us or either apologizing that if they hadn't come by in awhile to check on us.  I thought the ayce was really good even though there is not as much selection as goyemon, but the quality of the fish was good and thats what really matters.  I do wish that some items were not a one time only.  i understand the uni and sweet shrimp, but the ice cream and tuna carpaccio.  I love the fact that it wasn't overly busy and I didn't have to wait over an hour to be seated.  I will be coming back here due to the fresh tasting fish and friendly staff.

Food was amazing, Staff was polite and calm unlike some sushi joints where the waitress is running around like a chicken with its head cut off. that just helps no-one. 
food was fresh and the place was small but its perfect for a dinner for two. would not recommend for large parties.

Delish!! Ordered different rolls and we were very happy with how everything tasted. The service was exceptional. Order the Big B roll...seared beef on top with shrimp tempura. Yum! 

Chefs were attentive and so was the wait staff. We will be back!
Just ok. Edemame was tough. Service slow. Fresh fish is definitely used for you can smell it in the air. Not pleasant.  Moving on to the next sushi spot.

Sushi here is nothing special with a couple rolls being pretty bad. Spicy tuna not very good and fish being ok in freshness. 3 stars is for the excellent service though, very attentive and speedy waitresses.
My go to place for some bomb sushi! Been going here for almost 7 years! Love this place!
The ambiance here is energetic, the music is upbeat, and the staff are attentive. The menu is on par with other midrange sushi restaurants as far as selection and quality. The Kimmy Roll is great!

This place was okay.

The servers are friendly but the food was mediocre for the price they sell their sushi for.

We ordered the Almost Fire and Pania roll. The almost fire did not look fresh. It looked like it was sitting there for a while.

Somehow, I have no idea how, our other order was forgotten. So we sat there for how long waiting for our other order. How do you forget two rolls of sushi? The pania roll was good. It tasted like other sushi we've had before.

We spent $33 for two rolls of sushi that wasn't worth the price.  This was a good experience. But with so many sushi places in Vegas, we will try others.
Really like the fact they are open till 3am.  Sit at the sushi bar by myself and get great food and service.  Always leave stuffed.  Love coming here.

This place is awesome! I was in LV for a month because of work and my friends (locals) brought me here. The waitresses were extremely nice, we were even able to try their toro that they were able to get (not on the menu/not here regularly). I had a fun time and will be stopping by again (which will be in a couple of weeks). This place has great sushi!

The friendly, out going, and beautiful waitresses, great off menu choices, fresh wasabi, and sake made for an awesome place to eat!

Hands down my favorite place for sushi in Vegas. Everything is so fresh and delicious. The service has been excellent every time I have been there the staff is always friendly . They have a lot of different mixes of rolls to choose from. Cute little atmosphere. I recommend this place.

Sushi is delicious here. Staff is very friendly. I would have given them the 5 stars, but the only reason why I didn't is due to their place being too small and cramped otherwise I really recommend this place.

Best sushi we've ever had! We love sushi, we've tried several places in Vegas (and in other cities and countries), this one: the best!
Fresh fish, nice combinations, a beautiful masterpiece... art
This is by far the best sushi in Las Vegas period! !!!!  Always fresh,  I'm never disappointed,  and it's open late....I love it!!!!!!

This was my first time having sushi in Las Vegas and Sushi Koma was a recommendation from a co-worker.  I'm originally from Portland, Oregon, foodie capital of the northwest! I'm use to sushi on a conveyor belt and ordering right from the chef and when I sat down, so, I thought the service was going to be faster. Little did I know that you have to order all of your dishes (or at least some of them) at once. I would eat one order and then sit for a long time with no food as they were making everything fresh. DUH! I learned because once I received my order it was EXCELLENT sushi. My initial order was the sushi lasagne (i am not sure if that is the name, again, co worker recommended) I thought I died and had gone to sushi heaven. Kicked myself for not ordering two! I ended my "all you can eat" meal with the Stephanie Roll. It was so refreshingly fresh that I was satisfied for the rest of the night. I can't wait to go back and will be a regular. When my brother comes from LA, he is in for a sushi treat! Highly recommend this place.
Best sushi in Vegas!!! The service is great, they have all you can eat and you actually can eat anything on the menu!  They serve the best Dynimite ... Definitely coming back every week!!!
You have to wait very long for your food. The place is not clean,small,and it smells a little bad. They gave the Sake bottle half way.

5 stars for sushi koma! Amazing service from Aileen, very fresh fish, great AYCE variety menu!

Great parking, convnenient local location!

Wow! The sushi was so fresh. I loved the mackerel, salmon roe, tuna hand roll, unagi, shrimp tempura, white tuna,etc.Everything I had was bright and fresh. The servers were very efficient and very pleasant. The decor is contemporary and the place is immaculate. Although this time I sat at a table, next time I plan on sitting at the counter to watch the sushi being made. Great food and entertainment, too. What more could you want? While I have eaten at many AYCE sushi places, Sushi Koma stands out.  It is now my go to place. I crave it!

The sushi and other items were good. Not great, but good. It at least filled my craving for some sushi. The service could have been a lot better. Some of the servers just assumed we were okay without even asking, even though we wanted to order more. I know this because I could hear them talking right behind us. The hostess stand was right behind us and that's where the servers would just hang out. The restaurant was not busy at the time. We got the wrong order a couple times to. It was my first time and I did not like it.

The variety of this place is great. They have a somewhat extensive menu with creative rolls and everything tastes fresh. The servers have great timing and are knowledgeable about the menu. The only downsides to this place is, first, how super small they are. Thankfully we've been here only on slower times, but there is no way you can comfortably get 50+ people in this little space. Secondly, there are random rolls on the menu that don't list the ingredients - which would be helpful to both people looking for something specific, as well as people with allergies.

My friends and I got all you can eat sushi and shared everything. We did not have a single bad roll; all of them were delicious! The service was excellent. Even when one of my friends spilled her drink they rushed out to help clean it up. Overall this was a wonderful experience and is now one of my top favorite sushi places in town!

This is the best sushi ever,  the staff is polite and honest,  no matter what time you attend to their service, it's always uplifting and a happy energy, the food made by the sushi chefs is awesome :) and no I don't know the management or even a single person in that restaurant :)

I hate giving negative feedback, but my first time here was a really poor experience. There was a ten to fifteen minutes wait for our food to come (per order) this is including soy beans. Most everything we tried was not very good and wasn't the freshest. Maybe we went at a bad time. I was very disappointed seeing how they had 4 stars

Love Goyemon but its just to crowded....this restaurant is compariable to it and plus the app are great and its small so everything is down to earth only thing the al carte was sorta small for its price other then that perfect place to eat late at night
Judy is great and every single time we go in the staff do not disappoint. The food is always on point, satisfying, and fills you up.

Great place to eat alone or with friends!  Food is fresh and everyone is super friendly.  A little small inside but super cozy!  Can get very busy, but I don't mind waiting for made-to-order sushi.  I work late so the fact that they are open till 3am daily...GREAT!

Fish is very tasty and very fresh. Staff is attentive and polite, friendly and can strike up a good conversation. There are rolls that are both familiar and unique, and all of them were impressive. The brie and grape quesadillas were a pleasant savory and sweet surprise, and the menu options for AYCE are practically limitless! Can't wait to visit again and bring some friends to experience it, too.
The fish feels pretty fresh and they have an interesting take on some of the nigiri. The service is attentive and very friendly.

Love this place. Good quality sushi (with the perfect amount of rice), nice atmosphere & the service is outstanding. Hannah & Michele, you girls are GREAT! Sorry I didn't get the young gentleman's name, but you did great too!  - Dinner on 01/05/15

My friend came up from Hendertucky to have sushi at Brian's Beach, but as several other reviews mentioned, the place has changed hands.  The sign outside just says "SUSHI" with a banner above saying "Grand Opening."  She loved Brian's Beach (I had never been) so we were a bit skeptical but decided to give Sushi Freak a try.

I'm so glad this place is not even a mile from home!  And open until 3am every night!  The place is small, bordering on very small, but not too busy at 7pm on a Thursday.  Only 6 tables and about 10 spots at the sushi bar.  We noticed half of the diners were Asian so figured this must be good stuff!

The menu was kept very close to Brian's; our server said it was to honor the previous owner.  I did the AYCE and my friend started a la carte, but was hungry enough for to switch over to AYCE; our server was very accommodating.  

I guess edamame was an appetizer before, but it was served after we sat. From yelpers' recommendations I started with the Poki Tower, and I had to try their Dynamite.  I've never had a Poki Tower, so I can't compare it to anything, but the flavor was amazing!  The mix of ingredients and spices was awesome! It looked like pico de gallo, but that was the only similarity.  The Dynamite was also very good.  I like Sushi Kaya's more, but Sushi Freak's was still good.

I did half rolls for everything else (only available with AYCE) and had too many to remember.  The Stephanie, SSS, Almost Fire, Big B, Tiger, Alex's Muncie, were all very good.  The other two I had were also good, but I just can't remember their names!  I blame my Sushi Coma.

The service was great from the greetings as we entered, to their suggestions (including things off their unpublished menu), and to the chef making a special roll for my friend who wanted something "ridiculously spicy." (It was spicy, but not ridiculously.)  

Our only complaints, albeit minor, is their spicy items are not that spicy and as small as the place is there will be long waits.
Love this place. My boyfriend and I come here often and have never had a bad meal. The staff is really friendly and the food taste great!

A couple of us went there for a late night AYCE craving...it was our first time there and went because of the reviews. We were very pleased. The place was kinda small but the chefs were super nice and the servers were ok, some nice some didnt care to be there it seemed. Overall the food was good,  but not too many interesting rolls to be honest, for $26 ive seen a lot more variety else where, but the quality of the fish was worth it very fresh it seemed.

I decided to try to place out considering it was the only sushi spot open late at night. I ordered a Hamachi as its one of my favorite nigiri's. The flavor was bland and I didn't even want to eat it anymore. So I had some left overs which I didn't know what to do with it. There California rolls are alright and so are there masago's. Nothing to special at this spot. For me, this place is way to over priced for the quality of fish that we are given. Not worth the money. After my experience, I don't think I'll eat here again.
Just love this place. Perfect balance of quality and value. Delicious food + fantastic service = :)

This is probably the only sushi restaurant that has been consistent in taste and quality. I don't come here often anymore because I moved. Atmosphere is good, a little crowded and loud, but I learned to enjoy that type of environment after visiting Japan. (not that there's a direct relationship with atmospheres, it's just something I learned to appreciate) The art around the restaurant is dope btw. The servers are very social and accommodating.

This is Random but I don't know why they have a table and chair in their bathrooms lol. 

My favorite roll is the Tiger Roll. 
I appreciate the Jalepeno and Ponzu drop, on the Hamachi Nigiri and there AYCE options are great. 

This place is a good choice.

Not only does this place have the best all you can eat in Las Vegas, they also have a cute ambiance. The restaurant is smaller than some others in Las Vegas and it actually makes it more fun because it has a fun atmosphere. The sushi rolls are to die for the owner makes most of the himself. The service is good and very friendly. We moved recently and are still willing to drive the 35 minutes to get here because the ones around us don't even compare. This is my first review and I made sure that it was for this place because they deserve it.

OK, ladies and 'gents.. This is formally my very first review about anything good or bad and I am proud to say that it goes not only to a restaurant, but to a sushi spot that I have dubbed my very own getaway. Let me start out with the service first and foremost. When the time comes that you feel the need for GREAT; and I mean GREAT nigiri, then please step on in to this little hidden gem that has undergone new management (thank the good Lord), and is now titled comically: SUSHI KOMA. There you will be greeted happily and sincerely by your server/hostess/cashier/she-does-it-all and they call her "Wes". Yeah, I have no idea what it's short for, so don't ask. Not only is she sweet and humble but she knows how to keep the drinks coming and prevent you from wanting anything at all. The manager/owner and his assisting sushi chef greet you very happily as well and it almost makes you forget about how small it is inside or the fact that it used to be home of infamously horrible place called Brian's Beach Sushi. Almost. Until you look at the broad menu of beautiful items which most are very familiar and some had me second guessing my sushi infatuation? You then realize that both sides of the menu are included in their all you can eat lunch and dinner special which is $22 for lunch and $25 for dinner. This had me very excited to say the least because it includes some of my favorites such as tuna carpaccio and baked green mussels and the lovely tostadas! Green tea is nice and the rolls that we had were wrapped in a very thin layer of fresh rice which my husband loved and so did I since I'm not a huge fan of rice to begin with. Almost fire roll, Fish paradise roll and sashimi rolls are the only "rolls" I could eat over and over again... however, I would be in Heaven if I could get never ending servings of their tostadas and tuna carpaccio. the baked mussels were to my liking because they didn't over power it with all of the "filler" ingredients and so that leaves you with the salty ocean taste which is the reason why you eat shell fish in the first place. Make no mistake about it, this place had to go above and beyond to prove it's name and provide us with a lasting experience great enough to make me take time out of my busy everyday schedule so I could provide you with this "yelp". so is it a favorite/ ABSOLUTELY. When will we be going back? Every weekend. (Were only about 10 minutes away.) Oh' and a wonderful touch to it all was that "Wes" memorized our names after eating and talking there for over 2 hours... Pretty impressive, given the fact that I never formally introduced ourselves,she overheard us calling eachother's names out while entering the restaurant. You gotta love a place like that! Sushi Koma; one of Vegas's best kept secrets...

The food was delicious. However be sure to be clear about what you want to order. Our server automatically charged us for all you can eat sushi when we did not at all request it. It actually ended up costing us more for the all you can eat than just paying for the rolls as separate orders. But the sushi was yummy and we will go back again.

Food poisoning.

Now, bacteria can come from anywhere--a dirty door handle, utensil, cup, etc.--but Sushi Koma was the only commonality between my mom and I this day and we both became extremely sick after eating there. It's day two and I'm still feeling ill as I type this.

I think I can pinpoint the culprit: the spicy tuna. We both had remarked that it tasted 'sharp', maybe even bitter. I chalked it up to different seasonings. Spicy tuna is one of my favorites, but this tasted different and I simply assumed Koma has a proprietary mix. My mom and I ate the whole roll anyway, just to avoid being charged for it as per the AYCE policy, but boy, do I wish I'd ponied up the bucks rather than eaten that.

Regarding the rest of our meal, the salmon nigiri was delicious, buttery and soft with minimal rice. We'd made plans to return and order five orders of it, it was that good. The pinnacle roll was just okay. We enjoyed the Venice. Not a fan of the breading on the calamari, it was far too dense for the amount of meat. Felt like we'd ordered a bowl of fried panko.

As I said, the salmon was excellent and we would have returned to gorge on that, but when you have a painful experience like we both did (and are continuing to have -- Jesus, my mom is throwing up as I speak!) you know better than to risk it twice!

Edit: I tried to keep my review reasonable so it would be taken seriously, but listening to my mom being sick is making me pretty angry. Sushi Koma, shame on you.
1 of my favorite sushi places in Las Vegas! Fish is always fresh, customer service is always great! 5 minutes from the strip!
Aileen is the best, super friendly service and fast! Great food and a deal - everything was very fresh. The Yuzu sake is delicious.

The worst service ever!!!!!

How do I give this negative stars. Let me start with two of us went to lunch and there was about 12 people in the whole place. Ordered a beer that was warm. I asked for ice that took 5 minutes to get for my warm beer. Ordered edamame and nigiri for appetizers.....30 minutes later edamame arrives....30 minutes after that sushi arrives. The table next to us was there 2&1/2 hours and never got there whole order before they left. We were so disgusted with the service got up and asked the server to charge us for the stuff we ate. And yes he did charge us. I work in the service industry and that 2 items we ordered would've been comped. 

We left and went to rainbow sushi. Got stuffed in less than an hour. I wanted to try something different today but ended up with the worst service ever. I just read the reviews before I started writing this and someone had the same experience about waiting every 30 minutes for each dish.
Im disappointed. Umiya is way better.  Not going back to this place again. I feel like I've wasted my money.

This place is great, thank you yelp. We saw the high rating checked it out this past Sunday and were not disappointed. We did a la carte sushi rolls, but the all you can eat deal sounds great. The rolls were amazing and the wait staff was great.

The only issue was the sign, it still said Brain's Beach Sushi, this being the first visit it definitely was confusing.
Very small and cramped place fish wasn't very fresh and wasn't very impressed by any of there rolls

Nice staff.... Food was nothing special. Came here for the first time with two Japanese friends because we were in the area. Really don't understand why there are so many great reviews here on Yelp. I really wanted to like this place but the food was mediocre at best.

This place is a small hole in the wall; probably no bigger than my living room, but the sushi is delicious. Lots of options, great service, and overall a good vibe.
The only thing I didn't like was the selection of rap/hip hop/r&b music they had blaring through the speakers.
Oh and if you sit at one of the 2-seater tables, there's not much space between you and the people next to you. Makes friends!
Otherwise I will def return.

This used to be my favorite sushi restaurant but I will not be back after my last visit. The service is absolutely terrible. I came here August 14th to celebrate my boyfriend's birthday. We were waiting for sooo long to receive the 1 roll he ordered. I received my orders, but I did have to remind waiters because items were missing. We never got his order and it was such a long wait, our waiter asked us if we were ready for dessert!! I said he hasn't received his food. She apologized. We waited for another really long time, still no food. Another waiter asked us if we wanted dessert. At this point, you know the service is terrible when 2 waiters have asked if you're ready for dessert and you still haven't been given your food....

Roll finally came out (it was a baked roll) and was freezing cold. Not sure how long it had been ready for. The waitress apologized and said she's new. Paid full AYCE prices for 1 cold roll for my boyfriend. They were nice and did ice cream for his birthday but they brought it out right after his roll. They didn't give him time to order more knowing he never received his food in the first place. The ice cream and 1 roll was not worth the AYCE price they charged us. Whole experience was very bad. I also want to add that management was right there and very aware of what was happening and did NOTHING. Save yourself the bad service and cold rolls and eat elsewhere.

I'm afraid it's all gone downhill. When the wait staff tells you it was slow lunch and the reason why the rice is hard is because they are being resourceful....not good. Service is sucking balls. My kid is waiting  forever for a couple of pieces of tempera.  What the hell has happened?!

Well this sushi snob found a home the quality of fish far surpassed any all you can eat sushi bar in town the music was hopping as the friendly wait staff Thank you all so much for make 56 memorable Marcus gets a special thanks for introducing me to our new sushi family
This is good spot for sushi. Small spot and if there's a lot of orders your order may get backed up. But other than that the service is awesome. The sushi is to die for.

SOOooooooo.. This sushi place was my favorite new yummy joint in Vegas my first time there. I figured it wouldn't be as good as the first time, every time. So, I tested it and waited to write a review after 4 visits. Sure enough I hoped it would be 5 stars every visit but it was not. 

-FOOD: I order prety much everything when it comes to nigiri, except squid or octopus. Only because they use the low quality stuff and they dont spend hours rubbing for tenderness like it should be done. (haha that sounded odd). Anyways. Nigigri was a 5 star first time then it was 3 and 4 stars every visit after. The rolls are decent, nothing that actually says they are different from other sushi spots. Also my first time there they let me substitute a fish on my roll, and everytime after my first they denied me the same exact request. SO NOT COOL MAN! lol jk. butt really though, why did you guys get me hooked then cut off my request. GRR! Side dishes, are good, but nothing wow. 

-MENU: Pretty awesome when they say everything on the menu is ayce, so u dont feel like you have to avoid a portion of the menu. They still limit on certain items like UNI and sweet shrimp. 

-Service: Perfect, well as perfect as a place can get. I've been in the restaurant during busy hours and slow hours. They always serve me with a smile, everytime. They take my order very well, and have a great knowledge of the menu and items. Not too much with details of the rolls, but the server will ask the chef right away for an answer. No one repeats my order back to me to make sure they got it all, but I haven't not recieved my complete order yet so I'm very pleased. SOOOoooo, Service has once again added a star to the joint. 

Me and some others tend to agree on this: If the food is mediocre, or right above decent. BUTT the service is just awesome. You will always get us to return. So thank to all the chefs, servers, and management.
Wow this place so good one of the best places to get sushi definitely would recommend it.

I came her last Saturday due to a friend's recommendation. When I came there it was busy and crowded but they had a table for us under 5 mins. Long story short, it took and hour for our food to come out. That's absolutely crazy ! I understood that it was busy but how can you let a customer sit there for an hour for a few pieces of sushi. Our server seemed as if she doesn't know what she's doing. She messed up our order many times. Food is average, nothing special. Never again.

Sushi koma used to be my favorite place for sushi. The last three times I've been service was terrible. We waited an hour before having the first roll. The waitress apologized as they only had two cooks. I understand things happen but waiting an hour for service is ridiculous. When asking about the wait the response was, "you're order is there, it'll just take awhile." It's disappointing that the food is great & multiple service experience have been awful.

Excellent sushi especially for an all you can eat.  I lean more towards the traditional rolls that highlight the ingredients (fish being the main of course) and Sushi Koma delivers.  We all know how sushi places can be hit and miss but this place is a hit for sure.  Also just a heads up you can get the rolls as half rolls so you can try more.

Overall, everything is fresh and tasty. But I m disappointed on their Wednesday sake special. They told me the sake and tempura ice cream special started after 7. So we came here at 7 but they told us the special starts at 8. This is BS!!!

Probably the friendliest staff I have ever seen! Great variety with the AYCE sushi menu. As an avid AYCE sushi fan, this is probably the best place I have visited in the United States. It was also opened on Christmas Day which we were so grateful for because the lines for buffets close to the strip was horrendous.

Food was awesome! The only downside to this place was the service. The server doesn't refill drinks, serve the food to the right person, or pre-buss the table. I would give the service a 1 star and the food a 5 star. Definitely worth a try still.
food is great...service is great...what more can u ask for....the owner is such and nice guy when my Husband and i go there he always greets us with a smile...and plus its ayce

Came in late night with my boyfriend and friends tonight and were seated at the big table in the corner. Our server janet was very attentive and always had a smile on her face :) as well as the sushi chefs, even though it got busy as soon as we were seated. The owner was working behind the sushi bar and made sure all of our food was came out exactly the way we wanted. The sushi is always fresh too! My favorite is the seafood tostada!
Go-to late night sushi spot! Thank u janet and chris! :)

My husband and I went on a late date night after work. The food was great the service was amazing, no complaints.My husband had 2 servings of the rainbow sushi. My favorite was the tostada. Overall, best late night sushi we've had thus far.

A friend and I dined AYCE lunch at the sushi bar. The sushi was great! I really enjoyed that they allow half rolls with AYCE because we were able to try many menu options. Unfortunately, the service was not. I asked for a glass of water 4 times, and waited nearly 20 mins for an order of mochi to come out. Making this a 3 star experience.

Service was subpar... If you love yum yum sauce - this is your spot. We sat at the sushi bar but still had to place our orders through the servers. A bit of a change from the traditional sushi bar experience & doesn't bring the same ambiance. BUT... the edamame was excellent!

Great quality of fish! All you can eat with small amounts of rice and lots of fish! 
Really nice place and open till 3am! 
Creative menu!
Definitely worth a try!

good quality food, and we have a good time. but when we want to to go something for my family, there is no box for us to to go the food, i don't know why, also the guy told us, this time i won't charge you for the waste.food, but next time we will. what the hell is that? i already pay for it, your mind is working okay today? I not we could not.waste food, so we want.to take.it home. if you have that police you should let.the customer know before we order.the food. This is my first time, it will be.my last time for me and my friend. this is not.the best sushi in twon. Hate.that place and the guy.

Service is always awesome.

However on our last visit the Sushi Chef's were extremely slow for no apparent reason.  Also the fish while generally fresh was cut extremely small.  Every thing was mini sized compared to other AYCE places.  The last thing is that the rice isn't always cooked properly, on several occasions I have had slightly crunchy rice.

This used to be my favorite AYCE place, but after this last trip Sushi Koma has lost its crown.

Love Sushi Koma!  Went for dinner AYCE about $25 a person.  Waitress was very friendly and knowledge about the menu and offered good suggestions about how big the dish was and if I may want two orders.  We both got soda and the attentive waitress gave free refills and we didn't have to wait for her to put in more orders.  The Sushi chefs are true artists and everything was beautiful and very fresh and tasty.  
Five stars!

THE BEST IN VEGAS!!! We love to try new resturants but when it comes to sushi this place tops all and we have become regulars about once a week!! We love it here!!! All you can eat and for a reasonable price!! The fish is always super fresh and the staff is absolutely fantastic!!! Service with a smile and always accommodating!! Chris (the owner) is always behind the sushi bar making sure everything is top notch!! A++

Sushi Koma is great!
It was our second time here and it won't be our last. The service is great and the food is delicious!
We came in and were greeted right away and seated. The staff is all extremely friendly and give great service. Our server was very informative and very sweet. 
All our food came out in a timely manner and all of it tasted great. 
The AYCE is reasonably priced and is the best way to go. I love the fact the sushi is not over stuffed with crab mix and rice. Many sushi places pack too much rice into their rolls however Sushi Koma does not. They put the perfect amount of rice so you can enjoy the fish. 
All their rolls are also a great size as well so they are easy to pick up and eat. 
I would highly recommend the Bank Roll, Tropical Roll, and the Alex Munchie Roll. 
Their Hand Rolls are also really good plus their nigiri A+!
The sushi at Sushi Koma is fresh and very tasty.  The staff are all upbeat, quick, and helpful.  The sushi chefs themselves are very quick and do a great job. This is my go-to spot!

This place is okay if you don't have any other dining options to choose from and you are desperately wanting sushi. My family did AYCE and was happy to know that you can order half rolls which affords you to try the many different rolls without getting full. We were excited to give this place a try. The restaurant is very small and can be a bit uncomfortable when it is full which it was when we were there. The service was shaky from the start probably because there was only 1 waitress to serve the whole dining room (small). She did greet us as well as the sushi chefs but we had to ask for menus and then we had to ask for plates and chopsticks after she served us our first couple rolls. Spotty service aside, we did enjoy the seafood tostada, baked mussels, tuna and salmon nigiri and tropicana and Big B rolls. The bank roll and spider roll were okay, I probably would've liked it better if the sauce wasn't so thick and sweet. Also, the bank roll didn't come topped with smelt egg like the menu described. The almost fire roll was also pretty good. I wanted to try the towering tuna poki but was told that they didn't have it. Halfway through our meal, we ordered teriyaki chicken (a la carte) and was told that we couldn't order anything chicken because they do not serve chicken at this time. Something about the owner and having problems with getting the okay.  Anyway, at this point, we were still waiting for the sashimi roll and miso soup which were one of  the first items we ordered when we sat down and another tropicana roll. We decided not to wait for these items, paid and left. Don't think we'll be back to eat here again. We are putting this in the books as been there, tried that, next! Still looking for a good sushi restaurant any where in town after our favorite AYCE Sin City Sushi went down hill a few months ago.

I've been to lots of AYCE sushi places but this tops them all. Best in quality, service and price. When you walk in, you're greeted with a warm welcome from the staff. They let you choose if you'd like to sit at the bar or table. I sat at the bar and the sushi chef, I believe his name was CJ, welcomed us as well. Our waitress was extremely friendly, she even helped my daughter in her high chair.  Throughout our time there, they were very attentive. They made sure we had water, someone was there to take our order, and cleaned up our plates right when we were done. I loved how not one waitress helped a table, but all the waitresses helped each other out. You can really tell they got along well. The food was amazing! I'm really not into raw sushi rolls but the waitress suggested a raw roll that's good and you can't really tell it's raw. She was right! I couldn't even tell it was raw. I love how everything taste so fresh. I love how they had a kids menu. It was simple but simple is perfect for kids eating at a sushi spot. The prices are reasonable for an AYCE sushi place. It was just an overall great dining experience and can't wait to try it again.

This place is a bit small so don't expect to get a seat right away but once you do it's game on! This place rocks; staff is Awesome and attentive, the atmosphere is always fun and cool and most importantly the food is to die for!! For all you can eat sushi in Vegas, this is your place!!!!

Strongly recommend this place. I used to come here before when it was Brian's beach sushi. I am completely impresses how pleasant and expedient their service is here. They delivered a personalized service that I have received from very few businesses. Ok, with their food - amazing. I had everyone thing from their Philly roll to their tiger roll and I was not disappointed. I was in there yesterday and I want to go back today!
This my new favorite sushi restaurant by far amazing food didn't get sick after like others very good atmosphere very  good service

I would consider myself sushi OBSESSED- after living in Vegas for 3 months, I have tried nearly every ACYE sushi joint around, with Umiya being my previous favorite. Not anymore!!! Everything we had was inventive, fresh and phenomenal. The pan- fried gyoza were crisped perfectly, and the seafood tostada was like a delicious fish taco with fresh salsa on a tortilla chip. The sashimi roll was just eh, but the tuna carpaccio is absolute MUST HAVE. Maybe the most delicious sushi dish I've ever had. I also had a variety of nigiri, each of which was furnished with some kind of garnish which kept it interesting (jalepeno for yellowtail, lemon for salmon, garlic and herbs for snapper. We also tried a few different rolls- Tiger, Big B, and Fish Paradise, all of which were good, but not as good as the appetizers and nigiri. For dessert, green tea mochi and plum wine ice cream were delish! Service was very attentive as well. All in all, the most excellent AYCE sushi in Vegas!

The food itself is pretty great!  They have a large selection of rolls both raw and cooked! They have a pretty good appetizer selection as well. The restaurant itself is very small. Unfortunately that also means they have small tables which doesn't really work when you get the all you can eat sushi option. The staff is very helpful and don't mind when you push two tables together but when the place is packed you're S.O.L.

I normally love it here, have the frequent stamp card and all. Came in one afternoon and the service was terrible. Will never return about 20-24 minutes between rolls and we watched every table get help while we sat just looking around from the corner. And the ladies came and took our order like 3 times. I guess they just didn't put it in. And my mochi was melted asked for another and they brought me another melted. My new place is Sumo Sushi the lunch is $3 cheaper than here anyway. NEVER AGAIN.

I came with a friend a few nights ago and was relieved that there was ample seating still available on a Friday night at 7p. We were sat right away and opted for AYCE, ordering round one once we received menus that were forgotten upon our arrival. We started with salmon, yellowtail, and super white tuna and chatted about life and work while waiting for our fish, though it appeared that nobody else was and were receiving theirs punctually. 

Thinking service was pushed back due to the filling dining room, we stopped another server and ordered another round of uni, masago, and amaebi, requesting that the shrimp heads be fried, before round one touched down. Nope - these items came out almost as soon as we ordered it, so we stopped not one, but two servers, to inquire about the first couple of items. The servers assured us that it was "on the way," but everything about the timing and operation just seemed out of whack. I wasn't sure if I was supposed to leave feeling like I was in a "k"oma (ugh, by the way, I hate replacing c-words with a "k"), or if the communication between the servers was comatose. Sorry, "k"omatose. 

I do have to say, though, that the girls working the dining room are very personable, all things said. If any one of them has her own station, we certainly didn't see it - at any time we were able to place orders with anyone, and everyone came by to inquire about us and refill our beverages. A plus!
This is by far my favorite ayce sushi place in town!! Great service and great, fresh, amazing fish!

Must go everytime I stop by Vegas! Just a heads up it is a small location so plan accordingly! My friends and I frequent this location after every volleyball tournament we play in Vegas so we come hungry and at $25 bucks it is a great deal! I enjoy the carpaccio... And the mussels as appetizers and nothing but nigiri! Rolls are very good too. I'd have to say what does this place justice is the service we get. Everytime I visit the service has been impeccable and the servers always seem genuinely nice! They asked us about our tournament and even brought us ice for our poor knees! Refills were on point and food always came out in a timely manner. I would definitely always recommend this location. Heads up I heard the Uni tasted weird? I don't eat Uni so it didn't bug me. But just a heads up.

Another great AYCE sushi bar to add to my list! 

The name's now been changed to Sushi Koma because another restaurant federally trademarked 'Sushi Freak.' The place is a bit small, sitting up to maybe 30 people at most. My friend and I were immediately greeted by the sushi chef as we walked in. Prices were pretty standard' the AYCE lunch is $21.95, for dinner it's $25.95. 

I found myself eating more of the appetizers and nigiri than the rolls. The Tuna Carpaccio is to die for, sadly it's only 1 order per person. The Sashimi Roll was alright, but to me it lacked flavor. I was surprised they didn't have Agedashi Tofu on their menu since it's usually a pretty popular appetizer. The Yellowtail nigiri is a must-order, in fact, all of their nigiri was fresh and tasty. They don't skimp on each slice either, unlike some other places I've been to. The rolls were good too, but I only had room in my stomach to try 3 half orders, so I will definitely try more next time. 

Other than the fresh fish, what stood out to me the most was the great service. The 2 waitresses were very attentive and patient, always checking in to make sure plates were being cleared and drinks were refilled. And they didn't have a fake attitude, they were genuinely nice about serving us, which is something you don't see much of these days. 

Overall, great food, great service, I'll be back soon!
You have to try the tuna carpaccio!!! It's the best item on the menu. One of the best sushi restaurant in vegas.

So good! This is one of the best AYCE sushi places in town. They have a more limited sushi roll menu (meaning many of the rolls are very similar in their ingredients), but they are all pretty tasty. I highly recommend this restaurant! It's a very small restaurant, so be prepared to be right next to other people and their conversations while dining here.

I was not a sushi fan. I had tried it once many years ago and was not a fan. I was invited to Sushi Koma and decided to give it one more chance. I was so glad I did! The food was great! Our server recommended some really good things! I plan on going again in the near future!

So i came here with my husband on Saturday night around 9:30pm, the restaurant was semi busy only a few people in the dining area. The waitress sat us right away and took our drink orders, we decided to go with the AYCE and we're not disappointed. My husband is not a big fan of the raw stuff so he was really excited that there were so many cooked roll choices . I on the other hand love nigiri. There were a lot of items to choose from and left happy and full :). Only thing that was a little annoying was the seating once it gets full the tables get very crowded and you have to squeeze through all the chairs and tables .

Tried this place based on decent reviews and it's close to our house. First time was great and second time..well, I had to use the restroom soon after eating there.  Not food poisoning or anything big, but just not fresh.  

Price is compatible with other AYCE places.  I do like their appetizer selections, with a bit more varieties than the usual suspects.  The sashimi roll...warming, it's SO TINY.  It's like the size of my finger, no joke.  Although it's refreshing and tasting..it's just a bit too small.  

I don't normally eat rolls, I like to eat the real fish, so nigiri is how I can tell if the fish is fresh or not.  So I can't review if the rolls are good or not.  

I don't like how they add sauce on all the nigiris for you.  But you can inform the sushi chef or waiter to not put sauce on top for you.  I learned that after a few orders came in, I had to tell them to stop.  And the sauce was not spectacular or anything, seems either ponzu, soy or sea salt, but just seems like they want to cover up the unfreshness of the fish?  Maybe that's not their intension, but why would they do it?  We are capable of dunking our pieces of nigiri in our wasabi/soy ourselves.  

They also like to add sea salt on the scallops..which makes the scallops really salty.  A little yuzu would be just fine.  

Overall, decent AYCE place, not the best and not the worst.  Service was great and it's a bit tiny and they can get pretty overwhelming at times.

This place was recommended to me by a co-worker and I can't thank her enough.  It has now become one of my fav AYCE sushi places. The restaurant is small with even smaller tables but the food more than makes up for the tight quarters. The staff is very attentive and they're open till 3am!  Great local spot.

Best AYCE sushi restaurant in the world!  The owner and his staff are efficient and super friendly.   Love the white tuna sashimi and the tuna carpaccio.  Great that you can order half rolls too.  And it includes dessert!

I do not understand the hype for this place.  Their sushi is good but nothing spectacular.  The poke...eh.  The fish tostada...meh.  It's fresh, don't get me wrong, but nothing I ate here sticks in my mind.  It blends in with the numerous other "okay" sushi restaurants in the area.  The only bright spots were the nigiri...everything else was blah.

The restaurant is also really small and they pack it to the max.  They even stole two of our chairs during the meal to pack it even further.   This place is awesome if you like refugee-camp-style dining!  They really need to get a bigger space (and a new sign--it still says Brian's Beach Sushi).

Also, the service is fast and attentive but I couldn't take a bite without a server asking me how I was doing.  I felt like screaming "thank you, but for the love of god leave me alone!"  The serving tempo was so intense that I felt like everyone was having some kind of manic episode.  

For me, the nigiri is the only reason to go back.  Otherwise, I'll pass.

After a 4-5 hour drive from California to Las Vegas, me and my friends decided to have the AYCE dinner @ Sushi Freak. We actually found out about this place through Yelp and we had no idea how to get there, so we called the place up and the waitress who served us also gave us directions on how to get there. This place opened really late which is great for us since we arrived sometime after midnight to LV and were really hungry. 

It was around 25 dollars per person for AYCE but I'm pretty sure we ate more than that. Our orders came in a very timely matter, there was almost always food on the table to keep our mouths busy. They charged gratuity for large parties so we didn't have to tip the waitress but I did anyways cause she was so awesome.

This place was off the LV strip so it wasn't packed with a bunch of people, the service was great and the nigiri was fresh. We even ordered albacore which was not even listed in the nigiri menu and weren't even charged extra for it. I'd suggest the halibut, red snapper and yellowtail nigiri. I would also suggest the dragon/spider roll . The waitress Judy was extremely friendly and would frequent our table to make sure she kept up with our orders as well as filling up my hot tea and our waters. Judy was pretty good looking too lol I wish I sat on the other side of the table so I could get a better view, oh well. What's not to like though? Good food, great service, cute waitress and a fair price.

Its consistently fresh and delicious service staff is always helpful and Team Work oriented i've been here many times before but tonight Hana did it for me cute funny and New definitely a great add on to this already great chill spot to go in a koma lol

I really like this place. One of the better sushi restaurants in town in my opinion. Food is tasty, staff is friendly, AYCE, and atmosphere is good. 

Most importantly, the ratio of meat/veggies/other to rice is good.....a trait not commonly found in AYCE places! 

I'd highly recommend and this place is castle becoming my favorite sushi place in town

This is my favorite sushi place! I go twice a month for lunch and dinner and the food is alway consistent. The price is great. The staff is polite and attentive. Refills of drinks are prompt, clearing of used plates are constant. We usually do all you can eat and have never had to wait between orders. The owner is very active in the restaurant's success and almost always asks every table for feedback of their personal dining experience.

Where do I start? I ate here twice before the relocation. Those visits were wonderful. I went last night and, thankfully, my wife and I escaped an evening on the toilet. The staff was wonderful. They were friendly and prompt. But the food. What happened? We both were excited for the AYCE. I started with salmon Nigiri.  Ugh! It was mushy & warm. I struggled getting the 2nd piece down. The Tuna Carpaccio got our hopes up and the 1st & 2nd order satisfied.  But the rest of the meal tested our gag reflexes. The baked lasagna was covered in disgusting chunks of sour cream that overpowered all other flavors in the dish. The rice was a mushy lump. The baked scallops should have been called baked onions that I still taste this morning. There were a few tasty bits of scallop and mushroom but not before the onion dulled our senses. My wife then order the teriyaki chicken. Unlike my 2 prior visits, the chicken was fried! Were they kidding? We then had the egg rolls.  Oh the egg rolls. The nice deep crispy fried shell had us hopeful. The hope was dashed at the 1st bite.  The rolls were half filled with what looked like nothing more than day old cabbage. I asked 2 servers if there was meat in the egg rolls. One said there was chicken and the other said there was no meat! At this point our depression was firmly set.  We finished with green tea ice cream and a mango Mochi, which was the best part of the meal. We left a full 15% tip because we didn't want to punish the servers. The new restaurant decor was inviting; the "new" food disgusting. Maybe they lost the chef. Whatever it is, we will never go back.

I have to say, I am quite frustrated with the service of the place. This was around 1PM when my girl and I went there. We had our seat, and there were LITERALLY two other customers inside. So there shouldn't have been a long waiting time. After we made our first order (Tuna Poke) we then had to wait 15 minutes to just get that. On the flip side, all the other guest are being serviced IMMEDIATELY. We first thought that maybe they had a big order, so we gave them the benefit of a doubt. Then afterwards more customers were coming in and ALL the chefs started making THEIR orders! 

  We soon noticed that the chef would take our order from the waitress, then place it to the side, and then start making orders for different guest that have been waiting a lot less time. For every one order we did get to the table (which weren't many), they would sling out 3 to four orders to the other customers. I wish I taken video of this....!!!! This was just a bad experience from the beginning to the end, the waitress didn't even acknowledge that we've been waiting a lot longer. Even when I politely asked about when the orders would be ready, all she said was, "Soon!" And then walked away. I didn't show any signs of being mad. We just paid our bill, and left....

  And coming from the customer service industry, I am very lenient, I would happily pay more for good service, even if the food was not so great.

I'm an extreme sushi snob when it comes to fish. So when Goyemon went down the drain with all of the rest of this towns run down sushi joint, Sushi Freak came to the rescue. I've never had anything but exceptional service here, whether it's early in the day or really late at night. The owner of the place has personally introduced himself and always made sure everything was in order. They also have the freshest fish I've encountered at a sushi joint. The service is awesome and it's small but homey so I love it. Christine is one of my favorite servers and it's a type of atmosphere where I don't mind my server talking to me and laughing with me and suggesting items. They know what I like and I almost could skip ordering and get what I want anyways. I tend to always order nigiri and maybe a roll if I'm into it. But I'm a nigiri girl at heart and I love the extra garnishing they add, if you don't like it simply ask them not to put it there.  MY FAVORITE BY FAR. I just hope their popularity doesn't go to their heads like it did with Goyemon, that would be a sad sad day for me.
Good food delivered lightning fast and the waitresses kept my glass full!  I am usually not a fan of AYCA food but this is an exception!

I have been to Sushi Koma several times and LOVE it!  It's small, but the service is very attentive and fun, and the food is great!  Those I've come with say the sushi, etc. is extremely fresh and well prepared.  But personally, I love the seaweed salad, edamame, teriyaki chicken, teriyaki beef, and the grape quesadillas, plus the desserts. I can't wait to go back again!

Came here for lunch with a girlfriend and we did the lunch all you can eat $21.95. We ordered lots of food; seaweed salad, gyoza, edamame, miso soup, 5 sushi rolls and green tea ice cream. Everything was so delicious! Sushi was good, appetizers were good, and customer service was excellent. Definitely coming back when I am in the mood for AYCE!
the sushi here is on point! This is my new favorite sushi spot so far in Vegas. When you come you have to try the seared tuna carpaccio and the almost fire roll. You won't be disappointed!

Sushi Koma is always a good choice! Their sushi is fresh, the service is good, and it's the best for AYCE in the west side of town. I just wish it was a little bigger since it can get quite crowded and loud on busy nights. They are open til 3am and you will definitely be in a coma when you're done!

Not sure how to reply to a compliment however let's make this clear. My boyfriend and I joined a group of friends for a birthday dinner. We arrived after the group. Everyone kept getting more and more food they were ordering while I got none. I told 3 servers. I was yelled at by one telling me what I ordered which was not correct. Still no food after 45 minutes. After the next table heard me complaining at the owner they said hey we got all your food... the servers and owners heard. I stated I'm done I'm not eating, my boyfriend can finish and were leaving.  Okay you messed up table numbers no big deal but you left instead of taking responsibility and left some poor man to deal with your mess. We tipped well, I was a server I know what it's like. Basically all you had to to was take responsibility tell me you screwed the table numbers and apologize there wouldn't have been a problem. I did not have a bill. My boyfriend's was comped I can't speak for the others, they are regulars there. We sat there waiting for checks for 20 minutes after our bill was handled and no-one brought them checks after they asked more than once, so I don't k ow what to tell you there.

What can I say! The owner remembers our faces, the waitresses are super friendly and lightning fast and the sushi....my god! Fresh! Delicious and beSt best thing---you can do AYCE half orders. We have tried almost everything and have never been let down. Everything is pretty much...YUM!!! The sushi chefs will even make custom rolls for you (ask nicely) how awesome is that! They play awesome music too! Ambience is a mixed crowd- but a fun one to bat. Come in down say hi to Chris, try the Twist Octopus Roll, PCH Roll and no matter how stuffed you get DO NOT leave this place without sampling their Seafood Tostada-only 1 per person! That's how Good this is! We always save ours for last! Have fun! Come happy leave dazed!

So finally getting around to reviewing Sushi Koma. Started coming to this place when it first opened up under the old name but definitely like the new one a lot better. Unlike other sushi places, this place is pretty consistent with quality, taste, and service. The quality of the sushi  is very good. From the nigiri to the rolls, it's pretty damn good. Now, I'm not a huge sushi eater but have tried more than a few places and would definitely put this place in a top three. My girlfriend loves the garlic tuna and says it's one of the best. I personally like the shrimp tempura rolls, spicy crab, and also the terrayaki beef roll. I know some think beef and sushi don't go together. But what's not to like? Beef and rice! What's not to love. 
Even though the place isn't the biggest, it has a good vibe and comfortable atmosphere. No matter how busy it gets, the servers are always smiling and seem happy to be there (whether that's true or not). Overall, I recommend this place to all my friends and would still keep recommending it.
Love this place!! The tuna carpaccio is sooooo bomb. Everything on the AYCE menu is really good and the sushi is fresh. Cute little restaurant and the service has always been good.

Second time here and will continue to come back. The service is always great with attentive and friendly staff. The quality of the food is great for the price value; all you can eat is the way to go! The menu selection has a variety that caters to everyone. If you're looking for a fun night out with friends, Sushi Koma is the place to be.

If you want ayce sushi that takes 30mins for each order to come out then you are on the right place, and it wasnt even busy but the thing that kept bothering me more was how the sushi chef kept giving us attitude, which i believe was the owner. "why offer ayce if you are gonna complain on people ordering food?!"

We cancelled all our order and left and when we were on the parking lot the sushi chef came out right away to smoke his cigarette, who knows if he even washed his hands while making sushi since he could careless about his customers, just a thought!
By far one of the best sushi places in vegas. Its like they have the fishing boat parked in the back

I HAVE to do a re-review of this place. My GF and I have come here countless times and usually are quite satisfied. Normally the owner is present and the same staff which usually is the owner's wife/gf amongst others. 

We went in on 12/26/2012 and instantly noticed a very fishy smell. The owner was not there and there was only one server that I think I had seen only once or twice before. The service was horrendously slow. Others walked out but we stayed. 

When we finally got some nigiri it all tasted especially fishy. We did not get some of the things we ordered and finally just aksed for the check. The waitress KEPT apologizing to the point it was embarrassing for everyone. I cannot understand why they didn't call some help in. This waitress was clearly in over her head. 

Today my girlfriend is home from work sick thanks to this sushi. I didn't know this is what they meant by Sushi Koma.  Despite going here literally 35+ times, we will not be back.

This place is pretty good , it was my second time here and the rolls are really good here , my favorite roll is the mountain roll.
 Jannie was our server and the service she provided was excellent

Stopped in for lunch on Sunday.  This was our first visit and we will DEFINITELY be coming back! The sushi on the menu is delicious but if you really want a unique experience ask your sushi chef for a surprise.

Hole in the wall place with good fresh tasting sushi. All-u-can-eat is the way to go. Service is good,but, slow getting the food out. The cute waitresses are very friendly and attentive. I'll be back!
Great place to get good sushi everyone is very frinedly definitely recommend to try it.

My absolute favorite all you can eat sushi place ! I have been going for years and this place never disappoints . They have a great menu and are open late . One of my favorites is the seared tuna carpaccio , and i stock up on tons of nigiri (amazing yellowtail and cajun albacore) . They have really great fresh fish ! The staff is the sweetest as well . I wish they would expand because this place gets so filled constantly ! Loveeee it :)
Dang, I didn't know the tuna carpaccio was only 1 order per person as I gobbled up my bf's order and he couldn't get another one. I blame the little piggy inside of me.

I came here for a second time because my first time here was amazing. The sushi never seems to disappoint me here and it makes me happy that this place serves dishes on their All You Can Eat menu that other sushi restaurants do not. Their fish is fresh and their food is all high quality. They are super quick to make orders. Ross was our waiter and he was amazing! He was the only one working at the time and he was very quick to take our orders, serve us, and take our plates as we eat and he did an exceptional job serving us with no mistakes:) I live far from this place, but I was definitely come back one day!

I love Sushi Koma!! I've been here a few times and each one has been a wonderful experience. The staff is so attentive and super friendly. There's nothing that I like more than happy servers and the girls that have served me here are so awesome. They are sweet and made some great suggestions for us The food comes out fast and the fish is so fresh here! I can really tell it is a high quality of fish. They are open late and this place gets busy on the weekend nights. Love love Sushi Koma, definitely the only place to get fresh, fast AYCE with a wonderful staff to match.

Here we are, 3 1/2 years later, and this is still one of the best sushi places around.  It just get's busier, and better!  Finally went with a friend whom is a sushi fanatic, and all about "All you can eat".  

He ate to his hearts content, and barely came up for air.  I had to ask him after the meal what he thought? His response was "Great!" Everything tasted wonderful to him, and he said he didn't feel shorted or cheated on quality or execution.  I personally don't do the AYCE, as my appetite won't allow, but to have that come from a sushi foodie is huge.  Just one of the many reasons I've maintained Sushi Koma as an absolute gem of a restaurant.

Of course the service was good (As usual), even with several new faces. Efficient and quick, even though they were super busy that evening.

Go.... That's all I can say.

I've gone to many sushi places, but this place is one of my favorite AYCE sushi place in vegas.   Good food and good services.  You generally get much better deal in this place than anywhere else in vegas. 

some tips:
- good raw sushi. small rice, fresh fish (for AYCE standard real good).  \
- rolls are good, but huge. get half size. 
- may want to call in advance to put down name right before you leave. place is small and can get crowded quickly.

I just went here for the first time with three friends and the food was amazing! We all opted for AYCE and it was definitely worth it. I've been to several other AYCE places but this one had the best service by far! All of the servers were smiling and were quick to bring the food. I'll definitely be returning.

i feel like i am constantly writing reviews for this restaurant but that's only because this place has got to be, hands down, THE BEST SUSHI JOINT ON THE FRICKIN PLANET. i mean aside from the amazing sushi i ALWAYS receive here, the servers themselves are the best in town. but my review tonight (7/29 around 1:30am) is for one awesome server specifically: Jessica with the RED hair. tonight I was honestly having a rough night at work and wasn't in the best mood once I was done with my shift, but after we had our meal at sushi koma and got the spend some time interacting with Jessica my mood flipped 100%! that girl seriously put a genuine smile on my face and the business should be PROUD to have her on the team.... I'd also like to throw a very special THANK YOU to the sushi chef who (by request) made me a chefs special roll. I asked him to put ANYTHING together for me to try and he happily did and let me say, it was bomb.com! :D
SUSHI KOMA, YOU'RE MY 1 AND ONLY! thanks again Jessica! hope you're working next time I come in!

Amazing food, great service, great value. All you can eat sushi is $21 before 3pm and $25 after that. The appetizers are delicious and several of them have toasted garlic chips that make them incredible. 

The service and vibe is perfect. It's in a strip mall that looks like it won't be good from the parking lot, but opens into a modern decor that feels fresh and welcoming. The waiters are very cool and give great service with a smile. I eat a lot of sushi and Sushi Koma definitely stands our as one of the best.

This place is the best for AYCE. The only place I will spend this kinda of money! (Well, my boyfriend's money)  LOL. I eat here atleast once a month, sometimes more! Everything is always AMAZINNGGGGGG. You must try tuna carpaccio! MY FAV rolls are Kimmy, SSS, and all of the soft shell crab ones mmmm. Also the white tuna and unagi. Yum.  I think I need to go tomorrow...
 And I love the staff, super friendly!! 5 stars all the way ^_^

I had a terrible experience there. Me and my wife went there just to eat a regular plate of sushi but the price was about the same as a all you can eat at that restaurant. Nothing taste that special there from any other sushi buffet places even though the menu looks large. We don't plan to go back again.

So my dad and I had dinner here last night. Out of so many AYCE places I didn't know why I picked this one!!! Options were limited, not many choices to choose from. The worst part is food positioning for both me and my dad. 7 hours after eating there, I started to feel stomachache. That was in the middle of the night so I held it. The next day my dad told me he had diarrhea that night after sushi and he couldn't not work the full 8 hours the next day cause his diarrhea didn't stop. I was so mad with this stupid place that I had to come on Yelp and write down a review to warn everyone. 

People please! Go search around other all you can eat sushi place around the town. So many more choices for the same price and I never had any stomach issues after eating sushi. This was the only time. I grew up eating raw fish, this restaurant is ridiculous.

The best to place in Las Vegas for AYCE Sushi. The tuna carpaccio, eel, tuna, salmon, red snapper, octopus nigiri excellent also the spicy tuna hand roll. For me the one I enjoy the most was the Jane roll (spicy). Excellent service checking to see if I wish to order more sushi as well filling my drink. The one draw back I had was the music it was VERY LOUD and distracting, other guests had to speak louder over it and it was a VERY BIG distraction to me.
Came in during lunch and the service was fast. Amazing sushi. Fish tasted fresh and the baked rolls are delicious.

I love this place. Its probably the best sushi in town. My absolute favorite thing on the menu is the albacore. Good old fashioned albacore. it just melts in your mouth and the sauce is simple but just as delicious. I've tried a couple of different sushi places looking for the same delicious quality fish but I just cant seem to find one. AYCE is $25.95 for dinner and $21.95 for lunch.

Sushi Koma is FANTASTIC! I have been here twice and both times the service and food were amazing. They have so many items to choose from with the  ALL YOU CAN EAT Sushi special...their Dyanmite is some of the best I've had! If you like spicy, then go for the Jalepeno Poppers...sooo good! The place itself is small, so go in the afternoon so you don't have to wait...either way, if you are raving great Sushi and Rolls at a great price, this is the SPOT! Sushi til you Koma!!

After an amazing Elite event at The Barrymore, a group of us decided to continue the fun at Sushi Freak.  

The staff was incredible, making sure we had everything we needed and bringing our food out at a good pace.  The timing of our foods arrival was spot on, and the chef even sent some special creations not on the menu out for us.  My hot tea was always filled, and the empty plates were promptly removed.  

The quality of the tuna especially is great here, and I can't think of a better option in the valley for AYCE sushi.  


Come try the creative and innovative combinations at Sushi Freak, and enjoy a family-run, comfortable place to get your Eat-on!!

Best sushi spot in Vegas!!! Sushi tastes amazing and is super fresh!! If you like spicier rolls they have a spicy menu that is out of this world!! Their AYCE includes a large selection of appetizers that most places don't offer like chicken teriyaki, mussels, shrimp tempura, beef teriyaki and more! Chris the sushi chef is the guy to ask for when you are there, he bends over backwards to make custom rolls for you that you are looking to try!! Customer service all around here is second to none, you can't go a minute without them removing your used plates and drink refills. A++++ will continue to visit time and time again!!!
Love this place!!! Romantic  perfect for date night. Food is on point. It makes love to your taste buds

I was in Vegas for Labor Day weekend... Came to this place because a friend recommend it. It's an all you can eat sushi spot. Rolls my friend and I tried: fish paradise roll, tempura roll, variety of nigiri rolls, spicy tuna roll. PLEASE NOTE: Spicy tuna roll is actually really spicy here. It's my fave but if I come here again I definitely will pass on it. 
Pros: Overall it was great and delicious experience. $22 for all you can eat lunch buffet (soft drinks not included). Waitress was fast and attentive. Sushi was fresh. Plenty of parking. 
Cons: it's a small business with limited seating, I can see at peak hours they must have long waiting times. Also, it's located way off the strip.

I ordered the shrimp tempura roll and on the scale of 1-10... The sushi was a 10. Delicious egg rolls and the miso soup was to die for. Great music in the background! But the customer service was ice cold. No warm welcome no enjoy just don't sit here don't sit there. There was also a smell not sure what!

Went to sushi Koma for lunch and once again it didn't disappoint:). We took our families with us to try sushi for the first time, they loved it. The waitresses were so patient while we figured out what to order for their first taste of sushi. Thanks again !!!!
