Small portions. The sushi tasted very bland. Definitely not impressed at all. There's so many better sushi places in Vegas. Truly disappointed.

I sat at the bar and the service was terrific.  The food was wonderful as well.  I've never been to an AYCE sushi joint and was a little skeptical at first, but overall the food was BOMB! The calm nigiri was really good as well as the cajun nigiri.

In short skip it...it's small and cramped.  Plus they have a DJ setup right in the middle of it which only puts more emphasis on how small it is.  DJ was good though.  The sushi leaves no reason to come back.  Maybe late night little buzz, you want some sushi and some records spun.  That'd be about it.  There's way too many other sushi places that are better in this town.

Went there with some friends for lunch when they opened. There was nobody except us (group of 5). The menu was unexciting, full of rolls and baked stuff, which we didn't order. We were all nigiri or raw fish fans. We all opted for the AYCE lunch and ordered some nigiris to start with, and the waitress apologized as there was only one chef and the other was late. We were very understanding, but as we waited and waited for our food, we couldn't understand why it was taking so long. We were the only people in there and they just opened, and we only ordered nigiri, which is just raw fish and rice! It took 20 minutes to get our orders, and most of our 1 1/2 lunch was spent sitting around waiting for food. It would be okay if the food was good, but the fish wasn't fresh or exciting. The fish tasted bland and tasteless. Salmon was off color. Tasted more like something from a very mediocre sushi restaurant, which I think this was. I will never go back again. I am a huge sushi aficionado and have been to very many sushi restaurants, and this was one of the worst I've been to.

My boyfriend and I are sushi lovers. I'm  pescetarian, so sushi is our favorite meal we can actually share together. We used to bounce around to a couple of different places, but now Sushi Koma is the only place we will go. They are open until 3am! And the food is always good! The tuna carpaccio, garlic tuna, white tuna, and dynamite are AMAZING. The manager/owner always says hello to us and occasionally sends us a special plate. We bring all of our friends here. They offer All You Can Eat. And they even have a punch card, to earn a free all you can eat.

This is the worst sushi place I been to in my life and their service is so bad. Never again their so horrible and not even friendly. I wish I could give them zero starts but yelp doesn't allow so yeah but I would give negative stars. Overall all bad place to come eat. It doesn't even fill you up and I recommend not to come here.
I love how I can order half rolls off of the all-you-can-eat sushi menu. All the staff members there are super friendly. :)

My third time going back and this time I took my girl fiend. This resturant is well put together with top quality sushi and on point genuine costumer service which Is hard to find especially for a reasonable price. Next time I'm back in Vegas I'll will eat here for sue, really hits the spot. What really triggered me to write this review is because I left me debit card at the resturant and called a couple of days later and they offered to mail it to me as I live in SAN Diego which is above and beyond the norm for costumers service from my experience.
Thanks a lot, the little things don't go unnoticed. 
Cheers :)

The first time I came to Sushi Koma was when they were across the way in the smaller area, but their service was phenomenal then. Went today with a group of about 10 and our server didn't seem to keen on serving us. One half of the table got phenomenal service, while my half was pretty shitty. If you are going to double team a table, make sure both servers are on it and not just one of them. I think I would've had a better experience with the one server who was attentive rather than the two team server. Like I said, the one half had great service, while my half pretty much was left in the dust.

Yeah, this place is excellent for AYCE.  We went for lunch and left stuffed to the gills.  They have really fabulous and tasty rolls.  I especially loved the SSS roll, spicy, crunchy tempura shrimp inside.  YUM!  Most of the rolls are on the smaller side which is great bc you're not filling up on 2 rolls and done.  They also do half rolls which I prefer.  My MO for AYCEs is the try as many different rolls and appetizers as possible. :)  Also worth mentioning is the tuna tataki with little fried shallots on top.  Very garlicky and intensely flavored.  I will be back!
Great service very friendly. Awesome Sushi all you eat. And it's open till 3am. It's my second time here coming from Calif.

Had a lunch today and the first time to visit here. The best sushi place in vegas for me so far about taste. 

Pro:
All sushi were fresh n tasty. Especially yellowtail belly, salmon belly n cajun albaco were soooo yummy.

All rolls we ordered were so yummy. U can do half order for most of rolls so u can try many kinds. 

Con:
Food were so good but service was too slow. 
We always had to call our servers when we needed something. They never showed up to us until we called them. It was not that busy and there were 2 servers. 

We ordered some sushi together but it came out one by one so we had to keep stop eating. I wish everything came out together for same order. 

And sushi rice was little bit hard so it kept seperating from the fish.

Fresh oh my goodness it's been awhile since I've good sushi in this city. Fish Paradise roll was fresh and I really mean that. I could taste all the different flavors in the roll. We also had the sam's volcano. Now we don't usually do baked rolls but this one wasn't grease or too heavy.  Excited to come back.

Well I guess they are use to an all you can eat sushi crowd. I asked for UNI and it was a complete melt down by the sushi apprentice. WE DON'T SERVE UNI, UNTIL DINNER. I'm like ok, says here 4pm is dinner time son. OK your error its 440pm now, I guess your in another time zone? I will order from the waitress. 1 cold sake from first waitress, pretty good sake. Then the first waitress disappears then another waitress arrives and says can I take your order. OK BAM there you have my order. I'm finished talking I just want to drink my sake in peace and quite. Buddha style! Then I get the sushi apprentice yelling at me. SIR CAN I GET YOU SOMETHING? I was like son, I asked you for UNI and it never arrived. I have shut you down. So I will order from the waitress. Keep in mind this place was empty and the place is only 10 feet x 10 feet. The waitress then tells me he is new.  OK he's new... I forgive him. But wait he's not new according to the other employees what's going on here. Haha... You have to laugh. If you want micro / nano / tapas sushi this place is for you.... I'm pretty sure I will NOT be going back,  after the fiasco. I will say the second waitress was pretty good she said I ate like a bird. Saving them some money aka bird man. Just doing my part to save the sushi restaurant some money.  I approve this message J K KUHL.

was looking for good sushi, did the usual yelp search, read the reviews they were everything the restaurant & service was...

this place is small, lively,  definately worth the money & drive... I will definitely come back...

This was my first time eating here. I loved the concept of all you can eat from a menu. They don't have these kinds of places in Texas. We were pretty much the only people here during lunch. Everything tasted great and fresh. I got mostly raw stuff and that didn't disappoint at all. I will def come back the next time I'm in town.

One of my favorite AYCE sushi spots in Vegas.  Excellent service, competitive price, and excellent food.  They have a diverse menu as well that includes a fusion of different cuisines.  They are also one of the few AYCE spots in Vegas open really late.  If you are a fan of Goyeman, you'll be a fan here as well.

Don't believe the hype :) Was it good? Yes. Was it great? No... I can eat raw fish straight up and didn't like that the nigri had sauce all over it. The fish was good but would've preferred it without the soy sauce. They also put salt on top of the scallops. I want it in its original flavor. 

The service was not that great. I understand that you are the only waitress there but couldn't you go clockwise it counter clockwise to see if we were ok? We waited awhile for the sushi to come out.

Will I come back? Probably not.
Tuna Carpaccio!  But the sad part is it's only one order per person during AYCE. =(

I love sushi koma!! So delicious and very nice service. I will say the orders here take a lot longer to get to your table than at other sushi places but I'm letting it slide because the food is so tasty and quality. I'm glad they moved to a bigger space!

I learned from experience that it doesn't take a large fancy restaurant to serve food. Moon, owner and head sushi chef definitely utilizes the quality over quantity style that is Sushi Freak. The servers are friendly, and what's most important.. Moon and the sushi chefs have all been working with each other at RA for years, which I think gives the place more character. For being a small restaurant that specializes in AYCE, they believe in taking your time and enjoying your food there. Congradulations.

Great customer service!
My boyfriend & I tried this for date night and we loved it 
Not only is the sushi fresh, the menu is easy to use and everyone who worked there gave us great recommendations!! 
We sat at the sushi bar and got a "chefs special" on the house!
The servers were very attentive and the atmosphere was great  we would definitely come back!
great all u can eat sushi! Great customer service. The sushi there are really fresh! N the price is reasonable.
Great late night option. Happy with the food and service.

I'm just letting new and old customers they moved from their old tiny location to another spot in the same complex so don't be sad if you come up to the old location and it's empty, just look to the South for their new location
Went there for my birthday  The staff was friendly and the food was really good we had the all you can eat and boy did we eat I recommend this place to those who enjoy AYCE sushi
Amazing food and service! The sushi was so fresh and the rolls came out incredibly fast! The Sake Flights are AMAZING!!

Michele with one L.. Is horrible, 1 Star service.. She can't read minds.. Like duh we expect that as customers.. The food makes up for her lack of telepathic abilities though.. So 5 stars

Just kidding, all jokes aside this is perhaps the best sushi spot in town or at minimum is ranked very high up there.  The service is unquestionably great and even on a busy night whether it's Michele or Aileen, that ends up helping my best friend and I, we end up giving nothing but praises for how outstanding they are to us.  That goes for the sushi chefs and the owner himself.  Indeed all a part of a winning ensemble.

Now let's talk sushi.. Rice holds, they have good size fish cuts, they're tasty and incredibly fresh!  Haven't had any fresher in this town.  Me and my bud are nigeri aficionados and indulge in tuna, yellowtail, salmon (tastiest I.M.O.), red snapper, super white, surf clam and uni.  The latter two being in my opinion the best in this town.  I've experienced bad uni and surf clam before but never here.  Oh and the sashimi roll is ridiculous.

5 stars through and through..

This was stumbled upon accident and what a great surprise. This small yet lively restaurant not only serves top quality sushi, but the whole staff was absolutely wonderful. Right when we sat down, the servers immediately got out orders and food was served within 10 minutes. We tasted a variety of appetizers such as tune carpaccio, seaweed salad, tostada, and miso soup - all the portions were great and delicious. The sushi however took the prize (as it should right?). The chef even gave us complementary fresh clams to start. You can tell all the ingredient were super fresh and made to order. I really appreciated the fact that things were not stuffed with rice.

Our favorite rolls were: Mountain and PB!!

I was a little intoxicated when I went there because I asked for a corona (clearly not an Japanese beer) and then asked again forgetting I had asked the first time, I asked if they have any beer similar- the waiter said yes and I was iffy, but it tasted almost spot on! Good work, 5 points to you sir. There was a roll covered in sauce and was a bit fried that was delicious! Ugh angry I forgot the name. Other rolls I tried was okay, the reason I loved this place is cause our server was the shit, so were the guys behind the sushi bar, a fun experience. And that sushi roll was sooo good. I wouldn't of acted so publicly intoxicated if it wasn't for the fact we were the only people there at the time because it was three in the afternoon. Winning.

I went here for the first time last night and I am hooked!!! I've been to many sushi places..SUSHI KOMA has the most freshest tasting seafood!!! IF you LOVE UNI???!!!! Omg it's like BUTTER...so fresh!!! Most that i've tasted is TOO rich but it was just right!!!!! Dinner AYCE was $24.95. The service was AWESOME!!!!!! The waitresses were so kind and within 5 minutes we'd get our roll! Although it's tiny space, i love it. It's very intimate...and it didn't hurt that I had a handsome date! ;)

Awsome. Perfect service. Great chefs. Vibe is just excellent. It's located in a smaller strip mall and fairly inconspicuous.  The staff here is what makes this place. The decor is easy on the eyes. Ok so for the food and $#s. . I did the all you can eat. $26.00. A couple of dollars higher than other places but we'll worth the investment.. Venice hand Rollins a must have the sea urchin under the recomendation of the waitress was really good. The fried oysters and baked muscles .mmmmm yess. Sashimi . Everything was perfect except the red snapper which was good but not as good as. However I still keep the 5 stars.  I ate a lot more all of which was excellent. However I stopped due to guilt. .:)

Great sushi and even better staff. I love this place
And it's my to go sushi place in Las Vegas always worth the drive away from the strip

This place is the new "Brian's Beach" which had located in this spot beforehand. Their sign may still say Brian's Beach but as the owner had said, they are replacing the sign soon. 

This is located on the southwest corner of Flamingo and Durango facing east on the west side of the shopping center. 

Hours are 11:30 AM - 4:00 PM for lunch, 4:00 PM - 11:30 PM for dinner, and 11:30 PM - 3:00 AM for late night. Their prices are quite average in terms of an all you can eat sushi restaurant for lunch and dinner, standing at $21.95 and $25.95 respectively.

Upon entrance to the restaurant, you are greeted by both the waitress staff as well as the owner and sushi chefs. Service is phenomenal. The place seems to have been remodeled or redesigned, so in my opinion, actually looks better. 

I was taken to a seat at the sushi bar sitting directly in front of the owner/sushi chef. Heres a little background on the owner. He used to be the head chef at the sushi restaurant located at Fashion Show called RA Sushi. During one of my many conversations with the owner, I had been told that he was quite restricted by the management on how sushi was made. As a proud sushi chef, it was not something he could put up to as it was considerably lower than his own standards in sushi making. So he decided to take over this location, and start his own sushi restaurant.

Now about the food. 

My plan was to try the fishes (nigiri), as it was one of my favorites when it comes to sushi. The sweet, fresh taste of different types of seafood is quite the experience if its something you can handle (some people cant eat raw foods). As i was informed by the chef/owner, new shipments of the fishes are delivered daily so you get the freshest fish when you come eat at this restaurant. 

I started my experience with an order of tuna, white tuna, and yellowtail. For the record, by the time I finished my meal, i had tried most of the nigiri at least once. With tasting of the first 3 orders, I was surprised by the quality of fish they had prepared. Very fresh, and sweet. 

One little nitpick i had while i was eating here was the chef/owner tends to put various sauces (yum yum? ponzu?) or toppings on his sushi. As he had said, a lot of people like it like that, but for me personally, it was ok. But with a slight notice, he had reduced the amount of sauces/toppings there after for me so it was nice that he listened. I mean, it wasn't bad for the most part, it was quite the experience, for example, having a slice of chili on top of yellowtail nigiri. It was interesting, as i liked eating spicy foods as well. It was a different experience. 

I had told the chef that i was a fish eater, so after this first 3 orders, he took into command and had made various dishes for me. Most of my meal were made without ordering. Most were vary tasty and delicious. 

In terms of nigiri, my favorites were probably the white tuna, yellow tail, salmon, sweet shrimp, and scallop. All very fresh, naturally sweet, nice thick cut (if applicable). The sweet shrimp was quite large for what i had been used to. But as the name implies, it was really sweet. 

There was a few things i'd like to mention that you may not see in a typical sushi restaurant (or any that i had been to). Under their appetizer listing, they had "brie and grape quesadilla" and "sashimi roll"

Let's start off with the "brie and grape quesadilla". Seeing an item like this on the menu surprised me. Not something you usually see in a japanese restaurant. But it was suggested by one of the super nice waitresses. So i had tried it. When the order came, it was presented in a few triangle slices as well as a few avocado slices fanned on the side. Fresh off the pan/grill/whatever they used to make it. The taste was quite interesting. The brie was smooth and rich while the slices of grape gave it a nice acidic kick. 

The "sashimi roll" was quite the interesting item. It contains tuna, yellowtail, white fish, salmon, shrimp, avocado, and asparagus wrapped in a thin daikon radish that was previously soaked in a special vinegar. Not too much of a fan on the sauces that were drizzled on the plate, but aside from that, the pickled daikon radish plus the various fishes gave quite the interesting taste. The freshness of the fish + the slightly sour, but refreshing taste of the pickled daikon that it was wrapped it was quite nice. 

All in all, it was a good experience, and would love to go there again. 

This restaurant definitely ranks in the top 3 sushi restaurants for me (at the time of this posting...), with Sushi Twister and Goyemon as the other 2 restaurants in the ranking. The staff and chefs were super nice. Did very little to no asking as they were very, i wouldnt say annoying but, uhm.. i guess attentive may be the correct word? I had no more than 1-2 finished plates on the side of me before they were picked up, and i had rarely, if ever saw the bottom of my tea cup, as it was always refilled in a timely manner.
You will get Sushi Koma!! Really good! Awesome rolls! Server was very attentive and spot on! Will definitely be back!

I really enjoyed the AYCE Sushi!, the prices were great, the fish was fresh and the service was awesome!. I came in with a list and the waitress was very nice took all my orders and we indulged and we were all in a Koma when we left, loved this place!

It was good, but I had high expectations based on the other yelp reviews and things I have heard of this place. Quality of the fish was great, although the rolls aren't as creative as JJANGA and I feel like Goyemon has the same quality of fish AND more innovative rolls. We tried a little of everything though and it was all satisfactory. We received a complimentary salmon belly from the chefs and that was the best item I had all night. Skip the plum wine ice cream, tasted like cough syrup!

I felt that the service was excellent though- kept refilling our drinks all night and were very pleasant and attentive.
I love this place. Came with my friend for her first time and it was amazing as always. Christina was our server for AYCE. She's the best. Thank you for everything Christina!!
The best sushi in town!! Even though I live on the other side of town, Sushi Koma is worth the drive.  The fish is always fresh and the Seafood Tostada is too die for!!!! Great date spot!
So fresh and so good. The sashimi roll, tostada app, and white tuna nigiri are my faves. This is my post Red Rock hike meal.
Best sushi place in town. All you can eat , friendly staff and nice atmosphere. We've been here several times and never felt rushed and never been disappointed. Highly recommend this place.

Came here for my birthday! I had an amazing time, the server Christina made sure I had a wonderful time. 

Food was great! Service time and response was quick and accurate. 

Great little cool spot!

This review is for a takeout order. Really nice hostess and great service. Get the stephanie roll-- it is AMAZING. I really loved it and the service was so quick! Definitely worth a visit (especially if you're studying next door at cafe darak haha).

Only A.Y.C.E in las vegas that i would spend my time going to eat. Delicious fresh yummy perfectly cut sushi rolls and sashimi rolls. You can definately taste the difference in freshness on your tongue from here than other places. I've gone to pricey sushi spots to inexpensive and this place is the bomb. And they open late until like 3am!?! Sweet! The sushi chefs are all very nice people. Our one server is quick and always on it shes been there awhile idk her name. Lately theres been new faces server wise and they are a bit slow & ditsy but im sure they'll catch up. Small small place with a dim romantic ambience, always packed! Sometimes we don't even get in because the wait is long but i still Love it! Hehe =]

The food is good even though it's heavy. I come here every Sunday but today the service was so slowwwww. There was a 40 min wait for our last order I asked if I can pay the check now because I was in a hurry. She wouldn't bring the check in case we left food behind. Asked 2 different people to check on it and they just kept saying it was coming. Going on 50 minutes for 1 order. And we couldn't even be proactive and pay ahead of time. I am now late to grab my son. Again I come every single week they know me. Also the server was visibly sick and coughing. The search for a new sushi place begins again. The got too big for their service when they expanded
Luv this place!! My fave in town & I grew up in Japan so I'm very picky on Japanese food ;)
My favorite sushi place in Vegas. Wish the restaurant was a little bit bigger but the food is amazing.

I waited 30 min for two roll orders. I've never waited so long for sushi. People who came in after me got their orders before I did. That was annoying. I told the waitress I needed to leave and only then did my order come. She was very apologetic but how about comping my time? No deal. Sushi was good service wasn't. I can get good sushi but good service means more.
Fresh and crisp tasting sushi! The service was great. Only downfall I would say, is it is a small place and you can feel a little crammed. Other than that, awesome!
my 21 months old daughter got charge 17.95 for all u can eat? this place is starving for money

Overpriced for the quality of food and service.  Might as well go to the strip for overpriced sushi.   

And no Mil Disc.  If your gonna charge that much...at least provide better specials or discounts.

Best sushi place ever! They are always friendly and fast. They are very generous with the fish to rice ratio. Used to live in Vegas, moved to Phoenix. It's a must go to every time we are in town. They just moved to a beautiful big building, please don't ever change!

We went fairly late at night. We went around 11pm. It was Wednesday night and we wanted to try their AYCE, all you can eat sushi. 

We were seated immediately since it wasn't very busy. Everything on this menu was part of the all you can eat. However, several items can only be ordered once.

The menu itself was organized in different colored spaces. 

Our gave us plenty of suggestions to try on their menu. She was so upbeat and really energetic! We definitely enjoyed the energy of the place.

We enjoyed that you can get split orders. So you can have half orders. The appetizers were so incredibly delicious. We ordered the shrimp tempura, miso soup, fried oysters and shrimp and beef carpaccio. 

Then of course, we ordered a plethora of sushi. One important bit of info is that if you do not finish your food, you can actually get charged extra. So pace yourself and dont over do it.

The sushi itself was amazing. It was tasty, yummy and actually not disgusting haha.
Great atmosphere, incredibly nice staff and the food is amazing! The Jane and Kimmy rolls are to die for! Not to mention my favorite dessert MANGO MOCHI! Absolutely worth every penny LOVE

I love sushi, but vegas AYCE sushi spots have been disappointing me lately. I was recommended this place by several people so I decided to give it a visit! And I'm so glad I did. Inside is pretty small, I wouldn't say the seating is comfortable. They weee pretty busy but we got lucky and for seated at the only table opened. Even though it was dinner rush, they served their food super fast with exceptional service. I highly recommend doing their AYCE and be sure to try their yellowtail carpaccio and sashimi roll! Honestly, everything on their menu is good. So happy I came here, can't wait to be back.
First time in tonight and definitely not the last!!! Amazing sushi, chiefs and price!

This place is great! Went here for AYCE and ate til i was in a "sushi koma". There wasn't a thing I got that i didn't love. 

The quality of fish is superb! The nigiri tasted like it came straight outta the ocean and very tender. Not like some places where the fish can taste chewy. 

The service was great! I will definitely be coming back here!!!
Just discovered this amazing sushi place in Vegas. All you can eat sushi dinner for $25.95. Our server Aileen was super friendly and the atmosphere was fun and we had a blast. Check it out!

I went to Sushi Koma some time ago a few years back and I had a pretty great experience. I didn't get a chance to write a review then so I guess I will now.

They had a previous, smaller location that I had gone to, and I guess they have since moved to a bigger one in the same plaza more towards the back end. This was apparently done ~2-3 months ago. From what I remember, I do like this newer place better. It has a lot more space for not only people, but also for decor, and the sushi bar is definitely bigger.

The place looks very nice on the inside and has a more traditional feel than the previous place. I feel that I get easily detracted by tacky decor and contrasting wallpaper, although I did not feel that there. However, I did question, not quite object, the need for a big screen TV at a sushi restaurant (I believe there may even be more than one).

We came as a party of 3 with a hankering for sushi at 1:30 AM on a Tuesday, so I can't say I know what service is like during peak times. We were seated immediately and our orders were taken very soon after. Our server was very kind and was patient of our questions and orders. (Yes, you can do half rolls!)

The quality of their fish is definitely better than most places I've tried here in town, and the price is all relatively the same for AYCE here in Las Vegas. For dinner price, it was $25.95 per person, which I believe is a great price for a decent amount of variety and quantity. Their appetizers hit the spot, and the hand rolls taste quite fresh. Most of these are pretty standard, although you MUST try the Tuna Carpaccio!

I HIGHLY recommend the Big B Roll! (Although it's only one roll per person.) It's like any shrimp tempura roll but added with teriyaki beef on top. It's definitely something different but combine that with the "chef's special" sauce and it somehow works very well together. I also enjoyed their Bank Roll, PCH, Ninja, Rainbow Roll, and Tropicana Roll. I'll definitely make it a point to try some different things on my next visit. The ratio of fish-to-rice on the rolls were decent and I saw no attempt to cram a ton of seaweed and rice with very few protein in between.

For me, the food was pretty great, but the service is what really made our night spectacular. Our server's name was Ben, and I hope we get him again next time! We were always taken care of whenever he was needed and he never forgot us when it came to more rolls and refills on drinks. Unlike most servers, he is also not very stiff nor is he shy at making good conversation with you without also forgetting to attend to his duties. VERY fun guy, indeed, and he was super easy to talk to from the moment we were seated.

My only complaint is that while the music is good and fun, it is WAY too loud. Thankfully, the friends I went with were very vocal and laughed so hard that we didn't mind too much in the end. But if you're trying to have a more quiet dinner, this may not exactly be the place for it.

I can't wait to come back! :)
Love, Love, Love, Love, Love this place. 'Nough said.

I could write a book about how bad our experience at Sushi Koma was, but I'll just hit the main points.
It was lunchtime and I ordered a lunch special.  My wife ordered a few pieces of sushi, which they brought quickly.
After the better part of half an hour my lunch special was nowhere in sight.  We flagged down our waitress and asked if the order was forgotten.  She went to the kitchen and came back promising that it was coming soon.
This was lunchtime, and the order was a lunch special.  Why would it take half an hour to produce?  The "chefs" in the kitchen either forgot the order or were on a "break" or whatever.
At this point my wife just wanted to get out of there and so did I.  I had completely lost my appetite.  We told the waitress to box everything up to take out.
About 10 minutes later the lunch special arrived missing the four pieces of sushi which were supposed to be included.
We complained again, and had to show the waitress the menu to prove that the order was supposed to include sushi.  She went to correct the mistake.
After about another 10 minutes, a "chef" behind the counter glanced in my direction, put a container on the counter, and grunted rather rudely.  After a while I walked over and asked if that was for me.  He just grunted rudely again.
When I finally did get the sushi, the pieces were very small; like child (toddler) size.  Maybe the "chef" wanted to punish me for complaining.
My wife, who is Japanese, commented that the rice, which is the essence of sushi, was so substandard that she would expect better from a first day apprentice in Japan.
The only upside of this was the waitress.  I didn't get her name, but she must have spent most of her free time at the tattoo shop next door, because most of her visible body was covered with tattoos.  This is not an issue, and she was very polite, attentive, and obviously working very hard to do the right thing.  In spite of everything that went wrong, I gave her a nice tip.

WOW!! Did I say WOW!! The owners makes you feel like you are sitting in your mom's kitchen! The Sushi is oh so fresh!! And oh so freaky!! You must try the Spanish sushi! Really?? Yes, REALLY...lol... Thank-you so much to the new owners for bringing such a tantalizing twist to the Sushi Lovers tastebuds. And  it is so convienently located to all sides of the Greater Las Vegas Area. Congratulations to the new owners of Sushi Freak. I wish you only success!!

Just had sushi here this weekend. It's a small place, and I'd definitely recommend waiting for a table. We sat at the sushi bar, and I kept getting servers elbows in my face when they picked up sushi for other tables. But it is great sushi, and about $30 for all you can eat dinner sushi.
The quality of the nigiri here is amazing for ayce, possibly the best I've had. Staff is very friendly and attentive

This place is pretty good.  It is small however.  The best deal is to order the all you can eat for $25 because some of the rolls are $16 so it definitely makes sense.  Some items on the menu can only be ordered once, but that wasn't a big deal.  I got the Denver Roll, Sweet Shrimp, Big B Roll, Sams Volcano Roll, SSS Roll.  They were all pretty good I'm a great selector I think my favorites were Sams, and Big B.  I also did the flight of Saki for $10 which was descent next time I'd just get a plum wine instead of the rest of the flavors.  
One thing I didn't like is there were no baby lobster rolls, and the tempura ice cream was just vanilla, I would have fathered green tea.  The waitress said it is usually strawberry. I will definitely come back.

Thought I would try a new sushi restaurant with my husband. The ambiance is awesome, the friendliness of staff is amazing, and they offered to customize my sushi just the way I like it at no extra charge. Highly recommend and will definitely be back!!!

Have eaten at Sushi Koma twice with friends and everyone has been really happy with their food and service! The staff are nice (though usually a bit rushed as the place is busy). We never waited more than a few minutes for a table. 

Their prices are decent and we usually do the "all you can eat". Some other places charge you if you leave to much uneaten. Not sure if these guys do, but we've never incurred extra charges. 

Everything we're tried on the menu was great, except the terriaki chicken - it's way too sweet for my taste. But their rolls are great and their nagiri portions are great too - no skimping on the fish and filling it with a ton of rice. Tempura is excellent. Even their dessert rocks! We especially enjoyed the mocci balls. If you order ice cream, I recommend the red bean flavor. It sounds weird, but trust me, it was the best of all their flavors. 

Definitely recommend this place and will definitely continue eating here!

I've come here about 5 or more times by now, and every time the food has been amazing. I still remember the first time my bf and I dined here, I was so amazed! I remember thinking to myself it was one of the best meals I've ever had. What is awesome is that you get a good amount of fish with little rice. Also, I like the fact that you can get half order of the speciality rolls so you can try a lot of different rolls for AYCE.

Wanted to try some place new since we were too tired to drive over to our favorite place, Yama. We arrived on a Tuesday night at 8pm and they were packed. Always a good sign to me! 
We got our drinks and ordered 4 rolls. Soon after everyone around us was getting their rolls which were ordered after us. Even the table next to us commented about how we didn't get our food yet. We were only slightly upset about the wait cause we were in a great mood. The manager arrived shortly after with some of our order and we were never lacking for service after that. 
Very very loud atmosphere. We didn't mind that though. Also it was really warm in the restaurant. Our server let us know that she was training new people and we hardly ever saw her but were well taken care of by her trainees.
Overall: $26 for AYCE dinner, fun atmosphere, eventual attentive staff, great sushi!! Didn't seem to have a time limit for orders. Open really late. My favorite roll was the Washington roll!

I was here for a business lunch yesterday. I had an Avocado Roll and spicy yellowtail Roll.  The Avocado Roll would have been good, if the Avocado wasn't incredibly overripe.  Service was slow and our server was pretty inattentive.
Food was ok and pretty small place.  Music mix was good and service fine. There was sometimes a smoke smell probably from the Hookah lounge beside establishment.

They are really busy at saturday morning, lucky we are there early, really good food, and really good service, the lady there she is very kind, I forgot to ask her name, my favorite for today's visit is yellowtail, so fresh, and the sea urchin so fresh, it's my husband's favorite , thank you so much for the great food and service, excellent experience .

Sushi 'til you koma- obviously an AYCE sushi spot, open late (til 3AM), with fun staff and a variety of menu items. This is definitely a spot to go with a small group, share some dishes and have a fun time, which is exactly what I did one night with Cathey K and Neli T. 

DRINKS: Like any fun sushi bar, there are plenty of drink specials. Try a sake sampler, they serve enough to share. The plum was my favorite. Ask about drink prices prior to ordering, they are not posted (glass, half bottle, and full bottle available).
APPS: Fun mix of options, really liked the sushi tostada. The sashimi roll I was looking forward to was so tiny as to be doll-sized, and the tuna carpaccio was tasty but seemed overly seared to point that it was cooked. This dish was redeeed by the garlic chip garnish, which I really enjoy. For something a little different, they have a brie and grape quesadilla, which they serve with avocado slices. It was weird but somehow worked.
NIGIRI: Octopus, uni, ikura, sweet shrimp, cajun albacore, and salmon were among the items we had. I like how the salmon already came with lemon slices, like I prefer, and the server asked if we wanted the fried heads for the shrimp.  They don't overdo it with the rice, happily.
ROLLS: This section seems to be their forte. The Stephanie roll was easily one of the favorites at our table  (and not because it's named after me- it isn't), while others didn't stand out as much but were creative and large. Half rolls are available, as are hand rolls.

Our server was sweet and attentive, and dishes came out quickly despite how busy they were. Note that the seating is a bit limited, and gets packed on weekends, when lingering likely isn't as welcome- but there is no posted time limit.  Our sweet server was great about checking in on us and giving us ample time to converse and catch up, would request her next time but unfortunately I didn't catch her name.

Sushi until three o'clock in the morning? Yes please!

I came here with my boyfriend and his mom upon leaving the airport.  We were all hungry.  My boyfriend's brother, who lives in Vegas, suggested this place as he lives less than five minutes away. We were greeted and seated right away. The restaurant did not appear too busy. We all got green tea, which was perfect for the cold weather. It was the best I ever had and greenest tea I've ever seen! We shared the Chef's Specials and fried calamari. The Chef's Special came with our choice of sushi (we chose the California Roll) and eight pieces of various sushi. My boyfriend's mom ordered the Tempura Udon, which came out hot and fresh. I love the thick udon noodles. Just a tip though, make sure to eat the tempura right away or else you'll end with soggy tempura in your soup and the batter comes of off easily. I had a carrot tempura and it was sitting there for a whole, the batter came off and I ended up eating the carrot by itself. 

This place is perfect for drinks and munchies, or late-night dinner like for me, my boyfriend and his mom since we took the late flight to Vegas. They have fantastic customer service! The staff was friendly, prompt and attentive throughout our visit. We were greeted when we entered and left the restaurant and checked upon consistently.  They have a variety of sushi and other items to choose from. 

Overall, this is the best sushi place that I have ever been to. I will be back again if I'm in Vegas!

For $25 this has to be one of the best AYCE so far that I've tried in Vegas. Seriously good rolls! Some of my faves there though we're the super white tuna nigiri (OMG GOOD) and the Tuna carpaccio! Highly recommend this place and they stay open until 3am?! Good to know after a night out!

It's a tiny place that plays eclectic music & it's always busy. I've been here many times & it's my go to place for all you can eat sushi. 
The staff is friendly and I enjoy the overall vibe. There are a few things on the menu that I always order like the tuna carpaccio that is a must & they have an interesting Brie & grape quesadilla that is hard to stay away from. They also allow you to order half rolls so you can try more things which I love!
So many roll options. Fish is always fresh. Great customer service. Good amount of mochi options too. Most places only have 3 flavors.
Sushi here tastes very fresh. Service was great. Ross, our server, was on top of everything and extremely friendly. I will definitely come back.

This is by far the best sushi place in town. We are locals and we would not go any where else to eat sushi. The price is great and the fish is always fresh. The owner is fantastic he is always around and ensures that we have enjoyed our meal. We always take our family and friends to enjoy this great place. Thank you sushi Koma we will be back soon.

This place was super yummy!  Great service.  The chef will make you something special if you ask for it.   Friendly staff.  Fresh sushi.  Loud music.  Tiny place.  Busy tho.  Definitely a find for Vegas!!!   I think they shoudk give you more than one mochi for ayce dessert.

This is definitely my favorite AYCE sushi in town. I was looking for a place that's nearby in the west side of town and I'm so glad I found this place. This place is on par with Sushimon in terms of taste. The ambiance is nice and dim. The only thing that I would say is not great is the consistency of service. I hate to sound biased, but I'm friends with the waitress at night and I've always had great service at night. However, my family made a reservation here at 1PM on Christmas day and unfortunately did not get our seats until half an hour later. 

Food: 5/5
Atmosphere: 5/5
Day Service: 2/5
Night Service: 5/5
Overall: 4.5/5
Great spot, but very small! Expect to wait for a table. Nigiri was fresh and they had a range of rolls. Service was fast too.

Best all you can eat sushi ever! 

Everything was so fresh and delicious...made to order so it can take a little long.  So inexpensive for great quality!   

Cons: 
-you can only order one order of uni and amaebi 
-service can be a little slow when it's busy but they are still pretty attentive!

We need this in Hawaii!!!

The entire staff seems really friendly, the sushi tastes great, and the restaurant has a good selection of beer and sake.

Why it's unique:
- hand-painted artwork on walls and ceiling
- creative menu
- edm

Pros:
- talented chefs
- friendly staff
- fun setting

Cons:
- None
This place is definitely not the best, but it was decent. Pricey however and very tiny inside. Food was good for the most part. Fish seemed fresh.

Service:
As always, I got the AYCE. The service really deteriorated these past few months. It might be due to the servers working today. I usually come for dinner and the girls that work are awesome. Today, the servers are 2 guys. They're friendly and polite but forgetful. There was only 1 server for the beginning too so service was particularly slow. 
For some reason, they've been out of desserts for a few days now. They didn't have the green tea cheesecake nor most of the mochi ice cream flavors. :-/ 

Food:
Sushi was okay today. It wasn't as amazing as the past but still one of the best AYCE places I've been to. Another yelper said the quality has went down and I agree. It was definitely better a few months ago. 

I'd come back again next time I'm in Vegas just to see if today was just an off day but it's not as strong of a want as before. :-(
Not my favorite.  Servers were very forgetful.  Missing lots of items. Only dish I liked was the tuna carpaccio. Won't be giving this place another try.

This is our go to place.  We have been several times.  We went once during dinner and they were packed and very very slow but the waitress kept things coming slowly and apologized.   But we visited with our party of 8 and it was a great evening.
Tiny little restaurant with a lot of charm. Ambience was nice, staff was friendly, and the fish was top notch. Prices were also rather attractive. Definitely recommend.
Great atmosphere! Sushi was good, very fresh. Wasn't to big on the edamame. Prices were good. Got the all you can eat. You can't go wrong with that. We will definitely be back.

Sushi Koma is easily one of my favorite places to go in Las Vegas. The food is consistently fantastic and the staff is always friendly. I have been here many times and have never had a least the amazing experience. The spider roll is my favorite and a most try. A+

My top two favorite sushi place ever, friendly staff, opens really late at night, and amazing AYCE sushi! I realized they changed their name almost a year ago. I always leave this place with sushi coma, I'm never disappointed whenever I come here. 
 Recommend sushi place for all sushi lovers!

Dropped in for a quick sushi snack.  I didn't have time to try the AYCE.  I just had the Tuna Hand Roll.  The tuna was so fresh and tender.  It is served with sesame seed and rice.  If did the trick for a quick pick me up.  The server brought me out edamame to snack on while I was waiting on my roll.  That and a spot of tea and I am a happy girl.  I need to come back and try more items.  I saw some pictures on Yelp of some very interesting rolls.

Here for the fifth or sixth time now, been receiving great service! Food has been consistent! The owner served us amazing chef specialties, such as gigantic clam sashimi and TORO!! It was incredibly delicious, we appreciate it a lot! Thank you Koma :)

Service was good, but sushi was way overpriced for the quality. We ordered two speciality rolls, $14 each, barely any fish on them. Mine had more cream cheese than tuna and salmon together. Never coming back......and most of the reviews are ridiculous, they were written by the owner or people that show up drunk and order the all you can eat....if you really enjoy sushi, go somewhere else.....

I hadn't heard of Sushi Koma until it was recommended by a friend, so I decided to try it out.  My first impressions were that it was small, well decorated and had friendly staff.  Most AYCE sushi places I have been to in Vegas have been small or medium in size but I think this was the smallest one yet. Most of the tables are smaller than normal, so I wouldn't order TOO much food at one time.  There are 2 tables that are bigger that were meant for groups and most of the tables are set up for 2 people or 4 when you combine them.  I liked the feeling in there and the decorations and art on the walls gave a nice feeling to the place.
The sushi here is solid. There were a couple rolls that I really liked(PB Roll, shashimi roll) and a few that were your standard AYCE type of rolls. The thing I liked about their menu was how they a large 'spicy roll' section because I love spicy sushi. They also had a section of sushi rolls for 'non-raw fish' which I thought was a good idea because I know many people who don't or won't eat any raw fish.  One drawback was they had 1 per person limits on a few more items than usual. Their baked mussels were very good and I very much so wanted to order more but just one per person. For dessert you also get just one item and so I went with the coffee mochi.  It was pretty good, not the best mochi I've ever had but it was nice. My buddy got ice cream that he said was freaking amazing. I apologize I don't remember the name of it but he doesn't even like ice cream so that speaks to something since he actually liked it.
Sushi Koma is a small place with a good atmosphere, good sushi and really good service. I will be back here again even with all of the AYCE sushi competition in town

Came her for dinner on a Sunday about 4:30. Only 2 parties were present when we entered. Good for us, as per the reviews, I was expecting it to get busy before too long. 

Got seated at the bar and ordered AYCE. Drinks were brought out promptly and the food was out within minutes or ordering. We had yellowtail (which was the best thing we ate tonight), salmon, and super white. Also ordered a Tiger Roll and a Rainforest Roll. Now, Tiger rolls at every other sushi joint I have ever been too have never put spicy mayo on top. I am not a fan of any kind of mayo on my sushi, and failed to noticed this when I ordered. My bad. However, it wasnt bad. Actually couldnt taste the mayo. Lucky me. Also, the Rainforest roll is made in almost the same way as Sushi Mon's JJ Roll. But it wasnt as good. 

All and all, for the first order, it was pretty good. But this is where I drop 2 stars. 

A few other people had come in since we sat down, but the place was far from packed. It took the waitress 15 minutes after us finishing the 1st order to place the next order. Very slow and sad service at this point. Ordered red snapper, albacore, halibut, and more yellow tail. The first 3 came out within minutes. A point for the chefs for being so quick. However, for these nigri they put some kind of blended up white substance on top of the fish, and top with the chives. Was was this white stuff on top? Ground radish with an onionish taste? Very gross. We choked it down. Let a nasty taste in our mouths. 

Waitress came to get another order. Told her we were still waiting on the yellowtail. A few minutes later it came out. 

Finished it off (getting rid of the bad taste from the other nigri). Ordered desert- Green tea Ice Cream and Strawberry mochi. Fast delivery, but both desert were already melting. The green tea ice cream tasted more like machi powder,very strong in flavor. Not my cup of tea. 

Speaking of tea, the iced green tea is really good!! I recommend ordering it during the hot summer months. 

I doubt I'll be back. Wish they had a bigger list of rolls. Sushi Mon is still the best.

I really don't understand how Sushi Koma is so highly rated.... But I'm not anyone to say that people have bad taste. But I'm definitely not coming back here.

If there is one thing I can rave about Sushi Koma(formerly known as Sushi Freak), it's the great service. The waitresses were consistent and quick to serve my friends and I. The chefs were also courteous as they checked up on us as well from time to time. Unfortunately, service may be their only fine asset.

The sushi itself, was terrible. First off, the rice was crispy and overcooked. It felt like I was eating rice krispies, with fish... The rolls were mediocre. Not worth the AYCE tag of $25. I'd rather go eat at a buffet, where I'm sure you'll find better tasting sushi and rolls even though they specialize in multiple types of foods. I'll make it short, you can get the same sushi at your local grocery stores. I drove 13 miles to waste money, appetite, and gas.

I have no hard feelings for this place. They just need to work on the quality of their sushi. Otherwise, they have probably the best service that I've experienced up to this point. But service itself does not make up for the lack of sushi quality. For you sushi fanatics, trust me, Koma is not worth the the trip. Don't expend all your resources and appetite like I did.
Went to try this place out and they have the best service and food. It's a little pricey but worth it!

By far the BEST AYCE sushi restaurant in town. My favorite item on the menu is the sashimi roll. Their nigiri is top notch. The ponzio roll is another favorite. I take that back..it's hard to say which is my favorite because everything is so good. Tuna carpaccio is a must-try! The fish tastes fresh & is better than other places that I have tried.  The servers are always friendly and appear to be happy in general. I say this because another AYCE place I recently tried I experienced the worst customer service ever. (Sorry Sushi Koma...I didn't mean to cheat & I now regret that I went somewhere else). My friends, family, and I have to eat here at least once a month. Don't forget to get a stamp card. I've had at least 5 free sushi dinners from that card. Keep up the great work and please don't ever take the sashimi roll off of your menu.

Disgusting.. sushi rice has no rice vinegar.. sushi is mainly about the rice, so if the rice is no good, then it wont matter if the fish is good. Better find another sushi place. If you're looking for late night sushi, you're better off going to jjanga or sushi kama.

The service is absolutely phenomenal.

Waitresses are polite and consistently attentive. The sushi chefs are especially skilled and orders are not kept on waiting. In other words, the food comes out in a timely fashion. But most importantly, the food is abso-freakin-lutely great/yummy/melt-in-your-mouth/omg!

I even want to recommend one of the waitress's personal recommendation: Sam's Volcano Roll. Baked creamy goodness! Simply a must-try. Other recommendations are: Big B Roll, Tiger Roll and Ninja Roll. The Big B Roll comes with thinly sliced beef on top which makes for an interesting combination of flavors and textures. The Tiger Roll has a yummy spicy tuna topper. The Ninja Roll has eel and tempura for crunchiness.

The sushi chefs are especially friendly. It has been my second visit already and I plan to come here regularly!

Thank you.

Love love love this place!!! The servers are super sweet & always on top of their game. The sushi is delicious & the best part is that you could do half rolls in AYCE so you can try multiple things. Very small place but also very nice & calm environment.

Stopped in for a quick lunch bite upon landing in Vegas. Very friendly, efficient, young staff, including waitress and 2 young sushi chefs behind sushi bar -recommend sitting there as they like to surprise you with little sample rolls in between the orders. Apparently new mgt since 2/12 and they deserve notice-one of the friendliest AYCE sushi bar staff ever. Rolls were good, had a wide assortment-do the half rolls so you can try more. Only 4 stars as rice fell apart too easily, and pieces of fish in the rolls very tiny. But again....it's AYCE so I get it.

Sushi koma has really good fresh fish but their rolls are all kinda hard to choose since not a lot of them are that good to me. Maybe the best roll is the Vegas freak but it's not on the menu. My absolute fav though is the tuna carpaccio (MUST TRY) all you can eat for 2 people is about $55 and the customer service every time I've been has been really awesome! Friendly staff and they're always checking up on you to make sure you have everything you need. The only problem that I have is that they take too long to bring my food out like I'll order a ton of stuff all at the same time and then they'll Bring out like 5 things and then I'll finish those 5 things and then the waiting interval between when the next time my other rolls come out is such a long time. Like I'll find myself ordering more food during that interval not realizing I had a ton more stuff coming and ends up all coming out at the same time and me having to finish ALL THIS FOOD ugh hahaha that's the only issue I have. Other than that place looks clean, bathrooms clean, kinda small though but very friendly staff. Wait time is never long to be seated that's why I'd prefer here over than goyemon and if they do last call at 2:30 they extend it for you if you were seated at like 2:20 which I think is totally amazing that they love their customers  definitely coming back oh! And to add cafe Darak is just next door too so when you're done eating you can just walk next door to the most amazing cafe in the world (,:
Great and friendly! Also asks for an ID with credit card!! I appreciate that a lot!! I'm koma toast!

This is my favorite sushi place! I come here at least twice a month, possibly more. I highly recommend this resturaunt anyone! Please, bring you friends and family if you like Sushi. The service here is great. Meaning, my cups never empty and I'm never impatiently waiting. They treat you like family here :) Awesome environment and ambience. Ready to go back already :P

I have been coming to this place since before it even became sushi koma. It was Brian's beach when I fell in love with their menu. The food is great and even though the place itself used to be incredibly small it was always a good experience. Today I went there to celebrate my birthday with a friend and our kids. And the service we received was the absolute worst I have ever experienced in all the years I've been there. We started off with a male waiter who had a tendency to be in mid step away every time you spoke. But ok I could forgive that maybe he's just really busy even though there were only like 4 other tables in there. But I let that slide. I even let the dirty glass thing slide since mistakes happen and was easily fixed. But then we received our food but after 10 minutes of waiting I had to ask the waiter for the rice that was supposed to come with the kids food. He brought it quickly but dropped it off without a word and walked away. I tried multiple times to flag him down for various things but he never came back. Apparently mid service we switched waiters but no one ever said anything to us. Suddenly a girl started checking up on us. She was attentive but we had basically ordered everything we needed from our previous waiter so it was just a matter of waiting. We only had one item left and knew that it would take some time since it was a baked roll but after 30 minutes of waiting and being ignored we finally decided to get up and wait for our check at the podium.  At which point the male waiter came back to ring us up. Not one word of a greeting or how was everything; he simply just set the bill in front and waited to finish the transaction. I have never been so disappointed in a service of place I love so much. I love the food and the previous experiences so I may come back to try again but I will never allow that waiter to serve me again. Working in the service industry I know that is not the way you treat people.

Man, i have absolutely nothing to say bad about this place...OTHER than it is small. Besides that, the food is real REAL good.

My first night here I was a little intoxicated. Didn't remember much, other then having a great time and good food, and lots of sake bombs.

Came back for a 2nd time, this one around though I wasn't drinking and just wanted to enjoy the all you can eat sushi, and I sure did.

Compared to Midori here in the Los Angeles area, it is pretty much the same thing for a better price. 

Ordered a lot of seared tuna sushi, hand rolls, regular rolls and so on, everything was delicious.

Looking for a All You Can Eat sushi spot, this is it. Don't waste your time scrolling through pages of reviews and results. If you are in the area, go here.

Another all you can eat sushi in Vegas. I loved Yama Sushi, but after trying this one, I think I like it better. The restaurant itself is very tiny and the service was much slower. Though compared to Yama Sushi they were understaffed, so I can't complain. They had far better appetizers and nigiri. If you're a yellowtail/hamachi fan like me, then this is the place to be. Guaranteed to come back.

0 stars. Our waitress was SO RUDE!!! Service was extremely slow thanks to her and the dumb food runners kept bringing us other people's food. Quality here sucks and their screaming O is not good at all. Won't be back here they need to hire new hostess/servers because that Asian girl was so rude never again will I return.

This use to be my favorite spot for sushi to go to with my boyfriend.  We live in Centennial (North-West) and we would always make the drive here.  After a bit we started to notice the service was a bit slow and the chefs always seemed overwhelmed.  Although the food is very good, we started to feel a bit jipped when we would go.

After about a year and a half we decided to give this place another shot since they have late night sushi available.  We went on a Sunday night around 11:45pm-ish.  This place is always busy so we expected to wait a bit, and we were okay with that.  

We left the restaurant around 1:30am and I only received one roll and my boyfriend only received two rolls.  The waitress did notify us that the chefs were a bit behind but we had no idea they were that behind.  It was very weird because when looking around no one was getting rolls, only appetizers from the back kitchen.  I would feel better if I saw the chefs pushing out rolls and we just had to wait our turn, but no one was getting rolls.  We saw at least three couples cancel their orders and leave.  

It's very sad because Sushi Koma has so much potential.  The food is delicious!  I have loved all my appetizers and rolls, when I'm able to receive them.  It's a service issue.  I do not want to wait an hour and a half for one sushi roll.

Unfortunately we haven't been able to get back recently but we have gone a few times since my original review. I've been meaning to update but keep forgetting. ....so here we go.....Sushi Koma is still our go to place. Every time we visit we walk out happy and our tummies are even happier!   The staff is just as friendly as can be. The food has never been a disappointment. We have recommended Sushi Koma to lots of people and always get good feed back. Keep doing what you're doing!  We look forward to our next visit.
Seriously the best sushi all you can eat experience I have had. I will be a frequent here when I'm in Vegas!

Love this place, it's a cute intimate atmosphere! My boyfriend never eats sushi, but sushi Koma has changed that. I'm forever grateful because I love sushi, everything we had was very good! Definitely a new fave spot just wish it was closer to home!

My mom and I first discovered Sushi Koma in October 2013 on our trip to Vegas and we couldn't stop talking about how great it was. Since that visit, we couldn't stop talking it up to anyone who would listen. So, when we decided to do a summer trip to Vegas, the first thing we both thought was that we had to go back to Sushi Koma. Well...you know how you wake up in the middle of an amazing dream and you try to go back to sleep to continue the dream, but you never quite get the same experience? That's how this trip to Sushi Koma was. In fact, we kept trying different things in the hope that something, anything, would remind us of what we first experienced. There was one positive in a string of negatives- the tuna carpaccio- delicious! However, the other dishes were lacking. My mom wondered about the freshness of the fish, but to me it seemed the quality was poor. Also, there was a 5-10 minute time period where we seemed invisible to the 5 staff people working the small restaurant (with only us and one other party present). In fact, one waitress sat down at the sushi bar with her back to us- was she on break?! Needless to say, we won't be back, which is so disappointing since we thought we found a great, off the strip, place to eat.

Used to be Brian's Beach Sushi but i guess they changed the name. AAAAANNNNDDDDD they're pending another name change to Sushi Koma due to...lawyers....

Sushi is pretty good and they're pretty creative with some of their menu items. A lot of the premium choices you're gonna need to ask your waitress about. Some of the REALLY good stuff is only one per person sadly.

The Tuna Carpaccio is just really good. It's the baked/fried slivers of garlic that kick it up a notch. 

The various items we ordered were all pretty good but i cant judge them on just this one time considering inventory and stock and freshness of the fish.

Will gladly return as they close at 3am and is good for late night sushi cravings.

Oh the beef teriyaki, VERY nice. Not just beef either a few cuts of onions and carrots.

I found my favorite sushi bar. I can't wait to comeback again. If you're a fan of nigiris, you will love this place. Fish are always fresh, great service. If you're gonna sit on the bar,drink with the chef, offer them some beer. I promise you, your experience will be so much better. Ohh btw, dont forget to get The Torro if you happen to be there on fri,sat,sun. Enjoy! Take some friends with you, or alone. :)
Its good but not good as Goyemon. Their fish is fresh and have good rolls but lack variety compared to the other sushi places I've hit up. Worth trying once.

Food was good.  Big B, mountain roll and white tuna was delicious! 

Complaints: only 1 high chair and their portions were very small. 

Overall,  great sushi place,  will come again.

When you're hungry late night on a sunday when everything is closed early come here! I had the Sams volcano roll which was baked salmon, scallops, yum yum sauce on top of California rolls; the d.A. Roll which was breaded deep fried spicy tuna salmon yellowtail shrimp and avocado roll w spicy mayo; and the Alex's munchies roll which was spicy scallop and shrimp tempura roll w avocado slices, and all three were uhhhhhmayzing! Love love it for my first time here! Not to mention, the servers are super cute ;) Ended my night with strawberry tempura ice cream ;)

Tried one of their different sushi and the food here is much better but the waitress staff need to be much more organized and efficient! And what kind of professional establishment doesn't have bottled water?
Or any Cannes drinks besides cheap alcohol?

By far THE best place for AYCE sushi in my book!

You are greeted and welcomed by the very friendly and extremely attentive servers. Every new sushi place that I try, I always seem to order at least one hamachi item, because I think you can tell a lot about a restaurant by how hey serve their hamachi. Naturally, I ordered the hamachi nigiri.. And as soon as that yellowtail melted in my mouth, I knew I was at the right place! 

Three orders each of salmon, hamachi, and eel nigiri.. Five (half sized, which I love!) specialty rolls.. One serving of seafood tostada (bomb diggity!).. One last minute order of dynamite.. And (here's the kicker) one order of plum wine ice cream--which I've been searching for FOREVER for--later, a Sushi Koma took over me!

See what I did there?

Not to mention the service was tops! They cleared the plates as soon as we were finished, and always made sure we had water in our glasses, food on our plates, and smiles on our faces ^-^

And AYCE $25.95 for dinner, you definitely get your money's worth! Highly recommended!

This is the best sushi restaurant I have ever been too! We bring everyone who visit here first thing. The restaurant is clean and the service is excellent! I haven't tried anything there I didn't love.

I met a friend here for lunch. Started with hot tea and the tea came out in a coffee cup ...cute but not traditional Japanese cup. I Ordered a few nigiri's in which the waiter suggested to do all you can eat. I decided to order all you can eat. The fish did not seem fresh. The waiter forgot a couple of items and did not seem attentive. Last but not least, I ordered plum wine ice cream...waiter mentioned it was out. Overall food and service was ok. Previous location was a tad bit smaller but the service and quality was much better. Maybe the waiter was new?!
Freakishly good.  Excellent quality and super nice staff.  Absolutely the best sushi in Vegas!

Sushi Koma is my new favorite sushi spot. The food is awesome every time. The have been getting busier and busier each time I go so the word must be getting out. I love the all you can eat during lunch as you really get a great deal for a great cost especially for a sushi place. I would definitely recommend this spot to my friends and visitors to town looking for a locals spot off the strip.
Unbelieveable.. no need to go to another sushi place. Lunch or dinner, Sushi Koma is the best if you like all u can eat sushi!

sorry, I'm from LA and I had better although I guess you can't beat the price for an all you can eat

slices of sushi is way too small, you end up eating mostly rice

taste is ok

AYCE

I went this place cause it's near to my house. They do AYCE but I ordered for a la carte. I'm a uni&toro lover. I asked them about do they have toro,and the waiter asked to chef. And the chef tell waiter in his own language( I don't tell which country but Same nationally as mine so I understand what he says). He said "tell them it's expensive" after that,waiter come to us and tells me toro is $20 per order. Ummm I know. I eat more Expensive foods than that, stupid. I told him that Im totally fine with price I will order toro. After that,waiter went to chef and asked again,the chef said to him "shit why you took the order which is hard to cut. I have to bring frozen toro and have to waited it get melt. So lazy shit,tell them we don't have" after that,the waiter come to my table and tells me they don't have toro. Hahahahaha what a crazy place!!!
I feel so bad about that crazy guy will talk shit about you at front of you but you will don't know 

I still can't forget about that stupid face of him when I talked with my friend on the phone and use same language that he spoke very loud. He looked at me like "uh-oh......" 
 
That was a horrible restaurant I went in my life. 
I'm being patient to not using bad word in my review now.

This is by far my favorite sushi/all you can eat sushi spot in town!! I've been to every ayce places and all regular sushi places in town and out of town and the quality of fish/sushi is unbelievable, top notch!! Chris the owner makes everybody feel very special and the food shows that!!
Pretty awesome place. Garlic chips on raw fish?!? Yes. Yes please. The ladies are super nice here. The sushi guys are nice....a little slow but nice. Their all you can eat is pretty great.

Jessica-server

Decent sushi despite being one of those all you can cram down your slovenly gullet types of place in tacky Las Vegas.

We came after climbing at Red Rocks, and everyone was dirty and starving. Right at the beginning she asked if we wanted to split the bills, which was much appreciated for our group of 8. There was a ton of specialty rolls, so much variety, but I am disappointed they didn't have any with fruit in them (which I've had at other sushi places similar to here). We were all surprised at the high quality of the nigiri, not smelly or fishy. We might have ordered rounds of every one for everybody. And we probably collectively tried all the rolls. The baked/fried rolls were the least pleasing to me because they looked a lot like a big mess, but I would try anything else. I only wish dessert was also unlimited. Wouldn't object to returning.

Sushi Koma is one of the best sushi restaurants in Vegas. The restaurant is pretty small with blue walls. The staff are super cool and friendly. The food comes out really fast and the quality of sushi is amazing (especially the fresh scallop!! You gotta try it. It like melts in your mouth!) Overall atmosphere was fun with great music.
I have been here many times and they have the freshest fish! I haven't tried their rolls but the sushi is awesome.

This is definitely my favorite sushi place. The service is consistently quick and friendly and the food never disappoints. I do the all you can eat and the fish is always fresh. I love that they do half rolls so you can taste a bit of everything. If you you've never been its a must try.

Didn't get to try this place after 2 botched attempts. The first time they told me 1 hour wait after I showed up for my reservation on time. The second they told me again 30 minutes wait when I showed up on time. Too many other good sushi places in town to make it worth the hassle. Besides the place is small, crowded and not comfortable looking. I'm not an AYCE fan to begin with, so I'm going to stick with my regular favorites like Yonaka, Soho Japanese, Kabuki and Nobu.

I am giving them 5 stars for quality and food, and 2 stars for service.  We went on Wednesday for the AYCE and the food quality and presentation was excellent.  Everything was fresh/fresh/fresh, you have to try the mussels.  Great selection of rolls, no favorites they were all so good.  On the service, this is a small place, so we could not understand how the two waitresses kept forgetting our order, even though they wrote them down?
Definitely will come back, but will try to sit at the sushi bar, instead of a table.

Sushi Koma is one of the few places that have such good sushi. I took 3 of my friends to Koma to celebrate a birthday. The host / waitress (her name was Christina, I believe) was amazing with her service! She was not only friendly, she was really knowledgeable about the menu and even provided us with some really solid recommendations. 

It was pleasant enough to say that my friend definitely enjoyed his birthday after taking a few birthday shots with our new found friend and receiving such a good complementary dessert as his "cake". 

I highly recommend anyone who loves sushi to come here and enjoy a fantastic dinner!

My son always raved about this place so I figured I give it a try.  1st impression walking in.... SMALL!!!!  Total whole in a wall kind of look.  Waited 20 minutes for a table.  Immediately my friend and I ordered Kirin light and we both did AYCE.  We tried a few, loved the garlic tuna and yellowtail.  We also tried the spicy garlic ponzu, that I have to say is better than the plain wasabi and soy sauce!!  We got 2 special toro complimentary from the Chef to try which was very good.  Food was coming thru and service was great but then 45 minutes in, the server stop coming around and basically we felt ignored.  By the time we FINALLY got their attention we were already full from waiting around and was dying of thirst!  At closing, our bill was $73, due to their downfall on service I tip them $10 (paid on my credit card)  The shocking part is they had the audacity to take $15 tip from my account!!!!!!!!  Now this had pissed me off!!!!!!  How shady and untruthful these employees are??!!!!!!!  THEY CAN EAT MY $5 EXTRA TIP CAUSE KARMA'S A BITCH! MAYBE THEY CAN PUT THAT $5 TOWARDS GETTING A BIGGER PLACE AND HIRING HONEST WORKERS!..... Would I return... HELL NO!!!  I rather stick with the #1 sushi on town...."NAKED FISH"

What's not to like about this place. I got  here and was greeted right away and sat down quick, ( I got there early before the rush). the place got packed real quick. The place was small, but nice. We ordered the AYCE, and I loved it. You can taste the quality they put into the food. I started with green muscles and, sashimi roll, fresh and great flavors, then went on to different rolls. I ate so much I forgot names of rolls or nigiri I ate. 
Bottom line, if you love sushi, you gotta try Sushi Koma.

I remember when I came here when they first opened years ago. Always the best and freshest raw fish!! 5 stars every time! The best sushi I would say in Town. I love sitting at the bar. We always get all you can eat and of course try the chefs special. Phenomenal staff I just wish they would expand into a bigger space soon lol

Push their door and you're instantly travelling from Vegas to a great Tokyo sushi joint!
This place is awesome. Very small (I'd say it can fit maybe 25 to 30 people maximum), but so cosy and friendly, you don't want it to be bigger.
The decor is simple yet very appropriated. Some big cherry trees painted on a black wall. Bamboo blinds. Wooden tables.
I immediately fell under the spell of our charming host (sorry, I haven't had a chance to ask for her name...), with her customized Sushi Koma shirt (she confessed she did it herself one night after a couple of drinks! Haha).
Very friendly and client-oriented staff. Me and my friend had the All-You-Can-Eat dinner. They have great suggestions, their uni is definitely worth it, and they have unusual rolls too (the Ninja Roll is a killer!). And the spicy edamame is... greatly spicy.
AND they have real wasabi for a little extra, which makes all the difference!
You can order half rolls, so you can taste more. And the service is pretty quick.
I will definitely go back (maybe next time I'll have a chance to get the host's name), and highly recommend it!

Hands down the best AYCE sushi place in the Summerlin area.... if not Vegas. I have come here at least 15 times, and never once have I had a bad experience. It's a small sushi spot, so expect a wait if you ever come for the weekend prime times. If you can hold out, FUN TIP, they are open until 3AM. I recommend the Big B Roll, it's a sushi roll with the best beef on top, and it's only one per person so make everyone else order one of their own- don't share!!! It's way to good. Highly recommend any of their spicy rolls for those who need a kick, super delicious and will crave that spicy fill. I love the Kimmy Roll! Their tuna, and salmon nigiri is soooo fresh. Absolutely love! Back to spicy... I love the spicy tuna hand roll! It's actually spicy tuna and not the silly fillers like cucumbers and too much rice. 
If you're a drinker their house hot sake is perfect in between rolls. I love it when it's super hot. It's one of the better hot sakes where it doesn't have that bitter after taste. 
Needless to say I love this place and all the people that make it special. :)

A sushi coma is what we were promised, and we left in a sushi induced coma indeed! I definitely recommend both the Mountain roll and All the Fish roll (I think the names are correct). The seaweed and cucumber salads were both nice and fresh. Staff was super friendly. The place is tiny and pretty cramped, but we didn't mind at all. It feels so cozy. :)

The place is small and the service is slow but the sushi is good. Be there between 4 and 5 or you'll wait for hours. The portion is very small so make sure you order a lot at once or you'll spend the night there.

Almost a year later and nothing has changed. They are still slow with bringing out the orders. The sushi is decent and isn't paper thin. 

I came in last night around 1 and it was not busy at all. Maybe two other tables. We made our order of a variety of nigiri and a roll.

All the employees seem like they are everywhere. You would ask them one thing and then they would go do another. Our waitress even dropped food in my boyfriends water and just walked away. 

OKAY EVERYTHING CAME OUT SO SLOW. The waitress would bring out our one order of salmon. And then we would have to wait another 10 minutes for the next nigiri to come out. 

I don't understand. They had two chefs working at the same time. We decided for a couple more sushi and a roll. Of course. They somehow forgot the roll. 

We were over it and just got full because how slow the food was coming out. 

I'm happy the chefs brought us out uni at the end I think to make up for forgetting. Even though they told us they ran out of uni when we tried to order it.

It's your typical Vegas AYCE spot. The service was okay and the food was served in a timely manner. The menu had the usual spicy tuna rolls/Vegas rolls and there wasn't a "wow" factor here. A friend wanted to have her birthday here and so, we went. I would definitely come back for my friend if she wanted to come here. Other than that, I will stick to my regular spots with fresher fish and better service and variety.

Having sushi koma is juicy!!

Wow!! Can't believe how good this place is. I'm very surprised that I am actually addicted to this place after having ate it the first time today. I'm definitely coming back and recommending it to everyone who visits Vegas.
