I've been to a few difference AYCE sushi joints in la and Vegas and there hasn't been a place that I really loved except for this one.

My favorites are the tuna carpaccio and the sushi taco thing called seafood tostada are super juicy and the best on the menu. The Nigiris are all very fresh and juicy. The beef sushi called Big b sushi was pretty good and their miso soup was very tasty. The sashimi sushi was very good but it's very small and it's just one per person order. 

The servers are very attentive and very quick. As busy as they are they still have a smile and get your orders as quick as they can. The price is very reasonable for lunch and dinner less than $26. But they do charge 19% for parties of 6+.

This is the best AYCE I have found so far. Love the fact that it's open so late and that their nigiri always tastes great. My favorites are the nigiri and tuna carpaccio. The menu is pretty extensive and has a little something for everyone. Service is always excellent, especially when Judy is working. She is so sweet and accommodating. I definitely recommend this place and always look forward to coming back.

First visit, came in based on Yelp reviews and I was not disappointed! Great sushi and great service! We had multiple servers work our table which was great, we never wanted for anything! The AYCE has a good variety and the sushi was fresh and tasty! We'll be back

It's SAD to give them such bad review when we love their sushi.
We've been coming here for about 3 months now and the service is getting worse by the visit.
This is the THIRD time in a row that we dine in and our orders are completely messed up!
We were given wrong items, then brought teriyaki chicken with no rice for my friends kid when we specifically asked for the rice 3 times.
Only one person was brought a salad when 3 asked for one and when we kindly asked for our food they said it was coming and then returned a few minutes later to ask what we ordered.
There's only 3 tables occupied at the time on a Saturday around 4:30pm.
They really need BETTER MANAGEMENT!!!

Food is pretty good for the three times I've been there. The rolls towards the end started to have more and more rice. However, most importantly, the fish has always been very fresh! The only thing that disturbs me is the customer service. The hostesses were SO confused about seating three groups in a somewhat crowded restaurant. The size of the restaurant/capacity has not changed for what reason do you act like you've never done a day of this job before, it was just too awkward. Then the girl that took our order (which it also took forever to get her attention) did not take down our order right or forgot, three different orders of ours. It just takes too long to get someone's attention which is ridiculous. It's sad because I recommended this place to someone and now they will probably relay this experience. Too bad.

I was really craving sushi yesterday, so I went to Yelp to find a place and it didn't not disappoint! We started off with edamame, which was AMAZING! We got the "angry edamame" which was spicy. Most places, when they say spicy, it's not spicy enough for me, but this one was great! Right on point. The sushi was amazing as well! If you can eat a lot, the all you can eat sushi is a good option for you. Food was great from start to finish! Will definitely go again!
Our new favorite sushi place ! Great food! Good service . Ayce has great selection and so much to offer. Will come back soon !

First off, let me say that about 6 months ago I would have given this place 5 stars - I've recommended it to everyone and been a huge fan since it was Sushi Freak.  They have incredibly fresh fish, good choices, and usually a friendly staff.  

The last two visits, however, have been less than stellar.  About a month ago we actually left because, in 20 minutes, no one came over to say hi or take our order (at the sushi bar!).  I generally don't make a habit of leaving once I've sat down, but I was starving and we just didn't feel very welcomed.  The last time, this week, was very busy - the after work crowd is huge for this small place!  My group of three sat at the sushi bar - however NONE of the three sushi chefs made eye contact or took our order.  They seemed to be intentionally staring down and making food, and not communicating at all with the people at the sushi bar.  Only as we were leaving did a chef come on who was friendly and asked how we were doing - everything else we ordered through the server.

Just disappointed - there are so many great AYCE sushi places with hospitable chefs and staff, and I'm not sure what happened to this place!  I'll go back eventually, but it's dropped in my standings behind some consistent favorites.

SO glad I came across this place on yelp! Hands down, my new favorite sushi spot in Vegas. 

Quality of fish: amazing!!! Melt-in-your mouth nigiri. I tried salmon, halibut, yellowtail, white tuna, tuna, and seared tuna. Every piece of fish was delicious! I'm usually not a fan of red tuna, but the tuna here was amazing, I ended up ordering 4 more orders just for myself.  Also, the tuna carpaccio was to die for!!

You can try any roll at this place and you won't be disappointed!  

Great service.  All the servers were very friendly and actually looked like they enjoyed  working. Great atmosphere.  Tiny restaurant, perfect for date night, not good for big parties. I'm definitely coming here for AYCE again!

If I could give this place 10 stars I would! This place is amazing! I've come here several times and have always had a good experience. Decided to grab a quick bite by myself after work tonight, and sat at the sushi bar. I was immediately greeted by Christina who got me set up with drinks and appetizers quickly. Chris, the owner was SO accommodating and had the best personality and hospitality. He offered to make me a special roll, off the menu just the way I like it! The fish and food is so fresh and flavorful. Love the ambience and decor here. Sushi chefs are very knowledgeable as well and very friendly. Always open to questions and if you need something they have a sense of urgency. Love, love this place. highly recommend. :)

I cannot sing enough praise for this place, it's my new favorite sushi joint! I absolutely love the staff and service is always top notch. As embarrassing as this is, I've come once a week since I've moved to this side of town, if not more and I leave happy every time. I will be telling all of my friends and anyone asking for great sushi at work will get a college length thesis on how they can't go wrong with Sushi Koma!

I've had a my fair share of AYCE sushi places and this one tops it by far as THEE BEST AYCE SUSHI EVER. I'm from CA and I would definitely make a trip back out here to eat here. If you are out in Las Vegas, GO HERE! Your stomach will not regret it.

Prices: AYCE - $21.99 for Lunch & $25.99 for Dinner. As expected, but worth it if you have a big appetite or even on planning to order 3 rolls. There are no rounds, you can order as many times as you like.

Service: Awesome. Heard that this place was small, but was accommodated with seats right away. The staff are all very nice and they attend to you quickly. If there are multiple large groups of like 6 or more, it may take time to get in if it's busy. The staff make small talk, which I thought was pretty cool. Allows you to be comfortable

Food: Best I ever had. Appetizers were pretty good. Tuna carpaccio was something new to me, but it tasted really good. A must try. The tostada was like a combination of a poke/ceviche. The nigiri was what caught me. The quality and texture of the fish are on point. You can tell that the first are handled the right way.

Their service is amazing! Everyone is so welcoming and nice. Their Ngiri doesn't have a whole scoop of rice with it. Fish is fresh, favorite is super white tuna thanks to a lady that sat next to me and recommended it. Overall, this is my go to sushi place, plus its close to home!

So for starters, the food here is absolutely amazing!  The tuna carpaccio was on point, large pieces of fish for the sushi, and amazing that you can order half rolls for the ayce.  Now you may be wondering why the 3 stars.  

Well to me service is everything!  And the service here was...mediocre.  Everything took an extremely long time to get, and how they waited tables was different.  Every server waited on every table.  So we were asked 3 or 4 times if we have received specific orders.  (Because food was moving extremely slow) Gets a little much when you're trying to enjoy a meal.  Another downside is it seemed they put some sauce on almost everything, which had a strong vinegar taste.  Way to overbearing!
Awesome food in the right proportions. Service top notch new fav when in Vegas!!!!!  Great variety of Sushi and appetizers.

My coworkers and I decided to try this place out for international sushi day which happens to fall on my birthday. It is a small restaurant. Nothing fancy and I like it. The food came out relatively fast, but then again we were the only ones in the restaurant. I always order spicy scallop hand roll, albacore nigiri, and yellowtail nigiri. It's the best spicy scallop hand roll I so far have had in Vegas. It is made of 100% scallops and not of the fillers that other restaurants in town do. I ordered so many rolls that I really can't remember what I ordered. They were all good. Fresh awesome fish. The last dish was a tempura ice cream. Strawberry ice cream isn't my thing but that tempura ice cream was amazing. My only complaint is that I thought it was weird how the tempura was decorated with colored goldfishes (you know, the cheddar little crackers with the commercial that goes "I love fishes cuz they're so delicious. Gotta go fishin"). Nothing horrible or anything. I just scooted the fishes off to the side and devoured the fried frozen goodness. 
We also shared a large bottle of yuzu sake. This sake is for those who love flavored sake and dislike that alcohol burn. 
I will definitely come back for some more spicy scallop hand roll and other sushi.

It was my first time here at Sushi Koma. I came here before back in the days when it was too be called Brain Beach Sushi. Always wanted too come check it out since on the way too the hockey rink Thursday nights. Generally only read positive reviews for it. I had friends visiting they heard about it so wanted too check it out. Never pass up chance for good sushi! 

Since AYCE is so common here in Vegas its become harder too distinguish who would be da best of da best. I put Sushi Koma right up there in my top five. I feel like the quality of the fish was there from the nigiri, hand rolls, and speciality rolls. Dessert selection so solid nothing too creative but they make up for it with the appetizers. If there is anyway that I FEEL like distinguish one AYCE from another besides the OBVIOUS quality of the fish would be the apps and service. I feel like both they did wonderful job.

Apps we tried few of the things that our server recommended because when in doubt trust your server. She telling us most popular ones too. We couple of signature ones from the sashimi roll, seafood tostada, tuna carpaccio, and one odd for sushi restaurant brie and grape quesadilla. All of them was da bomb except for the tuna carpaccio. Me the fried garlic chips just not fan of. It tasted more burnt then fried and killed the taste of everything else. The rest have high praise not only for creative but tasted awesome. The sashimi roll love three or four different fish sliced thin all rolled up and came with nice sauce. Seafood tostada nice and refreshing nice chunks of fish and tomatoes in some kind of sauce. I love the fact with the fried tostada on the bottom use it as scoop of sorts. The cheese quesadilla in reality was much better then I expected. The Brie melted with some grape was great compliment too one another! The salmon skin rolls another one that stood out for me. The sushi was solid all around.

The service felt was fabulous. The minute walked in you could feel the enthusiasm not just from your normal greeting like every other sushi joint. Our server came over she asked if our first time. Great job telling us things that were popular and recommending. Couple dishes that hard time finish but never said anything about need too finish it. Warm smile and welcoming. Maybe cause smaller then most places and not very busy but still thought service more on it then more popular spots plus no waiting too seated. Sure if need fix sushi and normal spot is too packed come here.

First time visiting there with my sister and her fianc from CT.  Place is small, so cozy but they are moving to a larger spot in the same area.   Music was a bit loud but we were the oldest people there.   Specialty rolls were very very good.  Nigiri was fresh and presentation was nice.   My sister, who frequents sushi places definitely got her sushi fix and said that there was equal amounts of rice and fish, whereas most places they have more rice than fish.   Speed of the food coming out was excellent.  They turned tables quickly without making you feel rushed.  I would definitely go back again.  I had mostly the specialty rolls, but really want to try the Nigiri.
4/5 stars only because has to wait an hour at 10pm for a table for 4. This place is the bomb- great service, food, atmosphere!

Best sushi place in town for all you can eat. There yellow tail belly is the best I've ever had. The staff is extremely friendly and the restaurant is extremely clean. This is my go to place for sushi and has never let me down! 10/10!

Tried Sushi Koma tonight for dinner with friends. Pretty standard sushi but very attentive staff, especially Judie. Liked the yellowtail Nigiri and fried shrimp heads. 

Sweet shrimp was bitter, Big B and Kimmy Roll were too salty for me. 

Judie provided great service. I think tonight was just an off night and would try again.

Always great service and great food here. We were seated immediately no lunch rush. Seafood tostada is the best, but only one order per person, as in one only...lol. Seaweed salad is always on point. Great dressing that makes it different from other  seaweed salads I've tried before. Spider hand roll is a must. Love coming here!

This is my second time here but my first time was like years ago that I couldn't remember anymore.  I think the food wasn't that great the first time so I waited this long to come try it again.  

I came here at 6:30 on a Saturday and there was no wait.  The waitresses are all very nice and friendly.  They were very eager to take our orders and we got our order in a quick manner.  They kept checking on us to make sure we got our order and doing great.  

Since I don't eat rice so I tried mostly the special items that only one per customer.  The seared tuna, dynamite, fried oyster, seafood tostadas were all great.  I especially liked the seaweed salad because I think they add sesame dressing on it.

So the price is very reasonable for $25.99 per person.  If I were eat this much on the strip, I would be paying at least $100 for the two of us.  Great food and great experience.

Excellent sushi! Small intimate environment with an up beat vibe. Perfect service, not a bunch of phony pleasantries just on it with everything from filling glasses to knowing exactly when we were ready to order another roll. The sushi was out of this world! Can't wait to go back!

I have to agree with Jade - it's the service here that blows the other AYCE places away. Maybe it's the small format which sets Sushi Koma and the esteemed (but not AYCE) Yummy Grill on West Lake Mead Blvd apart from the rest. Drinks and plates are always being attended to - an AYCE meal at Koma doesn't have to take an hour or more, you could probably rip in and out of here in 25 mins with a suitably full belly.

Speaking of belly, yellowtail belly and salmon belly are almost always available and good quality, the tako sushi is tender, the special tostada is awesome, and the gyoza are addictive - thinly-wrapped and perfectly pan toasted. I could eat 100+ pieces of these if I had to.

Unagi is always good quality, and their saba (mackerel) is unusually delicate and light: it's made in-house and not super smoky/briny like most places. I love it. I prefer the live scallop on-the-shell at Yummy Grill to the 'fresh' scallop version at Koma, but maybe that's just me. 

You really feel like an appreciated customer here. Smiles among the cool waitstaff are a plenty and the Koma chefs have got skills. Sushi Koma feels like a small NYC-style spot - except you don't have to wait 45mins for a seat at the sushi bar. That's a good feeling.

This sushi place has become me and my husband's favorite sushi place on this side of town. When we first came here there was a little bump in the road. But after the first night things started getting better as we went more often. We've become friends with the wait staff and the owner. They are such amazing people. Judy, which is our favorite waitress, has a very bubbly personality and is very sweet. The sushi chefs are working in their stations as fast as they can. Not gonna lie, I personally know one of the sushi chefs, Bryan. An old friend of mine. I'm not the type of person to brag or anything but with the many times we've been coming to this spot, the staff knows us and we get some chef specials from the owner himself. He has approached us and talk to some of the customers. When the owner and the staff found out that me and my husband got married they congratulated us and gave us a dessert of our choice on the house. Even on the receipt the wait staff wrote congrats! 

I was told by my parents to treat others how you want to be treated. So therefore I have treated the people here with mad respect and I get that back from them. 

It definitely doesn't take a big name or a big space for a place to be good in quality and in service. Sometimes it can be from a tiny space that has the best service and good quality. 
Don't take my words for it, try it for yourself.

Let me be honest..

This place is way too small for me to feel comfortable. Maybe I'm claustrophobic, but I had anxiety as I ate. The restaurant is small and especially when they stick you in the corner. 

Not very many options, at least not when I compared it to my favorite place oshi sushi. 

Three times they delivered other peoples rolls to our table and I here was asked if I wanted a refill on my drink. 

I didn't like that the veggie rolls, calamari and shrimp tempura were all served with the same sauce. Made it seem bland and generic. 

The only roll I really loved that oshi doesn't have is the kimmey roll. The asparagus was very fresh and I loved the crunch top. There's no way I'm coming back for one roll though.
Everything here is delicous.  The fish is fresh and rice perfectly cooked. Staff is friendly.

This place was pretty good. I liked the atmosphere: it was dim but still bright enough for a big party. I went in there with about 15 people for a birthday celebration and they were good with their service. It was constant and we didn't feel the pressure of ordering right. They were really patient about our huge orders of salmon!

I liked the taste of their salmon nigiri but it wasn't anything memorable. They usually put thin slices of lemon on top which most of us disregarded so opt out for it when you don't want any! Also, desert is only one per person, but really who needs more than one after a sushi buffet? Aha. One thing I really liked was their shrimp tempura. The batter was light and not oily. 

We ordered other things too but nothing any other sushi place offers. This is the reason why I gave them a 4, nothing was memorable enough.

Omg this is the best sushi place in Vegas. Ever since the new management they beat out Oyshi by a long shot!! I love the Tuna Carpaccio and Sashimi Roll, they are to die for. I have been a fan of Brians Beach for YEARS but was always reluctant to go because the service was so awful, the new management definitely fixed that! Everyone there is extremely attentive and nice. I will never go anywhere else for AYCE again!

Sushi Koma is a cute AYCE sushi place, and they were packed the night we ate here. Because there's not a whole lot of floor space, I feel as though this is a restaurant better suited to smaller parties. If you must bring a lot of people, do yourself a favor and make a reservation so the staff has time to accommodate your party (and so you're not waiting forever). 

Sushi quality was fresh but nothing really stood out for me. Just your typical AYCE fare.

I was really sad that they limit you to one type of dessert! I guess it's a way to keep costs down. But seriously, can't a girl eat her weight in mochi ice cream once in a while? 

Anyway. The food is good here, so I'll try it with a smaller group next time.

I hate to give this place a bad review but my experience was BAD. We arrived at 8:20 ish and was told there was gonna be a 20 minute wait. We didn't mind but 20 minutes turned into 40 minutes & got seated around 9 pm. We then got seated and ordered but our food didn't arrive until 9:30. We understand that it was busy and our waiter was nice about it. We then ordered a second round of sushi and that came out one by one. We didn't see our original waiter after that and finished our food by 10:10. We looked around for our wait for the checks but didn't see him around but. Finally around 10:40 another lady asked if we were ready to check out, to which we gave our cards. I don't understand why it took 20 minutes to process our payment. The restaurant died down and wasn't busy anymore. I was absolutely dissatisfied about everything. The fact that our waiter left us and didn't inform us, the drastic wait and no one checking on us. I wanted to demand my money back but didn't want to ruin a good date night but I really hope the manager sees this.

Don't let the sign outside fool you.  This is Sushi Freak not Brian's Beach Sushi, they just haven't changed the sign outside yet.  Make sure you check-in to the right establishment.

I actually wasn't that hungry but it's been a while since I've ate made to order AYCE sushi so why not it was only $26 for dinner. My order was only a small portion of the menu but easily would have cost me more than $26. I had some shrimp tempura, deep fried oysters, octopus nigiri, elephant roll, red bean ice screen, plus whatever else we shared and some specialty items the sushi chef made for us.  Overall the food was very good but because I didn't try more of the menu it's a 4 which is still very good in my book.  Next time I'm coming hungry.

Service was excellent. We came with a party of 7 and Sushi Freak accommodated us very well. There was no wait. They were on the spot with bringing all of our orders out quickly and correct, separating bills and taking our money.  They made specialty items just because and said we didn't have to finish them if we didn't like it.  Don't remember how long we were there but they didn't rush us.  They also treated us like their number ones from when we first arrived till we left, excellent first impression.  Definitely will be back. 

The dining area is smaller but it doesn't feel crammed.

This place is really good! It is a quite small dining area but it's cute. It's definitely a few levels above most of the ayce places in terms of fish quality, flavor and selection of rolls (I don't like overly saucy rolls). I haven't tried a lot of the kitchen stuff. The salmon yellowtail and ikura were very yummy. I would recommend this place to friends!

The new location is impecable, bigger, and everyone was so attentive tonight.  I love this place for their good quality food, amazing service and warm welcoming ambiance. Thank you Sushi Koma for your amazing service. We'll keep coming back here as it is one of my favorite sushi places.
The best sushi place in Vegas . Just everything is good the sushi good customer services the place I definitely recommend to anyone looking for a good place to go to eat sushi

Sushi Koma is my favorite AYCE sushi joint.  It's around 25.95 for dinner.  I really like their selection of rolls.  I've dined here quite a few times and the thing I like most about it is their attention to detail in every roll.  I've gone to plenty of sushi places where the rolls look sloppy, rice is falling off, the avocado is brown, and the fish is slipping out of the roll; every time I have gone here and every roll I've had looks well prepared and tastes the same every time.  They are consistent in the great quality of the food.  The only reason I am not giving them 5 stars is because their service is extremely inconsistent.  The service is always pleasant but sometimes they are flat out freakin slow.  One time I left because other than moving me and my bf to another table, we were not acknowledged for 20 minutes!  Given that fact you gotta know I really love the food considering I'm STILL giving them 4 stars.  Tuna carpacchio (sp?) is a must.  Their spicy tuna has been unusually hot every time I've had it so I stay away from those rolls now.  My favorite rolls are the paradise roll, the stephanie roll, and SC7 (off the top of my head).

Good solid sushi.  Awesome value.  Everything is good quality and the service is excellent.  They never leave your water or tea half-empty.  The menu isn't the most innovative, except for the brie and grape quesadilla (definitely worth having).

Still, it's a good price for a lot of food.  And where some other all-you-can-eat sushi places give you pressure to hurry up or limit your menu, this place is very relaxed.
Good food delivered lightning fast and the waitresses kept my glass full!  I am usually not a fan of All You Can Eat food but this is an exception!
Oh my fking god. The food is so amazing here. The service is fast, the server is awesome, and the food is great. Will be back, thanks for the sushi coma!
Just found the best AYCE sushi in Las Vegas. Great vibe. And the sushi is better than good.

I have to say, at first I was skeptic about Sushi Koma moving its location.

I even chuckled when I found out that it was moved to a location in the same plaza.

But I really ate my words when I got to see it. Their new location looks.. well.. good!
It's a lot more spacious and open, and already that makes me feel more comfortable. No more congested seating with tables vibrating at the fidgety legs of the nervous customer sitting 2 seats down from you.

Gone are the days of having to scoot your chairs up close to your table just so you avoid hitting the back end of the person's chair sitting behind you.

Man sitting? Yes please, full spread. There's room to share.

Don't mind my sloppy gesture or allow my disgusting habits to turn you away though, this place feels and looks a lot more clean and classy than its predecessor location.
I really do enjoy the modern touch and more open sushi bar.

Quality is still the same, and pretty decently fresh. As always make sure you get the seared tuna carpaccio with the garlic chips. And a full order of their salmon belly nigiri.

 This place is the spot for an enjoyable ayce experience.

This is my favorite sushi place! I've had friends swear their favorite spot was better but everything pales in comparison to Sushi Koma. I love their new spot, same location but finally a larger seating area. Great atmosphere and some really great servers (some meh...) Best AYCE I've ever had!

Love this place!! tuna carpaccio is oh so delicious. Fish is fresh. I'll be back to explore the menu even more.


I wouldn't have found this place if it wasn't for yelp. Its in a small shopping center and seating is very limited. It's a must try though!

We've been here a couple of times before. And we came again for all you can eat for dinner. 
The food here are great! I love the food here. But the service was bad!! So when we seated the lady came told us she will be our server. But most of the time different server came to our table to bring food. So we asked her if we can order more food, she told us "BE PATIENT! You have to wait for YOUR Server to come to your table" so.... we waited......15 min..... she didn't even tell OUR server we wanted to order!!! And while we are waiting for OUR server she came to our table and asked if we want water refill!! Twice!!! And we had our water almost full!!!! 
She comes to bring our food and ask for water?AND ask if we were doing okay....we didn't like how she told us we have to be patient!! And also she didn't tell OUR server that we were waiting!!!  
We were so sad the service was bad but food was great! We are not sure if we'll be back.
I love their white tuna nigiri, big b roll, and brie and grape quesadilla. :)

Found this spot on here, well I find a lot of the food spots here, anyway. The service is great. The staff is super friendly and the sushi my son and I ordered  is really good. The environment is welcoming looks like a popular spot. There were a lot of people coming in. All in all I recommend this place if your ever around the area.
A year and 5 months later, still the best sushi joint in Vegas. Everything is just so on point with Sushi Koma. I ain't never gonna stray - hashtagloyal.

One of the best sushi places in Vegas. Fresh and clear sushi restaurant. Waitress was very nice! 

My go to place to all you can eat!

I've tried a lot of sushi places in Vegas never thought that the one around the block is the best there is!!!! No doubt my new fav place... Im sushi fanatic and i will recommend this place without thinkig twice i lv it the service the food amazing everything about it!!!!!!

This is actually one of my favorite places to go these days + it's right by Hunnie Bunnie's dance school.
I think the first time I came here I over stuffed my face with sushi and was in an extreme sushi koma which was TOO much.
All the other times I come here I find the fish to be fresh and tasty and I like their unique menu items like the sashimi roll, seafood tostada and the tuna carpaccio! 
Nom!

Was recommended to us and because we love sushi we had to try it. The place is small but luckily we got seated right away on a Friday nite! The staff were great and very attentive. Service was fast. The food taste good and FRESH! My favorite was the UNI. But everything we ordered was yummy!

I love this place! Just moved to this side of town and we lucked out with finding it. The food and service are so great. It's a little cozy, so I can see how people might have to wait for a table but it's worth it. The atmosphere was very laid back and casual

Service was quick and friendly, sushi tasted great, one issue though is too many people taking our orders and rolls getting forgotten so the actual looked at me puzzled when i asked about my volcano roll about 15 minutes after ordering it since i know it takes a while to bake it but she seemed not to believe me wheb i mentioned it to her then she checked and it had been ready. But the food is good though, just got to work a little on communication.

I loved this place! My fianc and I just went for our 9yr anniversary after a co-worker told him about this place. I am very picky when it comes to sushi and I must say that this place was delicious!! I like the fact that it's small! And it's close to my house, I think I just found my new spot.

The sushi here is amazing, probably the most freshest sushi I've had so far. The only thing that was a huge turn off was the service, it was literally a shit show, plates dropping, glass breaking, etc. Best advice I could give the owner is that for that small of a place they had way too many people serving and it just caused so much confusion. Other than the organization skills everything was great.

Ate here for the second time and forgot how good this place was when I first visited. I would definitely say that this sushi joint ranks among my top 3 here in town. Despite the fact that AYCE sushi here in Las Vegas are a dime a dozen, the quality and flavor of Sushi Freak stood out to me the most. They have your typical rolls with the same typical names, but then they also have their own unique style of rolls which give a refreshing change. Furthermore, they also have their own special dishes like the Tuna Carpaccio, I could eat that all day and everyday, definitely brought out the wow factor. The restaurant is very clean, staff is super nice, service is excellent, and theyre open till 3am. So what's not to like? Reason I give it 4 stars instead of 5 is because of the 1 limit per person on some of the specialty items. Personally for me an AYCE sushi should offer EVERYTHING as AYCE whether I want to have 50 mochi ice creams or 100 pieces of that fish. However, this sushi place is absolutely still worth going to, whether you get that sushi itch for lunch, or at midnight. I'm a fan, and i'll be going back regularly.
My favorite ACYE sushi restaurant in town. Also Ben Julian are both really great. Order the Big B and Tuna Carpaccio!

AYCE sushi with UNI! One order per person, but good thing not everyone loves it as much i do, more for me!! They have the best rice to fish ratio. And the appetizers are also very tasty: seaweed salad, cucumber salad, gyoza, miso soup, seared tuna, and also you can order half rolls (vs full rolls so you don't fully stuff yourself!) they have hand rolls as well and you add avocado and masago eggs for free on almost anything! They call it sushi koma because you leave feeling like you're going into a coma after all the yummy food you eat :) TRY it all if you can! Better to go in a group so you can share and try it all.

Let me start out by saying the sushi is AMAZING here and given the hours of operation, would be convenient for late night dates or outings. The only reason I gave it three stars was because of the service. The restaurant is not at all large and seem to be well staffed. Everyone in my party got the AYCE and throughout the night several dishes seem to have gone missing and never reached our table. It was totally understandable considering it was a party of 8 but still kind of interesting as the restaurant was not at all busy when we were there. The part that really made the overall experience just ok was the fact that it took them 30 minutes to figure out our checks. We asked for separate checks up front and granted they have auto gratuity they need to figure out for parties over 6 - it took a lot longer than it should have. Maybe it just an off night for them but I think it might be safer to try this place out with a smaller party, at a different hour, or when ordering a la carte instead of AYCE.

One of my favorite restaurants in Las Vegas, hands down.  Completely UNDERRATED.  I take this AYCE over any other.  Food and service.

Standouts are the appetizers (this is my favorite part).  Seafood tostada, sashimi roll, tuna carpaccio.  Good god these are so good!!  You can only get one of these though, whereas the other items are unlimited.

As far as rolls, I'm gonna go old school and say the tiger roll is my favorite.  That warm shrimp tempura along side that cold, spicy tuna.  My oh my!!  Random note:  The spicy tuna is actually spicy here.

This is a must for all you can eat lovers.

First time here and we're definitely coming back...best part is it's literally down the street from us. The staff were all so personable and attentive. The sushi combinations were fresh and delicious!! No disappointments.

I've been going to Sushi Koma for awhile now cause my friend said it was good. They were at a smaller joint which was cool but then they upgraded and everything is just bad now. 

At the smaller one they were fast, quick and friendly. Now that they got a bigger place they're slow and just take their time with everything. I went here with my girlfriend and it was just all bad. We got waited on by 3 different servers and we had to tell the host that the service was bad. Took forever to get rolls to us and they had more then enough severs. 

I gave this place one more chance and tried it for lunch with my mom and there were like 3 tables and 2 people at at the bar. So we sit at the bar and there one waiter running around trying to do everything and she did a great job but still slow and I thought wen you sit at the bar you tell the people you order so it's faster. Guessed wrong she had to come take out order and give it to them when we're sitting right in front of them, like we can tell them. The people next to us were telling them their orders but they never acknowledged us once unless it was an order from the waiter. So unless they get better servers like the ones from the small spot I'm not going here cause you'll be there for 1 1/2 to 2 hours just to eat sushi.

Went there twice In a week with my husband. We sat in the bar(same place both times) and was served our food rather quickly. The girl who took our order was friendly and did her best to attend to the decently full restaurant. 
Sushi chefs were quick and would even ask if we wanted anything else whenever we finished our sushi. The place is very small as many have mentioned but it was never crazy busy all the times I've went. All the sushi was really good. The baked salmon one was way too creamy for me though. Considering I was full out of my mind, that dish almost made me hurl. 
The eel rolls were amaaaaazing(I am a fanatic of eel). 
Seaweed salad was good. Pretty much everything was good. Tuna carpaccio was great!! Garlic tastes like chips it was crazy. 
Great place for sushi!

My husband took me here for my birthday. The wait was minimal although he had called ahead to make a reservation; it was a busy Friday evening a few days before Thanksgiving. 

We both did the AYCE. The selection of rolls and items on the AYCE menu were great. Lots of variety and something for everyone. We were so excited to try many of the rolls that we may have ordered too many. They found out it was my birthday thanks to my husband, and the majority of the staff came to our table to sing me Happy Birthday, and brought me an amazing ice cream sundae. On par with everything else, the ice cream was of course delicious. The customer service throughout our time there was great. They were very attentive and we never had an empty glass. I also did notice that there was no '1 hour time limit' blurb on the AYCE menu. We were conscious of how much time we were there, but I didn't feel as rushed to finish my meal as I did at other places. The restaurant is on the smaller side, but the use of space is well done.The dcor is industrial modern, and the music they play overhead is a perfect volume. We will definitely be back.

Checked this spot out today to take myself on a date. The location is in a strip mall and the outside is quite quaint. But once you walk in it's well decorated and really brings a bit of Asian feel to the place. Looks nice from the inside! 

All the employees were nice, I went when they were slow, so everyone was very attentive. 

The nigiri was really good, very fresh and that's what consisted of most of my meal.

Overall I had a great sushi dinner, but the outstanding feature of the meal was the SABA (mackerel nigiri) it was so good. It was the best Saba I've ever had, soft, lightly seasoned with fresh garlic and chives. I ended up ordering 'another order of Saba' 3 times. I'll probably come back just for the Saba. Get it!

It got 4 stars and not 5 because of some very minor service mishaps. I wish I could give a 4.5/5. 

Also take note! Lunch price AYCE ends at 3 now, not 4. :) 

Great little gem in Vegas!

It's really hard to give this even a 1 star. The worst, slowest and most unfriendly service. Not to mention no wifi. 
I have been here several times at various hours and never experienced such horrible service. From waiting 25 minutes to be addressed (restaurant not 1/2 capacity) to having to ask for wasabi and ginger....it's not like I was in a corner...I was at the sushi bar for heaven sake watching others who came in after receiving friendly service. What's even more amazing is the staff assumed I couldn't understand them. SHAME on them for thinking I can't speak or understand Mandarin, perhaps YELP will address this ignorance! 
In closing, what's more insulting is the server whom they replaced to make the situation more liking actually made it worse by inquiring if I had eaten all day and if I wanted a half of a refill on tap water...
SO DISAPPOINTED!!! 
Thank you for demeaning my aptitude and appetite!

My first time here. About 14 of us went to celebrate a friend's birthday. At first the food was coming out quickly and presented well. However, someone ordered a chicken bowl and it took about 30min for it to come out. When I asked why was it taking so long the response I got was "I put in a big order for this table" I said I realize that but I ordered after she did and all the rolls I ordered came out. A few people at our table had to keep asking for drink refills, where was their order, for them to clear our table etc.   We were all divided on the servers, some were nice while there was a few very rude. And the rice was over cooked. I can say I won't be back there.

Found Sushi Koma while searching for AYCE restaurants in the new side of town we are on. Eileen was awesome and explained how the program worked. The food we chose was delicious! Definitely will be back!
Absolutely love this place and it's always my go to spot!! They recently have moved (still in the same plaza) so there's more space, modern, and the same phenomenal sushi. 10/10 recommend

Alright the name of this restaurant is NO JOKE. I was legitimately falling asleep before I even got to my dessert (red bean and green tea mochi-both fantastic). The fish/sushi was fresh tasting and delicious! I ordered a hot green tea which was served in a cute mug and had great flavor. This is easily my favorite AYCE sushi restaurant in Las Vegas due to friendly and attentive service, fresh food and broad menu options, even having the option to order a half roll makes a huge difference compared to AYCE sushi restaurants competing in Vegas. I was a big fan of pretty much anything on the Spicy roll menu and can't wait to go back!

I kid you not, the people who live in this city are spoiled rotten. 24 hour 365 day gyms and late night sushi till 3am!

Finished a workout at LVAC and needed a post workout meal since I didn't have any at home. And since my trainer said it's okay to eat rice after a hard workout, I thought "Why the heck not?"

Definitely recommend doing AYCE since most rolls start at $6 along with apps starting around $4-$5 I think. 

The sushi was good as well as what was handed to me and two other diners as a special...and boy was it special!  Tuna belly! That I could've ate for days!

Perhaps it's a their twist on nigiri, but I don't think nigiri is suppose to be in a pool of sauce...still good though. The rice on the nigiri just fell apart, no big deal because I was hungry. 

The mochi selection is more than most sushi places I've dined at.

The tea is really good as it has toasted brown rice that you may see floating in your tea, but don't freak out like I did thinking it was a bug...

The guys here are super chill and the atmosphere was pretty good too with up beat music. 

Happy Eats!

The sushi was good and the all you can eat option is definitely the way to go. The menu is pretty large and I love that we had the option to order half rolls so we could try more of the menu without getting full on one or two rolls and the appetizer menu had a lot of options. The only negative was that tables for two were super small, like a round bedside table. But then again the place was small as well.
Husband and I ate at Sushi Koma twice, and both times the experience was very pleasant. It is a great small sushi restaurant for AYCE.

Excellent.  They got a little uptight about soy paper when I ordered and received a hand roll with soy paper.  They did not tell me it was an additional charge.  When I ordered the next one they told me there was a charge so I said to just put it on seaweed and charge for the first one.

I didn't care about the $1 and was willing to pay.  I felt badly for the waitress who was somewhat new and thought since she hadn't told me there was a fee that I shouldn't have to pay.  It was $1, I wasn't concerned.  I just wasn't so happy with the attitude from the sushi guy when I had already said not to worry about it, and charge me for it if they needed to charge.

I still give them 5 stars because
A) The food was really excellent.  And
B) As a restaurant owner, I know sometimes employee's are employee's and they don't mean to come off the way they come off

Friendly Staff and great food! It's a little small, but the prices and portions are great! First experience, free sake on Wednesday nights?! Blew me out of the water. Only complaint would be that sometimes the wait can get a little longer.

Hands down the best place in Vegas for All you can eat sushi. The fish is so fresh, staff is amazing, and the service is always good- even when they are crazy busy! Haven't found any place that is more creative and always good. Never a bad meal! 

My husband and I come here regularly... And by regularly I mean almost once a week! Soooooo good! I think we are addicted to this place :) great for date nights, families, and even small groups. I wouldn't recommend any other place for sushi! If you haven't tried Sushi Koma then you are missing out!

This is one of the best sushi places I've ever been to. First off, the staff is SUPER nice and helpful. There are so many options, good spacing between tables and they're quick. A lot of places will charge you by the hour for AYCE, but they literally mean it here "sushi till you Koma!". Our waitress was great, I never felt like we were rushed. We were a big party with 3 kids and she never once seemed annoyed or anything. 

The ONLY issue I have is that our runner came out a few times not knowing what roll he was giving us. I know it's hard to expect to know every roll, but I would hope you know what a California Roll looks like!

Came here with my girl Ambi D.  It is a cute little spot I remembered from back when it was Brian's Beach.  It was a busy Saturday night but we were seated quickly.  Our server was friendly and our orders came out at a good pace.  Ambi is a regular here so we ordered all her favorites, which are now my favorites.  They have a great AYCE menu, tons of choices.  Everything we got was fresh and good quality.  Sushi Koma is a little far from me but definitely will be back when I am in the area.

At this point i am a very regular customer. The quality of fish is as high as you will find at any sushi restaurant in Vegas. The service and atmosphere imo is the best you will find at any sushi restaurant in Las Vegas. As of right now this is all around the best spot for both authentic and Americanized sushi.

THIS PLACE IS AMAZING! Josh is the best server ever!!!! Get shrimp tempura roll! Get mango mochi! I love everything on the menu! I've never had to send anything back! The all you can eat option is perfect! Josh is awesome!

4 stars?!?! Is this for real? Why and how!? Disgust pure disgust. 95% of the rolls have eel sauce on them my sushi was tasteless and fell apart and was not fresh.. worst sushi I ever had...these reviews have to be fake. I'm starting to doubt yelp.

Plus: their sushi isn't made with too much rice to make you full like most AYCE places. They have great sake also.

Minus: HORRIBLE service!!!!! Absolutely terrible! And the restaurant is so tiny you feel piled in and so close to your neighbors and not enough room at the tables. They have some tasty things on the menu but in my opinion it's not better then the average Vegas sushi joint. 

The moral of the story: skip this place!

Lunch: (11:30am-4pm) $21.95
Dinner: (4pm-3am) $25.95

Very tight quarters in this sushi joint, we arrived early (about 6pm Sunday) and luckily my hungry party of 4 didn't have to wait to be seated.

Let's see...the short story of it is, I really wasn't impressed or satisfied with their rolls and nigiri. There were only 4 items on the menu that I liked, though, they weren't life changing. With their rolls, we all looked at each other and were like wow, they really packed the rice in there - It was like a rice roll and not a sushi roll, all rice and no filling. It was very disappointing (and filling). 

The good:
-Sashimi Roll -  (1 order per person and it's an tiny itty bitty portion) we all really enjoyed the flavors on this one. Refreshing, sweet, and lovely fish texture and flavor. 
-Salmon Nigiri - the salmon was sweet and buttery. The lemon slices on top were cut too thick so the flavor was too overwhelming and it took away from the salmon flavor. We ate the rest of the nigiri without it. 
-Seafood Tostada - 1 crunchy wonton chip topped with a mystery seafood mix in a poke style marinade. It was crisp and refreshing. 
- uni for AYCE was 1 order per person. It was very fresh and sweet.

The bad: 
-Crunchy roll- a plain jane CA roll and some sprinkles of tempura flakes. Not sure what's the deal, but It wasn't even crunchy :/
-Big b roll - a very dense roll. This roll was so terrible, that everyone at the table made a weird face after they took a bite. We all didn't want to eat anymore. The meat on top was chewy, the rice was super dense and soggy, and the flavor profile was pretty strange, sour and didn't tie everything together. 
-Spider roll - stuffed to the max with rice. A paper thin piece of crab, I think? We really didn't taste it. 
-Baked mussels - severely dry as heck! Typically baked mussels are plump, juicy and topped with Japanese mayo and unagi sauce. This one didn't have any, or if they did, we didn't taste it. It was painful to eat. 
-Miso soup - It came out room temperature and it tasted watery. 
-Plum wine ice cream - it tasted like artificial bubblegum. We didn't finish it. 
-Halibut nigiri - it had a ponzu-like sauce on it and it tasted like a very distinct artificial citrus and smoke flavor. We all agreed that they were mostly trying to mask an older fishy cut of halibut.
-They didn't offer us the fried heads on our ama ebi nigiri (sweet shrimp) - that's the best part! 

We also ordered a volcano roll, but it never made it to us and we were all actually extremely relieved about that. We all didn't want to deal with another train wreck.

For now, we will stick with Naka Sushi or Sakana until something else comes up.

My fianc and I are sushi lovers, and have tried so many restaurants all over Las Vegas. This place by far had outstanding service, very friendly, and chill positive vibes. The whole place just had so much character, with awesome art- to  how cool all the furniture was & the music playing that night. 
We did AYCE, and every dish was ultra amazing. Sushi Koma is definitely our favorite place to go. Absolutely adore this place.

This is the best Japanese restaurant....we (party of 4) are from San Francisco, California  for a week here. I consider myself a very picky eater, but this restaurant exceeded my expectations.  We got the all you can eat deal ($22 for lunch, $26 for dinner), you have to get this deal if you normally order an appetizer and at least two sushi rolls. I normally won't touch the sushi bar in a buffet setting.  This restaurant let you order from their actual menus (you can also order individual dishes), which means you get the quality.  I was afraid the owner wouldn't like it if we order more than 4 dishes each. As it turned out, she constantly ask if we have enough and would like to order more....  food is A+ and service is A+.  Must go to place if you like sushi rolls.  We will be coming back after our trip to the Antelope Canyons in a few days.

Service was def 5 stars.  But the food was probably 1 star.

And they are great at asking if you want more.  They were very accommodating with our kids.

But the fish and rice were def off.  And I mean really off.  I can't imagine it just being an off night because overall AYCE sushi is not that good and they weren't even close to being at the AYCE acceptable level.  I have pretty low standards for sushi.  I expected to be as good as Island Sushi and Grill in LV or Midori in Ventura County (CA).

Worst hamachi, salmon, albacore nigiri that I've ever had.  White tuna was the best nigiri that I had that night.
Rolls were really bad.  I mean how do you mess up something that has mayo, sauce, and rice?  Too many to mention.

The tempura was just okay.  The quesadilla is a waste of food space.  The gyoza was good.

Wish the food was better because they are awesome people.

Only been to Island Sushi and Grill before Koma.  Island is good for AYCE (not great) but Koma isn't even as close.  If this place is really the 4.5 stars that everyone raves about, you should give everyone else 10 stars.  When I come back to LV without the kids I think we're going to have to Goyemon.

I usually always go to Sushi Koma for the better meal but this time it kind of got on my nerves because as I was waiting and waiting for some service and food and they just seem to have too much going on there was a good moment where I was waiting up to 20 minutes just for some Nigiri.
I had also called them about 15 minutes before we got there to have the bar open for two people and they had told me that it was first come first serve. Now last time we had a server who had told us it was completely fine and put the table on reservation. when I arrived we got seated straight away but was slightly upset because I saw that someone had reserved a table yet told me that was not possible and it was first come, first serve. now I love sushi coma but I was getting a bit irritated because I always go here. just a tad bit upset this time.

We just moved to Vegas and this is by far our best bet for AYCE sushi.  Their sushi and appetizers have a creative spin and their ingredients are consistenly very fresh.  I would recommend the Tuna Carpaccio, the Ponzio Roll (raw), the Vegas Freak Roll (cooked) and the super white tuna nigiri which I can't get enough of.  The place is tiny, so try to avoid the lunch or dinner rush, and they are open til 3am!  Try their yuzu sake if you like citrus flavors.  Yum. LUV this place.

I love this place for a great deal on fresh AYCE sushi! I have been here a couple times now and all the staff are beyond friendly and helpful. They allow customers to order half rolls so you won't waste if you want to try something or you're starting to fill up. Their Brie quesadilla is surprisingly out of this world too, a must try! I always leave feeling happy, mighty full and ready for a nap... which in opinion is what you look for with AYCE! It's a pretty busy little spot so prepare to wait and be patient because it is well worth the wait! Or you can always do call ahead seating and hope to not have as long a wait once you arrive (depending on the night you may still have a wait).

I was not really impressed with this place whatsoever. The service was very weird, we were asked by four different people in the span of three minutes if we were doing all you can eat, and when we said no, they seemed put off. I was just in the mood for one or two rolls sorry! The menu was expensive for the average flavor that I tasted, and I wouldn't have minded as much if they weren't so all over the place with taking our order, and if it didn't take almost fifteen minutes to ask for the check when they weren't busy at all. I didn't order a ton of the menu, so i'm just giving an average review based on my experience. Apparently they are awesome for AYCE so maybe i'll try back next time when I'm hungrier.

I usually frequent another sushi place, but while on this side of town and craving sushi, I decided to give it a shot and order some carry out. Upon entering the establishment, I was quickly and kindly greeted. 

I order the Mountain Roll and the Washington Roll, and let me just say WOW! The fish is a lot fresher than other places. Very, VERY tasty!!! And the presentation was great.

I've heard so many good things about this place so I was excited to try it. Now I know why. When we walked unwell got sat immediately and ordered our drinks when another guy walked up to us. It took us 15 minutes to get them and it had to be from someone else since we asked someone else. At that point I was a bit irritated so I wasn't expecting much from this place but I was wrong. The sushi and rest of the staff was so good that it went from what would've been a 3 star to a 5. Only other complaint is that the "spiciest" roll wasn't even spicy to me.. And I hate spicy. I can't wait to come back!

I never realized how much I liked sushi until I moved to Las vegas where there was a plethora of ayce sushi spots. Sushi koma is my favorite spot and started coming here with my old roommates when I was living in South Summerlin, and I apologize for not giving them a review sooner. I never like to eat alone in restaurants but somehow I got the courage and came here pretty much every week (even sitting alone at the bar) because I need sushi at least once a week. It's a small spot so its usually busy but the owner mentioned its hard for them to expand so itll pretty much stay busy. Speaking of the owner, Chris, is a cool guy! He always says hi and remembers you and he's let me try a few specials before. The fish is always good, the service is great, and they serve different types of alcohol! Unlike some sushi spots only serve beer. Unfortunately I moved farther away where buying poke to go was more convenient to my schedule,  and then eventually I moved back to LA where I feel the ayce sushi game isn't as strong as LV, but I will def come back to visit and recommend as I usually take newbies to this spot when time comes around. Ill be back!

Stopped in here for dinner, they have a great all-you-can-eat menu that is very reasonably priced. Everything was very fresh, excellent green mussels. 

Accommodating with the rolls on AYCE, we couldn't decide between a fresh/deep fried version of the same roll, so the server recommended we get half of each and try both!

Great selection of Sake as well, I would recommend trying the sake sampler. Our favorite was the strawberry.

Sushi koma. I get it. So much food. Probably ate enough for mercury poisioning. But it was worth it.

Every bite delicious and it came promptly. I hate that lull between orders. 

The menu is huge so it's gonna take a few trips to try them all.

Service A
Price.    A
Food.    A

It was okay.  The rolls could have been formed better.  The space is very small and they choice of paint makes it feel even smaller.  There was nothing remarkable in my mind about this place versus the other sushi places in town.

I really like this place! First time here last nigh, had the AYCE, it was great! All dishes were fresh, the waitress gave us some good recommendations on some of the rolls! All staff were friendly and constantly checking up on us, which is a plus! This place isn't a very a big place so be sure to arrive before the dinner crowd.

Definitely coming back here again!

I used to come to this place all the time but it had a different name... So I decided to try it and so glad I did because This is one of the best AYCE sushi places in town! They bring out the rolls really fast and they have one of the best appetizer selections! Also the service was great and everyone was very friendly! Will be back for sure

The Sushi place formerly known as Brian's Beach (the sign still says Brian's Beach, btw).

I went here with some sushi-loving friends - me, I'm not a fan of anything from the sea. I was prepared to get my teriyaki bowl and keep my mouth shut as they noshed on roll after roll. Unfortunately, the place was all out of chicken and the waitress had no idea when they would even get more in. Not sure what that meant, but based on the fact the restaurant was clean and all the ingredients in the sushi/my orders were nice and fresh, I am assuming they're pretty picky about where they get their ingredients from.

I got the steak teriyaki bowl instead and ordered the brie & grape quesadilla as an amuse-bouche - it was really good. Maybe a bit burned, but brie and grapes are such a treat and who knew they'd serve them at a sushi place?

The all-you-can-eat sushi deal had my friends thrilled - they recommended ordering half rolls of everything you want to try because you can always order more if you like it. They don't really advertise half rolls on the menu so take advantage of that on rolls you aren't confident you can eat all of.

The service was okay, the waitress was really nice but she couldn't tell what roll was what when she was delivering them to the table. Not her fault (they do all sort of look the same) - maybe we needed to order less and be more cognizant of what we were asking for so we could decipher for ourselves.

This restaurant is TINY - probably only seats about 20 people at tables, maybe 10 at the bar. We went at 6:30 on a Sunday and had to wait for a table for about 20 minutes (and there's no waiting area, so it was stand in the door way). Don't jostle the buddha while you're waiting.

Ive ate here twice so far. If youre confused, yes this was formally known as sushi freak. Either way, the menu is the same. This venue is too small but the service is really nice. The taste of most of their dishes are delicious! Some are "eh." But thats seafood food combinations for you. I recommend their baked mussels! Just dont come with a party of 20. you wont fit.

Food here is good.  Prices aren't bad either.  However the service was really slow on my last visit.  Came here New years day for lunch AYCE sushi.  We were sat quickly however it took a bit for your server to come over and the food took a while also, he seemed a little overwhelmed.  The dining room is small and all the tables were not filled.  I ordered a bunch of items for AYCE sushi.  My salmon skin handroll, which is my go to...was covered in some weird ponzu sauce that seemed to be on alot of menu items we ordered.  It was a bit over bearing.  Towards the end of the meal it seemed like our food options were forgotten and they took even longer to come out.  I can understand not being ready for the lunch crowd on a holiday and I would definitely go back here in hopes that the service is better.
This was my first time and they had great service! Decent quality food for Las Vegas. Definitely have sushi koma!!

I've been to Koma a few times and I love the ambience of the whole store!  They have a bunch of different types of special rolls.  Definitely would recommend to a friend.  The service here was 10/10 too.  As soon as we entered we were greeted by Christina and she made sure we had a great time!
Great little sushi place with the best customer service. They are very attentive and personable. The waitress who helped us was laughing and making jokes with us. The sushi is fresh and so good.

Went here for lunch and the food was great. The yelp reviews really sold the place to me. Some of the rolls had too much sauce on them to enjoy the roll itself. Personal preference thing, I'm sure they have customers that want more sauce. The restaurant had a somewhat unpleasant odor when you enter, but I was still willing to try it. Glad I did.

I used to love this place, but as time went on their service got worse which made this place unappealing. 

This is the closest sushi place to where I live and I used to always want to come here, but the last trip I had here was awful. For such a small location and for as many servers as they had, I could not get anyones attention to initially order. We got AYCE and throughout the night we only received about 3/4 of what we ordered. There was a point where no servers were out on the floor and every table was filled, but no food had come out for 10 minutes. I assumed a mix up happened in the back, and when the food finally came out, we received the wrong rolls and had to wait for our rolls to be remade because they were given to another table and had already been eaten from. I ordered shrimp tempura about 3 times until I received it, after we ordered dessert. Lol.

I hadn't gone back since. The taste and quality is pretty good, but since my last visit I realized there are better sushi places worth trying.

I dont know why almost all the sushi places doesn't  have enough space to sit every time you go there. that's what i reduced one star for them. other than that pretty decent  sushi and small menu. dynamite thingy is the must try!! also the beef plate is pretty tasty.

Great AYCE spot for nigiri. Chefs and staff are super friendly. Only down side the small venue, and limited choices for appetizers. Other than that, extremely fresh and I recommend the tuna carpaccio and sashimi roll.

Tried Sushi Koma for the first time and it was great. My husband and I enjoyed the fresh fish especially the white tuna nigiri - we kept ordering more and more... you get the drill lol. The service was fast and staff are friendly. 

We will definitely go back again!

Brought my cousin here who was visiting from Oahu. Small place, tight seating, 4 adults and 3 keikis and we slightly huskier than avg. made the place look full. 
however the food made up for lack of space. Super friendly staff and no long waits for any of the AYCE orders.  Food was exceptional. I would go back.

Really good place. Each roll and it's own flavor. The staff was very friendly. Although our wait to get on took longer than the time we were quotes and them putting people before my party. As long as the food stays good, I'll be coming back.

THE BEST SUSHI SPOT IN VEGAS! Food is fresh! Chefs are amazing and fast! Staff is very well organized and super friendly! Love this place so much I go every week(sometimes more)! Definitely gotta try it!

Definitely the best local sushi spot in town. From the moment you come in and when you leave the staff is friendly, helpful, and give great recommendations on the menu. 
My favorite is their super white tuna nigiri.. Always such a refreshing and fresh taste!! 
Everything on the menu is awesome.. The carpaccio is fantastic too!! 
I come here often cause this is seriously the best place in town!! 
Ps I love you

One of my top AYCE sushi joints. 

Went for lunch which was about $21 and ends at 3pm. And dinner is about $26. But honestly the lunch menu is still amazing. 

This place is very small and cute. It could easily fill up if I came on a busy day but gladly I came just in time. Was seated just before 3pm so still got the lunch AYCE price. 

The menu is great and items that I thought would be Dinner only ended up being lunch as well. Like my favorite, Sashimi Roll! To die for! I can't believe you can order this during lunch. It's 1 per person though but that's understandable. Also got the seafood Tostada which I would assume with be dinner only but it's not. Delicious. 

The fish were all fresh. The white tuna nigiri just melted in my mouth. Fish/rice ratio was just right. Some specialty rolls had a lil bit more rice than I wanted but it didn't over power the fish ratio. Glad I was able to order half rolls.

The service was alright. I think the rolls were coming out a little too slow. There was a lot of time when we were just sitting there waiting for our food but other than that the staff was attentive. I would definitely come here again. Prolly stands up there with Goyemon but doesn't surpass it quite yet...

this is one of those "if i could give it zero or negative rating i would" type of reviews.. unfortunately i basically paid to get treated like shit today whilst trying to relax my mind smh.

first of all, to reassure & confirm, i asked girl at the front desk before hand if the business took "apple pay" she said yes. i sat down to eat. i was simply rushed into leaving if i wasnt ordering anything else.. & every 5-6 mins or so the chef & his side kick kept bothering me asking me if i wanted anything else to eat or if the food was good. now if they would have given me time to put it in my mouth & enjoy my time there it probably would have tasted a lot better.

**MAIN REASON I EVEN POSTED ON YELP BELOW**
when my plate was empty the chef came and took my plate & proceeded to bring me my bill. i picked it up & walked to the front desk, & said "im paying with my phone" this time instead of the front desk girl i originally spoke with, there was an older bald oriental guy who was very rude, and he said  "no we dont do that" i said "i asked the girl that was here ahead of time, so why would she say no?" he said "i dont know, but we dont do that.." i said "okay well i need to get cash back from the gast station next door & he started making phone calls and making me feel uncomfortable... he asked me to leave my purse.. MY F*CKING PURSE.. can u believe that?? instead of reassuring his self with his front desk cashier.. he assumed/implied that i was a thief.. i was so uncomfortable & embarrased.. then i said "i am NOT comfortable leaving my purse with you, & im not doing that.. why dont we at least try it and see if i can pay that way??" 
and of course, it went through and i fully paid for my order.. his frown & anger then disappeared & he said "oh i didnt know we took that" & i told him "you're welcome" & left. now i could begin to understand why he's feel a certain way about me having apple pay.. especially after eating in & being served before i paid.. but he should have went about things in a MUCH more friendly AND professional WAY. that really made that business look bad to me. it was bad enough i was having a rough day.. leaving there AFTER paying for that shitty experience was a horrible feeling when i left. & it was my first time being there.

POOR service. & the food was luke warm, even tho they said it was "freshly baked".. worst sushi restaurant ive ever been too.. the chairs didnt even match ?..

Fresh fish and great service all rolled into an AYCE experience?  Sushi Koma accomplishes this in an unpretentious and friendly manner.

The sushi rolls and nigiri were prepared and sliced well.  Not only that, it was fast too (with the restaurant packed).

My favorite dishes included the seared tuna carpaccio, the kamikaze roll, DA roll, sushi nigiri, and the uni.

Hats off to the sushi chef and also special thanks to Leona, who not only provided excellent service, but also gave a thorough, clear explanation of the menu (with her recommendations too)!

hey where can you get all you can eat sushi open till 3am every day? there sushi is decent, always good service. small fun place to visit with friends. I want this business to be successful and leave many more years! dont shit on them just because they are doubg the best they can. if you looking for highest quality fish just got to casinos and spend $200 each amd dont complain about sushi coma.

I found a new sushi place to go to. The staff is very friendly. Shout out to our server, Christina, she was quick and efficient. The chef's were quick and all the sushi made was perfect. Not like other places were you have to wait forever for your rolls to come out. We got our rolls as soon as 10 minutes, per 3-4 rolls we ordered at a time. The sushi was great. Fresh and done right. Spicy tuna was a bit hot! But that's why it's called spicy tuna. Lol. It was delicious anyways. I had the salmon skin. My ultimate favorite. 2 out of 3 rolls came out done perfectly. The other one was short of chef love. The dragon, caterpillar and kamikazi is recommended. For appetizer, I ordered Bulgogi and oh my golly gosh it was deeeelish! A must try. The restaurant was clean. We sat at these nice very comfy chairs, made for royalty. Lol. The customer service was great. Definitely will be back.

Little bit of a mixed reaction for this place. While the sushi is pretty good and AYCE, the service is meh.... it's not that the service is necessarily bad but man... that sushi is slow to come out. At times you are wondering whether the staff in the back is trying to catch the fish rather than filet it! But again, the sushi is good so if you have no problem waiting a while for your food you may have no issues. I, however started getting hangry (hungry-angry) so this place isn't for me. FOUR stars though!
My favorite sushi place! Great service and the fish is always fresh! Would recommend to bring your friends and family!

My second time trying Sushi Koma's AYCE was quite disappointing. I had a variety of nigiri and all the fish except for the tuna seemed good to me. The  place was busy but the coziness of the place didn't allow for a lot of people. Even then, I had to wait for my food longer than what I'm accustomed to. But that was alright since I wasn't absolutely starving. What made the experience so bad? When my nigiri came, the rice was awful. I would describe it as cold and with the texture of week-old rice that one has left in their fridge. Every frickin bite was just extremely annoying. No matter how friendly the service and fresh the fish, I can never stand a sushi bar with bad rice. It was probably an off night since I've eaten here before. But man, something like rice should be kept consistent in any respectable Asian restaurant.

One of my favorite sushi places! My husband (boyfriend at the time) and I would go to the car meets and sushi koma was having its grand opening. The owner offered free food, you didn't get to pick though  whatever number you had determined which dish you'd get. That was the first time I tried the Vegas roll. Super delicious. The only down side to this restaurant is the size. It's tiny and when it gets busy it gets way too crowded, and also they do not offer happy hour just ayce. My favorite rolls are the tiger roll, and mountain roll. Just enough sauce & full of great flavor. Fish is fresh too! The servers are super friendly. I usually also don't like getting sushi to go because I feel like it just doesnt taste the same (I know I'm weird) BUT sushi koma is different. We just ordered a couple rolls, egg rolls, and edamame to go & I loved it!

Fantastic sushi! My favorite AYCE sushi place in the Las Vegas/ Henderson area so far. The waitress was super attentive bringing us all kinds of stuff to try. Here's a tip order half rolls so that you have room to sample a greater variety off the menu. The nigiri sushi was splendid, fantastic fish to rice ratio. The only negative was minor- one of the nigiri pieces was served with a garlic topping which I didn't realize until it was too late. So if you aren't a fan of garlic and are ordering off the Nigiri section make sure you tell them no garlic. :) On the other hand, when I mentioned I didn't like cucumber in my rolls the waitress made sure that it was always substituted with avocado. Fantastic quality and service! (FYI: We went at around 4-6pm on a Friday night so not too busy, but it's a small eating area so during busier times it could potentially be harder to get a seat.)

I guess I didn't get the memo, but once I realized Sushi Koma was a play on Sushi "Coma", I was completely enamored at the genius of the name. Sometimes when I eat here, I still can't believe how dumb I was not to realize it. 

In any case, Sushi Koma is a solid AYCE sushi option on the Westside. Parking is plentiful, but seating is not. You are a bit cramped and close to other tables. We had a table for 8 here and had to maneuver a lot to get in and out of our seats, so for larger parties I'd recommend Oyshi instead. One thing I do appreciate about Sushi Koma over other AYCE places is they have yet to mess up my order and food does come out fairly quickly. I'm never worried if they forgot to put an order in. I just tried their hand rolls for the first time last week, and I'm definitely a fan. Their sushi I would say is a bit lesser in quality and freshness than Sushi House Goyemon, but still solid. I think they inflate the prices for non-AYCE so it's always better to just go ahead and get AYCE. I wish they had a few more interesting dessert options than ice cream and mochi, but at the end, I'm always too stuffed to eat a big dessert anyway. My husband is a fan of the Big B roll - baked sushi roll topped with beef, while my favorite baked roll is the Volcano roll.

GREAT SERVICE, EXCELLENT SUSHI ALL YOU-Can-eat,  CLEAN AND FUN!!
I eat a lot of sushi between California and Florida and this place has good quality sushi.  Better than Makino's. 
The all-you-can-eat takes it to the next level.  Small portions but great flavor and good quality fish!  Their attention to the components that make up each item on their menu is the mark of a real chef. From the crispy garlic chips that adorn the tuna tatki to the crispy, smoky taste of the nori paper, Sushi Koma beats even Morimoto in Miami.
The wait staff is extremely friendly- they take the time to small-talk with you.  They are very attentive,  you are not sitting and waiting to place your next order often inherent to all-you-can eat joints.

We just got back from Vegas to SF and we are compelled to write a review for Sushi Freak. During our stay in Vegas this weekend, we ate here TWICE! Once on Sunday night and today before our flight. Forget going to overpriced restaurants on the strip, if you have some wheels, it is so worth it to drive down Flamingo drive to Sushi Freak. This has got to be one of the best sushi places EVER! The rolls are very creative and very good! A must try is the Big B Roll--do it! because you won't regret it. 

We got the AYCE deal and what's cool is that you can even order half rolls to try out more of the selection. Fish is very fresh. Service is really good and attentive. Great interaction with staff and the owner. We will definitely be coming back next time we're in town and this is gonna be one of the places we recommend to friends going to LV.

I would've loved to have given this place more stars, but the service was terrible. Went with a group of 6, four were doing AYCE, one just a la carte teriyaki chicken and the last was simply hanging with the group because they weren't hungry so they just had a drink. Our waitress brought us other people's orders, forgot to put ours in, all of us needed refills repeatedly, empty glasses sat on the table for 15 mins or more and that's probably an understatement. She was constantly texting on her phone, paying no attention to us. It was later at night and there were maybe 12 other people besides us that had two other waitresses waiting on them. We literally waited to be able to order our second rolls as she sat in a chair texting on her phone by the front door. Eventually I guess she got sent home and the other two waitresses tag teamed our table, but by then- our experience was less than stellar. It really put a damper on what was to be an enjoyable evening with friends. I don't drink much so I kept pouring my drink into my guy's bc he had nothing but ice chips in his cup for a long time. At one point she refilled one person's drink but left the remaining five of ours empty. She even copped an attitude when she brought us the wrong order for the third time- and we informed her we didn't order it. Three of us decided "you know what, I don't care what she brings next- I'm eating it because I'm hungry!" It took over 45 mins to get our first rolls and one was "forgotten" so that person sat watching the rest of us eat. We all just started sharing with one another at that point, because everyone was hungry and it was getting much later in the night than we intended to be staying. The last two waitresses who took over for Miss Text aholic, saved the night in such that it wasn't a completely ruined evening.
