Was not impressed and will not go back, I have been to this place more than once - we have had  better service at several other places.

Amazing sushi. There is a limit on some of the more expensive items - but for the AYCE price and quality of the fish, it seems totally reasonable. I only had items from the nigiri menu and everything was fresh and delicious. My favorite was probably the mackerel and the uni, but everything was outstanding. 

The night I was there it was almost full and the dishes still came out pretty quickly -although I was seated at the bar, which helped. If you go for the nigiri, then plan on doing the AYCE as it will be cheaper than a la carte, and you'll want to try everything.

The best part about Sushi Koma all you can eat (AYCE) is that they make to order. Our first initial thought was buffet style with pre-made rolls, but we were wrong. The next best part is that everything on their menu qualifies for AYCE and you don't have to order the whole roll, but a half roll is an option. 

My favorites were the sweet shrimp nigiri with deep fried shrimp heads and the white tuna nigiri. Overall everything on their menu was good and the price was hard to beat!

Hands down BEST ALL YOU CAN EAT SPOT. The menu is fucking fantastic and the food is just as amazing. This is the ONLY spot I come to for all you can eat sushi. The staff is iffy some nights but for the most part always on top of things and keeping the food coming

We had a group of 8 people and were seated about 20 mins later on a Friday night And it was our first time. The food was pretty good but the rice to fish portion has a little too much rice. My reason for giving this place 3 stars is because I had a lot of issues with the timing of the food coming out. On multiple occasions they forgot we ordered things and times we had to remind them 3 times until it came out. It seemed our orders always came really late or they forget, or take the wrong orders. I did notice the table next to us also had a big group but had really fast service so perhaps it was just our table. I did not realize that it's 1 dessert per person so my table ordered the max and I didn't get any and the waitress was nice enough to just give one to me. Overall nice waitresses food was good, perhaps more waitresses.

Service was good, sushi was fresh but for an AYCE restaurant, Sushi Freak can't compare to House of Goyemon.  The selection at Sushi Freak is limited and they only allow one dessert per person? C'mon!

Yeah, not so much. I have to say that the service was good but the food wasn't great.

The miso soup was good except for the paint chips that we're flaking off the bowl's finish. Didn't see that until the soup was almost gone. 

The salmon in the sushi roll was somewhat mushy and there was a short hair in it.

The cucumber salad wasn't typical. Didn't like the dressing much. The taste reminded me of canned tuna.

The Super Philli roll was pretty good, though. The decorations and wall finishes were very nice.

For someone who is new to the sushi dining experience, I highly recommend this place.  The AYCE option allows you to really try out a whole variety of rolls.  If the whole table agrees to go with the AYCE option, you will get the opportunity to try a great variety of sushi.  I was expecting to really like and really dislike much of what I was going to sample.  The only problem I ran into is that I actually liked everything I sampled.  This is only a problem because I was sort of hoping I could begin to figure out which kind of sushi I like most for those times that I might find myself at a place that isn't as good as Sushi Koma.

The service was superb as well, except for a glitch with their credit card scanner.  That probably was the credit card company's fault, though, so I wouldn't hold that against the restaurant.

This place is a gem! The food and service was excellent and an amazing value for the AYCE lunch price of $21.95. I would have easily paid double for the food but the service put it over the top! Judy and the other wonderful server were on it and their suggestions on rolls and sushi were great. This is a must stop. Unfortunately I think that Sushi Koma has ruined us for any other sushi!

Another onolicious ACYE Sushi joint!  I love this place!  The staff is attentive, always making sure if needed to order anymore and our drinks were always filled!  They also offer unique AYCE items, such as their sashimi roll which is wrapped in a daikon radish filled w/ various fish (very delicate & delicious), tuna capriccio seared tuna with a garlic chips and a ponzu style sauce, and of course their ono nigiri.  Perfectly sized on a not so big mound of sushi rice!  They also have the typical AYCE desserts to clean your palate from your SUSHI eating fest, such as mochi ice cream, plum wine, red bean, and green tea!  I would definitely come back because I love supporting my locals and who doesn't love a quality product served with a smile!
Super love it here!!! Their Nigeris are awesome!!! Too bad they have too many limits and they are the best ones too. Try the Vegas roll (not in the menu) but very yummy!!! Service is great too.

Worst sushi ever. Horrible wasabi, cold eel, strange mackerel, salmon was ok, only thing good was salmon egg and server was nice. Koreans should not make sushi, if they are going to ruin it. Do you really have to serve my food in tinfoil? Music was loud and horrible and couldn't wait to get out of there. Please don't microwave the edamame 10 minutes!!!

I don't get these guys. When they were in the smaller place the food came out in a flash! but as soon as they moved to the bigger restaurant, they slowed down dramatically! It took them 50 minutes for me to get my first Sushi order which is a hand roll. That really Sucks! We were there for a good 2 1/2 hours because of the horrible wait! I feel BAD for the wait staff. They put up with a lot of Stress from a Very Slow Sushi Line and Crap from IRATE customers like me! Speed UP Sushi Boys & Girl! Wassssup????

Everytime I am around the area I must pay a visit to this little hole in the wall. Their white tuna nigiri is so tender and buttery, it just melts in your mouth. The salmon nigiri with the slice of lemon is very refreshing and the yellowtail and albacore are all very fresh and super satisfying. The owner is very friendly and they are always fast on their orders. It is definitely a good solid choice for AYCE nigiri sushi.
Sushi Koma is fire ! Everything is delicious, atmosphere is very zen like, BEN is the best server , and the food really puts you in a coma !! Try it! All you can eat is the best way to go!!!
Best place to have sushi in town! I'll recommend this spot 100 times over. Service is great and food is fresh what more do you want?

Yes! 5 stars for everything!
Service, cleanliness, the restaurant itself is beautifully done. The menu is easily navigated and they have quite the selection. From flavored Sake to Brie & grape quesadillas.

My fianc and I came here for the AYCE because they do half rolls. Although, there are things on the menu that are only one per person. We tried each of those dishes and didn't feel the need to order a second round. 

We started off with garlic tuna, salmon and Cajun albacore. The fish was very fresh, high quality. We had every intention of getting a second round but ended up filling up on as we worked our way through appetizers and rolls.

Sometimes you tell yourself you're going to skip red meat for the week because you've had bacon as an entree TWICE on the previous weekend. Well, you still need to eat, a lot, and luckily there are a boatload of AYCE joints around Vegas to fill yo' belly with fish. Gotta respek anyone who fills the belly...

Reasonz for Respek:
-Nice large pieces of nigiri
-Big orders of gyoza
-Many specialty rolls (~40 choices) and many don't contain 'spicy ____' filler
-You can get half orders of specialty rolls
-Different, but enjoyable, salad dressing
-Friendly staff
-TV's to watch sports if you're on a solo mission
-Solid tunes. I swear I heard Biggie and then Fitz and the Tantrums at some point

Disrespek:
-Some of the prices on the menu items are out of wack (only matters if you're not doing AYCE)
-Small place (maybe 10 tables). Come early!

OK, enough with the respek crap. This place was great. I was planning on eating my $21.95 worth and then bouncing, but the food was great so I stayed for an extra 4 rolls. Def worth a visit if you don't mind dropping $25 on lunch and if you want to leave super full!

This has always been a busy place which is a sign of good sushi! They offer all you can eat for lunch and dinner and i have been here a couple times in the past.
My past experience however was disappointing. My mom and i ordered 3 rolls total which took 30 minutes. A ridiculous amount of time for sushi to take. The waitress kept coming over and reassuring us that the food is about to come out meanwhile the couples on either side of us were already being served seconds and thirds. I felt that because we were not all you can eat customers we were not a priority.
This was upsetting, and when we mentioned it to the server she just kept apologizing.

I've been by a few times but never gone in, only heard good things. I tried the Washington roll the salmon wasn't great. The place is nice inside and the Servers are really friendly but there's better sushi in Vegas. They are open until 3am so if you're coming in from a late night and craving all you can eat, stop in.

This is my favorite sushi place EVER. The sushi is always fresh,  SOO yummy. Lots of options and great service.  You can also ask the sushi chefs to get creative and belive me you will be happy you did.  I am from San Diego CA, and we always make sure we come here every time we visit Vegas.  THANK YOU Chris and crew Koma for being AWESOME!
Mario hopes to buy a Sushi Koma hat next time.

My husbands says, "Sushi Koma is a gem!" He loves to come hers as does my teen. Servers are very friendly and keep things moving quickly. The location is cozy, with table and counter seating. It is always packed so have some patience. However, the wait is well worth it.

They have with a wide selection of choices, or you can make special request. They have AYCE which is freshly made at the bar. Everything you order, will be great. Enjoy!
Came here a few weeks ago on a girls night. Extremely packed. The service was good the sushi good. Nothing outstanding. Moderate mediocre. Quality fish but not much pizazz.

Sushi Koma puts sets the AYCE sushi standard bar high and puts other places to shame! Half rolls?! Genius. You leave feeling like you've tasted the whole menu and you don't hate yourself after.

Don't skimp in those amazing appetizers. This sushi place is well rounded with options and DON'T forget to order fresh wasabi if you've never had it. I'll forever dream of fresh wasabi every time I eat sushi now..

I am not usually an all you can eat sushi guy, but I came here with and on a friends recommendation.  I am absolutely thrilled with this place.

Drinks: Good beer selection, short and to the point with enough variety to accommodate just about anyone.

Appetizers were great.  Try the seaweed salad, tuna Carpaccio and tempura shrimp.

Sushi rolls, nigiri, hand rolls were all great.  Try the uni with a quail egg, and any of the spicy rolls.

Had the green tea ice cream for dessert and it was very tasty.

Customer service is awesome.  Very professional, fun and attentive.

Cleanliness: A

Dcor and ambiance was good.

Price for all you can eat was good considering the quality and variety offered for dinner.

Parking was ample.

Another fantastic experience last night with my great friends from the East Coast...   We arrived at 9:30 after Celine Dion and was treated to an amazing dinner with the best service and top notch Sushi.. Though my friends are international travelers, this experience was the highlight of their Vegas experience..  Topped it off with an amazing birthday desert too!!!  Though I don't dine there as much as often since moving to the NW Vegas..   When it comes to always being treated right, and never having to worry about the quality of the Sushi and service.. Sushi Koma is always #1 in my book!  Thank you!

We eat Sushi all over the US.  We read the Yelp reviews of Sushi Koma and decided to try it.  In all honesty, this was the best sushi we have ever had!   We sat at the sushi bar and had the all you can eat lunch.   Bryan was our sushi chef and he was phenomenal!  He was personable, creative and extremely talented at making sushi.  He went out of his way to make our first time visit extremely amazing.   Besides the terrific service from everyone who works here, I need to mention how incredibly good the sushi was!   It was the freshest, most creative, delicious sushi I have found.    Thank you for a great dining experience,  we definitely will be back. 

Our second visit to Sushi Koma was as good if not better then the first one.  I seriously love this place.  I would rather eat here then any place on the strip.   Service is amazing. We were blessed to have Bryan as our sushi chef again.   He once again spoiled us and treated us like vip's. The food is so ridiculously good. This place is such a hidden gem, this continues to be the only place I will go to sushi while I'm in Vegas.

Amazzzzzzzzzzzzzzing. Love there all you can eat. Love the mussels to the deep fried Philly roll. It's so small and cute in there the servers are amazing the owner is so sweet this place is bomb. Most likely be  back 2 more times this week. Thanks guys !'

Sushi quality is horrible. Will not eat here again. Not worth it. Go to Sushi-Mon on Sahara. Best AYCE sushi in Vegas. Plates were not being bussed and the service was slow. It's not a big restaurant either.

I picked up my food and it was cold I had prefer few different choices of rolls and shared with others. Everyone complained about food not tasting fresh and the sushi taste was off. We also order chicken and it was super cold as of it was never cooked.

My father and I came in here on a Tuesday night at 9:10pm. We were seated at 9:20pm, orders were taken and then we didn't receive our food until 10:10pm. 50 MINUTES. Three parties of 3,2, and 5 were sat down before us and they didn't receive their first order until AFTER us.
Five employees were at the sushi bar but they were not moving fast and taking their time as slow as possible. I work in the restaurant business as a cook and I know for damn sure that when it's as packed as this place was that you DO NOT have time to jump off the line and come back with a drink. 
Despicable.
They were better when they had the smaller store, it actually forced them to pump out orders to get people in and out.
The wait staff was the only good part. Shoutout to Ben, Melissa, Viviana, and Daryl. Thanks guys for doing the best you could do for us!!!

I've been to most of the AYCE sushi bars Las Vegas has to offer and Sushi Koma remains at the top of my list. The fish here is very fresh and the sushi chefs do a great job at enhancing the flavor of the fish rather than depleting it. The servers and chefs are all very kind and always leave us with an overall wonderful experience.

As a side note, the restaurant is fairly small so be wise if you plan on attending with a large group. Also on the plus side, they're open late!

Awesome sushi! Heard about Sushi Koma from a few people who drive from Henderson to get sushi here.  I live in Summerlin so was pleased that it is close to us.  Not a big place but friendly staff and  very fresh sushi and the rolls are great.  We have been to many sushi places but this is now our favorite. The tuna capaccio is fantastic.

This is by far one of the best AYCE Sushi's I've ever been to. It's becoming somewhat of a tradition now each time we visit Vegas for a tournament (We ate here just recently). Even an hour before dinner, I was able to make a reservation for a table of 13 - grant it our party came at a slower night when everyone had already left town. Their service is super friendly, very attentive, even for such a large party like ours. Everything is made to order, which I believe is so much better than buffet style. Everyone knows that made-to-order sushi tends to be higher in quality, but Sushi Koma kicks it up a notch, and they do pay close attention to taste, flavors, textures, quality of the fish, presentation and overall customer service. Or maybe I'm just a hungry fattie that wants to shut this place down for the night to inhale all the food.

They've got plenty of standard "western" rolls and then their signature rolls - all of which are great. (But I'm not a fan of tuna rolls in general.) They even have varieties to their spider rolls and volcano rolls - something I don't see often on menus. The sashimi - INCREDIBLY FRESH - Albacore, Cajun Albacore, White Tuna, Yellowtail, Uni (Santa Barbara), etc... all so buttery. I'm sad they didn't offer ankimo (monkfish liver).

If you've never tried Uni (sea urchin), I'd say go for it. People say it's the "foie gras of the sea", but I beg to differ as I consider ankimo to be the real "foie gras of the sea". Uni definitely has an acquired taste and has a very milky/bubbly flan-like texture when fresh. One of my friends in our group was being adventurous and doesn't really like seafood at all, but was willing to try raw fish, and then the uni. Being absolutely honest, I warned her that this is by far one of the most extreme flavors of seafood she will ever encounter, and after trying Uni, she'll be able to eat almost any other seafood, even raw. To my sadness, she didn't like it, but it was enjoyable to watch her reaction.

After hitting a wall, your mind tells you to eat more, but your stomach will deny you the satisfaction. So unfair. But leave a tiny bit of room for dessert as you can choose from green tea, red bean, vanilla ice cream, or their selection of mochi.

Sushi Koma definitely stands out from all the available sushi bars on the Las Vegas strip through the quality of their rolls and sushi. Yes, there's plenty of sushi bars to choose from in Vegas. And yes, this place is about 20 minutes from the strip. But if you ask me, it's absolutely worth the drive. For $25.99, it's way cheaper than the top buffets, and has better food quality IMO.

What makes it even better? Great company! The more the merrier = more dishes you can try. I'm glad this is a go-to spot for this group and I when we come to Vegas. Come hungry, eat happy, leave with a "koma".
Yummmmmm!!!! And impeccable service! Super friendly and flexible staff. Chefs are creative and delivery on it!

AYCE sushi for only $25.99 such a great deal -the price of about 2 rolls at most places.  This is not a buffet you can order anything you want from the menu and they make it order. Includes little sides like seaweed salad, edamame, and even 1 dessert per person.  
I was afraid they would take forever to bring out rolls so that you'd be too full to order anymore but they were on it bringing  us our rolls and the service was so friendly. 
Love coming to Vegas and finding awesome little off the strip spots like this.

This was my first and maybe my last visit at this sushi joint. My boyfriend and I were a bit disappointed with the quality and variety of sushi, appetizers and desserts that they offered. For dinner, they charged $25.95 for AYCE...a bit pricey compared to the other sushi joints that offered a better menu selection for their AYCE and charged the same amount.

I can say the 3 stars came from the great service that they provided and probably the Sashimi Roll (salmon and tuna wrapped in thinly sliced daikon). 

Overall... This is just another ordinary sushi joint.

This place is to die for! Small cozy environment and high quality fish - best one you can find in Vegas for the price! Get the all you can eat so you can try all of their speciality items (you won't regret it!)

Yummy! I love Sushi Freak. I had been craving sushi for a couple days and decided to go check this place out. Me and my boyfriend loved the complimentary edamame :o) we shared the miso soup which was delicious! And we had a garden salad with sesame dressing ... Yummy! We shared three rolls, I couldn't tell you the names now! But they were all good. Yum yum sauce is delicious!! We had one roll that was deep fried. I had never seen that before but it was good. There were 2 waitresses taking care of us and they were both very attentive and accurate and cute! Everything was perfect for a good date night with my baby!

A.Y.C.E. SUSHI TILL YOU HAVE A KOMA.
.
**2018 Yelp 100 Challenge #5**
.
Cute little place near where i live. Its much closer to me than Goyeomon so we thought we would try it out since a friend wanted to go. The interior is simple & small w/ nice high ceilings & you are definitly not sooo close to each other that you could hear the next table gossip. 
.
The first time we ate here we LOVED it... the rice was PERFECT & the fish had that fresh texture that i love.
The second time we ate here we were OK w/ it..... the rice was MUSHY but the fish was still that fresh texture that i love.
The THIRD time we came to eat here it was because my friend said he would buy us dinner since we haven't been eating out for 5 months so we decided why not go to AYCE sushi..... it was sooo DISAPPOINTING.... the fish was fishy and mushy... the rice was like eating mushy oatmeal... the tempura was DISGUSTINGLY cold & old & took FOREVER to come out.
.
Service was GREAT the first two visits & our server was MELISSA.... the third time.... OMG ... my miso never came out until i asked 3x... my shrimp tempura never came out.... i asked for no carrots in my salads but all 3 of them had carrots.... 
.
Maybe i will try ONE more time next year...

Everyone raves about this place so I decided to try it out. Sushi made me sad, the rolls didn't excite me and the price point was average. Service was super good!!! Why I gave two instead of one star. Maybe I just went on the wrong night

Probably the best sushi place I've had in Las Vegas . The service was amazing . The fish was fresh . And the scenery was fun and friendly . I wish they had a Johnny roll . (No rice roll) but loveeee over all .

Freshest AYCE sushi I've ever had . :) 

I found this place cause of yelp and by the pictures comments and ratings I expected a better location and it to be prettier . It looks okay at first but I think all the good reviews is because of the food . And OMG can they make sushi. We sat at the bar it wasn't too busy. I think they have a secret menu because the Vegas freak isn't on the menu they have out but it's included in AYCE . 

Our waitress Leona was really sweet and extremely helpful with Anywho , she was very welcoming and helpful , I'm definitely coming back :)

Chill atmosphere and fast service. Fresh fish and great selection of alcohol.
10/10 would come again

I really like this place. The service is good and the fish is fresh. They have a good selection of special rolls as well as nigiri, appetizers, salads and desserts. I can't even remember what we ordered but most of them were really good. All I do know is that they had fresh yellowtail which is the reason we crave sushi once of twice a month. 

It's good to remember that they do half rolls so you can try several different rolls to find your favorites for the next time.

Went there last night with my roommate. Intentions where to have some sushi and grab a couple of drinks, little did I know...

All of the sudden we are doing all you can eat sushi!! Brian and the boys behind the sushi bar kept it coming in a timely fashion as well with some fantastic banter.

Our server Jessika was on point as well.  We never had to ask for anything and she was very friendly as well.

Kudos to Chris though. I hadn't been to the establishment in around a year (my apologies). He  recognized me and came and said hello! Furthermore he refunded me money from my last stay, saying I was overcharged last time was there. 

Wowzers! I tip my hat to Chris and the entire Koma crew.  Honesty and great service will keep me coming back!!

I was invited to lunch at Sushi Koma. Over the years I have tried several all you can eat Sushi restaurants in Las Vegas. 
Service  at Sushi Koma was outstanding. Our server was friendly. Service was prompt and she kept an eye on us, making such that refills were provided and ensuring that additional orders were filled. 

We had a variety of seafood and each was fresh and beautifully presented. For a non seafood 
entree, I recommend the Chicken Cutlet Special which includes miso soup, salad and rice. The breaded fried chicken was all white meat and was very juicy and tasty.
After eating at Sushi Koma, I now have a new best favorite.

I keep finding old food on the dishes I use, the sushi is good, my favorite is the angry edamame super garlicky and spicy enough to clear my nose but not spicy enough to take away flavor. Owner should sell the sauce for this on the side it's really good... their green tea needs to be brewed longer or next time I'll just order water. I like their fish paradise, love the garlic ponzu sauce. Hopefully, they will get better at washing dishes, otherwise customer service is good from waitresses, (sushi chefs need to be friendlier) owner is about and available and the sushi is good for the price. Sushi til you koma!

I think this is by far one of the best ayce sushi spots in town. Like seriously, the size of the nigiri and rolls were perfect-no awkward mouth stuffing and everything tastes amazingly good! I feel like the fish is very fresh because when I eat salmon or yellowtail at other places I sometimes get this icky after taste but nope, not at Koma. I usually don't order rolls when I do ayce, but this place really has some awesome rolls, like the fish paradise. The only reason I'm giving them 4 stars is because they don't have oysters or a huge selection of appetizers/desserts, but that's okay bc I'll still be back when I was some bomb sushi. Also this is a pretty small place so be wary of wait times.

Ate here on a recent trip to Vegas, great off-strip spot for AYCE sushi! The sushi was well made and a decent price for the AYCE. The only reason that they don't get a 5 star rating is that the service was slightly sub-par. There was only 1 waitress while we were there and the place was packed. We had to wait a bit too long for our orders or even to place another order, but for the price and quality, it was still worth the trek off of the strip.
Server Andrew is supercool plus he has the OG checkered vans. By default this place deserves a high rating for the unparalleled taste in the sushi game.

So I've been to this place a handful of times. Needless to say I will NEVER be going back again. There were only 4 of us to start off. Right when we got there I ordered 4 rolls immediately. 1 full roll and all the others a half roll. My friends put in orders as well. After about 20 minutes all of my friends had received there orders except for me. I finally got my baked roll and politely asked what was going on. Well they switched servers for some reason but the first girl completely failed to tell the next girl what we had ordered. Speeding up to an hour later and I still had not received my HALF rolls when everyone else's orders were pretty much complete except one other person. FINALLY  I got another full roll...that was supposed to be half. I asked the girl what was going on yet again telling her I had ordered 3 half rolls. By this time I had told her 3 times what my beginning order was.  Then when I finally got my other 2 half rolls she rudely asked if we were done ordering and I preceded to tell her I was still waiting for my 3rd. It was never put in. We got the bill 30 minutes into our bill so we just paid and left. Let me tell you I am always one to tip but I definitely did not here. Oh and I did not even mention that the huge group behind us got ALL of their food and we sat before them. WORST SERVICE IN THE ENTIRE WORLD. I DO NOT SUPPORT THIS LOCAL BUSINESS ANY LONGER.

This is my go-to sushi place. Since they are open late I try to go during a later hour when it won't be too busy. It is a small place so it could quickly go on a wait. I always do the AYCE (all you can eat) and it is always worth it. 

This place has one of the best appetizers selections for an AYCE place. I am very picky about my seaweed salad, but it is always delicious. The baked green mussels aren't my favorite since I prefer a little more dressing on it but they are still delicious. I was hesitant to try the seafood tostada but I am so glad I did. It is definitely one of my favorite appetizers here along with the tuna carpaccio. The nigiri selection is always good, sometimes better. White tuna and scallops are my favorite. I don't tend to do a lot of sushi rolls but the tiger roll and the ninja roll are the ones I usually get and both are great. 

I am really picky about customer service and tend to criticize other servers unfairly. There have been several times where I have to get the attention of a server because part of my order is forgotten. They are usually good with refills. They usually take an unusually long time dropping the check and processing the payment. 

There is always room for improvement but I obviously like this place enough to give it four stars and attend it frequently.

I came here with a pretty large party (9 people). This place is REALLY small and I wouldn't recommend large parties coming here, but we came here relatively late, so they were able to manage a table for us in a reasonable amount of time. They were very accommodating, and their service was great throughout our dinner, and so for that I gave major props.

They have a pretty wide selection for the AYCE, which I think came out to about ~$26 a person. We got mostly nigiri, and got almost one of everything. What I especially liked is that their proportions of rice to fish. There's much more fish and very little rice, BUT we started noticing that as we ordered more, they start packing on the rice a little more. Not horribly more, but it was significant enough for us to know that they wanted to fill us up haha. But even then, the quality of the fish was pretty good, especially for AYCE. Everything looked and tasted fresh. Even the Uni, which I'm usually a little iffy trying at an AYCE place, because typically AYCE sushi joints have old or not good quality Uni, but the uni here was pretty good. Not the best at it, but good enough to get that buttery taste that you crave from a GOOD piece of uni. The rolls are good also, but they're just like any other rolls.

They have a couple signature dishes. One of them was this watermelon roll, which is a small plate of little sushi rolls, but instead of having the rice and seaweed look, it was wrapped in thin slices of cucumbers with an assortment of some fish inside. It gave it a really crisp and light texture, which was very refreshing. I'd definitely recommend that. They have a couple other signature dishes (I can't remember what they were). I do remember that they were pretty good, but didn't stand out as much as this watermelon roll.

I'd come back, preferably with a smaller group so that I don't have to wait as long, or come late cause they're open until 3AM! And they have some good happy hour deals with some good hot sake!

I've been going to Sushi Koma since 2015 and it's only my favorite sushi go to place. I love how fresh the fish is and I could eat it for hours then only thing is I do miss their old servers from the smaller restaurant. The servers now are kind of slow and I had a few lost orders but its pretty minimal and it's not going to stop me from going.

My fiance and I were looking for a new sushi lunch spot.  I went to Yelp to look for something in between the two of us and decided to try Sushi Koma.  We are so glad we did.  The staff is awesome, the food was fabulous and affordable with the all you can eat.  My bf didn't want me to share a review raving about this place because he wants it all for ourselves.  Enjoy.....

I've eaten a several All You Can Eat sushi places. This one is at the bottom of the list. The sushi was on the low end quality side. The cooked items weren't anything to rave about either. The brie and grape quesadilla was strange to see on the menu. I tried it and it was LAME. 

PROS: Cool inside interior
            Super cool employees

CONS: Quality

Went here after a concert at like what 12 or 12:30 at night?  My friends were like it stays open to 3am!!  That's definite points in my book.  Its a small place but man that food is freaking amazing!!  Stayed nearly til closing, everyone is super friendly in there too!!  DEFINTELY coming back

I have been to Sushi Koma many many times over the last several years, since it was Brian's Beach and Sushi Freak, but I only recently joined Yelp. So one of the first things I have to do is tell everyone how great this place is. On the other hand, if too many people find out about Sushi Koma, it might get too crowded, and I will have a hard time getting a table...

We love sushi in our house, but my biggest complaint at every other restaurant is always how long I have to wait. Seriously, anywhere else you will have to wait for either a round of sushi, a greeting, or the check for so long that you could take a 15 minute nap or longer. But somehow Sushi Koma is the only restaurant on the planet that has figured out how to make your custom order super fast. Everyone works together to take your order(s), bring your drinks, food, check & change, all while keeping your table maintained & as clutter-free as possible.

Sushi Koma offers an AYCE (all-you-can-eat) option, and at $26 per person for dinner, you can't go wrong. The sushi quality is outstanding and on par with other establishments that don't offer AYCE and have bills that might be three times higher. (I guess the last sentence makes it obvious that I can pack away a lot of sushi!)

If you want a sushi kind of appetizer, get the sashimi roll and/or tuna carpaccio. If you want something non-sushi, I recommend the gyoza and ask for it pan-fried. All of these & more are included in the AYCE menu, plus deserts. (I like their green tea flavored mochi ice cream for desert. It is small - good when you are already stuffed - and is a really nice way to end the meal.)

The biggest negative is that it is such a tiny little place, so it gets crowded fast. When we go, we try to get there early to avoid the wait - 5:30 seems to work pretty well. But with fast & friendly service, terrific food & AYCE prices, it is worth the wait if you have to!

Finding it: Sushi Koma is located in the shopping center at the southwest corner of Flamingo & Durango. Enter the parking lot is on the Flamingo side.

Definitely yummy sushi and appetizers. We are huge Yama fans but we will definitely be back here! 

Try the seared tuna carpaccio, sashimi roll, seafood tostada, and anything with the wasabi yuzu sauce!
Great food. All you can eat for $26.00. Cool little spot. Staff is very attentive. Definitely coming back here to try more stuff on the menu.

Awesome sushi and my new go-to spot to get my sushi fix. My girlfriend and I used to go to sushi mon, but after trying this place out and experiencing the freshness of the fish combined with the amazing service... I completely forgot about sushi mon. The owner is super nice and everybody in there has a smile and encourages you to try different things. Not only that, they make sure they cater to exactly what you want. If you mention you don't like green onions on top of your sushi, then that'll be the last time you ever see it on top.... No need to remind them like at several sushi places I've been to. They really care about their customers here and that's a big deal for me. On a side note, the owner had said that they might change the name to something other than sushi freak soon... Also it's a bit small in there but I can care less bc their sushi and service is A+++++++ haha.

Open until 3AM and good sushi don't always go together.

This place pulls it off. Nice small intimate location, not good for large parties but that's ok.  

Will definitely fo AYCE next trip since you'll pay the same amount for a couple rolls and a drink.  If you love sushi you should bookmark this place right now and get to it asap.

My friend and brother love this place so they told me to eat here. It's got a cute little hipster vibe to it which is different. They have an all you can eat menu that's $21 for lunch and $25 for dinner.

 I tried the Tuna Carpaccio, pot stickers and the dynamite and  those were delicious!
Our rolls came out and everything was fresh and served in generous amounts which was amazing. 
I started eating my rolls and I don't know if I was having an off day or I didn't like the type of crab that they used.  I couldn't figure it out but It was hard for me to get down which was disappointing. I think maybe the crab was either too salty or too bland. Idk.,I really couldn't figure it out so I need to give this place another try sometime to give a better review.
Always super good! We've been regulars since we moved to this side of town! Great vibe and awesome atmosphere. Hubby recommends the Big B, I recommend the Arizona! Soooooo good! Thank you Koma!
This is a great sushi place. Christina is a great hostess. There's different types of sushi and all of them are delicious. I would recommend this for people who like to hang out with friends.

Loved everything we ordered. The nigiri was delicious, salmon is not usually my favorite, but it was today. Nice piece of fish and only a little rice. Will definitely be back!  Sushi Koma is a clever name, I definitely had one after my lunch.
Best sushi in town.  The tiger roll is amazing.  The service is fast and the girls are gorgeous.  The place is small so seating is limited.

Great sushi cuts by the chef. The servers were attentive. The energy of the restaurant is very fun and the restaurant is very tightly put together. If you eat here a good spicy roll is the fish paradise roll. It is a spicy tuna,shrimp and avacado roll topped with cajun albacore, green onions and garlic ponzu sauce.

Totally worth the $26/pp AYCE price. They have Uni and Amaebi. Fried Oysters, 5 varieties of soft shell crab roll, great Sake selection and they are open till 3am. It's away from the Strip and Chinatown so extra star points for being a local joint. I've done a lot of AYCE sushi places in Vegas and this is as good as any. I really like the local vibe. Staff is so friendly and they have headsets so communication with the kitchen is efficient.
This place is so cute and quaint with a great selection... Perfect for a date... It's a Small business and has great service... Love it..!

I used to like this place when they we're smaller.  Food was great and fast.  We got to eat in few minutes and the service was excellent.  When they moved to the new place, although it's much bigger and nicer ambiance, it became chaotic.   It took a while for us to get our food.  Servers don't even return to your table and so quick to leave after they gave the food.  They are always in a hurry and walking around ignoring us. They won't even glance to our table when we need something even though they were a bunch of them there.   I think there are more people by the reception desk, standing and talking, than servers.  Food became subpar also. We were disappointed.   Won't be going back here anymore.  We will go back to Yama Sushi.
Love this place!! Come here all the time, the food is excellent and the employees and awesome!

Great service, great food. This is my favourite sushi AYCE restaurant in Vegas. 

I've even got my dad and all my friends loving this place as well.

Love love to be in a koma.. the sushi koma kind.. great service and was seated faster than the waiting time. They accommodated us with a big party. With such a small place they took our group of 8 and got us down. They even served out food fast. Unless they wanted us out cause we can eat. 

One thing I like about Koma is the uni. The uni can come with quail egg. OMFG love love that. It is two per person for the AYCE special. The food was all delish even when I asked for NO crabmeat in my spider hand roll. YES they have a spider "hand roll" that is also another plus for me when they have hand rolls that I love. 

Our table was always full and always cleaned quick by the awesome staff. They have such good service and friendly workers. The food is great and they have cool types of rolls. 

Parking is in a lot shared by other stores. Wifi wasn't working. 

If they didn't put you in a Koma they didn't do their job!!!!

To be blunt: as far as my knowledge of sushi goes, I know about as much as Jon Snow. I have had it on several occasions but can never remember what I ordered or differentiate between items. Lucky for me, Chad 'The Sushi Guru' S. accompanied me on my first visit to Sushi Koma.

SK is nestled in a shopping plaza right next to Cafe Darak and some hookah joint. After entering we were immediately greeted by several of the sushi chefs and waitresses. It was this very moment when I realized how small the restaurant was. We took two seats at the sushi bar and had our drink order taken and brought to us promptly along with a side of wasabi and ginger.

Chad recommended we both go for the All You Can Eat special and that's just what we did. It was hard to keep track of all the different things he was ordering, so I gave the menu a quick glance over and went for some items that had ingredients I could recognize such as beef, teriyaki, or spicy tuna.

All in all, together we ordered the Tuna Tostada appetizer, spicy tuna sushi, teriyaki beef roll, 3-10 Roll, D-A Roll, sashimi roll, dynamite appetizer, the deep fried oyster, and green tea mochi. There may have been one or two other items I neglected to note that Chad ordered, but you'll have to excuse my memory as it was foggied by the sushi koma I experienced after dinner.

The highlights for me were the D-A Roll and the 3-10 roll. I've learned that any kind of baked sushi topped with yum yum or eel sauce is right up my alley. I was also pleased to note that they do not skimp on the proteins in terms of the content of each piece of sushi. I have been to places where the sushi mostly just consists of rice and a little smidgen of crab, shrimp, or what have you.

For $26 Sushi Koma is as good a place as any to gloriously stuff your face with premium sushi.

Start with the Tuna Carpaccio, then induldge in a Big B. From there take your pick of whatever you'd like. The AYCE is the way to go but remember, there's people out there starving so eat what you order! Service is always great and despite being a fairly small place I've never had to wait. Do not take the name lightly - I have left in a Sushi Koma numerous times. Kudos to the team here.

My girlfriend and I were craving sushi and happened to be around this place.  Right after entering we noticed it was small and cramp. Very loud and could barely hear the hostess. After a 20 minute wait they finally seat us.  We had other customers at tables on both sides of us, my knees were able to touch theirs. Now I am only 5'8 so it's not like my legs are super long.  I had to sit with my chest against the table because we were positioned to close to the table behind us. Before we were done being seated we asked for two waters since we had already been waiting.  After 15minutes our server came back with our waters and started to take our order. 

We were starting to have a bad vibe about this place so we decided we will take it easy at first with the ordering. My girlfriend started with 2 orders of sea urchin and myself got 1 crunchy rolls.  After 20 more minutes they finally brought out 4 crunchy rolls and no sea urchin.  We tried to tell the server the mistake but they turned their back on us and went into the kitchen.  Right there we should of got up and left, but we were hungry and tired of waiting.  We start digging into the crunchy rolls(which my girlfriend is not too fond of) and only after 2 reminders did they bring out her Sea Urchin(and only brought out 1!!!) along with an order of Tuna Nigiri she told the server.  The tuna reaked. No other way to put it.  She was able to drag her chopsticks lightly against it and have the fish fall apart. Absolutely disgusting.  

We decided to get up and pay.  It took them 10 minutes to help us at the cash register. They even tried to charge us the full price for 2 AYCE.  After a bit of arguing, and even telling the cashier I would happily pay the bill if she takes a bite of the tuna we received, they finally lowered the bill to around 30$. We left with and had no appetite to eat anything else. 

Now yes, we understand the wait times, and we can even forget about the cramped space. However, for people saying this is the best sushi spot in Vegas, I can only question if you were even at the same restaurant that we were.  The servers and hostess's were very friendly, and seemed like they were trying their best. They are the reason I gave it two instead of one star. Fish was so bad I actually had to finally post my first review.

The 4th visit to this location and we were extremely disappointed with the service. Everything took extremely long to get to the table and if you've been to this place you know it's not a big place... the food was good but the service, being as slow as it was, made the experience not a very good one. 

I do believe that the servers need more training on how to multi-task and they also need to learn to be more efficient. I would think that being a multi-tasker would be a 'must' for this type of job position.

This place never fails to go all the way. Before we use to come here and sit at the tables BUT now we (my girlfriend and I) enjoy sitting at the sushi bar so much we actually prefer it!  The sushi chefs are always paying attention. We frequent this place so often, they just start making our favorites as soon as we sit down!  Fish to rice ratio is definitely the best by far for an AYCE sushi joint, it's almost like ur cheating. The quality is more of an a la carte joint and the staff is unbelievably nice, especially Aileen!!  She's always on point and so observant. Our favorite AYCE sushi hands down!  They're open late for u night owls too. 10 STARS!!!!!

Came here solely because I read a review from one of my previous customers. (Hi, Heather H! =o] )

The day my bf and I stopped in, the AC was in repairs. The owner/manager (not sure) made it a point to come by and ask us how we were doing, and informed us that they were getting their AC fixed as soon as possible. He was also offering more than the one dessert per person because of the heat. I liked that he was concerned about the well-being and comfort of his patrons. 

Anyway, I have to say that this place delivers. Their hamachi was pretty fresh, and their appetizers and selection had a lot of variety. I liked the tuna carpaccio, and a few other things that I can't remember the names of. (oops!) 

This place gets a 4 from me.

Came here for the first time and was greeted by a horrible hostess/server very rude. Then me and my girlfriend decided to do the all you can eat we waited an hour no joke an hour for any food to come out. Some of the rolls we ordered were as simple as a spicy tuna roll. Finally we decided to flag someone down and ask about our order because our waitress was no were to be found. They said our rolls should be right out they were working on them. An hour for any food to come out is ridiculous considering the place was not busy at all maybe four or five other tables.  After receiving our sushi rolls I was not impressed with the quality of the food at all. The rolls were mostly rice and the rice was undercooked and fell apart. Will never go back to this place.

Went here for the second time last night, my boyfriend and I were ready for some AYCE. 
The Angry Edamame was SOO great! It was a thick delicious spicy sauce. My boyfriend and I ended up wanting to lick the bowl after we were done. 
THe Nigiri is worth coming here alone, the fish are thick cuts and small amount of rice. ( as it should be! ) I had two orders of Octopus and Smelt Roe, it was DELICIOUS! 

The Elephant roll had the best sauce EVER. The spicy koma sauce is perfect. The Jane roll is great too. Wasn't a fan of the twist octopus roll due to the lemon in it but that was my fault for not reading the menu correctly.
The service was FAST and top notch. 
We had 3 different waiters making sure we always had food and water refills. 

This and JJANGA are now my two favorite sushi spots in town. 

The only thing I wish they could change is how cramped it is in there. Feels like you're eating on top of other people. Hopefully they can buy a bigger building someday..

After working, my coworkers and I went to this place. We had AYCE and were pleased with every plates!
Their sushi was fresh and they served longer fish than most of other AYCE restaurant I think. Service and taste were great!

Sushi Koma
Overall 5 Stars

Gold medal- UNI x 2
Silver medal - AYCE Scallops
Bronze medal - Mochi ice cream

Everytime I come here the sushi is super fresh!  This place has the BEST service that is why I had no problem giving them 5 stars.  All the waitresses are so helpful and nice.  They check on you quite often to make sure you have enough food on the table and food ordered to be on the way to the table.  

The uni here is really fresh and melt in your mouth.  Only bummer is that there is a 2 uni limit per person :(  

The scallops here are large and sweet.  AUCE!!  No limit!

They offer a mochi ice cream ball for dessert.  My favorites are the strawberry and the green tea.

Sushi Koma is always fresh, but they do not offer sashimi.  Hikari is another AYCE sushi restaurant in Las Vegas and they have AYCE sashimi, but the sushi there is not as fresh as Sushi Koma.  Can't win them all right.  You either eat the rice and get full faster or you eat fish that isn't as fresh, but still good.  Which do you prefer?

HAPPY KOMAING!!

I used to come here a few years ago when it was Brian's Beach. When I heard it closed down, I was sad and found myself lost and confused... Then we saw that this joint opened and took over. I was very skeptical at first to try this place, but I am glad I did! :) if you liked Brian's beach, I believe they kept the same menu.

My bf and I are now frequent visitors of this place. They have stamp cards, which entices us to come back because once you get 10 stamps, you will win a grand prize of eating one free ayce meal! We tried pretty much everything on the menu and haven't been disapointed. Also, if you don't want to order a whole roll and want to attempt to try everything on the menu, ask them to do half rolls. Half rolls are 4 pieces, so you don't fill up so quickly on just one roll of 8 pieces,

The service is impeccable and the waitresses are incredibly friendly. They are always on it, from refilling your drinks, to making sure you get everything you order. The place is small, so if it gets crowded, be expected to wait.  I feel as if the service is great, the food taste that much better. Haha.

I've been going here for about what, 1 1/2 years now.  Finally decided to do a review.  In my opinion, it's one of the best AYCE Sushi in Las Vegas!  The fish is definitely on the fresher side.  As a person who tends to order a lot of nigiri vs rolls, the quality of the cuts of fish has consistently stayed at a high quality.

Favorite Nigiri
Tuna
White Tuna
Red Snapper
Mackerel

Favorite Rolls
Big B roll
DA Roll
Pania Roll
Spider Roll
SSS Roll

Favorite Apps
Shrimp Tempura
Teriyaki Beef
Seared Tuna Carpaccio
Seafood Tostada

Service is top notch from both the Servers and the Sushi Chefs.  They are attentive and always check on you.  If I had to nit pick on anything, the fried calamari isn't season, so you would definitely have to dip it in the sauce provided with it, or with some soy sauce.  Occasionally, there would be either a mix up of orders, or they forgot something.  It doesn't bother me.   All you have to do is tell them, and they will get you what you want right away.  The restaurant is small, but the ambiance is great.  Just gotta be aware if you are bringing a bigger group.  Also advise that you order the bake rolls at the beginning since they take time.

Overall I highly recommend Sushi Koma!!!
Sushi Koma put me in a food coma. A glorious, spectacular food coma. Super satisfied with their food, service and prices. I highly recommend you go comatose if you check them out!
The sushi is amazing!!!! The service is so awesome!!!! Such a great price. The atmosphere is great. I highly recommend this sushi place!!!!

Got to the place put our names down for waiting list there was one group in front of us and some random couple comes and gets our seats so we end up waiting longer.... Then we are finally seated and order is placed fairly quick but after about half an hour only thing that ever came out was 2 appetizers... I'm leaving 2 stars because of corresponding issues and they let us leave with no hassle.

I'm torn between 3 star and 4 star. Today I'm going to go with the higher. The service was phenomenal. No doubt about that. I like that a lot. The food was good too. My friend really seemed to enjoy his choices. He got the AYCE lunch special. Me, I got the Brie and grape quesadilla. Ok I know that's craaaaaaazy. Quesadilla at a sushi place??? It had sooooooo much potential. But it feel short. One, not enough Brie. It is called Brie and grape. Two, size was TINY. I mean minuscule. When she served it I thought "where the hell is the rest of it???!!!".  So, tiiiiiinnnnyyyyy portion almost no Brie and they charge $8.50. That reallllllly put me off. However, the salad with celery dressing was yuuuuummmmmmm. The free edamame starter, which is served warm, was nice. My shrimp tempura roll was real good. And the mochi ice cream was yummy. Ive never had it before and I liked it a lot.  My friend seemed to love everything he ordered. The volcano roll looked fantastic. The place is quite small but quaint. I liked it actually. Cute place and I'll be back for sure.

Yes! An amazing all you can eat sushi place for locals!

If you were planning on going on Friday night, get there early because this place gets packed! My husband and I got there around 4 PM for dinner by the time we were done at 5:30, every table was taken.

That is the sign of a really good spot.

The starters like the sashimi, are pretty small in the all you can eat menu but totally worth it. The rolls are creative and delicious. And it's all you can eat so who cares if the plates are small you can just get more.

I also ordered the sake sampler. The strawberry sake tasted just like a smoothie. Next time I go back I would not get the sampler, I will just order the full-size glass of the strawberry sake.

It was our first time in sushi koma, and let me tell you why we are not impressed with the place at all. We went there because of the good reviews on Yelp, we thought   that  the place would meet our expectation. First of all it is a little overpriced. Second: When I ordered a Scalop hand roll from the menu, nowhere in the menu it said Scalop with imitation crab, so iinstead of having Scal op roll it was mostly imitation crab. The service was just ok, fish did not seem to be very fresh and rolls had a lot of rice in it. I would definatley not go back there again.

AYCE sushi place is almost the same everywhere here in vegas...but this place has excellent customer service and I think the fish is a bit fresher here than most AYCE sushi places...the owner is super friendly and greets guest and makes them feel very comfortable like we are friends...love this place

The sushi and rolls were good, but a step below my favorite spots around town. All you can eat during dinner hours is $25.95 and that includes everything on the menu.

Of the nigiri we tried the tuna and fresh water eel were the standouts. The yellowtail and halibut were decent as well. The cuts of fish were ample sized and more than covered the rice underneath.

The rolls we tried were well formed and used a minimal amount of rice -- about two grains thick. The Stephanie roll had chopped albacore, shrimp wrapped with sliced avocado and garlic ponzu sauce. The Jane roll was a yellowtail roll wrapped with spic tuna on top. 

Other items that made their way to my plate and into my stomach are the seafood tostada and vegetable tempura. The tostada consisted of a variety of diced up fish, garlic chips, green onions and sesame seeds on a thin square that had a fried wonton texture to it. It was a good mix of flavors and textures, but a little messy to eat.  The veggie tempura was pretty standard and the batter was rather unimpressive and bland.

The service was both fast and efficient when it came to ordering and receiving our food.

Best sushi and service in town. Their menu is a little different from other places. They have way more creative dishes for a little sushi place. I also like that it's kind of just a nice little hole in the wall sushi place that will surprise you. Yes, way better than Goyemon.

First off I want to say it's my sons birthday 5/11. We go and get seated then ordered our food. It took more than 30 mins to even get out appetizers and we were watching all the other guest get the food before us and finished it. They kept telling us it is coming yet nothing after awhile we decided to leave. What a way to start off a messed up day because the lack of service and watching everyone else get served finishing there food and all we got was one order of shrimp tempura and calamari which I paid for when we left. Never coming back.

The all you can eat here is okay. Nothing over the top. The service here is always a hit or miss. Over the 4 times I've been here, I'm always struggling to get a waiter to take our order. I come here because it's really convenient for me being close to my house... but will most likely go an extra mile somewhere else for better service. If you just want AYCE sushi and don't mind waiting 10 minutes to order, then this is the place for you.

I go to a lot of sushi places in las vegas, and this is the one i constantly go back to.  The service is fantastic all of the servers and chefs are amazing.  Always very sincere and kind, and they are always going out of there way to make you visit fantastic.

There are alot of ayce sushi, each with special dishes and quality of fish.  I must say, Sushi Koma has some of the best and creative rolls, as well as some of the freshest fish in this area.  I like how there the sushi is always consistent as flavorful.  I have not had any bad pieces from my numerous visits.  

The place is small, and most of the time it is always packed.  I love that it is open late into the night which is best for my friends and coworkers to grab a bite to eat after a long day of work.

Every time I have friends come visit, this is the place to go.  Great food, good prices, fantastic service and awesome environment.

This is that review where you run out of stars to give because it's mind blowing and words/stars can't emphasize enough how BOMB this is!! 

Beginning with the fact that for under $30 you can eat all your want (appetizers, rolls, salads, soups & desserts). Lunch or Dinner. Yes-you heard right! Everything you can fit in that belly of yours! 

Second- they do half rolls! Before you get too crazy ordering a ton load of rolls and run out of room to try almost all, take note that you can order a half roll of all your favorites. !!!WINNING!

Third-everything is amazing! My two faves would have to be the Volcano and Tiger roll. Holy Bejesus! Shrimp Tempura and Cucumber Salad is off the chain!!! 

Conclusion: it's bomb.com! Best in town, hands down.

AYCE !

Great selection. Great, fresh tasting. 

Service always came by and made sure we had what we need. 

There is a limit to certain delectable items. 

*Rather small establishment. Expect a wait, if you're not there before everyone else. 
*There is are two TV's that are viewable from all seats in the restaurant. 

I would AYCE here again!
+ they take RESERVATIONS !

Visited the place because of good reviews on Yelp, however, the freshness of the fish wasn't up to par in my experience.  It's just ok.  I probably won't go back anytime soon.  What's with all the misleading 5 star reviews?!  meh!

Great Sushi!! Open late!! Great staff! Has a very New York feel. All you can eat for just $25.

Overall Great service and will be dining here again!

This is my go-to sushi spot....

It's directly across the street from my house and it's open HELLA late! 

If your looking for the freshest fish, great service, awesome music and a nice atmosphere....COME HERE!! 

The tuna carpaccio is worth the trip...

AYCE - thats all we DOO DoDoDooooo;)!!!!
Sushi rolls insider mix is pretty different from many other places would serve. Fresh, juicy meals and good looking place, little bit small but modern and clean;)!!!! Waitress was very personal) Like it! Will come back)!
Super good! Staff is very personable. Sushi is very delicious. Came here because of the reviews, I was not disappointed! Very happy! Thanks everyone.

Ate here a few nights ago and all I can say is: Michele is the best server ever! She was extremely friendly, thoroughly explained the menu, and answered all of our questions to the fullest extent (it was our first time visiting). She checked on us frequently to see if she could make our experience there any better, which I really liked! The food was fantastic, the drinks were cold, and the service we received from Michele was beyond our expectations. We will definitely be back to our new favorite sushi restaurant!

I came here last night the food wasn't bad at all, it was the service that sucked we sat at the sushi bar thinking we can order from the chef but he told us to order from the server it seems like all the help was trying to avoid you as much as possible it took forever to get notice or flag someone down to help I order a soup I never saw lol it wasn't even busy not sure if I would come again because service sucks.

This poor rating for Sushi Koma is really a poor rating to all of you Yelpers out there. 

To be fair, maybe it should just be for the 20 or so people dining at Sushi Koma this afternoon, when my friend and I were there. 

Never mind the fact that I bragged about Sushi Koma to my friend, and won the battle of whose sushi place we would visit today.  Never mind the fact that I ate at Sushi Koma last week and it was good. And never mind the fact that every other AYCE place in town is going down hill too.

AYCE sushi in Vegas is going down the toilet. 

Let me explain:

The rice was crap. That's all, enough said. 

Two things I am most disappointed about: the fact that no one else had a problem with the rice, and they tried to charge me for two AYCE, even though we stopped after the first order came out. In the end, they finally comp'd one of the two meals, but if you added up the a la cart price for the sushi we did received (crap though it was), it would still not have come to one AYCE price. 

So, basically we got ripped off twice.

Today's visit was a 0 star, but I know Sushi Koma can do better (or at least they used to), so I am being generous with 2 stars.

But to all my fellow Yelpers: come on people, we deserve better than this. Stand up and start demanding better sushi, including the rice.

And to all the AYCE sushi joints out there - STOP PRE-CUTTING YOUR FISH! It increases the surface area that is exposed to oxidization and accelerates the deterioration - in other words, it makes it nasty.

First time here based on friends recommendation, but was a bit disappointed. The food was good, but the wait ruined our experience. We got AYCE, and after waiting over half an hour and 4 large sakes in, other tables that came after us finished eating and we still didn't not get our food other than edamame, and was then told they had lost our order. We put our order in again, and at this point the food was all mixed up and we didn't know what belonged to who. After putting in our second order, the food didn't come out, so we had asked them to cancel it since we were full from sake and waiting.

I want to give credit to the waitresses though, they were nice and apologetic, and the sushi was good. Just wished the food came out continuously so we could actually enjoy and take advantage of our AYCE.

Memorable items were the angry edamame, the brie and grape quesadilla, white tuna, and the seared tuna carpaccio. :)

My new favorite sushi place! 
Cozy atmosphere, and yummy rolls!
It was a little busy when we got there which may explain the not so great customer service (Had to ask several times for water refills, and to order more sushi). Just a suggestion, maybe hire a few more servers! Place is still awesome will most definitely come back!

Love this cute, quaint, almost hole-in-the-wall spot ! The sushi was fresh and they have all you can eat. Only reason I am not giving all 5 stars is the service was really slow towards the end. The waiters were really nice about it all but we waited longer for our smaller order than we did for the larger order we put in initially. Would've liked to have been comped for the inconvenience but instead we paid full price and still waited patiently for all our rolls to come out. Hopefully, next time the service is better but I'll definitely go back for the sushi !

First things first...I went in with an open mind and an empty stomach...Noticing a lot of
5-Star reviews from a handful of Yelp friends, I began to think-Are we missing out on other AYCE joints? Is my usual spot slipping like they say it is? Is Sushi Koma that good? Only one way to find out....Go!

We sat down for dinner one evening and almost immediately received our drinks and complimentary Edamame. Right off the bat, I order the "one per person"items-Uni, Amaebi, Carpaccio, and Sashimi Roll. We also got the Brie and Grape Quesadilla.
Quesadilla was good, but kinda skimpy on the brie and grape, Amaebi was plump and sweet, Sashimi Roll was good, and I liked the addition of the garlic chips on the carpaccio, but didn't care that it was swimming in the sauce. Uni didn't arrive.

Nigiri was up next. Salmon, Scallop and Hamachi were good. The Saba was exceptional and I killed about 6 orders alone. Still no Uni, so our waitress reminds the chef. We assume that the Uni is on its way and we go with a few rolls-Elephant, one with beef on top, and one with soft shell crab. Forgot the names, but overall, rolls were forgettable... The Elephant was okay, the beef roll was barely evident because the overkill on the green onion and eel sauce, and the texture on the soft shell crab was almost non existent from being fine chopped, I like to bite into the body, leg, or claw when I order anything with soft shell crab, know what I mean?

 Our waitress was still surprised we didn't get our uni, and in Korean, she and the chef were going back and forth for an awkward moment, and after 5 minutes, our chef reassured us that the uni was coming...don't know what happened there, but maybe he was saving the best for last? Got to devour the 4 pieces of uni which were very sweet, and we ordered up dessert.

Only ONE item per person, so I went with Green Tea Ice Cream and Wifey went with Coffee Mochi. She liked my Ice cream better, because this Green Tea tasted more floral, from being made with a green tea extract, as opposed from it being made from green tea powder. Choose wisely people, you only get one choice here. 
Service was awesome, food....just shy of me being a fan...it is what it is..
Moral of our visit? The Sushi isn't always greener on the other side!.....ALOHA!!!

YELP 100 CHALLENGE 2013-(52/100) "Komatose"

Yum! My GF and I found this place the first night I came to Vegas - because it was super late on a Sunday night and they were open - yay!

The sushi was really good - they have a great selection and it didn't take too long to get our food. The servers are very polite and cheery. For the $ you're paying (and it's not a lot) you're getting pretty delicious food. 

I still go here every once in a while and would recommend it for a quick sushi dinner.

I'm sorry but this is probably the best thing happened to my life, after my wife. This restaurant beats the living hell out of all those 5 star restaurants on the strip. Hands down the best sushi restaurant ever created. Greatest sushi quality ever. Please come here if you want the best experience eating food.

On first looks this place is very small...But no fish smell when walking in [Hint: if you smell fish at a sushi bar...RUN away really Fast]

The wait staff is friendly and attentive 

The Food was surprisingly good for a strip mall location..I have been here several times in the last few months

I went here for a quick lunch with a GF of mine. We had never been there before. They have great prices and great food. Super good spicy hand roll and they do an amazing lunch special menu!! So be sure to ask for it! I had three hand rolls and miso soup for 10.00! Crazy right! My GF got salad, soup, rice, sweet beef, tempura veggies and big hunks of salmon.... All for 14. The salmon was over cooked,,, what that's not their speciality... Lol. 

I give them them 4 stars because the place could be a bit more bright and friendly and the salmon was overcooked. It's all about the sushi business there. I appreciate that with the quality of food and the service, but would like to see it, never the less. 

The service was great, parking was easy, the food was hot and we were in and out within an hour.  

Gotta check out lunch there some time! It's worth it!

Great sushi, tuna carpaccio is delicious, Todd roll and tiger roll is amazing. Always have to get a couple orders of the shrimp tempura. Food is always very delicious but sometimes the service is a little off. Nice people but not on top of all the time but still will go back!

I'll keep it simple and say that the rolls themselves were pretty good in flavor. The rice is what completely killed the meal for me. I had several rolls that were complete mush. It felt pretty nasty to have a waterlogged ball of mushy rice in my  mouth. I have always heard that the rice is the most important component and now I understand why. As for the good notes... the seafood tostada was pretty good as was the bulgogi. The red bean mochi was a nice way to end the meal. I took a gamble trying this place after reading a ton of great reviews and a few that were negative. I wish I had gone somewhere else because 26 bucks is a lot of cash to me.

THEIR *NEW* LOCATION IS IN THE SAME PLAZA! 
I just wanted to say that i love how this place closes at 3AM and not 2AM like a lot of other places. I came here at around 2AM for a friend early bday celebration. Their services is so so amazing, everyone was so friendly and interactive with full knowledge of the menu and was available in case we had any questions. We walked in and was immediately seated right away and had our order taken too because we had what we wanted in mind already. 

The staffs are ALL so happy and let out a good vibe (because if i worked at 2AM i would've been pissed so idk how theyre all in a super duper good mood!) All our food came out fairly fast and all was yummy! It's hard finding a sushi place that serves every single sushi roll so delicious and flavorful that you always crave more.

AYCE is $25.95 for dinner which is super reasonable! I usually order around 4-5 rolls, a bunch of apps & deserts or more anyways so it's a really good price!! There's soooo many options to choose from and their menu is huge i literally wanted to try every single roll. They are also very open to accommodate with your needs as well if you wanted to tweak some rolls up! 

Their new location is super similar to their previous one except it's about 2x as bigger. Everything is super clean and they have such a relaxing dimmed environment with relaxing music! 

The only complaint i have is that they only do one desert per person for AYCE because some other places allow unlimited (but it's understandable!) other than that i highly recommend coming here!

We loved this place and have gone there for the last 3 years.  Our first time at the new location the quality has gone done greatly.  The old location had an intimate vibe,  food was delicious and service was amazing.  Today we went for Valentine's Day in the new location and service was terrible. Our server forgot our order (sake), took Forever for refills and forget about the check we have to walk to the front to get acknowledged. 
  We cut our meal short due to the experience.  We told one of the servers and he stated it was because of short staff the service was bad.  Funny thing is its the same amount of staff in the old location. Really disappointing experience today.

We haven't been in a while since our last visit wasn't as great as the prior visits, but yesterday our visit did not disappoint. Keep in mind I don't have a review for the most recent visit before yesterday. My other great reviews were from a while ago. Last visit before yesterday wasn't so great, but I didn't leave a review as i thought maybe they were having an "off day." Seems to be the case. Yesterday, service and food were both really good. The place was full, but we got lucky and were seated within 5 minutes. Even with a full house, our food orders came out pretty fast the first time around. Second order was a little slower as I think since we were doing AYCE and already ate quite a bit, they probably focus on the new customers' first order. I'm ok with that, as it's a smart service model. Sushi was fresh and tasty. Salmon didn't come out with lemon wedges first time but did on second. I don't mind it either way, just seemed odd it was different the second time around. We paid $16.95 for AYCE for our 6 year old since one roll from the kid's menu doesn't excite her. She prefers the Nigiri. It paid for itself since she had one roll plus several nigiri but it seemed high at first. They did seem short staffed and the girls were working hard. Service was good but we did have to flag them down a few times to get their attention. Overall though, a good experience. I'll go back.

This place is legit. Order as many things as you want at once, the WHOLE menu is AYCE ( some items your only allowed 1 of ). Great quality and taste BUT it's a small place inside. 

Service was a tad slow but not horrible. I will be back again for sure.

One of my top 2 sushi places in town, each of which I have to drive over 20 miles to from my house. This place just moved into a bigger building Within the same location. This is normally good you won't have to wait and let others finish to be seated however the exact opposite happened. The place was severely under staffed and took us over half hour to be seated. Since I knew the sushi was worth it here I wasn't too upset about it. I genuinely felt bad because of the understaffed crew also had to deal with flooding from I believe the bathroom. Kind of gross but we all have terrible days. None of this would hinder me from not coming back.

Great place! Most AYCE sushi joints fill up the sushi with rice but not this one. This is one of the few places I've been to where you can actually taste the sushi rather than just fill up on it. 

There are a few things on the AYCE menu that you can only get once- GET THEM. The dynamite roll, sashimi roll (tiny but is refreshingly tasteful) and seafood tostada. In general this place serves smaller portions but I appreciate it because you get the quality of the food back. Everything is very fresh and has SO many flavors that you can actually taste. Also get as much nigiri as you can-it's amazingly fresh! 

The green tea mochi tasted like it was boxed mochi, which is fine- except it was super old. So it mostly tasted like carbonation and sugar. 

Also the service isn't that great. The waiter we had pretty much looked like he hated everything. Which is fine because being in service positions suck but please don't show it at your workplace. We still tipped well because he looked like he could use a pick me up. This place is a must!

Went there for a first time last night and it was a great experience. The food was amazing. Sushi is fresh and flavorful and the AYCE deal is totally worth it. There are many sushi places in Las Vegas that are overpriced and their quality is not even that great. So glad we found this hidden gem. This is our new go to place when it comes to sushi :)

This place would have gotten 5 stars but the service isnt the best. My boyfriend and I have been here almost 20 times in the last few years. The quality of the fish is great and the owner is such a nice guy. When hes there the sushi is amazing. The only problem is that the space is small and the staff really is just running around the whole time. Its hard to get drinks or appetizers. This is an all you can eat place which is great and totally worth it. They have a seafood tostada which is a bunch of fish and tomatoes, onion, and jalapeno on a crispy tortilla thing. Its great. Its busy on weekends and the wait can be long but they really do have great sushi.

I've eaten sushi at many different places but this place, hands down, is THE best so far! I eat here a couple times a month for lunch with the hubby. The food and service here is always amazing and there aren't a bunch of restrictions on the menu! The tuna capraccio is the best tasting food I think I have ever consumed - ever. The tiger and elephant rolls are my fave and I love anything with eel,  avocado, or cream cheese lol. The place isn't big but its nicely appointed and comfortable.

This place is great! I love the food here.
The service is great, too! Everyone is friendly and helpful.

But the music is ALWAYS SO LOUD.
I even asked them to turn it down - they did but I felt like they took it from a 100 to a 99...
I have to YELL across this TINY TABLE to have anyone hear me...

If you plan to talk during your meal, don't come here.
If you just want to pig out and eat and make faces at one another, go for it!

Three stars is all for the service, the food was mediocre at best.

I was a little put off when I walked in. The place smelled like a fish market, the kind of scent that slaps your nose right off your face! Had I been dining alone, I would've left. But my friends were already seated for lunch, so I ignored the smell and sat down with my party right away. I figured my friends already had the table, might as well give it a shot despite the unpleasant aroma. Maybe it was just that day, since I haven't seen other reviews make mention of this.

Our server was very attentive and made roll suggestions, since it was our first time here. She was on point with our drinks and kept checking on us throughout the meal. 3 stars for the staff!

The sushi was ok. I was disappointed for the most part. I love nigiri more than rolls, and thank goodness the fish tasted fresh enough, but I've had better quality AYCE elsewhere. Appetizers such as baked muscles and dynamite were barely satisfying, borderline bland. The rolls we ordered were decent, but nothing special. Perhaps my expectations for the food here was too high. I wouldn't mind trying it one more time.
