Love coming here, the food rocks and the music is so good, makes the place even better. All the services and sushi guys and so down to earth. There is so much on the all u can eat and they do half rolls so u can try so much more. Love sushi Koma, u will leave go home and fall into a Koma

I have been here a few times and it has never let me down! The sushi quality, selection and service is awesome! Today I had a wonderful server by the name of Aileen that suggested for us to try some delicious sushi from the menu and she was spot on! They were all delicious! I will for sure come back here again!

The name says it all, I was in absolute sushi Koma bliss. My partner and I had gone to Sushi Koma for lunch on my birthday for a lunch date. We found Sushi Koma on yelp and seen that it looked pretty good and the reviews mirrored. The only thing that may be a burden to the establishment is the location, it is so hidden that most people would pass it by without even knowing. Luckily we found them on Yelp and Just plugged the location in. The sushi is very fresh with a decently sized selection and the staff is pretty quick and very friendly. Their menu was very graphically appealing and the color combinations really popped as well as the dcor in their dining area. Definitely give this place a try.

I'm not a huge seafood lover and so you can imagine I'm extremely picky about sushi. I love this place, the fact that it's all you can eat doesn't hurt either. Ask for the fresh wasabi, well worth the extra cpl of bucks. The scallops are awesome and their rolls are just so tasty

Generally in the San Francisco Bay Area all you can eat sushi is just a disaster...I personally can not find any good places.....

That is why I am blown away by Sushi Koma ( of course it is in Las Vegas) and its all you can eat sushi lunch for 22 bucks. Yes the service sucks and is slow but the place was busy and you gotta cut them some slack. Fish is good not great but what you get is pretty awesome.


I liked their eel, most of the nigiri although the tuna wasnt the greatest (the white tuna was really good though), red snapper was pretty tasty too.

I am a big fan of the rolls ( I know it aint really sushi but....) I really liked the rainbow roll which had crab, avocado and I think mackerel,  Ika Tobiko Maki which was Squid & tobiko ( squid was soft and fluffy not rubbery)  and the  Spicy Hotate & Avocado Roll  which was a nice combo of  scallop & avocado ( it had a kick to it and the scallop was very delicate in texture).

I would stay away from the fillers of gyozo etc and that stuff is not worth filling up on.

I will definitely come back!
Since I found this AYCE sushi place two years ago and I haven't been to any other AYCE sushi restaurant. Fish always fresh, service is excellence and price was reasonable. Highly recommended!

I lovr this place.
The fish is vey fresh and all displays are so cute and organized.
Some AYCE sushi place have large portion of roll and sushi however, I can try many diffetent things in sushi koma.

It was a small little sushi place. It had really good service. The sushi was quite average. The people were really friendly though. I enjoyed the SSS roll and the salmon nigiri the most. The all-you-can-eat price was fair; $21-26 per person. It was overall a good experience.

when was arrived we were greeted and seated right away and decided to try the all you can eat dinner  here. wow they have a great selections of rolls to choose from and theyre app was really good.the server brought edamame. i started off with the seaweed salad best ive had. they put a salad dressing on it. yum. shrimp temura, good. Seared Tuna Carpaccio delish! Green Mussel, very good. then i got some rolls Kimmy Roll8 which had
Deep fried calamari, asparagus, avocado, shredded garlic, yum-yum sauce, and cucumber roll with green onions, crunch, and smelt roe on top. and Big B Roll which had
Shrimp tempura roll with thin sliced beef, green onions, and chef's special sauce on top. after trying that roll. i think its my fav roll ever ha. then i finished off with the red bean ice cream! food was delish and staff was nice place was clean. def will be back!

I've been coming here since I moved to Vegas 6 years ago its my go to sushi eatery still waiting to be offered toro but it might happen I hope this place offers ayce and had a great beer selection and excellent menu try the double d and big b rolls very good

All you can eat price for lunch was good for the amount of sushi we ordered. The quality of the sushi was great, fresh and good size pieces of nigiri. The staff were extremely helpful and friendly. 

They have a good selection of sushi and rolls as well as other options like gyoza as part of their AYCE option. Sushi came out fast which was great. Would definetley come back again the next time in Vegas.

By far my favorite AYCE sushi place in Vegas. Everything is so fresh and their service is always very fast even when they're busy. My favorites are the sashimi roll (so sad that you can only order one), tuna carpaccio, Arizona roll, super philly, kimmie, and the almost fire (I only like this one the old way they used to make it. You have to request it) and the yellowtail nigiri is my absolute favorite. They put little jalapeos on top and it's so delicious! I definitely leave in a sushi koma everytime I come here, so they did their job.

Let me start by saying I read all of the reviews and, although I'm a huge fan of Yama, I thought I'd give this place a shot. After all it has 4 stars with over 400 reviews. A hard enough thing to accomplish right?! 

A party of 3 (2 adults and a child), we walk into the restaurant at around 12 on a Sunday and the place is empty with the exception of two people at the bar. We all plan on ordering all you can eat until I hear my 9 year old will be charged full price ($21.95). $22 for a kid that won't eat more than a combined total of 1 roll and a few appetizers. He was disappointed because he was excited at the idea of being able to try different rolls that we ordered. What happened to kids pricing?!? There is no way my child can eat as much as I can. 

So moving past this, he ordered off of the kids menu and we ordered two AYCE. The food we ordered came out immediately so no complaints there. Everything we ordered to begin with was delicious. 

Tuna carpaccio - 5 stars
Seaweed salad - 4 stars
Green mussels - 5 stars
Vegas Freak (a little on the heavy side but good) - 3 stars
Dynamite - 4 stars
A few different orders of sashimi. - all 5 stars

Teriyaki beef hand roll - 0 stars it was filled with mostly stringy fat, not meat. So gross!

Yum yum scallop hand roll - they brought me the wrong roll. Don't know what it was but it tasted like perfume. Disgusting!

Seafood tostada - 3 stars
Elephant roll - 3 stars

As the restaurant began to fill, the orders began to slow down.... We get to the point where the restaurant is completely packed and there are only two servers and 3 sushi chefs. The servers were working their butts off running food and taking orders but the sushi chefs and the people in the back of the house handling anything needing to be fried or baked were painfully slow. To the point where we ordered 1 roll and waited over 30 minutes to get it. 30 minutes!!!! For a roll that was only 5 pieces!!! 

My other issues with the place were that they pack you in like sardines. The place is the size of a shoe box and the tables are literally 4 inches apart. Too close and almost impossible to even walk around everything is so crammed. 

Overall, I wanted to love this place. But not everything is ideal for everyone. I enjoyed the majority of the food, appreciated the mostly attentive server and loved the company but I don't think I'll be making my way back anytime soon. If you want better service, amazing food and a little more (barely) room to move around, try Yama!

After hearing about Sushi Koma (aka Sushi Freak), from a couple of friends and family I deceided to try the buffet for Lunch with three adults and an infant.  The restaurant is located in a neighborhood shopping center, where other storeowners had limited success.  The place is on the small side, and we entered at 11:30 to find ourselves the only ones there.  The menu was extensive, and the sushi was suprisingly fresh and tasty.  The rolls were good quality and were not drowned in sauce, so you were able to enjoy the taste of the fish.  The rice to fish ratio was well balanced.  When we left the restaurant two hours later the place was packed with customers.  I wouldn't call this restaurant the greatest sushi place I have eaten at, but the food was very good, and probably the best sushi that I have tasted on the west side of town.  I would definitely come back again.  

This place is well worth a visit.  Try it... you'll like it.

We've been going to this place for a while, i first of all love how close it is to where we live! They recently moved to a bigger place so it's a lot more Roomey and there's a lot less of a waiting time. 

Their sushi are delicious, my favorite would be the dynamite roll ! I would definitely recommend recommend for you to try that one. And as an appetizer the teriyaki beef is to die for !

I hated it! 
I won't go back. 
Dirty plates stacked in our way we could hardly eat! 
I have been to a lot of sushi places in Las Vegas and I've never been so disturbed as I was when I went to this restaurant if they don't have enough staff they should hire more people or more efficient people who know how to multi-task at least. 
I got no refills. Some of the things I ordered never ended up coming. Over priced for mediocre quality sushi that wasn't fresh. My friend kept asking for water and the waiter kept ignoring her he was so busy try to up sale saki and shots to other members in our party he didn't have time to listen to things that are free like water. And I only got one napkin the whole time!!!! I was so angry but the time it was over I no longer wanted to tip but you know larger parties get the gratuity added in no matter how bad the service is. DIRTY PLATES STACKED UP TO OUR EYEBALLS ARE UNACCEPTABLE!
great food, great service. One of the best Las Vegas has to offer.

We came in around 5pm on a Saturday night and at first we were a bit out if place.  Walked in, was seated and provided drinks.  We go to a lot of AYCE sushi places and we thought that it would be like the others, you sit at the bar and you get the interaction .... Nope.  We ordered appetizers but then waited at least 20 minutes to be acknowledged by the sushi chef.  Was it because they only had 1 chef for 3 tables and a couple at the sushi bar?  It was a bit if a turn off. 

Some redeeming qualities that will make me come back: music selection, quaint little space and close to home.

I may need to return now that I know what to expect.  Maybe sit at one of the tables and then order a ton of sushi so we don't wait so long ...

We'll see...

I asked for hand rolls with no rice and was told no that is impossible to do. Seriously, how hard is it wrap a piece of seaweed around fish without putting rice on first. I have never been to a sushi bar that doesn't accomadate customer lifestyle requests. Then we ordered the all you can eat and they only had nigiri. So we just ate the meat and after the plates were taken away she informs us that we will get a $10 charge foe not eating the rice. What!  Do this place want to stay in business?
The food was good but certainly not near the best. The atmosphere is loud and service takes a while. 
Not a recommended place from me.

Went to this place for my grandfathers first time having sushi. I've gone to sushi many times and this was my first one in Vegas. 

When I walked in it was really tiny. I saw on here that others had deemed it kid friendly, but honestly... Just because they have high chairs doesn't make that so. It's really cramped in there so I wouldn't advise children under 3. 

Anyways, here are the specs on the food. It was good food. The fish was really fresh, some of the freshest I've ever had. I always have thought that if you can get squid or octopus and have it not be like chewing fish gum you're in a good place. That's how this was

My only complaint is the not sharing food. I have a 3 year old and a 1 year old. Because of this policy we ordered a child's meal which was fine. However, we started getting our food before they did. How do you expect me to eat my food in front of my starving children and I'm NOT allowed to share? This was pretty infuriating. 

Here's a few more cons:
- the salmon skin hand roll was cremated. It was terrible. Absolutely terrible. It was like eating fish skin chips and not what it's supposed to be. 
- it was a bit loud with contemporary music.
- it is EXTREMELY cramped once it gets busier. I almost hit a few people with my 1 year old just trying to get out.
- the high chair straps were DISGUSTING. I mean, they were just covered in various others kids meals to the point I couldn't tighten it down. It was stiff from all the yuck.
- We are forced to buy kids meals but have no kid friendly beverages? 
- many times we were delayed getting our food. How can you enforce a 45 minute time frame, but take 15 minutes to bring a couple things? 

Anyways. It was great quality, don't get me wrong. But the other aspects weren't as great. Other than the Brie and grape quesidilla. That was amazing. 
I probably wouldn't be back unless it wasn't my choice.
the food quality is so f-ing good everything is fresh and taste great and service is second to none great job sushi koma!!!

This sushi hit me so hard I'm incoherent. When they say "Sushi till you koma" they're not lying! Everything on both sides of the menu is part of their all you can eat offer. EVERYTHING! This is the best AYCE selection I've ever seen. 

Now, for the food. The food is mediocre, it all depends on what you order. Some of the rolls come out warm, so they don't have that cold refreshing sushi taste that we all know and love. 

Out of all the rolls I ordered, I only liked one. But they don't call me sushi-sensei for nothing, my sushi taste is quite refined (me coming from Hawaii and all). So don't let this discourage you! The sushi had a somewhat odd taste to me, but on the bright side, you can try all the sushi rolls you like until you find one that meets all your needs! 

Overall, best AYCE selection since you can literally have ANYTHING on their menu and you can share with other AYCE members. But the sushi itself was just "ok".

I have to say
When you come in this plays they show so much respect and grate customer service 
There sushi is #####111111
Always a good time and good meal, Kaori made our visit a good time, for rolls I think we had damn near everything, such a good value, always leave tired

All you can eat sushi. For $26. That's twenty six one dollars bills. Amazing food. Great staff. Enjoyable ambience. Hands down best sushi place I've ever ate at. For that price, you just cannot beat. I didn't finish my meal when I was full, but it was when I was disgusted with how much Ive eaten because it was so good.

Sushi koma is the correct name for this place. You'll be in one waiting for food. The 2  waitress at lunch were fantastic,  but the three sushi chefs must have been playing cards or with their fingers. 20 minutes between each order of 2 pieces.  Ridiculous

Sushi Freak has dethroned Goyemon as my favorite AYCE restaurant.  I've been here four times in less than a month, bringing different friends to experience it. There's not much in the way of atmosphere, but they more than make up for it with amazing food and service.

The fish is extremely fresh - I've only really gotten into sushi within the last year or so and was never sure if I could discern good quality from bad, but I can really taste the difference here. The super white tuna is sublimely buttery and almost melts in your mouth. It's always a favorite of mine, but the quality and freshness here is beyond what I've experienced anywhere else. I've also had tuna, salmon, yellowtail, mackerel, and snapper nigiri, and all were similarly fresh. As mentioned in previous reviews, a lot of the nigiri comes with garnish. The garlic tuna comes with a dollop of minced garlic on top, and the salmon is served with a lemon twist. I don't mind this, and it can easily be removed if it's not to your taste. 

As enamored as I am with the nigiri, I haven't tried many rolls. The two I've been ordering regularly are Jane and Ponzio. Jane is yellowtail and cucumber inside with spicy tuna on top, and Ponzio features tuna, albacore, and avocado, topped with albacore and finished with ponzu and sprouts. The rolls are pretty small, and they allow half-orders for AYCE, so it's easy to try them until you find your favorites.

The tuna carpaccio appetizer is topped with delicious fried garlic slivers, ponzu, and yum yum sauce. I'm not a mayo fan and find that the yum yum overpowers the fish, so I ask them to leave it off. The dessert selection consists of a nice variety of ice cream and mochi flavors, but is missing some of the more unique options found at Goyemon.

The service has been amazing on every occasion. This is a very small restaurant and it's never been busy when I've dined, but there are always at least two servers and two sushi chefs working. Orders come out very quickly and plates are cleared as soon as they're emptied. The servers are all very friendly and attentive, and frequently check if you'd like to order more - a nice change from some places where you feel like you have to tackle someone to put an order in.

I'm really struggling to come up with negative aspects of Sushi Freak. The only very minor issues I can think of are the lack of fresh wasabi and the limited dessert options. The fresh fish and friendly, fast service put them at the top of my list.

AYCE is worth it. Tuna nigiri is always great quality. Servers are very attentive. Ambiance reminds me of one of the cute alley restaurants in Osaka. There is a wait especially weekends. Lunch is the best time to go with my family.
The sushi was okay. The service wasn't that good. Porbably the only time i'll go there.

This is dated 10/05/17.  You need to know this before you review them this week.

This is one of my wife's favorite spots in Las Vegas to go.  Came by on Thursday night and their original location is closed up with paper signs all over the doors and windows.  They have moved to the other side of the same shopping center but closer to Durango behind the JITB.  Yes service is slow because this is their 2nd night and there are always unforeseen things that happen like the surge rush of people around 7PM that pretty much filled it all up at once.  The food and menu are all the same but they just need time to work out the kinks.  Give them a chance and please if you review,  Keep that in mind.

LOVE ALL YOU CAN EAT SUSHI!  I like the different varieties of sushis.  The ones I had were delicious!  Their menu was well categorized and very easy to read.  Service there is awesome!  Staff always picking up empty dishes and refilling my tea/water; staff is very attentive and always asks, if there is anything else or if everything is ok.  I would definitely go back, it's well worth the money and I enjoyed using my chopstick cheaters LOL!

This is great sushi for its location, the only big competitors would be in chinatown and near the strip. It has small seating so if you have big parties of 6 or more you might have to wait. The service and food where very good, our server was always checking up on us and getting what we need. I will for sure comeback soon.

Eating here is great, service was okay except not enough staff for such a small place. Sushi was excellent, but only 1 carpaccio per person. And if you get a freebie you have to pay taxes on it so technically not free.
Like that they are open late night . But it's a little small & crowded . Plus side great customer service. Sushi was okay I've had better in Vegas.

My favorite all you can eat sushi in Vegas. Delicious, handmade, custom order. The all you can eat also includes the appetizers and a small dessert. I think my only complaint is the stipulations on how many of specific rolls can be ordered.

One of my fav places to go after work for a late night meal. Great service as always and knowledgeable staff. Server patrita made it a great experience. I asked for an item on the menu and it was 86ed, so she asked if I wanted it a certain way and put in the order right away. 2 mins later the sushi chef had it ready. I would recommend this place to anyone with a big appetite.

So came here in Mother's Day a year ago and they screwed up my reservation. Had to go somewhere else was so aggravated. So decided a year later to give this place another shot called up and made the reservation. Wifey called they said it was a 15 min wait. Told them we would be there in 20. So we get there and then they tell us there is at least another 20 min wait!!! WTF!!! These guys are morons!!!! I didn't want to go there anyways place is so tiny you can hardly move in there....thanks for screwing me again!!!! This place is cut!!!!!!!!

It was my first time here, me and my brother in law were hungry it was 1030 pm and we wanted some sushi. Everything was soooo good, from the sushi down to the mochi ice cream. The only thing was they didnt have any other chili sauce that wasnt siracha. I like siracha but not with my sushi. Aside from that everything was great.

The food quality and service has diminished greatly in the last couple of years. They've expanded the restaurant, which is the only plus because now it's not cramped. 

This used to be my favorite spot, but I wish I never tried it again. I haven't been here for a couple of years because Sakana stole my heart. I should have left it that way. 

Let's start with the service. I have never been to a empty AYCE sushi restaurant that takes like 30 minutes to get you 2 nigiri (because they only served us 1 order every 10 minutes for some reason). It was hard to get the waitresses attention and she always looked annoyed when we asked for our food.

Food: I left here still hungry and that's not supposed to happen after an AYCE restaurant, but I literally couldn't order anything else because it was unappetizing. You can't really taste any vinegar in the sushi rice. Nothing at all stood out as, "I need that again!" The rice to fish ratio was not very good. They give you some really small pieces of fish in the nigiri and that's why I even come to a place like this.

Nice atmosphere, and good tasting dishes. 

I'll recommend the Sam's Volcano roll, actually I like all the baked rolls here, given the chance I would try all of them. 

Aileen is very cute.
came thru word of mouth and it did not dissapoint. great quality seafood and friendly staff. small quaint place, good for couples

UGH. Twice now i've come in and once I've ordered delivery. It is NEVER good. The takeout smelled like something was rotting and so i put in the fridge hoping it was just in my head (it was not) My partner would not even reopen the fridge until i discarded. I'm sorry guys, quality is very important!

Great food at amazing price. Eat as much as you want!!! My mom was ordering off of photos posted on yelp. And our waitress was super patient with her. Small place, but everything came out really fast. You got to set at the bar. In front of the sushi chef, so he'll give you chef's special (hint, only sashimi, no rice). Will definitely visit again!
good price , good fresh fish, good size slices, great service, wish I lived in Vegas, I'd go once a week.

Variety was "ok", most rolls have eel sauce and cream cheese (not a big fan). When I asked for 2 specialty rolls with ponzu sauce with a little extra, instead of eel sauce, the sushi chef passes us the rolls and says 2 rolls with extra ponzu and they had eel sauce on them.  Cups were not refilled the whole time we were there (about 45 min) with water.  Wanted to order more, but waitresses only came by twice to ask if we wanted anything else... Service was poor.

This is one of our go to sushi spots.  Definitely get the All You Can Lunch or Dinner.  If you're a sushi lover, all you can eat is a must.  Food always comes out looking excellent and always satisfies your taste buds.  All the servers are helpful and consistently checking up on you in case you need anything.  The owner is always seen working hard prepping food but always say hi.  You won't be disappointed coming here.  Use common sense though.  If it's a dinner rush time, don't expect to be seated right away.

I always leave happy whenever we come here to eat. We always do the AYCE. Even when the place is full, our orders come very fast. Food is always tasting good and the staff are very friendly. Good place to dine and hangout with friends. Will come here everytime Im craving for sushi.
New to Vegas and this is hands down the best all you can eat sushi I've been to! Service was awesome and fast, even for a Saturday night! I will definitely be back!

Wanted to try a new AYCE restaurant, and saw this place had good reviews so the boyfriend and I gave it a try. We are so glad that we did! The staff is so friendly, and offered up great recommendations when we were indecisive. The menu has an abundance of choices, and we enjoyed all of rolls we ordered...and we ordered a lot haha The restaurant is small and cozy, which is honestly what we prefer because it's easier for the service staff to be attentive. The tuna carpaccio is a must try, and we will definitely be returning here!
I will be back here whenever I visit to Las Vegas! This place has incredible deal $25.95 all you can eat sushi! Wow....their sushi is very fresh for all you can eat place. It was one of the best!
Waiter was super friendly & smiled the entire time and checked on us offen. Cozy little place and the food was delicious! Clean, louder music but I got a good fun vibe. I will be back : )

I remember when Sushi Koma was Brian's Beach back in the early 2000's. When I learned there was a new sushi joint in town that had the best uni w/ a tasty quail egg on top, I had to check this place out. 

Koma is located on the corner of Durango and Flamingo inside the plaza where Jack in the Box is. When you first walk in, you'll notice it's pretty small (40 people max). We came here on a Wednesday night around 6pm and it was already starting to get packed. There was only one table open for two!! You can choose to sit at the sushi bar or one of the tables. If you want to come here with a big group, I suggest calling ahead to see how busy they are, but they won't guarantee a table and they do not take reservations. 

FOOD: My husband & I got the AYCE dinner. The fish was always fresh. We tried the following: 

1. Salmon & Salmon Belly (Unlimited salmon belly here--- SAY WHAT!!!!) 
2. Tuna 
3. Yellowtail (This was my favorite) 
4. Uni with a raw quail egg on top (Best and freshest uni in town and the quail egg really compliments the uni flavor) 
5. Eel 
6. Mackeral (My least favorite) 
7. Alaska handroll (basically a California roll w/ salmon in it. It was really good here because they added sesame seeds to it) 
8. Calamari & Shrimp Tempura (crispy!!!) 
9. Baked Mussel (Some were cooked perfectly and others were overcooked and chewy) 
10. Dragon Roll (Basic and the same as any other place) 
11. Plum wine dessert (MUST TRY) 

The sushi chefs were super nice to us and they decided to give us a special toro plate that was AMAZING! It was melt in your mouth good. Seriously, I give the tuna toro a 5. :-) 

SERVICE: The night we came it was really busy so the staff was not on their game. It took a good 25 minutes before we got any of the food we ordered. Half of it came, then it took another 20 minutes for the rest of the order to come. They also forgot to bring us water and the kitchen items we ordered. We actually received our shrimp tempura and calamari after we had put in our dessert order, which was lame. All the servers were sweet and apologetic about it. 

PRICE: Typical AYCE dinner price of $25.95. It's a great deal for the quality of the fish and the fish to rice ratio. 

Overall, my husband and I enjoyed Sushi Koma. I wouldn't say it is the best in town, but some dishes were definitely above average. If you enjoy a reasonable fish to rice ratio then this is your place, but don't expect Sakana or Sushi Neko level where the pieces of fish are double the length of the rice. You'll still get your money's worth at the end of the meal. 

Happy Dinings, 
J Tran

Solid sushi restaurant for Vegas good nigiri. Good tuna carpacio and tostada. Been to almost every sushi place in Vegas  and this is top 5 for price, quality, and originality. Probably not good for big groups unless you make a reservation. Also for some reason servers are very nice and easy on the eyes.

Oh gosh, Sushi Koma is too good.

I am a huge nigiri lover so dried, disgusting fish is a big no no. I consistently order the same thing from sushi places so it is easy for me tell which place has better quality fish. My order is usually salmon, tuna, yellow tail, and scallop. I have never had bad quality fish from Koma and Sushi Koma is the only place other than Goyemon that I've been to that offers fresh scallop on consistent bases. A big part of nigiri is the rice and I have to say Koma's rice is pretty darn delicious even consumed by itself. So if you are a nigiri lover, this is definitely the place for you. One thing though, if you dont like lemon on your salmon or pepper on your yellow tail, just like them know you want nigiri with no toppings. I quiet like the toppings but some people may not.

My girlfriend and I are not big time roll eaters because my girlfriend is from Japan and she does not like that creamy stuff and I just like really fresh fish but of we did order rolls we would go with Todd roll, dragon roll, and tiger roll. Todd roll is definitely the best roll though. 

Sushi Koma doesn't have a huge appetizer selection which might be problematic for some people. They do, however, offer some very unique items which some people may find interesting. To me, a nigiri eater, as long as seaweed salad, miso soup, and baked mussels are there, fish quality is more important than anything. 

Service is a huge bright spot for Koma. Everyone is so friendly that it's hard to not love the place. 

Overall, a fantastic AYCE sushi place for nigiri lovers!!! I live like 40 minutes away but I am addicted to getting SUSHI KOMA!!!!!!!!!

You have to be a sushi fan to know what sushi place is good and not.  Sushi Freak is for sure Freak'in good!  One of my favorites is the Tuna tuna Carpaccio.  Their fish is very good quality.  You can't go wrong eating AYCE sushi here!

The service was horrendous! The place had 3 small tables with guests and 5 guests at the bar and they had 4 servers (not including one who looked like the owner or manager) for the small restaurant. The server sat me down at a table and it took 7 minutes before they even took a drink order. I had to look for the menu because i was not given one. I had to ask for the ginger and wasabi after 3 min of getting my first order; then i had to grab my own napkin from the table next to me because the table I was placed didn't have anything on it. the servers were either walking by looking down on a piece of paper or they would look past you. it was hard to get any of the servers attention because the music was on pretty loud.

if i could give them a 0 star it would be that for their service
Sushi Koma!!! I love sushi night! Mighty roll everytime!!! Yummy!!! :D best sushi place ever and amazing staff! One time I was cold and they turned the air down for me ^_^
This is my sushi spot!!! If your looking for an amazing All You Can Eat this is the place to get great sushi, amazing flavor! Service is always top notch and caring. Best sushi in town by far

THE BEST ALL YOU CAN EAT SUSHI Restaurant in Las Vegas. If you're ever in Las Vegas, this is the place you'd want to go. Fresh fish to awesome kitchen dishes as well! The wait can be tough sometimes, prepare yourself to go during the odd time or grab a drink next door till your reservation is ready!

Decent AYCE sushi spot on Southwest of Vegas. Lunch is $21.95 and dinner is $25.95 which is in the same price range with other AYCE sushi spots. Even with our party of +15 people, service was attentive throughout. Staffs here are extremely friendly too.

Since our group had so many people, we decided to have a lead person order for everyone. Of course it didn't work out when one person yelled out "wait I want tuna," while another yelled out "Give me lots of Salmon." Confused as mofo, I just ate whatever was given in front of me. 

Somewhat disappointed that sushi here had a dense block of rice which I am most decidedly not a fan of. All fish tasted fresh so that redeemed a little. I must say their Uni was the only memorable item. My favorite AYCE sushi spot Sakana limits on uni so I liked the fact that I was able to order uni until I fell in Koma. Ha. It was fresh and buttery.

Stuffed myself with lots of sushi then finished off with a scoop of green tea ice cream which sadly ended up falling off my spoon and down to the floor. Our party all left satisfied after a great time sharing sushi. Not my favorite sushi spot but I wouldn't mind coming back again.

Wow I was really surprised with this place.  Scallops just a hint of lemon or ponzu, tender, fresh, and just amazing.  Yellowtail bellys melt in your mouth and a little slice of jalepeno to liven everything up.  Sweet shrimp heads well they gave us 30 at least, for a party of 8 and they were the best I have had in Vegas.  Uni was fresh and gone in seconds.  I think I have found a new fav.  The staff was great not really stopping the service and we were there for about 2 hours.
Second time coming here! The food is amazing & the staff is amazing! I love this place! My new sushi place for sure!!! I forgot how much I enjoyed it until I came back last night!

My first AYCE sushi experience since moving to Las Vegas was Sushi Koma. Don`t ask me exactly what rolls I ate, because I have no idea, but I will say that this place is good for a few reasons. 
1. I like small places that get filled up around lunch. That, to me, means that this place has a following and that it is worth trying. As soon as my friend and I sat down, people started to flow in and it got cray cray real quick. 
2. They do not overdo the rice! Thank you! There is nothing worse than getting a sushi roll or order of nigiri and having a mini bowling ball of freakin' rice to eat. You fill up to quick and you start to question your life decisions after too much sushi rice.
3. Their flavors are on point. What I mean is that sometimes I go to sushi and a roll is either too sweet or too spicy or too something. Nope. Pretty balanced here. Also, I feel like their roll sizes(long and hand....heh)are good. Not too overwhelming and ugly but also not too small and unsatisfying(it's important to be satisfied, people).
I know for sure I ate their green mussels, which I thoroughly may consider marrying because they were so good! Also, another contender for my heart was the cajun albacore nigiri. I could seriously just eat that and be happy for a meal. SO GOOD! Try it and thank me later. Oh! Their salmon skin roll also; delicious, salmon skin bacon that I want in my mouth all the time. 

We've explored the good, now let's touch briefly on the places that need improvement and basically it is that the service can be a bit slow and disorganized. I was expecting to get "the sheet" that you usually get at an AYCE sushi place, but instead I got "the server" who had to take down an order each time and it was just a slight annoyance on my part because I`m used to just filling out a sushi sheet and sending it on its way instead of having to verbalize each thing I want to order. Minor, but something to think about. 

Overall, I want to come back here. AYCE lunch was like $22, which I think is alright considering the quality and amount of choices. Side note: The staff was very friendly, but just a bit all over the place. Go here and get all the fishies in your belly.
Keeping it short.  One of my favorite AYCE sushi spots.  Love the food and the service.

I want to preface this by saying that my previous experiences were great! However, my boyfriend and I came here around 11:30 am on a Wednesday. There was no wait, so yay for that! We ordered right away since we knew what we wanted. I ordered edamame and mussels, 30 minutes later and neither had arrived. The items from the sushi bar arrived very promptly after we ordered. We gave them the benefit of the doubt that the kitchen was just busy. Then, we saw the servers bring plate after plate of mussels and edamame out to tables that we knew were SEATED after us, so we know they ordered after us. We asked a server, she said she would check. About 15 minutes later, the edamame arrived. We had to request for our drinks to be refilled and had to constantly ask for them to check on EVERYTHING else we ordered beyond this time. We left after 2 HOURS and still no mussels, although they had brought out mussels to SEVERAL other tables. As my boyfriend was at the counter paying our tab, the server came up to him and said "Sir your mussels are ready, do you still want them?" Uhm, neither of us are at the table and we are signing our bill.... What do you think? The way the server handled the situation was also not to my liking because once she knew all of the problems we were having, she should have made sure everything else came out or comped one of our meals. I was disappointed because I know they have better servers. I've been there on a busy day with ONE server and she was GREAT! There were  2 or 3 servers on the floor when this happened.

This place is alright. Close to home, so I decided to try it out. 

4 stars mainly for the level of service I received. Very quick, very polite, and the sushi chefs are very engaging. 

I really enjoy their bulgogi hot plate. Definitely try it out. 

 Their nigiri is pretty good as well. 

I would be returning to this sushi place, but I still enjoy Sushimon and Kaizen more.
Great food..clean..service is excellent.  A hidden spot for Vegas locals.  Take a cab here and enjoy 25$ all you can eat.....and plan to be happy.
Food was good, but not  the service.  Staff was trying to be nice ,but looked like they were worried more about the profit rather than the customer.

This place is definitely one of the best AYCE places in town. 

The fish is consistently high quality, especially their salmon cuts (which is my overall barometer on the quality of a sushi place. If the salmon sucks, so will everything else). The fish to rice ratio is also good, so you're not getting a big lump of rice with barely any fish on it.

They have a good selection of rolls, with plenty of options to enjoy.

Their appetizers are a bit lacking in serving size, but the food itself is good.

Service is generally good here, especially when compared to other places where the service is usually pretty bad (I'll never understand why). A couple of times I got hit with the "second order lack of service" issue that tends to happen at AYCE places where they take forever to come back and get more orders, they'll take forever to get your second orders to you, or sometimes outright forget some or all of your orders. Every other time the servers have been attentive and gotten my food to me in a fairly prompt manner.

Prices are standard for an AYCE place (about $35 after tax, beverage, and tip).

An added bonus is they're open very late until 3AM.

My only real complaint is how amazingly small the place is. Its very difficult not to feel very cramped even when it's not that packed inside (though it usually is). Also it's small size means long waits if you don't get there at the right time.

Solid.  I am forever searching for the next Sin City Sushi now that Sin City has fallen from grace in terms of service.  It's like looking for a unicorn.  

In spite of the fact that Sushi Freak does not offer oyster shooters (my favorite), what Freak offers is pretty freaking awesome. Pun totally intended. hehe.  The sushi was very fresh and service was awesome.  Could be because the restaurant was the size of my closet, but my closet is pretty bomb and I was still impressed at how attentive everyone was.

We had a few different rolls and everything was amazing.  What can I say?  We like white people sushi and only occasionally order nigiri.  Everyone around us was eating the nigiri though and it looked fabulous. The definite way to get your $$ worth.  Take my advice, order the tuna carpaccio.  Just make sure your date has some so you both taste like garlic.

Came here for lunch today with my little family and best friend. Never been here before and I got to say for first time experience it was great. We got greeted right away and seated quick. We put in our order and right away we got our food. Really yummy. I think today was the most I ate and we ordered almost the whole menu, which is ridiculous for us. We hardly eat a lot of sushi but today it was too hard to resist. I definitely recommend this place and try their mussels and super Phil roll. Will update this when I come here a numerous time to compare my experience.

Anyone hating on an all you can eat does not appreciate the nature of the all you can eat.  You are here to double up, maybe triple up, in terms of the food you eat.  Sushi Koma, perfect place to make your $25 an easy $100.  Half rolls, check, nigiri can be saucy, but lets get real.  all you can eat

We love Sushi Koma. We have been coming here for about 3 years now. Aileen is great. She is always welcoming and knows the menu well. She always comes over and says Hi to our son that has been coming since he was born. We highly recommend Sushi Koma.

This was my first time here and I really enjoyed the food! The service was very prompt and attentive. Our server was very professional and polite. It is a part of shopping center but has plenty of free parking and very visible from the street.

They have a lunch all you can eat special for $21.95 for lunch and then $25.95 for dinner. You can also order by the roll but they range from $9 to $14, so if you're going to eat more than two rolls it may be a better deal just to do the unlimited. They also have a variety of different beers you can choose from (Sapparo was our choice), as well as wine and sake.

They have a huge selection of sushi to choose from. You can order as much as you want as long as you finish it. I was told by my friends that they will charge you a fee if you don't eat all your food.

I would definitely recommend this place and check it out if you're in Vegas!

I ordered a house salad because I like my veggies LOL. We had stuffed green mussels, calamari, teriyaki chicken, and fried oysters for appetizers. For our main courses, we had the Tiger roll, Volcano Roll, Japanese lLasagna Roll, Shrimp Tempura Roll, Spider Roll and Scallop Roll. For dessert we had strawberry and mango Mochi and green tea ice cream.

Wow. Just wow. First off I just moved to Vegas from California. I must say it was very refreshing when I ordered salmon and tuna sashimi and my tuna was bright red! I cannot tell you how many times I've gone out to eat sushi in California and the tuna was a soft pink. That's how you know it's not fresh. The salmon was to die for! The texture and The Taste was on point and it just melted in my mouth. The roles were all a good size. But above everything else, I would give this sushi restaurant 10 stars for their service! They seriously provided the best service I've ever had in my life. This is my first time, but it definitely will not be the last. I feel like this will be a regular!
Ordered Ponzio and it was delicious. Top of the heart sushi made with dedication. A hidden gem place that I will keep coming back to.

My bf and I have been to many sushi places in Summerlin and NONE come close to the service and fresh fish here! We went Thurs. Before Memorial weekend. One server and one busser. The place was full!  The server kept her cool, greeting, seating, answering the phone and taking orders. As a server from experience, I was definitely impressed! THIS IS OUR SUSHI PLACE HANDS DOWN!
Place was great. All you can eat sushi, great sake! Staff was prompt friendly and very helpful ordering so much food. I was in a Koma for sure! Great place
We went to there late night but there was include us 6team was there. There sushi was fresh and good quality of rolls. It was clean but loud. It is good for adult but not for kids.

My friends and I wanted to do Goyemon at 9pm, but the wait was two hours long. Uhh, okay, plan B?

I remembered reading about Sushi Freak on Yelp, and they were only a few miles away, so we called them up. No wait, you say? Interesting. When we got there at around 9:30, there was nobody around but us and the employees. Yeah, they weren't kidding.

If the indicator of a good AYCE sushi experience is the intensity of the food coma that you get afterward, then this one has to rank among the best. The variety and quality of appetizers is pretty ridiculous, and I didn't even get to try the dynamite or the beef teriyaki. Only managed to try four of their many rolls as well. The nigiri was solid. I've gotta come back here eventually, and I definitely envy people who live on this side of town because they have Goyemon and a place that made me forget mostly about Goyemon for one night.

(short version of the review ends here... read on for details that I felt obligated to include)

We had a bunch of appetizers first, appropriate enough. Yeah, they were pretty "freaky." One app was fish on a mini tostada mixed with diced tomatoes and sprinkled with crunchy garlic slices. Pretty good! And those brie and grape quesadillas, whoa. They're a nice cleanser between spicy or tangy portions. The tuna carpaccio was also really delish and featured the crunchy garlic. The sashimi roll didn't seem that flavorful to me though. Oh yeah, obviously we had to have the mussels, which are actually 5 per order. Loved them. All of these were pretty much one order per person, but that's fine since you still wanna have room for later.

Speaking of which... the nigiri and rolls were just as enjoyable. I'm lame, so I picked the lemon slices off the salmon nigiri and the jalapenos off the yellowtail (after I bravely tried one piece). Oh yeah, we were able to get garlic tuna and cajun albacore (latter by waitress suggestion), which I don't think were on the menu. Garlic tuna wasn't the best I've had around Vegas, but cajun albacore is up there. For some reason, the super white ("white tuna") was really great the first time and not so good the second time. Maybe we were just that hungry? But then again, my sweet shrimp heads arrived near the very end of our session, and I still enjoyed those a lot.

Dessert for me was mochi and my buddy's green tea ice cream. They have a lot of mochi flavors compared to other places, and I picked coffee, which was just awesome. The ice cream was also good, and it seemed to be a larger portion than I usually see. That and the shrimp heads were a nice end to a nice meal.

Overall, service was pretty good. Waitress seemed a bit flustered all night, miscounting utensils and forgetting to state policies up front, but she did give us some nice suggestions to order from the "secret" menu, including that tostada. The speed was nice though. Actually, our (large) first order was coming out so fast that she offered to ask them to slow it down a little. Not bad at all. Also, the employees' shirts even told us to freak until 3 am. Yeah, I think I could live with their attitude. Maybe I'll do a late night jaunt some time to see if they live up to that. Or maybe I'll go at lunch instead... the lighting tonight seemed a little dim to me. Would've loved to see the colors stand out more, but live with what you can I guess.

Be prepared to pound the pavement after the extra 100 pounds of sushi you'll destroy at Sushi Koma!!!

I have heard whispers of sushi Koma from a few people in town but never really thought to much about heading there as the few sushi places in my area are pretty decent ala Naka Sushi, and sometimes once you
find a good sushi restaurant you don't like to stray to far as you might feel like your cheating on them with the new hot sexy thang that's just walked past.

Arriving at Koma we had some friends arrive   Earlier and grab a table as the line was out the door and waiting might not have been fun in the heat.

Grabbing a few beers to start with, we ordered the AYCE, as sampling the whole menu is always the challenge that never gets completed. Tuna Carpaccio to start off was legit and highly recommended. After blowing through quite a few rolls id also recommend the Elephant Roll as I think we got two orders it was that good.

Overall 
Service: 4-5
Price: $$$
Food: 4-5
Drink: 4-5
Coming Back: oh yeah

I was satisfied with "all you can eat menu". Great baked sushi options (my favorite). 

The place is very nice, clean and comfy.

The rolls and nigiri are pitifully small, much like the dining space. Even the table we were seated at was tiny, only two feet wide, barely large enough to house our drinks and a single plate each.

The tuna carpaccio was almost fully cooked and covered with burnt garlic. The amount of tuna served was smaller than my pinky finger, though it's supposed to be a $10 dish. I'm not the biggest eater yet I ate easily over $100 worth of sushi (got the AYCE) and still walked hungry. That's how embarrassingly small the serving sizes are.
Hands down one of the best sushi experiences I've ever had. Sushi was really fresh and the service was second to none. Definitely worth a detour off the strip.

Moved to a new location (in the same area, just on the other side of the parking lot). Much more room now. The sushi is still as great as ever. Going on 3 or 4 years now and this is still one of my top AYCE sushi joints.

I decided to meet a friend for dinner on a random Thursday night. Being new to Vegas I was pleased to find that this place was accessible and easy to find. There was a nice crowd of people but they seemed really understaffed. The server was so sweet but was in such a rush every time she came to our table that she ended up misunderstanding my order.

My friend went with the all-you-can-eat special but I only ordered one roll and a seaweed salad. The portions were ridiculously small and I was extremely unimpressed with the sashimi roll from the appetizer list. I felt rushed to order it and that was her only recommendation when I asked about the possibility of any rice-less specialty rolls. When we were ready to pay she informed me that she had made a mistake with my order and the reason the portions were so small is because they were a-la-carte. She assumed I was doing the AYCE special like my friend. An honest mistake...I guess. The music that was playing was the best part of the whole experience.  I felt like I wasa eating sushi at a nightclub!

Overall though, I probably wouldn't come back here again.

Great sushi, even better service. The space is unique, a bit small but not in a cramped or uncomfortable way. The sake was tasty and there were some unique rolls and appetizers, like the tuna carpaccio. The menu was broken down in a helpful way. The price could be more competitive but a great dinner option.

I'm not big on all you can eat sushi however I am into great sushi!  The reason I don't normally like all you can eat sushi is it is not the best quality of fish.  This place has a wonderful selection of good quality sushi, I was very impressed.  

The chefs are great and quick, the wait staff are really nice and always filling your drinks they seem to treat you like family.  The owner was working behind the sushi bar and we started talking he was one of the chefs who opened one of the large sushi places on the strip he followed his dream and opened his own place Sushi Freak.  

He has little twists on a lot of what we ordered some had a touch of sauce or a little something special on them, the rolls are good and you can get a half roll so you can break up the meal.  He has a lot of experience designing and creating some great dishes my favorite of the night was the Tuna Carpaccio YUM!  He was extremely generous and no qualms about you eating your fill and even offers more once you are full.  So for an all you can eat sushi I will definitely be back for seconds and thirds...  Next time I think we are going to let him decide what we eat and just try some of his creations!

The last review I wrote about this place was 4 years ago.  After my visit last night with friends, I felt compelled to write another one because after 4 years it is STILL the BEST place to get sushi in Las Vegas. I've been in California for almost 3 years and simply refuse to eat any sushi out there for fear that it won't taste like Sushi Koma. That's why whenever I come "home" to Vegas,  Sushi Koma is ALWAYS on my to-do list. My friends and I had dinner there last night and once again,  Sushi Koma did not disappoint!!! If you're deciding where to go and you're reading this review,  look no further...I guarantee you will thank me!!!
I highly recommend this place to any sushi lovers!!! The sushi rolls are amazing and anything with yummy sauce is a must try! I have been here 4 times now and they are consistently tasty!!!

I can't do the "all you can eat" sushi here because I don't eat that much, but I've chosen my favorite sushi rolls and they're always good. The spicy tuna is REALLY spicy so be careful. Other than that, it's a super cute little place.

This is my favorite place to go for sushi! The space is a little small, but personally I don't mind at all. I've been going here for about 2 years and yes, I've had my fair share of servers who do not seem happy or energetic at all. However, they don't last long and the great servers are always so friendly and happy to help! 
As for the fish, I feel that the quality is great for an AYCE sushi place! They have a wide variety of options and so many delicious things to try! I will definitely keep coming here for sushi!

Best sushi on the west side!!
Great food and service, very fresh fish plus many other creative dishes to enjoy!!
Open late and lots of parking available.
I would recommend to anyone looking for great sushi at a reasonable price!

Wow, what's with these 4 n 5 stars.  Service is good, food is subpar.  Fish is sticky and definitely not fresh.  Heavy sauce on rolls that leave bad after taste.  Expensive dish to get you into ayce.  No launch combo.  Tap water?? Really??? Just shows the quality of their food.

One too many visit wish I ate at McDonald's.

Met up with some friends from out of town for a late evening dinner. The AYCE sushi was great. Taste was very consistent (meaning everything was pretty tasty and had that same level of freshness). The staff was very accommodating and extremely friendly. Noise level was adequate enough to carry on conversation. I am definitely a fan.
For an AYCE place, the sushi is pretty good.  Very fresh.  They don't give you a ton of rice to fill you up like most AYCE places.  Will definitely go back.

The best sushi spot in the west   
Kimmy roll  everything is good!! 
Staff is the best, open till 3 am

Food was awesome and the service is wow everyone was so nice and outgoing.. it's was my first time and I enjoyed it a lot.. the waitress was so nice and helpful I forgot what this dish was called but it was rolled In shrimp and rice on the outter and thin sliced meat on top [recommend by the waitress) and man was it good.. I will surely be going back

Friendly staff.  Great environment.   Great food 
  Definitely coming back.  Hana was great.

This place had amazing sushi!

Get their hot green tea! Seriously it is different from your usual expectations of green tea (in the good way). Probably the best I've tasted. 

MY ONLY COMPLAINT: The area is small though and what I really didn't like was sitting at the bar and the waiters were constantly reaching above me to grab other orders (mine and other parties). It was uncomfortable!!! I felt like they could've went around to grab the sushi instead of consistently splitting my party in half to reach for sushi. 

If you're going to go here you might as well do the all you can eat! It makes it worth it.

Back when this place was owned and operated as Brian's Beach Sushi (then later as Sushi Freak), the food quality was superb and portioned accordingly. Nowadays, despite the good service, the food quality and portions is merely but a shadow of its former self. And at the end of the day, you always judge a restaurant by the food they serve not just by how it's served. We always ordered the limited quantity sashimi roll, tuna carpaccio, uni and sweet shrimp sushi. I say limited because despite the place being ALYCE, these items can only be ordered once--and that's fine as long as the portions are good. The thing is, now they have decided to make the sashimi roll half the size (for comparison, the roll slices were dollar-sized before and now they are quarter-sized), the tuna carpaccio plate went from a foot-long serving plate to a small petri dish, and the same downsizing goes with everything else compared to what it was when Brian ran the place. It's understandable if you reduced the price and thus reduced your portions to stay profitable, but I rather would pay more than get skimped on. In any case, I suppose there are other better options out there and we'll be going less and less to this place if they continue the downward trend of lesser quality (and OMG they rice-pack their sushi topped disproportionately with teeny fish!).
love this place so much. food is amazing, great server. will definitely re-visit.
Came skeptical, left happy. Decided to go for the all-you-can-eat dinner and had tons of great fish. Service was amazing too. Will be back...

This place is by far my favorite sushi restaurant in all of Las Vegas! I'm a big fish eater and I go out for sushi often. This place over and over serves the freshest fish and offers the best service. The owner is on the floor 90% of the times I have walked in and you can really tell this man has a passion for what he does. Always friendly, always enthusiastic and he does everything from taking orders to bussing tables, making sure the restaurant stays on top of everything and everyone. This type of hard work and "care" is so hard to find, please check it out for yourself!

It's a small spot and I am sure of it sooner than later he will need a much bigger place as it gets busier every time I stop by. I totally suggest the sashimi dinner, super fresh fair price and lots of food. The other great part is these guys stay open until 3am! I am in the industry and work crazy late hours so this is super convenient, it's hard to find good food late!

SK is dope!
Been a part of my training diet for quite awhile now -Always fresh fish, everytime.
Chefs are fun and good at what they do, as are the waitresses -They are awesome.
I've had alot of Sushi, and this little place is worth making your spot.

For food: 5 stars. For service: 3 stars is generous. My party of three went to Sushi Koma on a busy Friday night. We placed our orders (2 AYCE dinners, and one dinner entre for our non-sushi eater.) We ordered just a few things to get started, and were impressed when not five minutes later the first part of our order rolled out: a couple of rolls, and a gyoza app for our non sushi eater. We tucked in, looking forward to a nice meal. (OMG, tuna carpaccio with roasted shaved garlic! Amazing!) It was a busy night, but the place is small, and there were three chefs working the bar, and four servers, who were very attentive and sweet, BUT... totally disorganized. 

All four of the servers seemed to be working our table, and while one of them would come around every few minutes to ask if we'd like to order something else, we had to keep replying that unfortunately, we were still waiting on items we'd already ordered and didn't want to order more than we could eat. There seemed to be no centralization of orders, and while having four attentive, very friendly servers is awesome, having just one server who made sure that our orders came out correctly and in a timely fashion would have been better. We had to ask for the rest of our order five times, and our non sushi friend waited about 45 minutes for his chicken teriyaki bowl. We were there for over two hours, and while the food was excellent, the efficiency and accuracy of the service was not.

One of the servers later apologized and explained that our entire second round order was given to another table by mistake. We waited about half an hour with no items delivered. With AYCE, at least you're not going to be charged for something you ordered, but didn't receive, but it's still annoying. We eventually got everything we ordered, but wouldn't have if we hadn't kept track of it ourselves. The food was wonderful, and the service was well intentioned and friendly, so I'm willing to give them another try, but I won't come when I'm in a hurry, or if there's someone I want to impress. I want to spend my meal enjoying my food, and not tracking down orders because one of my dining companion hasn't gotten his entre. 

Tuna carpaccio, seafood tostada, sashimi roll, and chicken teriyaki apps are a must! The Elephant roll and Stephanie rolls were great!

Really love sushi, literrally never leave unsatisfied. The service is ukbeat, very cool enviroment with mixture of music genres cycling through. Only thing is I have seen rolls presented tighter and neater. Very good experience makr sure to get half rolls. They put a lot of rice on their nori for the AYCE. 

Our server Hannah was very attentive and always had a smile. Keep up the good work.

This is probably my newest favorite place for sushi! I didn't know what to expect, but i was pleasantly surprised! Their rolls were not over stuffed with rice and from what I had the nigri was super fresh. We sat in front of the owner and he kept our food coming steadily. He actually was making things for my husband, like the mackerel or the super white tuna, which both these items he generally doesn't like but liked it at Sushi Freak! I love that he added sea salt and lemon to the octopus and he did the same with the scallops! 

Service was awesome! The 3 ladies working there were very attentive and so were the sushi chefs. I definitely will be back and they have a great assortment of rolls that a pregnant lady, like me can eat that doesn't have tuna or raw fish! Definitely a place to go for AYCE great sushi!

First off - this an an AYCE joint. Lunch $22, Dinner $26. It's open until 3am!

Onto the food! This place has some interesting menu items for sure. Brie and grape quesadilla? Where did that even come from? Still, I can't knock it because I did not try it. When you sit down, they'll bring out some deliciously salted hot edamame which is a perfect nom before the storm that is AYCE.

Their nigiri list includes all of the usual suspects and some off the menu items such as garlic tuna and Cajun albacore. One of the stars of the menu is the Ahi Tuna Carpaccio which is really a tataki, not carpaccio at all. It has a lovely sear and is topped with green onion, garlic chips, ponzu and yum yum sauce. I'd recommend skipping the yum yum sauce. Highlights for the nigiri: Ono, hamachi, hotate, Cajun albacore and maguro. Skip the tamago - it isn't made in house. The tako is also not worth ordering, it's super tough.

Unfortunately, this place seems to be hit or miss. I've been twice in the same week and the first time was unbelievably  good and fresh! Upon eating the ono (super white tuna) I realized how watery all of the other fish I've been eating is! The second time around was a total miss and I only ate four orders of nigiri which is a record low for me. So if you go, hopefully it's a good night, because when it's good, it is a-maz-ing. Best quality fish I've had for Las Vegas AYCE.

Another noteworthy aspect of this restaurant is the little touches they add to each order of nigiri. Serrano chile for the hamachi, lemon slices for the salmon. This can either be a good thing or a bad thing. Every now and then a garnish to compliment the fish is welcome by me, but when every order is garnished, it becomes too much and I'd rather focus on the fish.

Other hot menu items: The gyoza- I'd skip it, it's only decent. The shrimp tempura- smaller than usual shrimp, slightly heavy and greasy batter. The spicy tuna hand roll (with avocado)!- the spicy tuna here has a distinct Korean funk about it; it's heavily seasoned and redolent of gochujang.

Oh, if you like rolls, there was a large selection conveniently separated into fried, baked, shrimp tempura etc. sections for ease of finding what you want.

After reading reviews on Yelp, I thought I would give this AYCE a try with 8 of my friends. I was extremely disappointed. We all ordered and the first thing I ordered was a spicy tuna cut roll. Once my friends started to receive their orders (complicated speciality rolls)  I was expecting my order but it was no where to be seen. I was very patient and decided not to ask the waitress since I thought mine would be following soon. 

10 minutes after my friends received their rolls, they started to order another round. I then asked the waitress about my Spicy Tuna hand cut roll and (I can't make this up) this is the response I received, "You already ordered that and it's coming. So you want to order another one before you get your first!?" First of all, I don't need an attitude. I was just asking why I haven't received the ONE item I ordered in the past 20 minutes! Once everyone else starts receiving their second round..I finally get my order!  

The rest of my party was finishing up eating so I didn't want to order any more sushi instead I ordered Green Tea Mochi Ice Cream. You would think that should only take a couple of minutes.. NOPE! Not at Sushi Koma! So after 10 minutes passed, they bring us the bill and still.. no Green Tea Mochi Ice Cream. I asked the waitress and I got another smart response, "You already put that order in with the other waitress, it's coming." At that point, I was furious and didn't say anything because I didn't know what horrible words would come out of my mouth.

 I looked at our bill and since we had a large party, automatic gratuity was added on there. No wonder our waitress didn't care about us, she was getting a nice tip no matter what. As our party started to leave the table guess what they bring out... yup you guessed it! My Green Tea Mochi Ice Cream. I took one bite since we were already leaving.

 As we were leaving the waitress finally asked us, "How was everything?" I said, "Absolutely terrible. I only had two items delivered to me during my 'AYCE' dinner and every time I asked you about my orders, you gave me an attitude." She then tried to touch my shoulder and attempted to apologize since her manager was watching. I just walked away. 

When we went to eat, it wasn't even crowded! There were 3 people at the bar and only 1 other table with 4 people on it!! I will NEVER EVER come here again! What terrible service. Maybe they can't handle the stress of serving a big party. There were also multiple waitresses!! Regardless, I don't need an attitude with my dinner. Had the waitress served us without an attitude, it would have been a different experience.

This experience is one of the reasons why I created a Yelp account. I had to share this horrific dining experience. DO NOT EAT HERE.
Love this place! It has become our number 1 sushi restaurants! Great selection of fine quality fish and great service. Tuna carpaccio is the bomb!!!!

First visit- Ste 106 was the old location & was a shoebox, it was tiny, but the vibe was funky- cool- trendy. The service was great, our server checked in with us, and got our new orders for more sushi rolls (they can do half rolls, BTW). This was our exploring our new area/ celebrating Mother's Day lunch spot. And it was delicious. Hubby's faves were Japanese lasagne and Dynamite (both baked, so it takes some time). Kids meals are $9.99. Our son had the teriyaki chicken. He loves chicken. 

Second visit, new location, Ste 126 & 127, for my birthday lunch (AYCE is a splurge for us). For many years, we went to Yama, and since coming here for Mother's Day, we are Sushi Koma fans! I love the way it is set up here, it's more comfortable. The restaurant can seat 70 guests. The front counter and sushi making station are at an angle, parallel to each other. So, the seating in the middle follows. And then on each side there is also seating bordering the walls. (Hoping that makes sense.) The single sex bathrooms are in the back (clean, also very nice, kept within the overall theme of the restaurant). The music is on point (remixes with great beats) and I love the blend of original unframed art pieces and positive messages. The furniture is dark wood. It is one of the nicest looking sushi bars in town.

The service was excellent, our main server, Janie (not sure about the spelling), was pretty attentive and even heated up our son's miso soup (that was very nice of her). It looked like there were five people working there total (the sushi makers were both Asian). We had miso soup, eggrolls, & edamame for our apps. Also had the Spicy Tuna, PB, Japanese Lasagne (baked), & Dynamite (also baked) to name a few. Delicious. And a nice way to celebrate my birthday. (Glad we discovered it.) I had the green tea ice cream, and my loves had the chocolate mochi. Mmm. I love this place.

There were five or six other parties there. On a thursday, for lunch, it's decent. 

Yes, we'll be back, it's one of our favorites.

The seared tuna carpaccio, ninja roll and elephant roll were pretty delicious.  The vibe is trendy, however a tad bit cramped.  Not a fan of the low rise sushi bar counter, but that's just my preference.  Not a bad price for AYCE dinner.  There's plenty of parking.  The music is nice and I like how ventilated the establishment is.  The food was good enough and overall the experience was positive.

We were in dire need of a new sushi place since the quality and service changed significantly at our old favorite sushi joint.  One of our cousins recommended this place and we decided to give it a go. 

It's a SMALL restaurant. I can imagine on busier days for the wait to be significantly long with no where to sit and wouldn't be surprised if the max occupancy is 30 people. Larger groups would probably have to rent the entire space out lol.

They do have AYCE, for dinner it was $25+ My go to items are Garlic Tuna and Raw/Fresh Scallops and both items were way beyond what I was expecting, damn good. 

Service was great, only complaint is that the servers need a better outlet or designated area for them to receive sushi orders. We sat at the bar and kept having to move so that the servers could reach the orders for the other patrons. It wasn't a big deal but sure was annoying. 

New fav spot!

We gave it a second shot here since some people really love this place. I figured, you've got to give it a second try because maybe it was just a bad day. 
I've still got my personal faves at other AYCE sushi places. Im sad to say that this second try was my last attempt. It was exactly like what I remembered.
Great service and fresh fish. They also have an extensive AYCE menu. The only reason I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 is because I've had better and their hand rolls were mainly rice.

Me and husband went there because of all the good reviews but we were disappointed at the quality of the rice, it was super mushy it had no texture it spoiled the taste of every single roll  and the nigiri as well. The fish quality was ok but couldnt get past the fact that the rice was horrible. 
   Green Mussels were not tasty at all they were xtra rubbery, dry, wrinkly like they were very old. 
   Its a shame because I really wanted to like this placed since its close to my house, and actually the place itself is really nice and cozy and the staff is superfriendly and attentive. TOO BAD!

OMG. First thanks to Yelp for helping us find this place. 

It is a small place but outstanding. When ordering, order half rolls if you want room to try more. Like everyone else has said - very fresh, very good, well priced. They have high chairs FYI. We had A+ service. Asked our server for suggestions and she was right on. Will definitely be back.  They are open until 3 AM.

Here is the truth ony was server was fantastic they was there and working hard but food was sucks ,horribe sushi cut all over was mess ,taste was not there sorry guys need to get this right never again and forget dont try all u can eat becasue then cant offer nothing all alakarte lol was so funny what ever ? ask was they cant give to me was so funny and ? pay almost 70$ for nothing

Ok, so I absolutely love sushi! By far my favorite. I read reviews about this place and they were good. So, here I am. It was not the worst, but not even close to good.  Nothing was bad. Fish to rice ratio was good. Sauces were good. Variety was lacking. Servers were great! Dessert options bad! The appetizer items that people raved about in their reviews were all no good. Edible, but that is that. So not feeling satisfied. Won't come back. Wish I drove out of the way to one of my favorite sushi places! There is always next week!

Very rarely do I rate a place 5 stars. Usually because a place doesn't deserve it. This place deserves 6 if I could give them 6. This was the first time trying Sushi Koma and I will be a regular for sure. 
The place itself is small but when you walk in honestly that is what gives it it's appeal. The decor is cute and the entire staff seems so relaxed and works together cheerfully. 
One trick is to order a few hints at once because they do get busy. 
There wasn't anything on the menu that i tried that I didn't like. The fish was fresh the rolls tasted uniquely different as they should. I loved the rolls that were smaller too. I wish I had taken more pictures. Price was well worth it and comparable to other sushi places. 

Can't wait to go back.

My sushi cravings took over me so I was in need of a fix.  When i first walked in, i noticed all of the artwork displayed on the walls. The hand painted Japanese cherry blossoms add an authentic vibe. It's a small little joint so it felt like an obstacle course of trying not to touch people. The waitress asked if we were ready to order but asked for a few minutes. 10 minutes later and no one came by to check on us. We even had to catch one of them when they're trying to serve other people to get our order in. A couple that actually arrived 20 minutes later than us got their first order of sushi... Wtf?! The nigiri and appetizers came out quick so I thought it was going to get better. We mostly ordered nigiri because the boyfriend didn't want the coma from the carbs. You would think it would take a minute to make. Our final order of nigiri took 15 minutes. It took another 10 minutes to get our check. Countless of times the waitresses passed by and didn't bother to ask if we were doing okay or if we need anything. Even some of the sushi chefs were busy talking and looking behind the flat screen to make our food. I didn't even get dessert because it probably would take another hour. Sorry but it's not worth the $21 lunch.

We've been in town for 3 days so far and have eaten here twice already! 

Really good Nigiri, you can order half rolls when you do AYCE, and with a party of 13, we got great service!

This place for AYCE is fantastic. They give you large pieces of sashimi and little bit of rice. No skimping at all. The fish quality is decent and I've been to a couple other places (hibachi on the top of my head) and this place has the best sushi. I only ate their sushi didn't try any of the rolls so can't speak much about it. What I know is great service good big pieces of fish you guys rock! Will be back possibly tonight lol

I was super exciting to come to this place after all the good reviews. Finally decided to come on a Sunday afternoon. Me and three of my friends have arrived at 2pm. The restaurant was small and there were only three tables beside us. (Two persons per table) One server and two chefs in the restaurant, it is short of stuffs for a Sunday afternoon. After we been waiting 20-25mins, three of the rolls and two salads have arrived. We thought the food should be here faster because most of the AYCE places are speedy. All the food from our table was down into our tummy, but rest of the order hasn't came. 45mins has passed, some of the food finally has delivered. We been sitting in the restaurant for an hr, we were still not even half way full. Why?! Because they are at turtle speed status!! It is ridiculously slow and the food wasn't extremely yummy. It is really disappointing!!!

We were celebrating grandson's 15th birthday.  We did the "All you can eat". Got our monies worth. The guys were great, friendly and attentive. A birthday cake was served  making for a happy grandson.  

We plan to bring other family members to enjoy the excellent food. Thanks Guys!

I'll admit that the size of their fish reduced over time but their service is still top notch. I came here with my bf to celebrate his birthday. It was a Friday night and obviously busy. We sat on the sushi bar, close to the door so we get cold whenever people come and go but we were so hungry that we didn't want to wait for a table. My first visit here was when they first opened, and I remember how their nigiri sizes used to be. So yes, I'm a little disappointed that over time they resorted to decreasing their fish size but we're also talking business here, so I understand. I still love their baked mussels and that tostada and their albacore, amaebi, and white tuna was waaay too freaking fresh. I was a bit sad that their dessert menu is minuscule compared to other AYCE places. So far, two stars are taken off. But their customer service is simply the best I've had in a while and that alone gains this place a solid star. Their servers (and even the sushi chefs) were attentive and friendly towards the customers. Our drinks were always refilled and they never fail to keep coming back to ask us our orders. I hope they get a chance to expand some day. Their location is pretty small and that's one of the main reason I don't come here as much as I want... I'm a bit claustrophobic.
Good, tasty fresh sushi. Small portions of rice. Definitely worth every penny. Sushi is well prepared with a special touch. If you are not that hungry you can order a shirashi plate.

Sushi was delicious!  The services was amazing.  The place was very efficient and cozy.  
LC

Used to be Brians sushi and it was then but now it's way better. Most all u can eat sushi places have bad service, but I was impressed with the service and owner. He was friendly and kept giving us different nigiri to try even when we didn't order it.  Very impressed!!
My boyfriend and I always come here this past time we went we had mentioned we were in a rush and they had our food out within minutes of placing the order. Favorite all you can eat

If I wrote this 3 years ago, I'd be giving 4 stars. We used to love this place, but recently, it's gone really down hill. They used to cut the fish thin and perfect, now it's so thick, it's close to being inedible.
