Last night, our most recent experience there, will def be our last. We were sitting in the middle of the room in one of the booths, and still being ignored. Every time we wanted to order something, we had to try to flag someone down, still being ignored. Once we finally got someone's attention, she placed her tray full of dirty dishes on our table and walked away and left it there... disgusting. When we were done, we sat for about 10-15 minutes while we tried to get someone's attention to order ice cream and our check. Lately it seems that they prefer quantity over quality, and it used to be the other way around. Very sad.

I've been here twice, once when it was Sushi Freak and another time recently.  They've improved from the last time I've been here.  I remember not liking their specialty appetizers because they just didn't work for me.  But now they taste pretty good.  The tuna carpaccio is drowning in sauces and fried garlic that I don't taste any fish, but the sauce and garlic go very well together.  For their sashimi roll, I remember I didn't like it because it was pretty much piece of fish stuck inside a thick piece of radish. Now they slice the radish very thin so that it doesnt overpower the fish in their roll.  The changes they've made to their appetizers turned me into a fan of Sushi Koma.  

Some rolls were a hit or miss.  My friends and I really liked the Kimmi and Big B roll.  We didn't enjoy the Fish Paradise or Pania roll. The nigiri was delicious!  The salmon had a "fluffy, melts in your mouth" consistency, as my friend puts it, and we couldn't stop ordering more.  And the rice:fish ratio was perfect!

The servers are really friendly and since the restaurant is really small (I think there were about 6 tables and the bar) it feels very intimate and it's not too loud.  

*they have exotic flavored mochi like coffee and green tea!

My favorite sushi place in vegas.  Eaten there 4 times and I never left disappointed.   First tried it because Dessert magazine voted it to have the best quesadilla in vegas with its Brie and grape quesadilla.  While that is excellent I love their sushi even more.  They have an extensive list of specialty rolls stuffed with avocado and cream cheese.  My favorite rolls on the menu are the double d and the Tod.  When I'm getting towards the end I order a pania and a a d.a which are desert like with their sweet tempura.  Last of all I finish with a Vegas roll which is not on the menu. Stuffed with scallops and cream cheese.  Perfect way to end

Probably my favorite AYCE in town. Large portions of fish with every order, a lot of AYCE restaurants will try to skimp on the fish. My favorites include their yellowtail carpaccio and their fresh fish rolls. Large selection of sake and a lot of original rolls. Their new location (same shopping center) is so much bigger allowing more staff and seating so there is no longer a wait or service issue. It's decor is swanky and is definitely an upgrade from their old space. Danica is the best waitress and gives exceptional service!

Came here with some friends for late night munchies and this place was conveniently open and close. We ordered some nigiri and the rice portion is super small. Which is amazing, makes you less full so you eat more (no wonder you get a "koma"). The salmon already comes with lemon, which was convenient!  But the must try here is definitely their white tuna, sashimi roll, and seared tuna carpaccio. The food came in a fairly manner which allows you to pace yourself. Given that fact it also makes you fuller as time passes. The ambience of this place is nicely dim but is really small for an all you can eat place. Making it seem full and busy. So the wait might be a little longer due to the size of the place but it most definitely worth the wait. The wait is hardly a problem because they seem to have people in and out at a timely manner. The service here is fantastic, we adore our waitress! She was attentive and quick. If you're reading this ?? You go Glenn coco! ! Do you ! And stay golden!! But overall this place is a must come. The white tuna is so soft and smooth, tasting super fresh! While the seared tuna carpaccio had so much flavor with yum yum sauce and eel sauce making it sweet yet savory at the same time. While the sashimi roll may be small there is a flavorful punch to it due to the daikon radish they use to wrap the sashimi pieces. The only down side of this place is the dessert but it's still a good selection with ice cream and several mochi flavors. I mean honestly I don't really care much for desert due to the fact that I usually go get boba tea after sushi anyways.

Came here on a whim because I NEEDED sushi. After seeing the yelp reviews, I knew we couldn't go wrong. 

Like a lot of sushi restaurants, this place was crowded and seating was tight. We opted for the dinner special menu instead of the all-you-can-eat or sushi al a carte. I'm a big fan of sushi dinner specials because you can usually get a roll, miso soup, rice, a meat of some sort (chicken, fish, etc.), tempura, and appetizers (gyoza, egg roll). For $14 you really can't go wrong if you're on a budget. We had so much food, we had to take it home. 

The food was fantastic. I got the teriyaki chicken special: chicken, white rice, miso soup, 1 gyoza, 1 egg roll, 6 pieces veggie tempura, and a 6 piece california roll. OMG so much food!!! 

I especially loved the gyoza! A lot of places I've been will have these super greasy, but these weren't at all. 

Def. coming back here!

Best place ever! I've been going here for the last 5 years hahaha I've tried other places in between but always come back to this place! The service is above the rest and the timing for the food is just perfect. They always try to accommodate your needs. Thank you for existing I'd hate to go to another sushi place again.

I really don't know why this place is getting 5's. I'm really reluctant to give out too many 5's because a 5 star to me is TOP NOTCH stuff. This place is super hyped. There's nothing really special about this place other than a few special rolls that don't pack much of a punch.

Seaweed Salad: 3/5 They're seaweed salad is prepared a bit different taste the same though as most places. I think this place LOVES SAUCE. I HATE things being over sauced. Their seaweed salad came with a drizzle of a yellow sauce on top of it. It made no difference to the flavor. Tasted like a normal seaweed salad a little more watery than usual. 

Their version of poke: 2/5 Wasn't impressed, I was very disappointed that they didn't have an Ahi poke every places has this. Instead they had a Spanish version of poke. It was like tuna with salsa on top of a chip.

D.A. Roll: 1/5 I'm not much into deep fried rolls so this wasn't something I ordered. They mistakenly brought it to my table but since we had AYCE we didn't mind eating it. 

Sashimi Roll: 4/5 The only special thing I kind of liked on the menu. I was blown away when yelpers said there was a sushi spot that made sashimi rolls. I had to try it. Basically its your assorted fish wrapped with a thin slice of radish. The radish adds an odd flavor to the sashimi that makes the roll a bit sour and yucky. 

Nigiri: 4/5 Probably the only good thing about this place. The ratio of Fish to rice was just perfect 50/50. Yet we all know more fish than rice is what we really want. The fish was really fresh too. The salmon nigiri came with thin slices 

Tuna carpaccio:0/5 EKK OVERLY SAUCED! The thin slices of tuna were super thin and it was drenched with sauces. The caramelized toasted garlic added an eerie flavor. The Tuna Carpaccio I absolutely hated it. 

Baked Green Mussel: 4/5 The Baked green mussels were delicious not as sweet as orders and it was cut into 3 pieces than your usual 2 pieces. Unfortunately its 1 order person which makes it limited. 

AYCE: 3/5 Is limited all you can eat is suppose to be ALL YOU CAN EAT but here it seems like more than 10 items are LIMITED to one order per person. I don't like that.. I hate limitations lol

Overall Doubt I'll come here again, the sushi was eh okay wasn't amazing.

this place has good sushi, however the service was very slow... took about 30 minutes to get our first roll. tempura ice cream is not available on the ayce menu like most other places... we ended up ordering one only to be told they were out

The service was great! Staff gives great recommendations on sushi, everything we tried was amazing and the portions were good. The restaurant is clean and neat. The atmosphere is nice! If you want tasty sushi for a good price this is the place to go!

I went there a couple weekends ago and I could say hands down this is the best sushi iv'e ever had. Its $25 bucks for all you can eat and let me tell you, so worth it. All you pay for is your drink which is $2 for a soda. Free refills. For how busy they were, they were very fast with the food. Every roll we got we delicious. Our waitress was awesome and I will get her name next time. I regret not taking any pictures of all the food.  I am going back on Friday with some friends that haven't been there before and I will upload some pictures.
This place was cool, my buddies and i wanted sushi last minute and since it was open til 3 it was perfect. Everything tasted amazing, i only wish we didnt get full so fast so we could eat more.

Best sushi place hands down!! We come here regularly and I just can't get enough of this place.
Their costumer service is amazing, food always on point! They have a great all you can eat sushi with some pretty unique things.
If you want to try something different, I highly recommend the dynamite, it is absolutely delicious!! They have a fabulous tuna carpaccio with thin slices of garlic.
Also, they have a kids menu that can either be a la Carte or all you can eat, sweet!
I just wish they wouldn't have a limit on the really good stuff but it's part of their deal. 
It's a must go to place if you like sushi and appreciate all you can eat, you won't be disappointed!

I love sushi , also looking to try out new spots. The guy that helped us, (wish I had gotten his name). He was really patient with us wile we looked the menu over, then helped us decide what to eat and some of the number one orders. We went around 1:30am witch was great because everything else was close. The food came out within seconds and tased great, the presentation was perfect . I couldn't ask for more, I had all you can eat so it came out to $58 witch I hope  paying $70 was ok. Price was fair and the atmosphere was settled, they had casual music playing and everything looked clean to the touch. Definitely coming back

Favorite sushi place! Recommend the kimmy and almost fire. All the sashimi is good. 

AYCE $25 for dinner and $21 for lunch (before 3:00)

Hannah serves me a lot and she is attentive and adorable. 

The inside is cozy and really cute. Open late! Come here!

Awesome rolls! Awesome service!! The waitresses are very friendly and the food is fresh! Ask for the sushi tostada! It not on  the menu but it's amazing! My favorite was the Kimmy roll, my husband's, the almost hot roll.  (We think that was the name)

Generally I avoid AYCE places, especially sushi, but gave this a try with local friends.  Overall, staff was very friendly and attentive and orders arrived quickly.  Reasonably wide selection on menu.  Avoid anything with yum yum sauce which seemed like hot, melted mayonnaise. Some appetizer dishes OK, like the seafood tostada and spicy edamame, but a bit on the salty side and a bit too much fried garlic.  Best approach is to mainly order nigiri sushi, which had modest amount of rice per piece rather than mostly rice instead of fish.  A bit of concern was that the hamachi was totally different looking the second order, which brings to question whether one or the other was the same fish.

Glad I got to try out this place. The sushi was fresh and plentiful. I recommend the Super White Tuna! 

The rice was a bit mushy, but still had good flavor.

Sushi aside, the real treat is in their appetizers! I think you only get one each in the AYCE price, but they have some sort of poki tower served on a fried crisp that was absolutely outstanding! It was cuts of sashimi tossed in a citrus/soy like sauce sitting on top of a fried crisp. Then it was topped with green onions and fried garlic slices. The garlic slices is what sent the dish over the top!

The sashimi roll was very good too!

Service was great! Strike up a conversation with the chefs. They are very friendly!

Its a bit of a haul from the strip, but if you are a visitor/tourist (like me), you can take the bus straight from the strip along flamingo (between Caesars and Bellagio) all the way out to Durango.

You can spend $35 for a crappy buffet on the strip, or you can catch the bus out to Sushi Freak for some pretty good AYCE sushi! Your choice!

BOMB SUSHI, GREAT STAFF. I'm very satisfied each time I come here. Lemon eight is always my go-to, highly recommend if you like lemon. All you can eat is highly convenient & the Japanese wine is delicioussssss

I love love love this place! Very great staff, comfortable dining area, and their all you can eat is a good price. Plus they have a HUGE selection of sushi and other foods to choose from. Never have i eaten something i have disliked from this place. Such a great place for sushi. You will love it here!!
Great service and creative chef! However maybe because I went on a Monday the fish didn't taste all that fresh

This place is bomb if your a sushi lover like me. They use the freshest fish available that you literally can taste the difference. Everyone is very friendly & there always smiling. I have not eaten sushi anywhere else in the last 2 years. Chris who happens to be the owner is an awesome guy. If I could give this place 10 stars they'd have it.

We eat sushi at least once a week.  This week we decided to deviate from our usual sushi spots to try this place.  The reviews were fairly good and a couple of friends recommended this place.  

We were seated fairly quickly and being very, very familiar with AYCE sushi joints, we ordered our first round of sushi with our drink order.  The drinks were served really quickly.  

Because the tables are so close together (like about a couple of feet) you can't help to see and hear what your neighbors are ordering.  While waiting for our first sushi order our neighbors order another round of sushi (mostly nigiri), which they got in about 5 minutes.  We continued to wait for our first order.  Our other neighbors order a round of specialty rolls, which they got in about 5 minutes.  We continued to wait for our first order.  After about 15 minutes from time we placed our order the server did come out and apologize, saying the the sushi chefs were backed up.  Hard to believe when others are ordering and receiving their orders  right next to us.  We waited exactly 13 more minutes after the apology and decided to leave ( I know it was 13 minutes because I started the stop watch app on my phone).  Never tasted one bite of sushi.  We payed for our drinks, which they made sure to charge us and check the table to see if any food was actually delivered.

Guess the one star is for the great taste of our drinks (a coke and a Kirin Light)

Love it! Fresh and yummy, fast service. I think this used to be Brian's Beach. It is very small inside. We were here on a Friday night and it was busy. We had to wait maybe 15 minutes and the girl at the desk was super nice. We were allowed to order our drinks and drink them while waiting. 

AYCE is a great deal. The food comes out pretty quickly. Service is awesome. Love love love any of the rolls with yellowtail. Good sized portions, fish is fresh. Please see my photos on Yelp for a closer look. Amazing and we will be back. 

YAY!

The sushi here is excellent. Had a pretty bad experience with the service though. I waited like 15-20 minutes for the first and second round of sushi. Every other place I've been to consistently gives you sushi but here the wait time was horrible. It was the worst!! The wait was pretty bad to get in as well. Took about a full hour. Was very disappointed with that. I don't know if this happens often but just make sure you have patience when you come here.

Sushi Koma didn't give me a k/coma, but they do serve good food in a cramp and dark setting. The table for two is on the small side; just having our menu, drinks, wasabi, and ginger made things a bit cramp. When the food came, my sister placed the menu on her lap to make room. Also, you're not assigned a single waitress, it seems like they all serve you. But that made ordering and receiving chaotic because food was served in bizarre intervals. The first thing I ordered was a house salad but it didn't come until after I made a second order. Other tables around us asked their servers where their food was or to cancel their order because they didn't want to wait anymore. However, they're quick to clear your table and toss those dirty dishes on a two-story cart behind a curtain for everyone to see and hear.  

At least the food was good, except for the salad. I know, I know, ordering a ($2-$3) salad at a sushi place is like ordering a hotdog at Le Cirque (sorta), but it was just a haphazard bowl of iceberg, chopped carrots, and .5 oz of dressing (not tossed). The nigiri tasted fresh; drinks were refilled without asking; and the rolls were great and not filled with too much rice. I liked how they organized the rolls into fresh, fried, baked, and crab categories. It made ordering easier. 

I'll give them points for innovation, though. Under appetizers, you can find their own version of the quesadilla, carpaccio, and tostadas -- sushi inspired, of course. It was my first visit and it was busy, so I'll give it another chance.

Three stars for the service. This is my favorite AYCE sushi restaurant in Vegas and I love that it's open late. It wasn't even busy today and the wrong rolls ended up on our table one too many times. Our waitress clearly wrote our order down word for word and even repeated the order. Also, my sister ordered a sprite, but a guy came with a pitcher of water and refilled her cup after she said "no thank you" and left.

My boyfriend and I decided to try a new AYCE sushi place. We brought our 2 year old daughter along who loves going out to sushi with us. Waitress seats us and only brings out a water for my boyfriend and I and not our daughter. Whenever we go out to AYCE we order our daughter an order of gyoza and edamame and that it more than enough for her.

Waitress informed us that we were not able to share the gyoza we ordered and give it to our TWO YEAR OLD daughter. I was really disappointed because we have brought our daughter to OYSHI where the chef's make her her own special dish. 

We came in at 3:22 so we were charged dinner price, as well as an extra $7 for the gyoza for my daughter. The restaurant was dead so I cannot judge the service quality because there were only two other customers besides us. The waitress asked us if we were splitting checks before we were even ordered any food which was rude in my opinion. 

The sushi was okay. The restaurant did not WOW me. I will not return knowing that other sushi places I have gone to are much better accommodating to my TWO year old daughter. The restaurant just seemed so cheap to me that they weren't willing to have my daughter eat 4 pieces of gyoza off of my order?

This place is great for AYCE sushi. The pros are fast, friendly service, delicious fresh fish and a variety of options. The cons would be how small this place is and the air conditioning is a little bit over powering. Overall a great place and one of my top choices for sushi in Las Vegas.

I was so blown away by the quality of sushi the had here. The wife and I decided to give this a try looking at yelp for some great reviews. We nailed it and my wife was very happy with me. We opted for the AYCE for lunch and we were sooo happy. We love sushi and we now have a new spot plus they are open until 3am. You must try this place now. Don't let the outside fool you. You will thank me later.

Alas, I was duped.  I was conned by people claiming this place was a Mecca for AYCE sushi.  I don't think it's bad, but it's not great.  And from someone who isn't a sushi snob at all, that's pretty crap-tastic.  My wife didn't like the sushi at all.  I think we're going to have to stick to Yama Sushi, Island Sushi, or Sushi Fever.  I had the SSS roll (shrimp lover type roll), some salmon and yellowtail nigiri, the octopus roll, and a couple other rolls.  The SSS roll had a strange texture, but it was alright.  You can't go wrong with nigiri.  It was fresh and delicious.  The octopus roll had lemon rind in it.  Really?  It kills all other flavors.  It really wasn't good...

Another thing I noticed was that they put the chipotle mayo and yum yum sauce on our rolls, even though those sauces weren't in descriptions.  Normally people probably don't care, but I'm not a big fan of either.  I prefer ponzu or nothing at all.  Also, the cream cheese tasted a bit off.  We didn't get sick at all, so it wasn't spoiled, but it just didn't have a good taste to it.

Sorry Sushi Freak.  For a bill, with tip, of over $70 for two people, I'm not freaking impressed.

Third time eating at Sushi Koma. Really great atmosphere, service is quick and the wait staff are friendly and attentive. I had Adrian as our waiter but the other staff would come by and ask us if we were doing OK. Extremely friendly and always made sure our drinks were filled. They never skipped a beat! I asked if they could sear the tuna in the nigiri and they were more than happy to accommodate my request. Would highly recommend Sushi Koma to anyone wanting AYCE sushi. They're also open until 3 AM!

I ate here last night with Eric R. and Tony T. and then once a year ago around this time.  A year ago, Eric R. called and reserved seats at the sushi bar once he confirmed the Texas football game was on TV, so we came to dine and watch football.  Last night we got there around 6:45 PM on a Sunday night and it was very packed except for 4 sushi bar spots open by the door.  The host told us 2 were reserved and since we were a party of 3, we could wait for others to finish - that was fine.  Later the host said the people who made the reservations were not coming so we could sit there.

Soon, 3 people got up from the bar further into the restaurant so we asked to sit there, away from the door.  The male server/chef said sure, so we went to sit there but the host then said the reserved sign on the first seats that we were not allowed to sit on now must be moved to the other side of the bar because those customers like "seats 1 and 2" even though she said they were not coming.  The male server/chef and the host argued and finally we were allowed to sit away from the door.  After we were seated, the whole bar cleared and no one showed up for the reservation, so all of that was annoying.

Once seated we tried a lot of different things.  I had iced green tea which was nice and grassy.  The standouts for me were the mackerel and the ika with shiso leaf.  They were so good that I ordered them twice.  The mackerel was perfectly cured - not dry, too meaty, or fishy, topped with grated ginger and chopped negi.  The squid was very fresh and not too chewy.  I really enjoyed both of these the most.  The whole scallop sushi was really fresh too.

The pretty good items were the hamachi (we got belly cuts on request) with serrano pepper, salmon nigiri, tako, uni, amaebi (some were missing tails, and we requested the heads after and they were very small and oily but tasted okay).  Eric R. and Tony T. had some things I did not try, including surf clam, halibut, escolar, unagi, maguro, tamago, masago with quail egg and ikura.  They both had the teriyaki/bulgogi beef which was actually almost exactly like gyudon and pretty tasty.  I also had a yellowtail jalapeno handroll which was fine.

The bad: Tony T. and I both ordered salmon skin temaki early in the meal.  The chef tried to discourage us because "it takes at least 10 minutes" - I did not mind because it is normal to wait for the skin to bake/toast, so we said sure.  Well when it came out, I heard Tony crunch his a little but all of the skin (and there was A LOT) was just raw fat and skin, not hot or cooked at all!  I pulled all of it out and put it on a plate, and showed the chef.  I did not want another one but I wanted him to know this was unacceptable so he did not serve it to anyone else.  He apologized and said he should have checked it before serving, but this was not his fault but whoever made it in the kitchen.  I did not want another one and a server snatched it out of my hand and whisked it away.  Tony T. also ordered seared tuna carpaccio which the restaurant initially forgot and when it was delivered it looked kind of like cat food.  He said it was very salty.  For dessert the AYCE says only one mochi but Eric R. ordered 2 without any issue.  I got plum wine ice cream which tasted exactly like bubblegum ice cream and it was nasty.  Don't do it!  I should just stick with my uni as dessert policy.

Overall, it satisfied our sushi cravings in the area since Taiga and 808 Tapas were closed, but I would not rush back.  I would definitely recommend a stop here for saba and ika lovers though, because they were pretty great.  Also I second Drew A. on the pricing - if you do not do AYCE you end up paying bizarre prices like $9 for a tiny bowl of the beef.  The nigiri is priced almost $2 higher per order than other a la carte places too.  The chefs were friendly but swamped and it was very hard to order anything because they did not often look up at anyone at the bar, which was sunken.  Drinks were refilled often and the service was otherwise very good.  Open til 3 AM even on Sunday!

This is small place on the corner of Durango & Flamingo. It has a small dining area and a small sushi bar, so it fills up quick.

The service here is a little slow and the sushi chefs were not very friendly. The food is great though, so I would recommend trying it out.

My favorite sushi spot in vegas by far, and I've been to quite a few of them! Sorry Kaya lol. Customer service is on point, the AYCE is at a great price, totally got my money's worth by the end of the meal. 2 rolls and 2 appetizers and I already ordered more than the AYCE price! 

The food is also fantastic. This is all around a great sushi spot. Totally recommended 5 stars!

Go go go!

I came with an empty stomach ready for FEAST!! It was my first time coming here, it was a Friday night around 6:30pm. The wait was bearable, only about 10-15 mins, it was a packed house but all the servers were on top of their tables. 

We were always catered to, servers were filling our drinks when empty, plates were being cleared when possible and orders were always taken with efficiency! My only issue was that the span between ordering and actually receiving your order was a hefty wait time. 

I learned after order my second round of rolls that I might as well order everything I want at once because it was going to take a while because of how busy they were. 

Other than the wait time between ordering and receiving your order I love the menu, the staff and quality of food! Our server was funny and made sure we had all our orders and if we were waiting a long time he would make sure we had our order within 2 minutes! Haha it was amazing! 

I would definitely come back to try more rolls! My favorite roll of the night was the Venice roll! I couldn't tell you what's in it but it was delicious!

That krazy Gaga was playing overhead:

Can't eat my can't eat my
No I can't eat my sushi rolls
(She got no more room in tummy)
K-k-k-koma face k-k-koma face

This krazy gurl?  Full as a tick.  Entirely my fault I went into Sushi Koma at this cafe in the Desert Breeze Plaza? strip mall.  Barely any signage this eatery is there, but it is.  Right-hand side of the lot.  From the outside, it appears just a teeny non-descript hole in the wall.  Inside feels markedly different.  Nicer, inviting, contemporary.

All You Can Eat brought out the voracious freak in me.  My eyes were WAY bigger than my stomach.  Under 30 bucks is a sweet price for AYCE quality sushi.  Sake, Ama Ebi, Maguro and Hamachi nigiri were the best orders of the meal.  Uni was also pretty good.  Well this *is* the desert, so you cannot expect something like that to remain spankin' fresh, all the way from whatever port it travels.  And I was told it is driven in from L.A.  Tekka Maki, Sashimi roll, Tuna carpaccio were fine.  For the money, should have just continued with nigiri.  Over-did it though with the Elephant, Ponzio and Spider rolls. *bleurggh*

Service was biased :-\ not that warm and welcoming.. at least not to moi.  Let's just say, you'll get improved attentive-ness from waitresses, if you are a male lookin' eligible and seem to be makin' da paper.

Strategy for getting my Sushi Freak on, if there is a next time?  Starve most of the day, then nigiri all the way into another Sushi Koma.

A dimly lit sushi joint for the late nights with your friends that like to stuff their faces with oddly named rolls. Let me make it clear right now that, 98% of the time, I will never suggest going out to eat for sushi, but this was a special occasion and my friends chose to have AYCE sushi here on a Friday night.

The Arrival: The wait wasn't too long at all for my party of eight. Yes, eight! I'm guessing we got very lucky! "Sweet!" I thought. "Seated so soon? Love this place already." NOTE: I would also like to note that it says they take reservations here on Yelp, but I don't think they do.

The Folks Running This Place: Everyone was very friendly, but not all of them were knowledgeable of what the menu items were. Some looks were exchanged on the names of certain orders, but that was solved almost immediately. I wouldn't remember all of them either, if I worked there. This would be a good place to add that their menu selection is extensive! So many weird names to remember! I also asked one of the servers for a recommendation, my table loved it and we ended up ordering another.

The Overall Atmosphere: It'll seem crowded because of the size of the room. People are talking, music is playing, orders are flying out consistently, and the whole place is alive. It's all good.

The Grub: I'm not a sushi lover, but I enjoyed several of the options here, and am the kind of person who is always willing to try everything. My sushi-loving friends enjoyed their food wholeheartedly ordering one after another. Our empty plates would pile high at the end of the table.

***Here are some menu items we would recommend: seafood tostada, lemon eight roll, ninja roll, mussels, Vegas roll, salmon nigiri and the tuna carpaccio you've probably read about on here about a hundred times is definitely worth a try.

Anyway, they've got my stars. Nothing went wrong, we were treated well, and nearly everything I tried was delicious. And yes, I left full and "koma"tose!

I hate to only give three stars because the owner is really nice according to my girl that is a regular. We went there last night around 11pm. It's a small, hip, hole-in-the-wall type of sushi bar. The food was a bit overpriced, as my girlfriend also agreed upon when I mentioned how 4 pieces of small shrimp tempura is $6?! Idk, maybe I'm overreacting haha we didn't get our second water until close to the end of our meal, nor did we get our second shot glass for our sake until the second large sake bottle we ordered. We asked for extra napkins, which wasn't provided. The waitress was nice, but was gone in the back most of the time. We had to even order with the sushi chef once. Nonetheless, we still tipped 20% totaling to 65$ for 2 small sakes, 1 large sake, California rolls, shrimp and veggie tempura, crunchy rolls, and spicy tuna rolls. I guess I'm used to even recognized sushi bars having a happy hour or not being so overpriced.... I liked the music though! Haha

It's in a strip mall - you can hardly see it off the street- came in for lunch-- YES, I would come back!!!! Ordered the Brie and Grape Quesadilla- around 8 bucks it was SO different- "DELICATE" is the first word that came to my mind-- note to the Chef-- of the 8 or so pieces only about 3 had actual brie that i could taste- but im giving you 5 stars for now anyway- i like this place- COOL is the vibe of the staff-  i will return!

One of my favorite AYCE sushi places on the west side of Las Vegas! And...  only $25/per person!

Definitely try their:
First paradise, Tuna Carpaccio, Sashimi roll, and the salmon nigiri! Anything salmon here was delectable, phenomenal, and buttery!

I can't think of anything bad about this place but one time, we ordered sake and received a little drink called cooking wine.. It was... YUCK!! That only happened because it was someones first day and we felt bad because we got them in trouble. BUT they gave us a free bottle of their best sake and it was sparkling amazing so I can't say sh!t! But I just did.... So there... 

The waitresses were great!! They came back for our order before we were ready so more food came just at the right time. They suggested their favorite rolls which we ate without question o.O jk it was well worth it and definitely trusted their judgement! 

Check this place out! It's also open late ;) ... late night carb load!!

I'm not really sure what the hype about this place is. My friend and I randomly decided to come here and eat one day because she told me her friends all thought this place was great. We ordered almost everything on the menu as part of the all you can eat lunch special because we love sushi - but we were quickly and most definitely let down. The service was fantastic but the quality of food...kind of sucked. The fish didn't taste as fresh as it should taste, the specialty rolls tasted kind of off, and nothing was really special about the place. I prefer Yama and Sakana hands down.

Came here twice already on the trips to Las Vegas, and each of the visits have been great and have surpassed my expectations. Both times I've gone, it was after a basketball tournament game and we came with an empty stomach and left happy. 

Food: It's an all you can eat place where the dinner is $25.95 from 3PM-3AM. I've tried a little bit of everything, from the rolls to the nigiri. The freshness and quality of the fish is not bad for a city so far inland. One thing I enjoy is the gyoza and tempura. You would normally think an AYCE sushi place with have decent side appetizers, but Sushi Koma does! The gyoza taste almost homemade and the tempura is lightly battered and comes with a light dipping sauce. One of my favorite rolls is the spider roll. It has soft shell crab, crab meat and avocado topped with eel sauce. It is a simple roll, but taste really good with the soft shell crab. I like the crunch and texture to the roll as well. Included with the AYCE, each person gets a choice of a dessert, which ranges from mochi ice cream, to a scoop of ice cream. 

Service: The waiters and waitresses are really friendly and they're always asking you if you'd like to order more. They are very patient, especially if your table isn't ready, or still trying to figure out what more to order. 

Ambiance: Sushi Koma is a little loud and dark. It has more of a traditional Japanese feel, yet something about it makes it not as comfortable as I'd like to it be. Maybe the reason is because of how dark it is inside, or there are too man TVs where people can get easily distracted. This is one reason why I didn't give it 5-stars. 

They charge you for the extra rice you leave, so make sure to eat everything and try not to order so many rolls because those come with lots of rice that'll make you full faster. I'll definitely be back because it's worth the price. Just order some uni and nigiri, and you'll make your meal worth it in the end. :)

Not a lot of variety. The rolls didn't really taste anything special. We ordered a beef fry and we got more onions than beef. Their green macha tea tasted AMAZING though. But that was it.
Staff was also friendly.

This is a Vegas sushi mainstay for a reason - great sushi for a fantastic AYCE price.  They recently moved to a larger space and have not changed the prices.

I have noticed though that when it gets busy, tables get faster service than sitting at the bar.  This is a great place to bring your friends.

An awesome experience every time! My favorites include: seared tuna carpaccio, sashimi roll, PB roll, and Kamikaze roll for some good spice. 

Friendly service and great food. What more can you ask for!
Wow. This place is amazing! This will be my new favorite sushi spot! Fresh nigiri, lots of rolls to choose from, and to top it all off, excellent and friendly service!

favorite place to do AYCE sushi. I legit come here at LEAST once a week. the wait staff is super friendly and so are the sushi chefs when I sit at the bar. I wish they did a loyalty card, I come here way too often!! haha definitely recommend to everyone.?

Came here for Valentine's Day dinner. I called the day prior and asked if they did reservations (since it says they do on here) but, unfortunately, they do not. 

The food was amazing! The fish is fresh -- probably fresher than other sushi joints I've been to. Their carpaccio was divine. The shrimp tempura was lightly battered and very delicious. 

The service was good; however, they were pretty busy so the food came pretty slow. The servers were very nice though so it kinda made up for it. Also, we didn't finish one of our rolls and they didn't charge us for it because they knew it was taking long. Overall, it was a great dining experience.

We were in town visiting my sister who lives about 5 minutes from this gem. Initially, we stopped by because it was so close and we like to try new sushi in the Vegas area. This place was phenomenal. We will be back every visit to Vegas! It's a small little restaurant that's well decorated and has a great ambiance.  You would never expect the quality or customer service just from walking through the door but everything was exceptional. The servers were all kind and we did the AYCE menu and someone was there right away to make sure our plates didn't accumulate. I didn't try a roll I didn't like which is rare. The appetizers were great. I really enjoyed the tostada and fish farm roll. The seared salmon is also a must.

Praise to the late-night-food-run gods for blessing us unworthy Las Vegans with Sushi Koma. 

I came across this hometown sushi joint two summers ago when my boyfriend, Matthew, and I were out and about, and my loyalty has been to SK ever since. 

The boys behind the bar know exactly how to dish it out & if there isn't something on the menu that immediately catches your eye, never fear.. they'll send you uniquely made specials specifically tailored to meet your fav-fish preferences. Though all their food is worthy of its own rant, you have to, have to, HAVE TO try the seared tuna carpaccio. Thinly sliced seared tuna painted with yum-yum & ponzu and garnished with garlic chips & green onions. You've never had an orgasm like this one. 

Sushi Koma is also one of the only sushi restaurants in Vegas that caters to vegetarians & vegans. So don't be afraid to ask about their green menu!

Aside from the food, you can always count on great service and a warm welcome from the owner, Chris. All the staff really make a genuine effort to not only make sure that you had a good meal, but to get to know you in some way or another. I guess that explains why they have so many regulars. The food was good, but it was the server who noticed that I died my hair & the chef that remembered that I don't like salmon that brought me back again and again. 

SK, I never considered myself a "regular" anywhere until I met you. Thanks for being the best first love a girl could ask for.

I've been going to Sushi Koma since they were in their previous location in the plaza. It's my go to AYCE sushi place in LV. The owner and staff are always welcoming and my family enjoys going here too. My parents are extremely attentive to detail with food due to their culinary background and always talk about the freshness of the fish and the variety in the cuts of the fish that we get. I love going here and the new location is so cute. The service was good before but it continues to improve over time. My parents appreciate that the owner recognizes them and always takes time to talk to them and see how they are doing. It is extremely reasonably priced for the quality of food and the service. I always recommend Sushi Koma as the AYCE spot!

Until Oyshi Sushi on Sahara and Tenaya Way reopened its doors, this was our go to sushi place for my fiance and I. They had some amazing rolls especially for AYCE value.

However, I'm not sure if it's because they're located in a plaza that many high school students hang out in or what, but any time we tried going there after the first couple months we'd been going, it was always crowded with hipster types and large groups of teens.  Their dining room is very small and I doubt it can accommodate any more than 20 people tops, including the sushi bar.

For this reason, while I haven't eaten there in a little over a year, I can only say that they're 'A-OK'.  Nice selection, but very limited on seating and you better be prepared for sitting amongst hipsters now that apparently "sushi" is a requirement to fit in with the hipster cliques.

Been here twice now and the food has always been good. We have always been seated pretty fast. (But that is because I don't come during the busy hours). It is a small little place, and may feel cramped if it's gets really busy. You don't really have a designated server, but it's always been a good thing. Our water is never empty, they always check to see what else you need (I do AYCE and do a little at a time), and the food always comes fast. The menu is easy to read. All in all, it's one of the better local neighborhood AYCE sushi spots. NOW, MIND YOU... this is not a Michelin star place on the strip, so don't expect that kind of food. It is good for what it's suppose to be.

We've been here six times and I can never get a picture in because the sushi has been devoured ! The fact that almost everything is lemony is a huge plus for me. Uni is amazing. Albacore delicious.. Even Cajun style which I'm never a fan of. Scallops are delicious. Green muscles (usually take a while so order first) My favorite roll is the twist octopus which is simple, clean and delicious. They're AYCE is the whole menu (considering that one item is 10bucks it's smart to do AYCE for about 25 I believe. We are always happy here and drive about 30 mins to get our fix. Thank you sushi koma for being consistently delicious!

My favorite. Why? Because it's small as heck and the food is great and service awesome. Almost always. But if you got a big butt, you are gonna feel cramped. This place is small but worth it. Unless you got a big behind. I believe they tried to be authentic Japanese so they have smaller chairs and tables. Then again it's prob more to do with their square footage. The chefs are awesome. I almost said cooks. Whoops. No soup for me! So the fish are cut nicely and big. Rice is just right. It's my to go place. Whenever I want sushi I come here. You know they do sushi right when the sea urchin is served cold like the way it's supposed to!

Don't tell the better half but I think the waitresses here are super cute too. But then again I came for the food damn it! Uh and the service is a nice topping *wink wink*. The chefs are really chill and know how to slice. I even got a little extra order sample served to us just because. I am not sure if he knows we go every 3 weeks almost. But once a month for sure.

I don't like giving out 5 stars but I will give these guys a well deserved one. If they lack something they make it up with something else. I hope they don't become A holes like Sushimon can. They can make you wait for 3 hours, forget and never have a second thought to customers who have gone  to them for over 10 years. Glad I found a better place, and much closer too! I hope Sushimon chokes on their shrimp heads that they make so well. Semi joking but mad as heck still. 3 hours! I wouldn't wait for a Victoria's Secret model  to give me a kiss for 3 hours! Okay, I probably will but that's beside the point.

I Love sushi freak! They have fresh sushi and a very unique menu. You have to try the VEGAS ROLL&soft shell crab. They have a very friendly staff and reasonable prices then your average sushi place. also the volcano roll is the best:) this will be my new spot.

Absolutely love coming here! The food is always so good and just fresh! Service is amazing too. Love every time Cat is our server. All the girls are great but Cat is our fave! If you have not tried, must try at least once.

Good food, terrible service, large party catered to while other smaller parties like mine (party of 2) waited while they were served. My first and last time going to this place and still charged us FULL price.. even after apologizing over after we waited over 30 mins for our first 4 sushi rolls! Total time spent there was 90 mins and it spent waiting on the FOOD!

Stumbled upon this place by accident as the place we normally go to was closed. The food here was amazing! So fresh and so much variety. The service was great and the Sushi chefs kept making different things for us to taste.. there wasn't anything there we didn't like. It was all delicious. We went back there this week and had the same awesome experience.. I almost hate to write this review as I don''t want people to find out about it ...so we can be sure to always get a seat.. but they are too good not to share :) HIGHLY recommend!

They have amazing food and really good service as well highly recommended!!!!!!
The best Japanese lozana in town!
The music in the restaurant are really nice and the vibes are happy.

I'm picky about my sushi, but Koma is hands down one of my top places! Reasonable prices, fantastic service, fresh, tasty, unique, and yummy rolls. Everyone is very friendly and welcoming, You have to try the tuna carpaccio.

Hands down the BEST AYCE sushi in all of Las Vegas valley.

I've live in Vegas for 7 years and this is one of my favorite go-to spots for sushi and to bring friends and family from out of town.  My husband and I have had over 50 meals here and we have never had any stomachs problems after eating here (not the same for other AYCE around town).

Price is about a $1-2 more than other AYCE, but for the quality of food you get here, so worth it!  You get one order of uni (sea urchin), amaebi  (sweet shrimp and fried head) even during lunch.  That right there seals the deal for me.

Quality of fish is excellent!
Flavors of the rolls are balanced.
Servers are always friendly with smiles (especially Judy).
Orders could take some time to get to you because they have a very tiny sushi counter, so be a little patient.

Most of the staff have been here since opening / for a few years, which speaks volume for the chef owner Chris in terms of how his staff are treated.  It's really nice to see.

I went here for my first time last night and I had a great experience! This place recently just took over a previous sushi restaurant that's been there before called Brian's Beach. Their old sign is still up and so are the restaurant hours on the front door. They really do need to change that soon. I almost didn't go in because Brian's Beach's hours on the door said they closed at 11pm but there was a neon "OPEN" sign at the front as well. Kinda confusing but anyways Sushi Freak doesn't close till 3am which is an hour after most sushi joints close. They also have the best customer service I've ever had before in a sushi restaurant. Their rolls aren't that bad either! I enjoyed the Venice roll and the Sam's Volcano roll. Yummy. Prices are pretty good too. They have AYCE with lunch costing $21 and dinner costing $26. Overall, I totally recommend it! It's sure worth it.
Very mediocre sushi, we ended up ordering mostly cooked items because the nigiri was just not good. I wouldn't go back.

The sushi was excellent but the service was so slow it ruined the whole experience. It took 15 minutes between each dish, including dishes ordered together. It was the first time I've left an all-you-can-eat place still hungry.

I and my fianc , went there for all you can eat, gotta tell you this that we are obsessed with this place great spot delicious food. Although they restricted the good ones from all you can eat still worth to try.
They don't have a big choice of Japanese food but service was great and all the food was delicious.

I love sushi koma! This is hands down the best sushi in Las Vegas. Starting with the waitress Judy, she is so sweet and attentive! The sushi chefs really whip up the best nigiri and sushi rolls. Took my dad here for his birthday and he was so happy! Love love love sushi koma! :)

Stellar service and excellent food! Came at 1am and everything was served fresh. Our server Christina is very attentive. Love the new location and its chic contemporary vibe, not to mention all the extra space they have compared to the previous location. Will definitely be returning!!!! I wish I had photos of the rolls we ate but we inhaled them as soon as it was served

Food - Their fried oysters were disgusting. They tasted old and frozen for months. It left me with an after taste all night. Sesame chicken was dry and sauce was not good. Uni sushi was crunchy, they forgot to defrost the ice. House salad was covered in dressing, I couldn't taste any greens. I thought, there's no way they will mess up my ice cream, right? My green tea ice cream tastes nothing like green tea, it had a bubble gum flavor. These were the main complaints, I haven't mentioned about other dishes. Yucky food!

Service: They were friendly, but were very disorganized. They took my orders, but forgot to bring food out; I waited for one of my dishes for 30 min, when I asked them, they told me they didn't have the ingredients today, then why didn't u tell me when I placed my order and had me waited the whole time? Also, I had to beg for refill of my tea. The waiters were just running around like crazy. They had 8 tables and 5 waiters, come on. Another table got up and left. 

First time there, and will be my last time. If you want all you can eat sushi. "Doh" sushi in chinatown is the best in town, great food, great service. I made a mistake, should have gone to Doh like I always do!

I was very skeptical about trying Sushi Koma! But I was with friends so I gave it a try. 

We were there around 12, so the wait was not an issue. The appetizers were amazing (tuna tartar, gyoza- extra crispy, shrimp tempura, edamame and seaweed salad). I was not a fan of the fried oysters, because the breading was too thick. For sushi, we tried yellow tail, uni, white tuna, sweet shrimp, salmon and some rolls. Sushi Koma did not disappoint when it comes to the freshness of their sushi, as well as the proportion of protein to rice. I am not a fan of unagi, but loved how crispy sushi koma's version is. 

Staff were attentive, kept up with our orders and did not mind how many splits the check was. I'll be back for more!!

I love sushi all my life and NEVER GOT SICK. The worst part was I threw up which never happen in my life. Here's the story..  I decided to give this place a try. The 1st two bites of nigiri I had, I was like ok the rice doesn't taste right. I thought it was me so I asked my friends if they have the same issue. They said yes the rice is a little hard.. so I told the server that it's hard for us to finish all these when the rice is not cook right. She went and told the  chef so they made a new batch. When the new batch comes out, again the rice was the same.. I said ok I'll just eat the fish.. slowly my stomach didn't feel right. I went to the bathroom and threw it all up. Never again I'm coming back. I never leave a bad review but this is unacceptable.

This is my favorite ayce! Service and quality compare to none.  I eat a lot of sushi- and this place consistently is awesome. I'd give 10 stars if I could!where to start to order- any of the nigiri is awesome. My husband likes the Fish Paradise and Ponzu Roll with the shrimp tempura. Everyone is friendly and for 25.95 for all you can eat you can't afford to pass this up!

Awesome and probably one of the best AYCE. We went on Valentine's Day and they were short staffed. I contemplated leaving but glad I stayed. The food was amazing and worth the money. Next time I'm in Vegas..this place is a must.

I've been here twice.  The service is okay.  The food is okay.  Everything is okay.

They have a SHIT ton of rice compared to fish.  So I get full a lot quicker. 

The music is way louder than it should be.  I had to scream to have a conversation with my husband and my brother.  My brother was appalled by the entire situation.  I felt embarrassed since I was the one that said we should go here.  I will definitely not be coming back.  Especially since my brother took me to a much better sushi place that offers more fish than rice for a slightly cheaper price.  

Overall:
Definitely not the best sushi or service.  But they do open late for those who are craving extremely late night sushi.

I used to love Sushi Koma but the last few times I've been the food has been subpar at best. I recently wanted to give them another shot because it was my go-to AYCE sushi restaurant & it's also less than 10 minutes from my house. I saw that they moved to a spot just across the parking lot from their old location & I was excited.

The new location is aesthetically pleasing & way bigger than the old spot. I love the modern feel to the place, however the food varied from bland to bad. The only orders placed that tasted good were the appetizers; cucumber salad, gyoza & vegetable tempura. Only 1 roll of the 9 we ordered was good, which was the Tiger roll. We ordered another one & not only did it not taste the same as the first time but the middle was freezing cold. 

I'm so disappointed with the food at Sushi Koma now. I used to be a regular but I now have other AYCE restaurants that I'd rather drive farther for.

I read lots of great reviews for this place. I'm sad to say I was not impressed. Kobi Sushi over on West Flamingo is much better. We won't be back. We didn't receive all the rolls we ordered and the ones we had were very fishy tasting.

I love Koma, it's been my go to place for ayce sushi. Lately tho, some of their dishes are so salty(garlic tuna carpaccio, miso soup, and few others). They also forgot to put in some of my orders... But rice to sushi ratio is still awesome and their no rice sushi items are bomb

OMG!!! Ever since my last review of Sushi Koma, I have been back there 4-5 times and the experiences were all awesome. I have to upgrade my rating of Sushi Koma from 4 stars to 5 stars because the girl I complained in my last review doesn't seem to be working there anymore. All their staff are so wonderful and made our dining experience so much better than any other AYCE sushi place.

Unlike other AYCE sushi places where food seemed to degrade with time, the food at Sushi Koma continues to be fresh and delicious. I have tried other new AYCE sushi places but nothing came close. If SK continues to serve great food and the service stays the same, I will promise not to stray again :-)
This place is great. Inexpensive but still quality fish. The tuna was so good we thought it was toro. Some good rolls too

All-you-can-eat $22/lunch or $26/dinner.  For $26 during lunch, raw shrimp and uni (sea urchin) is included.  

The inside is pretty nice and service was decent.  There is a large variety of rolls and nigiri (no sashimi) that were pretty fresh.  My favorite items were the tuna carpaccio, salmon nigiri, white tuna nigiri, and uni.  However, the nigiri came out with too much rice in my opinion.  The Washington, Cali, Denver, and Venice rolls were among the table's favorite. 

They also served the uni last (even though I ordered it first) because it's expensive and they probably hoped that I was too full so I would cancel it...

Overall, I've had better buffets in Vegas and would probably not come back!

This is my go-to on the Westside. I've introduced this place to dozens of friends, who have in turn introduced it to dozens more. 

Pros: AYCE is a great price. Free bottle of sake after 8pm on Wednesdays. Music is always fun. Rolls are absolutely delicious. Open late (3am). Ample parking (except for on Wed, when they have car shows). Quick and friendly service. Uni is better than Yama's (sorry, not sorry?). 

What we ordered: To preface... Every roll we ordered was pretty light and refreshing, so it might be a bit biased. I've had too many bad experiences with too many cream cheese rolls, so I'm over it. 

-Stephanie Roll
-Kimmy Roll (definitely my fave of the bunch)
-Ponzio roll
-Tropicana Roll
-Tuna carpaccio (always a must have, we even got 2 dishes this time)
-Alex's Munchie (super spicy to me, but I'm not great with spicy)
-Fish Paradise
-Uni
-Seaweed salad
-Cajun albacore (slightly spicy)

Cons: No lighting in the front corner table. Super small place, not great for groups. No garlic albacore, WTF?

My date and I were sat at a table meant for one against a wall. I hit my elbow as soon as I sat down because there was no room for me. We ordered our drinks and when they arrived two things happened: first the drink I ordered was put in front of my date and his drink in front of me. Second neither of our drinks had ice in them with no mention of any reason why. We left money on the table and left. We were very disappointed because we wanted to try something new. We didn't even get to try the food.
The sushi was very good, but what put this place over the top was the outstanding service.  The waitresses were prompt, professional and pleasant.  I will not hesitate to return to this restaurant.

Sushi Koma is a terrible place, and you should never go there...because then it might get even busier and harder for ME to get a table.

Because this place is tiny and wonderful. I am white, and midwestern, and pretty broke, so I realize Sushi Koma is probably not "world class sushi" but it's probably the best a plebe like me will ever be able to enjoy and afford. So Five Stars.

SK has supplanted Goyemon as our favorite Go-To Friday Night Sushi joint, for a variety of reasons. The AYCE Koma is a great deal; $25 for dinner, and the beer is cold and comes in a frosted glass. 

The sushi itself is always amazing, and comes quickly enough you don't start to lament your hunger, but slowly enough you know it's actually being made with time and care. The staff are always friendly, have good recommendations, and actually remember your whole order...even when it's completely ridiculous. (We go with a big group, and have the first half of our order down pretty pat; 
"6 salmon, 8 spicy tuna, 8 cajun albacore, 6 tuna, 8 yellowtail, 6 mackerel, 6 red snapper, 2 tiger rolls, 1 big b roll,  4 sweet shrimp (with heads), 2 tuna roe, 2 unagi, 2 brie and grape quesadillas, 4 orders of the tuna Carpaccio....we'll decide on a few more rolls after that...")

We're all nigiri people, and generally only get a few rolls, and the nigiri here is just...over the top. So wonderful. (If you're still reading this, ask for Sam's Special midway through your dinner. Yay.) It's a great, casual sushi place. Its a neighborhood place, and now I really want sushi. 

Pros;
- Great food, great prices, great people, great atmosphere.
- Accidental Omakase possible if you sit at the bar, late at night, and are friendly with the staff. 
- Open late for that midnight sushi crave!

Cons;
- This place is SMALL, and it's wonderful, so it gets crowded fast. Be prepared to wait. Have some conversation, hang out at Cafe Darak next door. 
- This place is SMALL, so in order to not have every conversation overheard by everyone else, they end up playing music pretty loud. When it's at the busiest it gets shouty in there.

I've been to Sushi Koma when they were a smaller restaurant, and this is my first time going to their newest location. They have definitely improved! 

It's much more spacious, compared to their cramped location before. The decor is so chill but nice at the same time. 

The service is great too! The servers were super nice and always took care of us. My water cup was never empty honestly. 

The fish tasted fresh and I enjoyed what I ordered! Their fish to rice ratio is not bad for the nigiri. I recommend ordering their Big B roll though! It's only one order per person, but it's so good! There's not many rolls I know that have meat in them, but it works! 

The only thing that I did not really enjoy were their mochis. I ordered a coffee mochi ice cream, and it was rock hard. Even though I waited for it to melt, the outer layer was just dry and not pleasant. Usually it's chewy and soft, but it was too hard for me. I would stick to the green tea or plum wine ice cream instead.

yum ! AYCE sushi in vegas ! 

Important things:
- prices: dinner AYCE: $24.99 lunch AYCE: $21.99
- super small restaurant so if you have a big party be sure to call ahead 20-30 mins ahead of time to see if they can accommodate you
- about 15-20 mins away from the strip
- lots of parking, big lot in front

Came to try this place out when visiting Vegas after a friend recommended it and it was so worth it!! The ambiance is really cute with japanese decorations. There is a sushi bar and the service is great! Another great thing is that they're open late, they close at around 3am everyday. 

We came with a party of 7 which was great because we could all try almost all the rolls, we just ate one of each. We seriously tried almost 20 different rolls and they were all really good! The sashimi is all fresh and they don't pack on the rice like some places do to fill you up. My personal favorite was the tuna carpaccio, you're only allowed to order one per person but it was SOO yummy! The rolls are pretty pricy if you are not eating AYCE so if you are eating AYCE then it is definitely worth it! 

Some of our favorite rolls:
- volcano roll
- tuna carpaccio
- B-roll 
- fried oysters 

Overall, super yummy! Definitely will be back if we are in vegas. Great place to go late at night and AYCE is definitely worth it! When in vegas, definitely check it out!

This place is small and kinda cramped, but the food is always good and fresh.

Pros: Very good sushi, very fresh, lots of different options. They have AYCE. Girls are all young and cute.

Cons: Cramped.

Will definitely eat here again when I'm in the area.
First time here,  really great food.  I ordered Rainbow, Washington, and a bunch of nigiri.  Everything was delicious!

Stopped in during a family trip to Vegas. Service is friendly and extremely fast. I think most people must come here for the "All You Can Eat". I wish I had read into the reviews and realized that this was an all you can eat place before we came, because I would have chosen a different sushi restaurant. The speed at which the kitchen is working may be necessary to feed hungry people lots of plates, but they are unintentionally cutting corners on quality. The dynamite appetizer with scallops was overcooked, or possibly cooked and then left for a while, then reheated, because the little scallops tasted unpleasantly fishy and extremely rubbery. The dish was also made with mostly onions, and very little of the actual scallops. I have never had it made that way before. I love onions, so I didn't particularly mind. But the presence of multiple onion skins inside made it difficult to eat and left my daughter choking on them. Cutting the skins off of an onion before cooking them for customers is very basic and expected. The sushi itself was decent, though over-sauced and not anything special. 
Basically, this rating suffered for the inattention to detail and quality. I hope other people have better experiences!

The best sushi place in town hands down! Fish is always fresh and the customer service is always spot on! 

The sushi chefs are so friendly and make the experience the best! The manager and owner always make a point to say hi to us and ask us how we are doing. 

Keep it up!! Won't go anywhere else.... You shouldn't either trust me we have tried. Did work out, no place as good as sushi koma
Fun place and great atmosphere. Cool waitresses. Very sweet. Food is ok sushi quality Ive seen more fish to rice ratios but the literally let you eat until you cant move if thats what youre into.

Sincerely the best sushi I've had in Vegas. If you do all you can eat lunch at $21. They give you the option to do half rolls so that you don't get too full. I had the sashimi roll which was probably my favorite, the ponzio and the red worm roll came pretty close. They have a great selection of seafood and their service is hospitable and friendly. Can't wait to go back.

Sushi Koma was recommended by a good friend so we decided to try it. The all you can eat price of $26/person is good value. The sushi was good, but by no means great. I think the high rating is based on value for the all you can eat sushi. The sake menu was highly disappointing. It came with no descriptions (other than category) and no prices. We spent twice the price for the sake as compared to what we had at Sushi Hokkaido the week before, where the quality was twice as good. In the end, we spent the same amount as we had at Hokkaido, but we were less impressed with both the sake & the sushi.
Yummy yummy yummy.. I left with a full tummy! Great all you can eat deal. Chef made us special things off the menu. Dessert was also good!

Teeny tiny little place. I suggest calling ahead to make sure you can get a table. I truly enjoyed the sushi here. In fact, I enjoyed it so much I can add it to my favorites! The Elephant roll is a MUST get! The service was great. One of the girls, (asian/blondish hair) was incredibly sweet! She was so welcoming and so thankful for having us. I will be back again for sure.

I came here a few times when they first opened to see what all the buzz was about since so many people were giving them 5 stars~ It turned out that I actually knew a couple of the sushi chefs who were brought over from Ra Sushi at Fashion Show! 

The fish was very fresh and yummy when I went however the rice was a little hard for my taste. I did LOVE the tuna carpaccio with garlic chips and the quesadilla with grapes was different & tasty! Like people have mentioned before they do seem to add more sauce than other places but if you just let them know from the get go that you don't like saucy things they will refrain. The service is very fast and friendly! The restaurant itself is pretty small though! I will say Goyemon has one leg up on them for having more creative desserts. But this place is definitely worth checking out & I have to support my Korean brothas~ haha

Tip: don't forget to get a stamp loyalty card

Went there around 10 pm last Sunday for AYCE. It is a tiny restaurant with tiny tables, so it could be challenging when the food arrived while you have drinks, plates, soy sauce, menu, etc already taking up half of the table. Service was good, servers were very attentive and food arrived quite quickly (maybe because not during normal rush hour). Sushi and all plates are very tiny, consistent with the size of the restaurant, but it was actually good because you can order and try many different plates. Fish was very fresh and the hot food was great too. Tempura ice cream or fried banana were not part of the AYCE menu but for $5 each, you get a gigantic plate of goodness. Not a big fan of the seaweed salad, overdressed. Other than that, this is an awesome place for good food, good service at a good price.

Ok I read the reviews and hesitated to write a review because my brother loves this place. I didn't. 
One review someone wrote about how the salmon nigri the rice falls off and breaks easy 100% true. 
Someone wrote they take so long to get your order 100% true. Someone wrote the place is so small 100% true. Besides there was a damn fly the wouldn't get away from us. The ONLY THING I liked was the Vegas freak. This place had burnt food. The way they sent the food was unprofessional and I don't care what anyone says this place is Deff on the top of the WORST sushi places ever. Go to Umiya on flamingo and desert inn or kaizen in Henderson where people actually listen to what u want to order.

I've been here twice now and both times I've been very happy with the food and service.  We came in here on MLK day last week for dinner and it was PACKED. We had to wait 20 minutes for a table. I was worried the service was going to suck, but we were very pleasantly surprised that it did not. 

We did AYCE, which is $25.95 for dinner. It includes a shit-ton of stuff and I can't even begin to describe all that we ate because we went to town. I will say though, that the items that they allow only 1 order per person are bomb. I can understand why those are limited.  We got a ton of nigiri, and the fish to rice ratio is perfect. The fish tastes fresh and is cut nicely, unlike some other AYCE where the fish is completely butchered by some amateur chef with a butter knife in the back. A lot of their items, including nigiri, come with sauce, which seems to be a Vegas thing and I hate it!, but we requested no sauce and it was fine.

Overall a great experience and will be one of our go-tos for AYCE sushi.
Affordable all you can eat sushi, SO delicious, and a super friendly staff. We've been here about 5 times so far, and will continue to go back.

Pretty awesome spot tucked away in a strip mall. Inviting, friendly ambience with dark walls and good music set the tone for this unassuming place from the outside. 
For $25, you can choose the All you Can Eat special so you never have to worry about your bill going crazy. 
My Faves: 
Dynamite Appetizer: a baked scallop dish in a savory creamy sauce. 
Tuna Carpaccio: The Bomb!
These two dishes are so good you are limited to 1 per person for AYCE. 
Love the Salmon Sushi, yellowtail, and Tuna are always my faves. The Chef also brought over some Toro Sushi on the house that was amazing. Finished off with Green Tea Ice Cream included in the special. 
A new favorite spot!

I LOVE THIS PLACE. I love it so much to the point where I'll drive great distances to get my AYCE sushi fix here. This place is absolutely worth driving any length, consuming every calorie and cutting your night short to fall into (as the name of the place suggests) a Sushi Koma and sleeping happily ever after afterwards.

This place is FRESH. Everything from the fish, to the seafood, even the appetizers, is probably the best you're going to get in Vegas with an AYCE concept restaurant. You can also order A La Carte from the regular menu but let's face it, dining patrons here take advantage of trying every single delectable item this place has to offer. 

If you're a nigiri feen like myself, definitely try every single nigiri on the menu to see what I'm talking about, freshness wise. The appetizer menu is amazing as well. The Brie & Grape Quesadilla is a must try and I always find myself ordering about three of these during every visit. It's interestingly good!

The service here is always on point as well. My beverage cup is never empty, my table is never piling with empty plates and my sushi orders arrive simultaneously so you can actually enjoy everything while it's fresh. If you happen to be sitting along the sushi bar and have a chance to talk with Moon (the owner and head chef) during your meal, let him know that Julie Tran says hi. I'm always a low key walking billboard for this place if I know you're craving sushi and wouldn't mind spending a little bit of my time informing you about how amazing this place is.
Best place to eat sushi, its kinda small place tho and crowded but the food are awesome, fresh.. love the place.
Amazing service with an Amazing selection for an AYCE spot. No complaints whatsoever, every visit has been a joy.

Sushi Koma is right! Wow! Lively atmosphere, fresh fish, and skilled sushi chefs (if thats the right word). The phrase "surprise me" brings something new with each visit, and we look forward to the next visit each time we leave! The owner works hard and loves interacting with his patrons. I suggest anyone give this place a try!!

I love this place....Yama Sushi used to be my favorite place but it always packed and sometimes service isn't the best and honestly after I've tried different places and  I can find good sushi in Las Vegas besides Yama (Sushi Koma is that place)  This place has great sushi the employees are great I even got a complimentary roll last time I went. One of the best parts is that it's open late a winning score for me yayy!!! SUSHI KOMA!!! Oishi!!!

Dank ass sushi. They allow you to get half rolls and their fish to rice ratio is perfect. They only give you a tiny bit of rice to go with your nigiri. The fish can actually wrap around the the rice - unlike many other AYCE places, where the fish is places on a mountain of rice. Im a fatass motherfucker- I want that fish man. I need my mouth to smell like pussy
Came here not knowing it was all you can eat. $22 for lunch, great food & atmosphere, very clean restrooms. Will definitely make this a regular spot.
Great food ! All you can eat is my favorite and a great deal ! Sam (sushi chef) is amazing ! The service from Aileen is great as usual ! A fun welcoming environment :)

This restaurant has the most disorganized staff ever. No servers are assigned tables. Terrible service and wait for the AYCE food. The first male waiter lost virtually all our orders, giving us only 2 out of the 7 appetizers we ordered. The first quesadilla was even missing two slices. We also ordered a salmon nigiri and an uni nigiri, and received none. Another waiter told us uni was only on the dinner menu, which the first waiter neglected to point out, but salmon was still missing so we had to reorder it. It took thirty minutes before we asked the second waiter. We then ordered four nigiri sushis from the third waitress, and had to leave before the last two came due to the time wasted at the beginning, as well as the slow pace of operations even around the relatively free hour of 3 pm. Also, the sushi rolls did not come with wasabi, or the first waiter forgot. 

It was a very unpleasant experience that the quality of the food did not really make up for. We ate/waited for about 2 hours before quitting in waiting for all our orders to come. My father got so upset that he said it made him hate sushi. We definitely are not going to ANY AYCE sushi after this messy experience.
Came here tonight for the first time! So so so amazing, great service, awesome service, and great sushi all you can eat! Can't wait to come back! This our new favorite sushi place for sure.

I don't understand why this place has such good reviews? Hubby and I went there to check it out due to the high ratings, BIG disappointment! We decided to get the AYCE to sample the various rolls. The flavors were boring and bland. We've had waay better sushi here jn town. The service was ok BUT I came here to get some good rolls and we definitely will not be coming back. It is not worth the money at all!!!

Love!!! Best thing is, you can order half orders (on ayce) which gives your stomach more space to try more options.  

Service is amazing! Our server David was genuine, fun, and patient! 

Came in at midnight and couldn't be any happier!

I love this place or I should say I loved this place as this is somewhere me and my boyfriend love to go when we are craving sushi. However today's service was less than satisfactory. I thought this would be a great spot for me and my aunt to meet for the first time since we both love sushi. Well it soon turned out to be a disaster. Being someone who used to manage a restaurant I'm all for trying to make sure the bigger parties are accommodated for however I feel you should still make sure to accommodate the others seeking service too as poor service to one or two people could be far worse then poor service to a larger group. We had a party of 6+ sitting next to us who seemed to steal all the attention as it took us 20+ minutes to receive any of our orders and then only about 5-10 minutes for them to receive theirs. The worst part is there were 3 people in the back prepping food and still dishing out their orders fast and ours slow & last. I'm super embarrassed I even raved about this place after the horrible service we were provided today. Looks like we will be trying to find somewhere else for next time.

The 5 star bump update review after a few visits. Yeeep. 

I think the AYCE is pretty solid with some decent level of freshness. Of course, every sushi place has on/off days for certain fish, but overall everything has been in a good range of fresh that we've had. Also among our favorites are the seafood toastada, salmon skin handroll (unique in that it has perilla/shiso leaf),and  thanks to Tien, I always get spicy yellowtail handrolls here. Nigiri wise the super white tuna, yellowtail with a jalapeno slice, and scallop (which I order with a bit of masago on top) are among the most consistent in freshness and happen to be some of favorite nigiri anyways. 

The real kicker for this place is the service. The ladies are fantastic about checking on you, refilling your drinks and clearing plates. They are friendly and talkative, but yet aren't intrusive. We've had several different servers and all of them were just as good as the other. Love this place for the service as this on point is very rare in AYCE, and sadly just not usual in restaurants to have that consistent of a staff. 

We come late night and there hasn't ever been a wait, which is surprising since the place is small though traffic is steady. I can't speak for daytime though. 

I really think this place will be our new spot as the service does it over the top for us. We used to be big fans of a place close by but lately it's been so busy that there's a wait and it's so busy that the consistency is slipping. 

And yes, they have stamp cards now, I'm not sure if they always did. I did not know this so ask for one! I think that is my one little critique is they don't really mention the cards.  Still, I have my stamp card halfway filled and there's good reason.

(Yelp 100 Challenge 9/100)

This tiny sushi bar and sit down is a great place to have a bite when you're in the mood for AYCE. It's $22 for lunch and $25 for dinner starting at 4pm. It's open tip 3AM, which is a huge, huge plus for me as a hungry college-goer! We need our after party snacks ;) 

Ambiance: 3 - Small, but homey. Almost too small for my taste. Sitting at the bar is more roomy than chillin at the tiny table my party of 2 was seated! Fun, American music playlist though aha! I heard everything from 90's to alternative to punk rock. 

Service: 4 - One thing about a small place, it means pretty quick service. I've deff been to slower sushi places! It only took about 10-15 minutes for all my orders to come out, and most everything was correct. They were also super attentive and really friendly and kind!! 

Food: 4 - Food was yum! But nothing to write home about. Yet, I'd still go back! I did especially love the ahi tostadas, and fresh nigiri (all of it)--which I'm a huge fan of!
