Not the freshest fish I've had, but still pretty dang tasty. For specialty rolls, I'm addicted to soft shell crab, so my favorite rolls always include those. (Bank & Spider are my go-to's) For dessert, you can only have one! Sadly, they were out of green tea mochi :( But I made do with coffee. 

Definitely interested in coming back to taste more nigiri during lunch--gotta save those bucks! Go try their 'small dishes'; it will definitely make you fall in love with fresh fish!

Reasonable all you can eat price and they have good service
Fish is fresh enough to enjoy
Worth to try

I was told this is a place with fair price of sushi( like 25 bucks per person for all you can eat) and good quality of the fish. 

I am not very professional of the sushi thing but I like the food here. Non like the regular buffet, they prepare your food per your order. The fish to me were pretty fresh. 

The service was pretty good. I really hope I could find a spot like this in Houston.

Great as always.  My chef this time was Ryan and he was very accomodating.  Told me he has inly been working here for a year and he looks young but provides nice cuts of fish along his older chef boss.

12 albacore
2 fresh water eel
2 tuna
1 denver hand roll
1 elephant hand roll
2 denver rolls
1/2 ponzio roll
1/2 stephanie roll

Staff was nice and fast.  Came at noon when there were only 4 other people.  

I came and ate solo to see if i would be put in a komatose after.  Too bad the family didn't come with but i ate enough to make it worth it

This is one of my favorite places to eat sushi. Top 5 definitely, but the last couple of times I've come here with my sister I've ordered AYCE and she's done a-la-carte and they have been watching us like hawks. It made me very uncomfortable. I'm not sure if they think we were trying to get away with eating cheaper or what the case was? Either way, it took us 20 minutes to order our food and a table that arrived 10 minutes after us were greeted first. Over all, I love the food here but as far as service goes I'm sure I could find much better at other Sushi bars. I'm giving it 4 stars because the tuna carpaccio and Cajun albacore is amazing but if it wasn't for that it would probably be 2 stars.

Ok their food and prices are GREAT. Their fish is very fresh. I love their natto hand rolls but they really need to work on their speed.  Even for simple orders, they are quite slow and that is a big problem with this place.  If they get the slightest bit busy, you can easily wait 10 min for 1 item.  I have no problem going back here, but only during slow times or late at night when it's not busy.

All the positive reviews for this restaurant is on point. Super fresh sushi and their "All You Can Eat" price is worth it esp. if you're hungry!! Tiny restaurant (was smaller than I expected), but luckily came during a non-busy hour right before dinner so we got seated right away. 

I was super hungry when I arrived, and was pleased at how fast they served our food. & did I mention that everything tasted fresh which is a huge, huge, huge plus for someone with a sensitive stomach (I hate eating risky seafood! Haha). 

Definitely would recommend all sushi lovers to stop by if in the area. So happy to have found this gem.

Went for lunch because it is close to our new office...probably one of the worst sushi resturants I have ever been to , portions small,service bad, our lunch was over before they brought our food...nope...wont be back..to many other better places in town...
The sushi is so flavorful and fresh. The waitress who tended to me was very nice and she was more than happy to hold small conversations with me throughout my visit. Will be coming back.
Favorite AYCE sushi when it comes to fish quality. Salmon belly, super white tuna, tuna carpaccio and seafood tostada are staple dishes. For dunner, ask for amaebi and deep fried heads. Yum!
Great food and service. Their shrimp tempura is awesome! The Big B roll is a must, so tasty with the steak on top.  The waitress are all so nice and quick with bringing the food out.

Sushi Freak is the new Brian's Beach.

After the Elite event at the Barrymore, Steve W. suggested that some of us go eat some more at the newly 're-opened' Sushi Freak.

NIGIRI: Not my ideal fish-rice ratio. But hey! Not bad! Large slices of fresh, fresh fish on medium size rice nuggets. All my usual fishies tasted delicious and the uni wasn't bad. Not exceptional! But satisfactory.

VARIETY: I skip out on rolls. But I do help myself to appetizers and unusual dishes.  The tuna "carpaccio" was amazing. Seared tuna drizzled with some type of mouth-watering sauce. I could've scarfed down a few plates of this. And God knows I love a good tuna tartare. The deep-fried crisps they were served on were fresh, flaky, and delicious. The stack of fried dough and tuna was a beast to eat. But just dig in; this is AYCE sushi, not a fine-dining establishment.

SERVICE: Some of the best service can be found at small sushi restaurants and Sushi Freak is no exception. Steve so happened to be SF VIP so the chef prepared some special dishes and came out to speak to us personally. The girls serving our table were sweet-natured and fairly attentive. There were 7-8 of us and they had no problem splitting checks. Nothing turns me off more than restaurants that have issues tending to groups. 

Sushi Freak is yet another addition to my list of favorite AYCE sushi restaurants. The owner was so polite and wanted to make sure that we were all happy. He apologized  for any drag on service but assured us that they will do everything they can to keep us satisfied. These people are good people. And they serve up some mean sushi as well.

I love coming to this place whenever I'm in Vegas! Whenever someone tells me they're going to Vegas I tell them this is a MUST HAVE on their to do list! Best sushi ever - and I live in SF! Love the vibe and decorations, the employees are so friendly and the chefs are amazing! I can't wait to go back... just for the sushi! The sashimi melts in your mouth and the rolls are so good - not overstuffed with rice, super fresh fish and great flavors.

Wow this place really amazed me. By far one of the best ayce sushi in town. Friendly staff, awesome service, and amazing food. They have something going here. I love every roll I got. Tiger roll was my personal favorite. Their version of tuna poki is abosolutely delicious! Everything here was full of flavor. Definitely becoming a usual here.

Had high hopes last night as we dined AYCE in what were told was a "Good" place. Well, Sushi Koma fell flat. Drink menu has NO pricing! ?? Food came out in a very unordetly fashion, completely out of order and incomplete. Place was busy, but not packed, no line at the door. 7:00. No excuses. The waitrons have radios, so wonder what is wrong. Well, not my place to tell them hoow to run their business.  We were party of 4, so not a big table, second from kitchen door. Wife ordered Alan carte tempura entre. Did not come out all at once or in any kind of order. Interesting. Won't go back. Sad.

My regular 5-star go to spot as of late did me dirty with some old fish on their appetizer sashimi plate (I'm lookin' at you, Naka Sushi) so I decided to try out a new joint.

I think many past reviews have hit the highs and lows of this place right on the nose (don't you love yelp?)

PROS:
--Sashimi roll appetizer: Highlight of the entire meal, outstanding
--Fish was fresh; good salmon, yellowtail and red snapper
--Seafood Tostada: Great flavor
--Tuna carpaccio: Great!
--Service: Excellent, fast and friendly waitress
--Good use of the toasted garlic chips on a few dishes
--Gyoza: Perfectly pan fried, so many other places steam it soggy.
--Chef willing to make some stuff not on the menu per request, such as my California style salmon Nigiri (rice/salmon/avocado/lemon/jalapeno/garlic ponzu)
--Open til 3am
--Decent fish/rice ratio
--They'll do half rolls if you ask (most places do these days)

CONS:
--The music is a little bit in your face...I guess they are going for the hip vibe with house remixes of top 40 pop...
--Though I'm a fan of garlic, in a couple plates they mistakenly used garlic ponzu when regular ponzu would have been called for. Had to have been a mistake as the after-taste didn't gel right with the fish. 
--The lemon pieces over some nigiri were twice as thick as they should be. A little over-powering
--Not too many choices for rolls, but I didn't walk out hungry 

The place is the closest sushi joint to where I live and open til 3am...I walked out satisfied and I'll most likely be back. 

Strong 4 stars

By far the best all you can eat sushi experience I've had in Vegas. My husband and I tried the tuna carpacchio and a mountain of different nigiri pieces and the DD roll. Every roll was fresh, tender and wonderful. Service was spot on except for the random Pinnacle roll that arrived at our table. We told our server we didn't order it but since it's AYCE, no harm, no foul.

Sushi Koma has great ambiance although it is small but it has a very vibrant hip atmosphere that isn't stuffy or pretentious at all. The servers were friendly and upbeat and kept asking if we needed more rolls. I think I finally gave up on my 22nd piece of nigiri...no more sushi. I truly achieved the level of a sushi coma with bottles of Saporo to round out my experience.

The tuna carpacchio was unique with some delightful toasted slivers of garlic that were crunchy and unexpected. I loved the spicy yellowtail roll. It was super fresh and spicy. The rolls came out quick and with great presentation. I did overhear the table next to us complain that they were charged extra because their toddler ate some yellowtail rolls. I wish I could get my kid to eat sushi....but that's another story. She did love the tempura ice cream that came with multicolored goldfish crackers on it.

We arrived around 5 p.m. and by 6 p.m. the place was packed and I saw people waiting outside. This is a great restaurant and obviously the word has gotten out to the locals.

I came here with my boyfriend, wanting to try something new. The service was fine, and the sushi was alright, but my boyfriend and I both felt sick after eating there. I honestly felt that $60 was wasted. My boyfriend and I both agreed we will not return.

Solid choice for AYCE sushi!  Not quite my favorite, but it will be in my sushi rotation now!

What makes or breaks this spot for you, is whether you like their "twists" on sushi.  All my nigiri had sauces on them.  I am used to plain fish/rice, maybe a little lemon or wasabi hiding in there, but they used sauces.  I liked MOST of the combinations...others didn't do much for me and wished they were plain.  (I hear you can just request without the sauces though).

The most important thing though, the fish tasted fresh and the service was good, although I went dry a few times on the drinks.  The food comes fast, and empty plates disappear quickly.

You have to try the tuna carpaccio, the tostada, and they other apps.  Those were probably the highlight of the night for myself.  A nice change from the norm....although they do limit you to 1PP.

This place is very small though.  We came around 11pm on a Tuesday night, and we still had to wait 30min for a table.  Be prepared to wait, no matter what time you show up.  This wasn't a big deal for me, since I never mind waiting for something "worth" waiting for...

And they also seem to skimp out on the desserts.  They have it clearly written, one dessert per person....this isn't a big deal for me personally, but a lot of my friends go crazy with the AYCE mochi and tempura icecream found in other places.

Last thing, order the tempura icecream for dessert!  Yes, you will have to pay an additional $4-5 since it is not included....but it is worth it!  Not only is the portion size huge, but they make it out of strawberry icecream so it is super sweet, and very good.

So even though it has some faults, there were plenty of good things to outshine and pull out the 5 star in my book.  Go for it!

Everything here is very fresh...love the white tuna...melts in your mouth...AYCE is the way to go here and the nigiri sushi is made with small amount of rice so you're able to try more different things...great place.
What a great small sushi restaurant!!! Love the freshness of he fish. Don't like the wait so I always do take out.  Highly recommend!!

Ive been to many all you can eat sushi places, however, this place is by far one of my favorites. They have great quality fish and there appetizers are also all great. I would recommend this place to anybody looking for a hot sushi spot in vegas. And the owner is awesome!

Wow!!! What a find!! Our friends from out of town found this place on yelp and since the ratings were so good, we decided to try. Don't be fooled by the exterior and shopping center, bc it's excellent inside. A bit small but I think it makes it more personable and intimate. Service was outstanding, got lots of great reccomendations and even some off the menu items. Their special cold sake went great with the sushi. Truly a great combination. Fish was very fresh and rolls were a good size, not too big or too small and definitely well packed in the roll. 
Overall a five star experience for the low price of $25 for ayce!! Try it!!!
Food wasn't bad, but it wasn't great either. For that price you can find soooo much better sushi in town. Service was poor

Incredible service and product. Highly recommended for anyone who loves real sushi. Fresh cuts, fresh fish, fresh flavors!! Great deal for all you can eat. The toro melts in your mouth. One of the best sushi spots in Vegas. Come here, eat here, be in the Koma!
First time at Sushi Koma.  The sushi is very fresh and the service is fast!  Aileen was our server and she was great at recommending rolls and other specialty dishes!

ambience, what ambience? dark, dank and pretty ghetto. ice machine broke, so we had lukewarm drinks. very cramped inside.  if your loooking for a spot with good good ad atmosphere...this is not the whole package. food was not bad, but couldn't deal with crowd , space and ambience.  def a place for a younger crowd... and I'm 40@

Went yesterday afternoon for the first time for a little family birthday celebration for my son. It's a fun and upbeat place. Service was wonderful, waitresses were friendly and helpful, the food just kept coming, and the finished plates were quickly cleared off the table.

The fish was very fresh and all ingredients were top-notch... from the salmon, tuna, and halibut, to the shrimp, fresh water eel, crab, and scallops! We also ordered miso soup, deep fried oysters, deep fried calamari (both were light and crispy and came with their own sauces!), gyoza, and spicy edamame (hot & yummy!)!

I personally feel the Seared Tuna Carpaccio wins all around.  Holy shiitake! This dish is incredibly  delicious! Perfectly prepared and topped with crispy garlic chips... PERFECTION.

I asked the waitress if they do anything special for birthdays (pointing at my teen... lol) and she enthusiastically told me not to worry because she'll take care of it... Awesome!

AYCE lunch is $22 and dinner is $27. Very comparable to other AYCE sushi places here in Las Vegas! This is the closest place to me, so I'm absolutely THRILLED!

Keep in mind the place is quite small so it looks like it fills up quickly. Also, some items on the menu allows only one order per person and only one dessert per person (clearly marked on menu).

Sushi Koma gained 4 new fans in us!!!  Definitely bookmark!
The sushi here is amazing. Thanks the manager Chris and all the employees for giving an excellent service. Will definitely return.

Definitely love that when you eat here the people are friendly! The food is consistent here and that's hard to say about a sushi place..our favorites are the super white tuna, garlic tuna, salmon skin hand roll and the Deep Fried Shrimp Heads! It's now our favorite place..the only thing I can say bad is that they need to expand their space.. I'm a big guy and I feel cramped sometimes depending on where I sit 
We still love you sushi koma!

With Vegas having so many options for great sushi. My wife and I decided to try a new spot.  We had some friends that had been here before and wanted us to meet them here.  We all did the AYCE dinner and we all enjoyed it very much.  They have great salads, spicy edamame and the rolls were all awesome.  We all had a serving of Uni w/quail egg too. We also had the sashimi roll!!!.  yum!   Our service was on point too.  We were never without food or drinks and we were there a few hours.  We will def be back!

This is definitely my favorite sushi AYCE in Vegas.   I live in Henderson and we always come all the way to the west side just to eat here.   The baked rolls are soo good and fish is always fresh. Portion is not very large which is perfect for AYCE. The waitresses here are very friendly and (Aileen) was very cute.

Perfectly priced mediocre soosh. All-You-Can-Eat is a bargain, and the staff is super friendly. But sushi is made of fish & sauces: the fish is tiny and fairly bland, but the sauces are syrupy thick and overboard.

Food quality, price ($26 all you can eat) and service was really good. Portion size is really small or should I say bite size. But trust me don't let the size fool you. That just means you can eat a lot more and try pretty much everything. Staff was friendly and attentive. Would definitely come back the next time I'm in Vegas.

We've dined at sushi koma more times than I can remember. And Everytime they deliver nothing but the freshest fish, well proportioned nigiri, and amazing service. But this particular experience, I'm compelled to leave a review because I've discovered they have fresh wasabi... And it makes a world of difference if you're a wasabi Eater like me. 

There should be a 6th star review option for those exceptional venues.
The sushi is really fresh n the remember free sake every wed!!!

Came here because of a friend's recommendation. I was debating between Goyemon Sushi House (my AYCE go-to place) or trying this new place, and I'm SO HAPPY that I took a leap of faith of trying Sushi Freak. 

The quality of the fish here is amazing. Hamachi (yellowtail) was the first thing that came  to our table and we're instantly impressed with the taste of the fish and the unique way they "modify" their regular sushi. Same thing on pretty much everything else we had eaten that night (saba, albacore, ikura, etc).

I love Uni (sea urchin) and Amaebi (sweet shrimp) and most restaurants have similar decent taste/quality in these two, but WOW the ones I had at Sushi Freak is way better than I've ever had--They're generous on the amount of uni they put on sushi, and the sweet shrimp was so fresh and tasted lively and was actually sweet. Because of this i'm hooked to Sushi Freak for good and i'm happy about it. 



Couple other things to note: 
1) Our server, Judy, was excellent in doing her job; she recommended great dishes, greet people real nicely as they step out, very sweet and friendly. She was part of why our Sushi night out was so wonderful, and I really appreciate that because i'm tired of the "server checking on you for what you have leftover" attitude seen everywhere else. 

2) I have to mention that not only our server was great, the rest of the staff members were very nice and timely in pouring us tea and cleaning our dishes. The chefs at the bar were cool too.

3) The head chef/owner actually came out to introduce a dish he had created (seafood Tostadas) and taught us how to eat it, and we were impressed about the dish and how he actually cares. 

4) Loved the Tuna carpaccio appetizer. Very flavorful. 

5) The server said they open till 3AM and they receive daily shipment of fish.


I'll be back with more people for sure.

Formerly known as Brian's Beach Sushi, now under new management. Sushi Freak delivers everything that you would expect from a sushi dining experience. Friendly staff, prompt service, and of course excellent tasting and well rolled sushi.  They are open late into the morning which is great for after a night out  drinking with friends or a date with your partner. This is one of the best sushi places to eat hands down!

Always eat AYCE here.  This sushi place is bomb, so just order whatever your heart desires and trust that it will taste delicious.  The restaurant isn't that big - they have a sushi bar seating around 8 ppl and a handful of 2-4 seater tables.  Despite the restaurant being small, I've never really had to wait for a table.

One important note, this place is chilled like an icebox all year round so I always have to bring a long sleeve and closed toe shoes to keep from freezing throughout the meal.
All-around good sushi joint. Good food & nice waitstaff. I always get the jane roll (spicy tuna w/ eel i think), but everything else i've tried so far has been yum.
I love this place. Great atmosphere. Superb service. Amazing sushi! Get the all you can eat deal. This place is just fantastic. Highly recommend

I came home from college and was super excited to go to Sushi Koma! Sushi Koma used to be my favorite AYCE sushi because the fish was extremely fresh. Now the fish is just okay. I really hope Sushi Koma goes back to being the way it used to be, I am very disappointed.

My favorite thing about this place is its ambiance. It's an all-you-can-eat sushi joint located in a strip mall, but once you get inside, it is so tiny and cramped that it seems like some place you might actually find in Tokyo, which I find really lends to its authenticity. Regretfully, the food was not as impressive as the ambiance.

I started with the sea urchin, and it was probably the best sea urchin I've ever had. That being said, it still provoked an innate gag reflex, and I had a rather difficult time swallowing it but because the "rules" on the menu state that there is an extra charge for any leftovers and the listed charge for the sea urchin was "market price," I swallowed it down like Divine eating that dog turd in Pink Flamingos and didn't think about it for the rest of the meal. The "3-10 roll" was scallop based, but I am convinced that these scallops would have given Gordon Ramsey a stroke. To say it tasted bad would be an understatement. It was an abortion, and I couldn't eat more than the one piece. Fortunately they didn't charge me extra, so perhaps my valiant effort with the sea urchin was in vain, but then again, it's best not to push the envelope.

Next, I had the "Denver roll," all of which I gladly ate after my experience with the 3-10 roll. The fried calamari was also fine. My favorite savory item was the brie & grape quesadilla (not pictured); however, it is also a 3-ingredient dish that I could have prepared myself in under 5 minutes. Unfortunately, they only let you have one of this item. The best part of the meal was the plum wine ice cream at the end. It was delightful and almost floral, so I was disappointed that they only allowed me one Japanese-sized scoop of it.

Overall, I have to say that Sushi Koma is not worth the trip unless it is late at night and you are really craving sushi - because the place is open until 3AM. Other than that, I can't recommend it.
Super great value off the Strip.  Great quality unless you're super super picky, and service was friendly and attentive.  We'll absolutely go again!
Fresh, yummy sushi! The tiger roll was delicious. The service was friendly and excellent. Small, but nice atmosphere.

Ah sushi. 
We haven't had sushi in about 6 months!  
On Thursday afternoon, we popped in to Sushi Koma, as we were in the area, and were super hungry. 

First impression:  This place is small.  I don't necessarily mind small, it was cozy...but if I'm honest, I was worried that the servers were going to hit us with their trays a couple of times. 
The tables are small, and for people who order a lot at a time (like we do), it makes things really cramped.  

Service was super.  The girls were nice, and very prompt.  
The chefs were on it with the orders.   

The food was standard.  The rice was a little wonky on a few of the nigiri pieces...like unable to pick up with chopsticks because it would fall part, wonky.    But the fish was really tasty.  

Nothing stood out too me as stellar or spectacular like some other sushi spots, except the tuna carpaccio.  That was amazing.  The brie and grape quesadilla was interesting.  I'd have liked a bit more brie, as I couldn't really taste any.  

I'm bugged by the fact that they don't offer all of their dessert options with the AYCE.  They have a green tea cheesecake that I wanted to try, but dessert for AYCE is ice cream or mochi only.   It wasn't clearly marked that they aren't available, and I was really disappointed.  

A definite A-OK vote from me.  Not amazing or stellar, but very nice service, and good fish.  I'd come back, if I'm in the area, but won't go out of my way to eat here.

Having been here several times, I've never had a bad experience. It's not just another boring AYCE...it's actually good quality and super friendly staff. The best part is that they're open until 3am, so you can satisfy those late-night fish cravings. The seafood tostada is fantastic! It's like Hawaii meets Mexico (crispy wonton chip with pico de gallo and poke!). 

The space is small, so there might be a little wait. But it's definitely worth it. Plenty of parking in a large stripmall lot.

Some of the freshest sushi I've had in Vegas!!! Open till 3am and the staff is great! Plus there's a hookah lounge next door! Bonus! You can get hand roll versions of most rolls! Also, they will make rolls with whatever you want inside! Best all you can eat spot! However, beware...the best things come in small packages! This place is tiny, so don't be upset if you have to wait for a seat during busy times! Just be patient and know its worth the wait!

The food is always absolutely amazing, service was ehh, could use a little more attentive and server didn't introduce himself and took a while to come back to take our order. I always think acknowledging the guest is the most important part of service.

Used to be a regular here when I lived in Vegas but it is the first place I go to when I'm back. This is my favorite sushi place everrrrrr. Service is amazing: manager, servers, chefs, you name it. Quality of the fish is superb. I live in boston now but I still crave the fresh taste from Sushi Koma.
This is THE best AYCE sushi ! Fast service , no time limit , and the most amazing Hand Roll . I wouldn't bother with anywhere else !

What makes this place better than most AYCE sushi joints? It's spacious and the staff is way friendlier! I highly recommend going in when Darryl is in. He was our server and he was very attentive, honest, and made sure we were good on orders. He consistently came around to check on us and made sure our waters were refilled, made sure we were good on our food and if we wanted to order more food, and just simply made sure we were kept satisfied and happy. 

I've been here a few times, even before they chose to name this place "Sushi Koma"...and every single time I've been here, I've always left with nothing bad to say. Some of my favorites were the tuna carpaccio, baked mussels, and the nigiris weren't top notch, but still good enough to make me say, "mmmmm"!!!  

I'm going to want to come back and try more of their rolls since we were so full on the nigiris. Check the picture out, talk about nigiri overload!

Mmmmm i sure did go into a koma after eating here. We got all you can eat.. (Cheapest we've seen so far) maybe 20.95? Small place not much seating and not many seats at the sushi bar up front. The chef kept making us "stuff that wasn't on the menu" which was AMAZING but he would not tell us what we were eating! It was delicious tho.  The tuna capa something was handed to us as well. Quite garlicky and delicious.. Altho  i wanted to save room for thing WE wanted to order they kept making us "special dishes" no complaints. I just wish i knew what it was so we could order it again! Well worth the money   Id say we had AT LEAST  6 rolls plus plum ice cream plus mochi ! 
Will def return it was delicious an the staff was real helpful with our choices of dishes!

I expected more from this sushi location. Wasabi and ginger looked like it had been sitting out. Neither of my rolls tasted "fresh" as I would expect from sushi made right in front of me in the restaurant. Also, both rolls were bland as all flavors ran together. I've had these rolls at other restaurants but what I had here was disappointing. 

But hey, maybe I ordered the wrong thing

Wow we had so much sushi until we Komad! :p sushi Koma is sort of a small sushi restaurant with excellent food, service and drinks. I love that they offer half rolls! It gives you the chance to try a lot of different rolls.

Best AYCE sushi in town and they are so friendly and their open till 3am. Dinenr is $26 and trust me it's worth it. I never had such fresh fish before in Vegas and I've been to many sushi joints. I only did the sushi and nigiri but next time I will try the rest of the menu such as the deserts, tempura, and etc.. I really think once it gets more popular it will be impossible to get a table there without a long wait! Bye bye goyemon.

PROS: fish quality, service, atmosphere, price
CONS: none
Sooooo goood! Never stingy! DELICIOUS ALL THE WAY. I always go here for a quick stop or takehome. It's right by my house down the street.

The sushi is really good! But the service is unbearably slow. That's the only bad thing. We came in one day and there were only two people in there besides us and it took forever to get a few sushi rolls.

One of the best AYCE Japanese in town.  Yes, please bookmark it immediately! 

Hubby and I went on a weekday late afternoon, glad we went on non peak hours because the restaurant itself is quite small, approximately 25 seatings.  Lunch is $22 dinnier is 27, however if you want sweet shrimps & uni (one order pp) then u gonna pay dinner price, same rule with almost every AYCE Jap in Vegas.

Service was awesome, our waiter took good care of us. We ordered quite a few appetizers from the kitchen; he told us the sashimi salad wasnt on AYCE menu, that's fine with us, but couple minutes later, the chef himself brought us the sashimi salad comp from the house! AWESOME!

Seared tuna carpaccio was good, i like the touch of the deep fried shallots laid on top of the seared tuna, the crunch...hmm... yum... wish the portion was bigger! haha! 

Sashimi roll looked so pretty, immediately took many pics & instagram it.. lol... the fish was ok, very fresh, but the dressing/ sauce was overpowering the sashimi itself.

Seafood tostada is a layer of sashimi mixed with ponzu sauce, laid on top of a deep fried dumpling sheet/taco... a unique app from sushi Koma! 

Seaweed salad was ok, very ordinary, nothing special

Shrimp tempura & calamari were really good! The batter was thin, fluffy and light weight! Served hot! Dipped into the tempera sauce, the juice, the crunch, the shrimp itself was fresh and perfectly cooked, so many good flavors in one bite!

We had soft shell crab handroll because soft shell crab must order as a roll, cant be ordered by itself.  But i will say the combination of little rice & seaweed, the soft shell crab actually tasted so much better!! 

We finally moved to the entree section, haha, in general, all the nigiri were great, nothing to complain, fish was very fresh! And the presentation was very appealing as well! 

Each AYCE in town has their specialties, Sushi Koma, i will definitely come back for your nigiri, capaccio, tostada,  and your mochi ice cream! 

Unfortunately for grilled salmon kama and raw oysters, we have to go somewhere else, they aint on the menu.

It's mediocre sushi 

Pros: all you can eat.  So if you're hungry, not picky about the quality, this will fill you up. 

Waitresses and staff are very nice and friendly. 

Cons: barely edible. The fish looks like it has been colored, smells and tastes fishy. 

Not fresh fish. 

Mayo on everything, greasy. 

Can't do sashimi because the fish is so old, it's a big risk to eat it without having be smothered in mayo to mask it. 

I love sushi and think it's important for the fish to be fresh and flash frozen previously to kill any parasites. 

I ate two pieces of different sushi orders to give it a chance. Couldn't eat anymore than that. Left there hungry, ordered a pizza later. 

I will not be going back.

I FINALLY convinced my co-workers to try a new sushi place and got them all to come here! We came last minute in a group of 6 and were seated almost immediately. The staff there was amazing and super friendly. Food was just amazing as before and  very accommodating for the picky grump we brought with us! GO GO GO!!!

Service was slow. place is too small. Sushi was loaded with rice. So, would i come here again, probably not as i felt that my order did not seem to actually fully reach the chef and when you are doing all you can eat, you expect good service with efficiency, otherwise why are you all you can eat. if you cannot manage that service requirement, don't do it and serve good sushi at a better price. don't force prices that make customers order all you can eat. Not sure if there are better places in vegas but this place was not the best in my eyes.

Mmmm ok. I haven't been here in a looong time. Last time I was here they were in the old location. It's been about a year or so.

We were seated, asked what we wanted to drink and then our order was taken after we got our drinks.

I don't know what happened to my server. It's like she forgot that we are here. Yeah, I'm literally typing this out as I'm eating (or trying to, at least). Anyway, I asked one dude if I could order with him. He said, "Ummmmm, I can get your server for you." And promptly walked away. I think he forgot because he went into the kitchen. Oh maybe he went to find our server in the kitchen? Maybe... We waited... Ten minutes, no one to take our order and no food on the table... Had to get the attention of THREE people just to have our order taken.

I don't remember the service here being so utterly dreadful. In fact, one of the reasons I used to love this place was because of how awesome the service was.

You changed bro.

But hey, at least the sushi is still pretty decent. Even so, the sushi doesn't make up for the complete lack of attention and awareness by the servers.

Not sure what the infrastructure is like here so I won't go too hard but there needs to be some improvements. It's Thursday night and there's 7 groups with each group ranging from 1-4 people. It is FAR from busy. I see six employees walking around. I think 3 are servers and 3 are bussers maybe? Somethings up... I don't know what it could be. Maybe it's just not a good day? I really want to give the benefit of the doubt because I really loved this place in the past. 

You know, I used to be a server for two different high volume restaurants. The biggest issue preventing restaurants from running smoothly is employees with disgustingly poor work ethic. If you've ever worked in the service industry, you know what I'm talking about. It's not just  the service industry. It's everywhere. 

Anyway... I'm having fun typing this out so I'll end with this. Rating the employees.

Our server, Korean girl, speaks Korean well - 1/5 (not very attentive, absolutely no customer service skills, needs most training) 

Busser guy - 2/5 (I don't hate him, seems like a nice guy but I get the vibe he is new) 

Latina food runner - 3/5 (she was very nice and probably new)

Girl with tats - She did stop by to pick up plates and fill water and I like her tattoos so I'll give her a 3.5/5. 

Patrita - OK. This is actually a turning point. She kind of just came out of no where and started helping us. She went to check on our food. Apologized profusely when it turned out the order was never put in. And has just been very attentive. Even though I'm about done with my meal, I'm glad that at least there's someone willing to take initiative. AND SHE IS PREGNANT. Good on her. 5/5

Short bald guy who I assume is owner aka kkomalul. He was nice enough. Doing his own thing most of the time. Neutral. 

Anyway, I'm done now. With my food, that is. I am not sure if I'll ever come back but if I do, its not likely to be my decision.

Edit: One more thing... There was a slow and steady flow of people coming in and going out. You will not be greeted, you will not be thanked. At least not by their own volition. Being a server is a fairly straightforward job. However, I wholly believe that training is required. Regardless of your background. Every restaurant is run differently. Every employee should be trained to maintain a customer service mindset. 100% not something that was evident here. Other than from Patrita.

I may have just come on a bad night. I don't know. I do know that I really did not enjoy my time here tonight, overall.

I rarely do real-time reviews but I had a feeling it was going to be necessary.

Cheers.

This is my usual sushi joint. Love it. It's cozy and everyone is super friendly and on point with getting the orders right out. MUST try the tiger roll, its my favorite :) Four stars because they are super nice, but check in on you a little too much when you're trying to have a conversation with someone. Never rude though, great attitudes.

Koma is my regular sushi spot when I get that sushi craving, which is quite often. I can't believe it's taken me this long to write a review, but here we go.

First of all the best part about Sushi Koma is the customer service. All the chefs and waitresses are really attentive even when the place is packed. I have experienced very few mishaps here and that is always a positive thing. There are quite a few places where the food is great, but the service ranges from mediocre to bad, but Koma isn't one of those places.

While the service is great, I'm not about to forget the food. The nigiri ranging from my favorites like surf clam and octopus to yellow tail and salmon, are always fresh. I have yet to have a bad experience with any of those offerings. The only nitpick I have is that the lemon slices on the salmon are a bit too thick at times.

The appetizers are also really good, but unfortunately are mostly limited to one order for each all you can eat. I recommend the seared tuna carpaccio and the mussels, though the sashimi roll is also pretty good.

Finally onto the rolls. The rolls are just as good as the nigiri, though I feel this is where koma is the weakest. The variety of rolls isn't as big or as diverse as some other places. I usually end up sticking to a few of their rolls and after a while it gets a bit old. Hopefully they eventually experiment a bit more and try adding a few more different rolls. Maybe as a daily special menu or something.

Overall though you can't go wrong with Koma.

Sushi Koma is a great little sushi spot located in West Las Vegas. They are on the South West corner of Durango and Flamingo. It is my go to spot for late-night sushi. The staff is great and the atmosphere is always fun with a good crowd. They have all the classic Sushi including a bunch of different specials that they are known for. Some of my favorite items on the menu are the Tuna Carpaccio, the Seafood Tostada, Dynamite special, 3-10 roll, New York roll, PCH roll and the Sam's volcano roll just to name a few. They have Wi-Fi and stay open really late which makes it a good  place to eat and chill out for a little bit!

Sushi was really good. The yellowtail nigiri was phenomenal. If I go back I will make a meal just out of that alone. Only real issue I had with this place is that they automatically add a 19% gratuity to your bill and our service was bad. Dishes were forgotten and wrong items brought to our table. At the end of the evening they even made mistakes charging the credit card. Maybe they just caught me on a bad night but it was very frustrating.

**Summary**
       - Best - I have to start by saying that this is my new "go to place" for sushi. 
       - Freshness - I usually go half nigiri/half sushi rolls, but tasting that first piece of sushi my first night, I had to go all nigiri for the night. It was definitely some of the freshest sushi I've tasted this side of the Mojave Desert.
       - Next Level - All the nigiri have their own little touches. The salmon has a lemon wedge, the yellowtail has a thin slice of jalapeno, and the sweet shrimp has a sprinkle of sea salt and a splash of lemon juice. It's these little things that take these ordinary nigiri dishes to the next level.
       - Creative - You can ask the sushi chef to create something for you and you'll see why they chose to name the place sushi freak. I got salmon with cornflakes on top and it was delicous.
       - Expertise - The ex-head chef from RA at the Fashion Show opened this restaurant 3 weeks ago bringing with him some of the freshest fish suppliers.
       - Waiting List - The place is very small so I'd suggest calling ahead or going at off-peak hours. Trust me, it's worth the extra effort. There's a reason there are people waiting outside for a seat.
       - Brian's Beach - This use to be Brian's Beach and as of March 1st, 2012, the sign is still up. 
**Price**
       - $21.95 11:30am-4pm AYCE Lunch
       - $26.95 4pm-3am AYCE Dinner
**Menu** http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/dEAk-gE-5Q95a7p91gNn8A?select=CRIJHtvoQAlPDg5XIbV7oQ http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/dEAk-gE-5Q95a7p91gNn8A?select=AY-RzhlhTkh8mSZ3bKQphg
**Nigiri**
       - Saba - Mackerel with a special soy based sauce. Best Mackerel I've ever had (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/dEAk-gE-5Q95a7p91gNn8A?select=4K_BIu7T8I900UQbzxitOg).
       - Hotate - Scallop with lemon juice and a touch of sea salt. The tiny bit of sea salt really enhances the scallop's flavor (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/dEAk-gE-5Q95a7p91gNn8A?select=dNNuJ2RHBoXge7InUBggjg).
       - Sake - Salmon with thin lemon wedges on top. Nice and buttery (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/dEAk-gE-5Q95a7p91gNn8A?select=ylyCk454GitnpyRtHVI3hA).
       - Hamachi - Yellowtail with a thin jalapeno on top (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/dEAk-gE-5Q95a7p91gNn8A?select=jF-L0ha2GH_2clMR0pXJ-w).
       - Amaebi - Sweet shrimp with lemon juice and a touch of sea salt.
       - Uni (Sea Urchin) - So fresh it just melts in your mouth. Freshest in Vegas (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/dEAk-gE-5Q95a7p91gNn8A?select=zQ9TY1ivPInfVIJKd9Wznw).
       - Cajun Albacore - I usually don't get this, but it was awesome.
       - Hirame - Halibut with green onion (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/dEAk-gE-5Q95a7p91gNn8A?select=hffcCuSxFtKW0bYAvo3kww).
       - Ikura - Salmon Eggs (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/dEAk-gE-5Q95a7p91gNn8A?select=gpN0BzIeU0QSEWzTyhTQgQ).
**Nigiri**
       - Dynamite - Can't go wrong with baby scallops, onions, mushrooms, and dynamite sauce. Yums (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/dEAk-gE-5Q95a7p91gNn8A?select=WtN8SoddXyOHwIEb96TsOw).
       - Baked Mussels - A must try (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/dEAk-gE-5Q95a7p91gNn8A?select=kVlfSKmhqa34hlZHUArow).
       - Seafood Tostada - It was very different and delicious with bits of fresh fish with ginger and sliced roasted garlic flakes (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/dEAk-gE-5Q95a7p91gNn8A?select=P-MlLo5NjxQRlCNrl1n9aA).
       - Deep Fried Amaebi (Shrimp) Heads (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/dEAk-gE-5Q95a7p91gNn8A?select=zLVKLuO426E2OQf9mmIRRw)
       - Teriyaki Beef - Not your normal teriyaki beef. It was really good (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/dEAk-gE-5Q95a7p91gNn8A?select=4L6fefl0eRCkYhka8kxQnA).
       - Green Beans - Pretty good for vegetable (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/dEAk-gE-5Q95a7p91gNn8A?select=kTvLvE_ZG8ajIV5Isy_CnA).
       - Gyoza (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/dEAk-gE-5Q95a7p91gNn8A?select=opJaUQ4cEXmao1DYaLXeOg)
       - Shumai - We got it steamed and they looked like wontons (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/dEAk-gE-5Q95a7p91gNn8A?select=-s2_4flHjNUHfg6Pe9Lxbg).
       - Fried Oysters (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/dEAk-gE-5Q95a7p91gNn8A?select=tem1rQLEb69cJ-8WTsMLtw)
       - Sashimi Roll (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/dEAk-gE-5Q95a7p91gNn8A?select=FbHBtuJge7__bllMLUzNOg)
       - Almost Fire Roll - Shrimp Tempura, spicy tuna, and spicy sauce (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/dEAk-gE-5Q95a7p91gNn8A?select=V8cJx9QwbX84_xfUYZT7kw).
       - Ponzio Roll - Tuan, albacore, and avacado roll with ponzu sauce (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/dEAk-gE-5Q95a7p91gNn8A?select=Xk4L9iFfbNmIeNzHviP7KQ).
       - Viva Las Vegas Roll - Spicy crab and scallop on a crispy roll with crab on the inside. This would be perfect for those who don't like raw fish (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/dEAk-gE-5Q95a7p91gNn8A?select=YJXGdaTyeAhmn6hKxoO_3w).
**Recommendations**
       - I'd recommend this place to anyone. It's my new favorite sushi place.

For an AYCE this place is 5 stars. We went around 4:30 on Sunday and there was no problem getting a table. There was actually another Yelp Elite sitting next to me. 

The bf and I each ordered a large Kirin Light ($8.50 each) and the AYCE. We had yellowtail, tuna , albacore, and snapper. Many many pieces and they were so good. The fish was so fresh. I liked that they did not put a bunch f rice under it. It was the perfect amount.

We ordered the Philly roll, rainbow, Jane, Catepillar, Spider, some steak roll and the sashimi roll. We ordered multiples of these rolls but I am not going to admit how many. =) They were all very good and very fresh.

The service was fast and they had a lot of people waiting on the small amount of tables they had. We only waited about 5 minutes in between orders. I highly recommend this lace if you want AYCE. Loved it.
I love this place! The food is just delicious! I cant resist this place! I always come back for more!

Based on reviews and that it's an all you can eat sushi, I wanted to try it.

1. Its a small place
2. lot of parking 
3. they have the music blasting
4. THE SERVICE WAS AWESOME, SUSHI CHEF TO SERVERS ALL FRIENDLY
5. The food was overall good
6. price is average about the same as any other AYCE sushi joint

The service was the best, it was better than the food. The food was good but not the best AYCE place I've been to. The service was the best of all the AYCE sushi places I've been to date. I tried most all nigiri, the fish to rice ratio pretty good. They do half rolls which is a plus so you can try a whole bunch. I didnt notice any signs saying a time limit which I appreciated. i came out with a food koma!!! 

Its open till 3am which is awesome for you ate owls.

Make sure to call ahead to see wait times. This is my go to spot late night as they are open until 3 am great ayce, reasonable pricing, very nice Stagg and progressional

They stay on top of things with radios that's how busy it gets here. Let me tell you this the rolls You can only order one of order them, I see why they only allow you to order one otherwise you wouldn't stop. 

Thanks for always being nice, great staff and food on point

Raw fish is a necessity and watch over those who come in between me and my sushi. When these cravings hit, find me the closest AYCE joint because I am ready to grub someone out of business. 

My friend had arrived early and waited inside for me. When you walk in, you see everything. The restaurant is small. We were placed at a two top near the divider which separates the front door from the dining area. At times, the table got cramped, but the pace of the sushi chefs helped to not overrun our table. During periods where we sat empty, the waitresses came up to thank us for our patience and made sure we were doing well. Quick refills on our iced green tea helped to not unleash any negativity. If one point of service fell behind, the other made up for it. 

The sushi rice held up rather well and rarely fell apart. The fish was fresh and was not masked by an overabundance of sauce. A small drizzle across to lend some flavor. My friend and I dined off of the nigiri and appetizer menu. She is allergic to shrimp, so most of the rolls were a no go. Even with our limitation, those two portions of the menu was enough to get us full. The fish to rice ratio is even. Sushi Freak does not overload on the carbs. Besides the nigiri, the Brie and Grape Quesadillas are delicious and innovative. I like the garlic chips on the Tuna Carpaccio. I would pop these nonstop if they offer them. Ask for octopus, squid, scallops, or salmon to come with a sliver of lemon to accentuate the flavor. The yellowtail came out with a slice of jalapeno and that transformed a fish I normally don't like into something magical.

Food was good, service was fast, and really liked the over all place!  Only problem, they nickle and dime you over little stuff, like a extra $1.00 for a soy wrap, it only cost .11 a peice and you sale it for a $1.00, why not just add it to all you can eat....  over all food is good!

Sushi Koma has a nice variety of rolls and prompt service.  We visited at lunch time on a Saturday and wait times for roll prep were minimal.  There were only 2 others parties in the small restaurant, so I can't speak for busier dinner times.  The wait staff is very friendly and constantly checking in on guests.  

We selected the AYCE option.  Our major gripe was after the first couple of rolls, the rice units per roll more than doubled.
Loved our cute waitress...but place was way to small for comfort...our table was tiny and for all you can eat sushi....not good ..our food didn't fit on table...no elbow room tables were too close..

By far the freshest AYCE in town! I can't tell you how excited I am that this place is close to my work. I have a new favorite AYCE sushi place! 

I visited on a Friday afternoon around 2:30 and they weren't very busy. The waitress was very friendly and took my order right away. I never once had to ask for a refill on my drink, the service was beyond efficient. The sushi chef recommended some nigiri and came through with some amazing selections. I tried the following: scallop, salmon, white tuna, ahi tuna, and cajun albacore. Every bite of the nigiri was delicate, fresh and savory. I ordered a couple of rolls which were executed perfectly: volcano roll and a spicy crab hand roll. The sides I ordered were: dynamite, shrimp tempura and green mussels. Everything was delicious. I was amazed at how wonderful every bite of food was.

I have been to this restaurant many times. This is open late so it is my go to place if I missed the normal dinner hours. Sushi is Fresh, food not bad, sushi chef is a nice guy, most staff are nice, service is prompt the and the restaurant is clean. But my last visit did not turn out well. After been recognized as a regular and exchanging pleasantries with few of the staffs and sushi chef, when I was about to pay the check with my Visa card, the dumb manager asked for my ID which would have been okay if I were there for the first time or looked creepy, but this was an insult so I paid my bill and 1st time in my life I left with $0 Tips. In this economy restaurants are competing for business where these guys managed to make a happy customer mad. So I probably will advice you all to find a better, friendlier place where you and your money will be appreciated.

Love this place! Very friendly staff, personal attention to detail and great sushi!

We do the AYCE and get stuffed with some delicious food. Love all things spice, so got to have some spicey tuna but balance that with some eel. 

Specialty rolls are great, come out so beautiful they look like colorful works of art.
So close to home, good service, late night hours, table or bar love it!

This is my favorite sushi place! I am obsessed with the sushi and all the servers. The sushi is the best quality in Las Vegas and this is the best service. They have a great selection of nigiri and amazing rolls! There are so many options and I always leave so full. Their AYCE is the best. Whenever I want sushi this is where I go. I won't go anywhere else because nothing else compares.

No doubt our favorite sushi place! My boyfriend and I always want to try new sushi places but we always end up going to Sushi Koma since we know that our money is gonna be well spent at this restaurant. Worth every penny! 

I don't even know where to start but all the visits we've had here (maybe a hundred lol) were all superb. The food is AMAZING. The best part about this particular sushi place is not only the fresh fish but also how they ratio the rice and the fish. You don't have to worry about not finishing the rice because it has the perfect amount for the nigiri. This is really the most important factor to me lol! 

Also, I love everyone that works here. They are all so accommodating and nice. Genuinely nice. They're more like friends than just people serving you your food. It's always nice to chat with them once in a while :) 

To sum everything up, this place is BOMB. 5/5 stars, or even more that that!

Was recommended this place by a local business. But boy, did it not meet my expectations! First and last time I'll ever dine here. Service was terribly slow and unresponsive. I ordered miso soup 3 times until I finally got it. We were probably waiting 20-30 min in between each order which half of them were actually delivered. The fish was not fresh, tasted like it came straight from the freezer and was thawed out. Their selection was boring and simple. The only good thing about this place was the fish to rice ratio. 

Definitely would drive the extra miles and go down spring mountain for better ayce sushi.

I've been here a couple times and last night was disappointing to me. When me and my girlfriend arrived, we were greeted by our server (I don't remember her name) she was nice enough except after we told her we needed a minute to look at the menu for AYCE she disappeared, another guy working there noticed us and asked if we were being helped, I said we were but I did not know where our server went (she had been gone for some time, I even asked my girlfriend to make sure I wasn't over reacting and she agreed). He took our orders and after a few moments later our original server had made a reappearance to ask if we were ready to order, I informed her we already did with someone else. After a little while our food starting being delivered but I had also ordered a bottle of sake which never got delivered until I asked for it a 2nd time. At this point and my girlfriend and I were eating and the chef kept handing us our orders directly, he was being somewhat rude about it saying in a annoyed tone "hello?? here you go". I WAS EATING!! Can you imagine how annoying it is to be in the middle of eating and some guy is giving you an attitude cause your not grabbing your food fast enough from him??Me and my girlfriend were sitting at the bar area in front of the chefs so I know I'm rite there but that doesn't mean I should be serving myself (if you sat at the bar at a P.T's they wouldn't expect you to pour your own beer or make your own shots). If my girlfriend wasn't with me I probably would have said some choice words about there service rite then and there but I didn't want to make a scene so I kept my mouth shut. At this point I was a bit annoyed but I wanted to have a good night so I tried to let it go, then the chef with an attitude starts handing me stuff I didn't even order! Like what dude you expect me to go run it to the table?? Their Sushi is great but their service is lacking, think I'll be going to another Sushi place from now on.

Such a great deal, and the service is amazing! Definitely try as much of the menu as possible because they all taste good. You can even order half rolls so that you can try more variety. Delicious. I would recommend this place to anyone!

A solid 4 star experience. The vast majority of the nigiri was fresh, and quite good, but the salmon came out slightly towards room temp and definitely should've been colder. As before, not the best sushi I've ever had, but if you have a large appetite and want to save a couple of dollars I definitely recommend dining here.

One of the things I appreciate about Sushi Koma is how fast the service is and especially compared to most Japanese restaurants. There are some places in town you'd need a sundial to time the waitress. At Koma, our servers were right on point and delivered everything with a quickness!

We'll definitely be returning.

Too bad!  I used to love this place. But since the last time, the quality changed completely. We had variety of nigiri sushi and a couple of rolls. The rice was all wrong. It was cold like it's been refrigerated. The fish wasn't fresh at all. Some of them I had to spit it out. The only reason I gave it two stars is for the friendly service.
By far the best sushi place in Las Vegas! $25 for AYCE! With the best menus. Best thing on the menu is the seared tuna carpaccio and the sashimi roll. Yummmm!

Wow. This place is a real treat. Went there after reading all the reviews and boy was i not disappointed.  

I WILL BE BACK.

Came back the following week and they did the impossible. It was even better the next time.

Friendly staff and great food.

Unlike most AYCE sushi places this one goes the extra mile:
* touch of wasabi on the maki
* lemon and sea salt with the ika

All the plates are made like you are paying for each roll.  You will not be dissapointed

Met tonight with friends and was amazed beyond my expectations.  It is cozy, but that is one of the reasons I loved it. The service is fantastic! You don't just have one server, everyone makes sure you are taken care of. You have to try the seared tuna carpaccio! Garlic chips explode this dish! The Dynamite scallops are mouth watering! We had several orders of both. I think the negative comments of the wait may have been because they ordered baked items. Everyone knows those take longer..duhh. We were surprised when a server brought over a gift from the chefs. Tuna belly. ...it just melts on your mouth! Not part of the AYCE menu....a gift for us to try! I thought about not writing a fantastic review and keep this place to myself, but they really deserve it. You will not be disappointed!

This place is, by far, the best sushi in Vegas! Great service, great food... Just make sure you get what you order because if you customize something, they sometimes have a challenge conveying the info to the chefs...  They are super accommodating and it's not a slow meal - they are on top of you, in a good way!

I love this restaurant especially since it's open late. We had this waiter I think his name was Josh but he was really nice and had great service. He was on top of it!!!!!!! The other staff was great as well!

Service is average, cause waited for 45 mins to get seated and dish fell on the table when giving to us. 
Food quality and variety is excellent!
Food: Uni is in fresh!

Overall still like this place!

Very very disappointed and  a Very Bad experience at Sushi Koma. 
  I usually don't write reviews but after todays lunch experience at Sushi Koma I felt forced to today. We 
come here quite often but this will be our last. The waitress (the one with a nose piercing) was beyond rude and had an attitude. When we asked why our order was taking so long (30 minutes for one order) the waitress almost yelled at us saying there was only one server during this lunch hour, and at that time it wasn't that busy, only about 4 tables, and shouldn't taken that long because there were also 3 sushi men. She continuously ignored us and went inside the kitchen. After multiple attempts to have her take our order she finally came, when we ordered from the menu (all you can eat) she bluntly and rudely said no, when we asked why she almost mockingly said because they were out. I never had this kind of experience at any restaurant ever. The only thing that didn't take any time was when we asked for the check. If the owner happens to see this review, PLEASE PLEASE PLEASE!!! reconsider the waiters and waitresses you hire for your restaurant. 
Overall this experience at Sushi Koma has been very bad especially the service today.

Excellent menu and great food. Service was ok as I have found I tend to get things I didn't order while waiting for things that I did. Sushi Kaya has the same problem but because the food is very good you leave happy and full. 
  We have been to this place on christmas also and it did not let us down great food mixed up service.

I'm a fan of AYCE.  I'm also a fan of Sushi.  Like pallet-loads of it.  And, ultimately, I'm an avid fan of a good price.  So, trying Sushi Koma was a natural fit.  It's off-Strip, but we usually have a car whilst in Vegas, and one can always cab it.  Here's the breakdown:

PROS:
_Lots of parking
_Uber friendly Chef staff and servers.  Hi-five small businesses!
_Bold (and successful) attempts at modern takes on appetizers: case in point-the Brie Grape Quesadilla.  It was a unique stab at the standard boring cheese quesadilla and I appreciate when Chefs take risks!
_Tuna Carpaccio A++++  I mean, SO fricken' good!  
_Seafood Tostada A+++++ The flavors in this dish is uh-mazeballs.  I mean, SO good that I just wanted to slow down time, so I can savor it.  I guess I could have chewed slower, instead of shoveling it down my face....
_Open til 3AM, so one can opt for AYCE after working on dance fitness!
_Right between 4-6PM seem pretty open, so if you don't like crowds, this is likely an ideal time

CONS:
_Certain foods have limits (e.g. both A++++ rated items listed above). 
_Sometimes AYCE can be overwhelming.  For the untrained belly.  SO, for AYCE pros, it ain't no thang.


I will definitely keep this on my must-eat list for my multiple trips to Vegas/a year!
Not a fan.. maybe it was an off day for them.. but it's 3pm.. not busy and service was so bad and slow. I think this place makes me not want to eat at another AYCE place again.

Been here twice in one week!!! Their AYCE is only $25! And the sushi and oven baked dishes are amazing!! Full of flavor, tons of color, just delicious! 

The customer service is PHENOMENAL!!!!!! The ladies and gentleman here are all smiles and fun. Your water glass is never empty. It is always filled. The service is fast! I had such a good time here. Plus, the second time, the girls remembered us!! Love it. 

I again live 30 minutes away from here and will definitely be back!! Love y'all!

Best and most affordable sushi AYCE I've ever been to. Let's not kid ourselves, sushi places are a dime a dozen.  Sushi Koma's quality is definitely topnotch and you definitely get more bang for your buck. $25 per person for dinner can't be beat.  The fish is always fresh and you'll definitely leave in a food "KOMA". Chris, the owner, is always so hospitable and accommodating. He passes by everyone's table and asks about the food and service and makes sure everyone is enjoying themselves.  He will occasionally make daily specials and have customers try something new that is recommended by the sushi chefs.  Thank you to Sushi Koma for making our experience one to be remembered.

Was the first time at this place we very in joy of there sushi 
There price was very good 
There service is very good 
I will recommend this place to anyone..............

It was a good place. Good food and yummy desert. Very tiny place but only waited like 2 mins to get seated (went about midnight on the weekend so maybe that's why) even if it looked really packed. Service was good and at the end they suggested a change in the way we ordered the food (Something about instead of paying for the all u can eat pieces we didn't eat we can change it to to go and it wouldn't be as much??) which was very sweet on saving us a couple bucks!

My favorite sushi restaurant in Las Vegas! We have been going here for 5+ years and the quality has never waivered. The staff are super friendly and accommodating. We just went to their new location (in the same plaza just in the other side) and it looks awesome! I would highly recommend the Kimmy roll and the Tiger roll!

Easily my favorite sushi spot on my side if town hands down. I know people have said on here their Ayce is inconsistent but I have YET to experience this issue. I can honestly say this is some of the tastiest noms I've had at a sushi spot especially for ayce. Plus their new spot is super cute!

For those who don't already know, I have been on a hunt for the best AYCE sushi in Las Vegas. While I still have a few more places to visit before my quest can officially become complete, I can say that this is by far the best AYCE sushi house I have gone to-date. 

Telling from my experience as well as what other reviewers say, this place is always crowded with people. We sat in a small table in the center of the restaurant and we could definitely feel how busy all the waiters were getting orders around in a full house. Although there were so many customers, my date and I got out orders at a quick pace. 

The waiters and waitresses were also the most welcoming and personal out of every restaurant I've encountered so far. When a dish was served, they would always wait to see my approval before going back into the question. Someone was always there whenever I had questions to ask, and they always constantly asked me if I ever needed anything or if the food was good. 

Yes, the food was actually very good. As you may have already read, the fish to rice ratio was superb. The fish itself just screamed out FRESH, at least compared to other AYCE sushi joints. I was pleasantly surprised that they did half orders too. Not all sushi houses do that. 

One thing that I thought was very unique and cool was the fact that they put lemon on top of the salmon nigiri as garnish. It gave the salmon so much more flavor, and a bit more of a zing to it. If I ever have a salmon craving, I'll probably go here to satisfy it. 

I also liked that they had a wider array of flavored mochi ice cream. I always look for my favorite flavor, chocolate, but most places never seem to serve it either.

PS: They serve Tamago without the sticky rice! Pleasant surprise!

I am a weekly customer of this place and the staff is great and the food is always top notch. The fried ice cream is new and I crave it all the time. I have tried many sushi places and this place is by far the best

Similar to Keena E., I've been on the quest for the best AYCE sushi in Las Vegas as well.  I've been to Sushi Koma 5 times. And I've waited until now because it's a small spot and I don't want it to get busier ;)

I've been to lots of other great places - including Umiya, Jjanga, Goyemon, O-my, and Toro.  Sushi Koma is still top of the list (with Goyemon as a close second, and Umiya as a close 3rd).

Their fish to rice ratio is amazing. The seared tuna carpaccio and seafood tostada are insanely good. They've never been out of Uni (unlike Goyemon, which didn't have it). And their servers are insanely fast.

I measure by three different things in comparison to Taco Bell:

DECOR: Sushi Koma is located in a plaza with numerous other food places and stores. Walking in it's actually quite tiny! However I do like atmosphere. This place is definitely for the younger crowd. Think teenage to 30s. The waitresses dress in pretty revealing clothing short shorts and tied shirts. The music is loud and random, but I dug it. 1.5 stars for decor. 


SERVICE:  The service was pretty good. I was with a group, so a lot of Sushi was to be ordered (we all got the buffet). It's not surprising that some of the order came out in different time slots and I believe one order might have been forgotten. But to be reasonable a large order of sushi (think six items) must be hard to keep track of, so that's understandable. .5 stars for service.


FOOD: The sushi and appetizers are delicious! For appetizers I tried the Gyoza and the Brie and Grape Quesadilla. Both were absolutely delicious! Note though the Brie and Grape Quesadilla should probably be an afterthought as a dessert. It's very sweet so it didn't exactly compliment the food. As far as Sushi rolls go, I tried D.A. Roll, Double-D Roll, Kimmy Roll, and more. They were all delicious and fresh! Great sushi here! Be adventurous and try some cool stuff! 2 stars for food!


FINAL VERDICT: Is Taco Bell better? Nah.

Sushi is great and if you're in the mood treat yourself! If you an under 30 person definitely go here. It's hip, fun, and delicious. It won't make a hole in your wallet as the buffet is $25.95. Not that bad considering Sushi can add up quickly and is expensive anyway. This way you can try a lot and not worry about spending too much! Note that if you are over 30, I'm not saying not to go here, It's just this place draws a young crowd and has loud music. if you are down with that though for sure try this place! It's amazing! Now when will Taco Bell have a buffet...

Like another poster said, the best thing on the menu is the Seared Tuna Carpaccio. You only get one per person for the AYCE but it is heavenly and so delicious! 

We had several yummy rolls and its the best AYCE place in Vegas. I give it 4 stars only because this time the salmon was not perfectly to my liking - a bit slimy, and every time we go just a little some thing is a bit off. Last year, the service was a bit slow. The service this time was quick and friendly. 

If you're in the area and looking for good sushi or AYCE, visit this place. You won't be disappointed!

The food, the atmosphere, the service omg I am sooo impressed. Amazing sashimi. Christina took excellent care of our table. She refilled our glasses any time they were getting empty, without being asked and was very kind. Absolutely recommend

I'm not a huge fan of AYCE sushi. Eating to the point of that feeling of being over stuffed just doesn't appeal to me but tonight I caved. My stomach was craving everything and at a place like Sushi Koma you can't easily narrow down your selection especially if you're a party of 1. Best part, they allow half rolls so if you are tossed between a few choices just choose them all, half style! 

For the ones who knew this place awhile back, it was a small cozy little spot which probably held about 30 people, tops. Although I like that the new spot, still within in the same shopping complex, is a great, trendy and a lot larger! Although they have expanded, quality and service still remain. Go check it out for yourself!
Yummy, fresh sushi, and you can do half rolls with AYCE. I've tried many sushi restaurants in Las Vegas, and this has become my go to. I always leave happy!

AYCE sushi (or if you realllllly want, they have prices for you). $21.95 for lunch (minus the sweet shrimp and uni) and $25.95 for dinner. Koma opens at 1130am and runs all the way to 300am nightly. 

What a great place. Thanks to David T. and Smitcha B. for this find. Yes, Sushi Koma is a few miles north of the strip, but it's worth the trip up for AYCE sushi. 

Go for AYCE nigiri sushi (tuna/halibut/red snapper/yellowtail/salmon are my favs), specialty rolls and appetizers. Koma serves up fresh fish, yummy rolls, and has good service to boot. My only concern would be Koma's small establishment...I'm sure they have a long wait if you walk in during the busy hours. They don't have many seats and the tables may be a bit crammed for your liking. 

YOU MUST TRY THE: BIG B Roll (tempura/crab roll wrapped with rare steak). The steak melts in your mouth.

A must stop for my Vegas trips!
Customer service is amazing, very sweet servers. Top 3 sushi spot in Vegas I highly recommend giving it a try. Even when it's busy the service is quick.

This is THE BEST sushi place in Las Vegas. My boyfriend and I splurge here often. They have a huge selection and their fish is always fresh. I crave this place all the time because it's phenomenal! 

Every time I go (which is usually pretty late), it's always packed. Fortunately I usually get a table right away because I have a small party. The waiters are so sweet, patient, and attentive. The GM or owner (I'm not sure? he looks important lmao) is always out on the floor helping the staff which is really nice. 

I take the 20 minute drive out to this place because every other sushi place I go to cannot compare. 

My favorite rolls are the kimmy and mountain roll! And their nigiri is so fresh and well cut. You have to try their yum yum sauce on your dishes. Somehow, it's better than other places. 

Thank you for such a wonderful place with talented chefs and amazing staff!

Good standard AYCE sushi buffet.  But the best things on the menu are only one per customer, so you can't eat all you can on those marked with a heart.  Which to me defeats the purpose of AYCE.  The service was good, a little pushy and rushed but at least they're on point. The servers are so busy and rushing that they sound super robotic and monotonous.  The place is small and popular so be prepared for a wait during peak hours.

A nice little "hole in the wall" AYCE sushi joint! It's off the Strip but well worth your trip and money! This place is a bit smaller than most AYCE places, however the service is friendly and pretty fast!

We ordered a variety of specialty rolls, but you must get the sea urchin and sweet shrimp! (each limited to 1 per person) In addition, the salmon and yellowtail were both delicious. The super white tuna was also another memorable culinary treat!

For dessert, I highly recommend the plum wine ice cream! An absolute gem! Other dessert options are available such as green tea, mango, and vanilla mochi ice cream.

Hands down the best ayce in Vegas! In saying that, I am saying it in regards to food and service. There are two other ayce places that are good (umiya and goyemon). However, the reason that koma outshines the both of them is because of quality and service. 
NIGIRI- if you like good quality fish with light rice, koma is the spot. My favorites vary from mackeral, salmon, tuna, and scallops... the usual norm.. but thanks to koma I am now a huge fan of surf clam as well. I've tried it before.. but octopus, squid, and surf clam have always been on my non preferred list.. but surf clam is a must try! I love love love it, esp because all of the fish have nice cuts with very light rice. (Super hard to find in ayce sushi places)
The fried oysters are nice and plump, shrimp heads are cleaned right and they discard the shell portion that a lot of places forget...so it's nice and crunchy without scratching the roof of your mouth. 
Salmon skin handrolls are awesome, nice, crunchy and petite so that you can taste the essentials without overfilling yourself with rice. 
Rolls- I am not huge on rolls period, especially at ayce.. but the big b roll and ponzio roll are great. Great flavors, and not too over sauced. 
The greatest aspect of this restaurant is that they accommodate you. If you're like me and would like a salmon skin handroll add unagi..or a shrimp tempura roll with just tuna on top (these items are not on menu), they usually accomodate. 
Service is always fantastic and so is the owner Chris. He Always checks to make sure that everything is great and that his patrons are happy. I love koma! :)

I used to frequent this place and the quality of the sushi in the las 2 years has been on the decline.

They have stepped up there customer service game, and I must commend them for it. All the servers were attentive. We never had an empty glass, and our plates were being taken away promptly. All in all service was a 4/5 star service.....

But sadly you come to sushi for the sushi and that my friends was not on point this evening or the last handful of times we've been. 

The salmon had a crunch to it that I can't even begin to explain. Yellowtail was disappointing. White tuna had a decent texture but just tasted mehhh... on a happy note though the angry edamame was gold!!!!! The sauce was amazing.

Not their best not at least by my standards but I'm sure I'll give them another go because I always do. Maybe next time will be better.

I love this place. All you can eat sushi for $25?! YES! They have so many different kind of rolls and tiny dishes to eat! Down side is you only get one dessert. *sad face* we came in as a big group and took up pretty much the whole restaurant and only like 4 tables where actually open for everyone else cuz the place is so tiny!

You would never think you'd have to go to the desert to find great sushi. That's like looking for the most amazing wine at a liquor store; yet, here the dogma sits and becomes broken again and again every time I revisit this now must-go-to restaurant in Las Vegas. It's never disappointed me or my friends when we've come here. This amazing place is Sushi Koma.

Location - 4 stars

For some people Las Vegas lives and dies on the Strip. Many people think there's no point venturing blocks, much less 7 miles away from Las Vegas Blvd. However, being able to enjoy Las Vegas from a local's perspective I've seen so much greatness exist outside the neon confines of one street. Though being 7 miles away from the heart of the Strip could be considered too far for some, I think this measly 15 minute drive allows Sushi Koma to be exactly what it wants to be without the pressure of having to follow any rubric or standard like you might on the Strip. It stays true to what it wants to be and that's what makes it special. Located within a low key strip mall with only a small sign outside its one door entrance, huge flavor hides in this nook.

Interior - 4 stars

Some would say this restaurant is small. I don't disagree. Entering into the restaurant you can see all four corners of the restaurant with a small tilt of your head. Including the sushi bar this place probably fits close to 35-40 people at max capacity. Waits can be as long as 40 minutes during the busy hours. But when you look at the hand painted cherry blossom trees and hand written signs, this place really has character. It's charming and you feel invited as soon as you sit down. It is an intimate, safe place.

Food - 5 stars

I know you hear it all the time but this place is the Real Deal Holyfield when it comes to quality sushi. Sure, AYCE sushi is often just whatever when it comes to quality. After all, you expect to eat a lot of decent food, not spectacular food. Sushi Koma breaks that ideology completely. Though all-you-can-eat (or all-you-can-koma in their words) is the name of the game, so much of the food has body and flavor. The appetizers have the standard items like gyoza, edamame, and miso soup but than it takes you into left field with items like a brie and grape quesadilla or seafood ceviche tostada on a wonton chip. Their rolls aren't just cheaply bound stacks of rice sloppily soaked in eel and sriracha mayo sauce but carefully crafted and balanced. My favorite is their nigiri. To be able to eat fresh tasting salmon, white tuna, and even mackerel, a fish I generally hate eating raw, is blissful. Top it off with the ability to order half roll orders and getting ice cream at the end of the meal, having quantity AND quality is a dream that comes true at Sushi Koma.  

Price - 5 stars

With a place touting both quality and quantity it's more than reasonable to think this place will break your wallet down. After all, just to get a la carte sushi on the Strip can cost you nearly $20 a plate. However, lunch starts at $25 and dinner is $29. That means you can have all that you wished for and more for under $30! Just win one hand of blackjack and you can eat here!

Staff - 5 stars

I really like the staff here. Because this is a small place the staff really take care of you.
